review_body: Cheap rates during this COVid-19.Could have improve with better guest service agents in helping me with what I needed in providing customer service.Ground floor was loud people slamming doors and dogs barking.

Overall the hotel was okay although it has some flaws. The walls are very thin we heard the people next to us all night and the cleanliness was very poor. Our room also didn’t have a microwave sadly..

They knock even with th "Do Not Disturb" sign out and wad awakened multiple times. Once, I stated that I was in the shower and male housekeeper was still at door, so had to stop and open. Worn clothing found at base of bed headboard, and no one cleaned bathroom for 3 weeks. I did. Otherwise, great location, and rooms have balconies. Room price was lowered because of virus lockdown, but tiny parking was still 35+ nightly.

Fabulous place to stay and the price is very reasonable for being in the heart of Waikiki The rooms are super clean and the breeze that you get while on the balcony unreal The general manager Kathy is outstanding ! for making my stay a very memorial one and her staff is always smiling and very helpful . FYI this is very rare to see the general manager present and working along with the staff awesome job !! very impressed I will definitely be back and stay here thank you again ...

I love staying here at Ohia!! They have a great hospitality and Kathy special services have been great! I would recommend staying here at Ohia at any time!! We are here for over 30 days and love staying here!

Kathy is the great manager at Ohia! She is always accommodating and enjoys her job here to service all the guest In house! She gets 100% of this review because she’s always helping!!! We had a great stay here! And I love the rooms!!

Needed an emergency place to stay and called the hotel and when I arrived I felt like family. This is a perfect place to stay and always willing to help people! The staff here is outstanding!! Thank you to Kathy the General Manager for always accommodating me!!

We stayed at the hotel for 30 days for business needs and just want to say the General Manager Kathy was fabulous! She accommodated our needs and always was willing to assist us in every where! I recommend everyone to come and stay here if you want a great location and great staff!!

Yes it's true about the room decor being old and in need of upgrading but it was clean, came with a balcony, and no musty odor. Excellent location right across the Waikiki International Market Place with all the shops, restaurants, and beach in waking distance. Make sure to check in at the front desk first before trying to park, you'll need to show the pass at the camera before having excess to the parking structure, get there early limited parking stalls.

To start this review, we were greeted rudely by the customer service people right at check in. I will give a couple workers who were nice but the rest of the workers who helped us were very rude. They kept passing on helping us and had to wait very long to finally get checked in although there wasn’t much people checking in at all. Right when we got in the room, the bathroom smelled really bad, the shower rod kept falling, paints on the wall were chipping and the pots/utensils in the room were really dirty and disgusting. The workers cleaning the room also didn’t do a very good job cleaning. Speakers included in the room didn’t include an AC adapter, which made it useless. The kitchen light wasn’t working and the sink was very dirty at the time of check in. There were also ants all over the room. The only good thing about this place is the location, Otherwise, i would never come back here and would advise everyone to stay away from staying here.

Building is 60's concrete shell that could use gut job rehab that other Aston/Aqua properties have undergone in recent years. Unlike Waikiki properties of a similar age, with noisy window units, it has great quiet central air conditioning. The building has wall to wall carpet squares, but stained areas are not replaced. Maintenance and repairs are unprofessional and very slip shod.

The room was dilapidated and not secure. The sliding glass door to the patio had no functioning lock. The bathroom was dirty. There was no parking at the property and I had to find parking elsewhere. I left before nightfall and went to a different property.

Good location but is needing to be updated!! The staff was very nice but the carpet throughout the hotel is in terrible condition. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows were flat. The location of the tv to the bed was not placed well.

Was so happy with the place and the service personnel for the price and location. The beds were comfortable and the kitchenette was terrific. The only disappointment was the shower, small sized and cement surrounding made hitting elbows uncomfortable .

This hotel is situated in a great location close to the International Market Place and many fine shops and restaurants. It's an older building and needs to be updated and upgraded. The staff was friendly. We were able to park our car in the building, which was helpful.

The images from the room website where very nice although the room we received was old and dated electrical plugs was not working, Cockroaches, in bathroom, shower getting clogged,Noise from the street made it hard to sleep

This hotel is centrally located in Waikiki. In this bustling part of Oahu, the "Aloha Spirit" of the staff is exceptional and appreciated. The front desk staff are helpful and reflect the warm '"trades" breezes characteristic of this time of the year.

First of all, I would like to shout out to hotel manager Katherine who has been very helpful and very understanding in helping us to ensure we have a fabulous stay in Hawaii.We booked this first ever family holiday after a stressful year from suffering baby blue, so this holiday means alot to us. We have booked a noncancellation room, but after reading the review here in tripadviser it stressing me out, so I have contacted Katerine directly and Katherine has been very kind and very lovely to upgraded our room and esnure the room was fully cleaned prior to us staying. So I decide to do my very review of the hotel room 1080:1. Best location in waikiki 1minute walk to International Market Place, opposit Market Lane and eatery as well as Nordstrom Rack, minutes to Ross seaside and 10min walk to public beach waikiki, minute walk to Waikiki Trolley and Bus stop. So eat, shop and repeat in a matter of minute and walking distance. 2. Clean room with no issue of airconditioning or hot water Room was fully cleaned before our stay, there was not any issue like what other traveller here have said, i have never find any ants or insect, as a matter of fact, they do have insects inspection/spray to ensure the room is clear of bugs (thank you) '3. Room with viewRoom we stayed 1080 has the best view facing the street, if you are looking to stay here, please upgrade to street view room or deluxe room.4. Spacious studio suiteWe have been upgraded to Deluxe room 1080 and it was so specious that our kids could run around, would no doubt requested for the same room next visit.5. Entertainment in roomThey have cable TV, so it helps when you dont feel like going out but the kids is not bored as they have all day long Disney chanel to entertain the kids. 6. Super friendly lobby staffLobby staffs are very friendly and fully of Aloha spirit. Loves their greeting every morning especially Moe, he has made my day with his smile and one of the girl, i could not record her name, but always smile when we arrive :)7. AmenitiesThey put out free coffee in the early moring and free iced tea in the afteroon, could I please say they have the best iced tea, I love their ice tea there and the kids really love it too. They have small pool, we spent some times there even though some day could be very cold as it is not heated, but still good enough. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for budget hotel with best of everything, if you are looking for luxury hotel with luxury room and facility, then can look for the 5 stars hotel like Royal Hawaiin, but if you are looking for good budget and best locaiton ever, this is your to go to hotel. Should you have any issue, you can always get in contact with Katherine, she has made our first family holiday a fabulous one and no doubt the best hotel experince I have ever experience (Katherine always waived our resort fees, i dont know how much thank you I could say to her for going above and beyond ensure we have a great experience). Mahalo to all the team at Aqua Ohia, and expect us again next time when we are in Waikiki :)Cheers Lynda

This is an Ok place to stay and it is reasonably priced. A good value for families with a friendly staff. Great location near everything. The hotel is clean but a bit shabby. The rooms are studios and spacious.

The only good thing about this place was its location and the pool was pretty nice. The photos of the rooms online must be the very few they have updated. I don't normally like to leave bad reviews as I understand that sometimes things happen, but after reading other bad reviews and the responses from management, it seems they don't actually fix any of the things they say they are going to. Our room was outdated, dirty, and smelled. The shower had mold in it and hair, the floors were so gross we kept our shoes on at all times. One of the beds had holes in the blankets. To top it off, they charge you an amenity fee AND a resort fee (what resort?) that is not included in the price you see online. Oh, and if you try parking in their parking garage (if it isn't already filled up and you have to find parking elsewhere), turning in to the steep driveway will probably scrape up the bottom of your car.

Cost conscious travelers stay here. It's been spruced up since 2019 but not luxurious. Clean modest rooms. Convenient location for Waikiki beach, shopping, restaurants, etc., but that means some noise, even early in the day.

Only thing good about this hotel was the location. Website photos very deceiving. Very old hotel, paint and tile peeling. Musty moldy smell from the AC combined with the the street noise 8 floors up made sleeping difficult. And with only 1 working elevator we spent a lot of time waiting for the elevator.

The hotel is stuck in the 1980s and could really use the help of an interior designer. The king size bed is not that big. The kitchen appliances, doors and other features of the hotel are outdated. The location of the hotel is excellent. Some of the best restaurants in Waikiki are practically located across the street. Unless you absolutely have to, do not rent a car. The price of a rental car, parking at the hotel, and parking other locations far exceeds to cost of taking a taxi or calling an uber. There is a bus stop less than a block away along with a bike rental stand. The beach is also a short walk away.

The hotel is in a great location, close to trolley car stop, restaurants and convenience stores. The staff are very friendly. The rooms are desperately in need of an upgrade. The kitchen equipment need to be replaced. Staff are friendly and helpful.

I visited with my grandmother. She had stayed previously in this hotel. this visit we had a room with 2 fridge, but no microwave. there were only 2 lamps in the room so there wasnt enough light at nighttime. There was no second curtain so the sun was beaming in the room very early in the morning. the bathrooms should be updated as there were moldy areas throughout. the carpeting needs to be replaced ASAP. the beds were great, we were exhausted with the tours and shopping so we slept comfortably.

The Ohia was chosen because of its ideal location. Just about every place in the Waikiki area is extra expensive. This place shows its age, but our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The view out our window looked like a slum area. However, if you are okay with just closing the drapes, and being happy with everything being within walking distance, the place is fine. There is an added non-optional resort fee, as most hotels in the area have. The well staffed reception desk and the small elevator are always very busy. The hotel is located within minutes of Waikiki Beach, International Marketplace and many of the fancy shops and restaurants.

Not suitable for families perhaps a night or 2 for adults. Unable to accommodate early check in for international travellers. Dirty rooms dirty bathroom. Staff ignore you and serve other people because they don’t want to help you

I travel around the world once a year staying in at least 20 countries. A,though Hawaii is one of my favorite locations, it has also become one of the most expensive places to stay. After a purge by the hotel owners via the government on Airbnb, prices have skyrocketed and Hawaii hotels are heavily dependent on Asian travelers. at the so-called cheaper end of the market in Honolulu you can expect to pay at least $130 a night for poor accommodation with no facilities. This is very common and covers most If not all accommodation in this price range. Honolulu has also adopted the Las Vegas style resort fee. This particular hotel has the nerve to call itself “studio suites’ It is in-fact shoddy old decrepit small rooms. In Europe you wouldn’t pay more than €45 a night for such rooms. There is no breakfast include, there are virtually no facilities the place is disgusting. Avoid at all costs.

My Wife and I stayed here for 7 days! We NEVER HAD AN ISSUE AT ALL, during our stay! The Air conditioning was ice cold when we needed it , NO issues with HOT WATER at ALL! The staff were absolutely wonderful and friendly EVERY Day we were there! The cleaning staff were always courteous and friendly, Too!! They try very hard to make everything PERFECT! KUDOS! Thank You!

I would like a refund after the stay or a free 3 day stay for what happen to the room they have assign me. I would like to see the ladies that are young have respectful relationships with guest. The room we stayed was poor and I couldn't do much of it. When you say free upgrade or room replacement there should be a room with a better option.

Reasonably priced with kitchenette in a room with a nice sized bed with cable television. Airconditioned and some units have large balconies with decently sized bathrooms. Centrally located to all the main bus routes and all the main attractions. Right down the street is the best beaches which are located in front of the Royal Hawaiian hotels if one walks to the right on the beach down the way from the Royal Hawaiian hotel individuals will find some of the best beaches in Waikiki with some of the best snorkeling one could ever imagine. Also close to many shopping areas. I love the fact that people can save money and rent a hotel with a kitchen and prepare their own meals which save dollars on end. One can google Safeway or Don Quijote closest to Aqua Ohia Waikiki and one can find the address to Safeway or Don Quijote and google maps how to get there on city bus. One could also google the location and find directions to local stores.

This hotel is very dirty. I stayed for 5 night. Hotel has two elevator only works one.my room floor hallway s carpet were wear out and dirty. Inside my room insect or ant all over. refrigerator was rusty and freezer don't work. kitchen stove coil were uneven you have to hold cooking pan for even cook. Bathroom light bulb was burn out. television signal get lost, you can not charge your iphone in room plug were not working, room carpet were wear out and dirty. Balcony door can not closed all the way and you hear outside noise all night. table lamp wood was full of dirt and still visible.

Stayed for three nights. The location is very convenient. Very close to the center of Waikiki. Marugame Noole is just on the next blck.The staffs were good. The room was OK. But,The elevator was out of order during my whole stay, and I saw many people were left on thier floor even though the elevator stopped.

Location is good. Housekeeping sucks. They left my door open all day after servicing the room. Unsafe and unimpressed. Front desk apologized but did nothing really. If you want someplace really crappy, this is your hotel.

The rooms have never been renovated, simply gross. The roll aways were disgusting and in the worst condition. We slept in our clothes and did not shower because it was so awful. They charged an additional Amenity Fee upon check in! Lol - what a joke.

I never write reviews but being there was such mixed reviews and we were staying so long the price was ok and so I decided to book. Room was tight. The bathroom didn’t even have a real door it was a folding thing. The shower had cracks and mold inside. My parents room was the same but they kept finding cockroaches. We asked them to spray but I’m sure it wasn’t done as they kept finding them every time they walked in. My friend said the pent house is probably the only room in there that’s modern and up to date with no problems. Rooms looked nothing like the website.

This place needs to be torn down and rebuilt. Nice location but nothing works and everything is old and dirty. Lobby was done nicely. Rooms were getto. Carpet is old and filthy, don't walk on it. Nothing worked. AC was minimum and maintenance was asked to check. Offered fan but outlets didn't work. Phone didn't work, TV controls didn't work. Ice machine was in the parking garage. Parking was overpriced.

Front Desk were very nice. Bell Captain, Housekeeping were very friendly too. Location was very convienent. Close to international Market easy access to everywhere. Amenities were good too. Room had kichen,and a nice size fridge.

"I have no complaints as the price is low, but I would like you to improve the lack of electricity in the bath and the peeling of the paint on the toilet seat."The staff's attitude was friendly and very good."The entrance and the entrance of the room are a little harder to close, so I think it needs to be improved."

False advertisement of resort fees due at check in. Very disappointing. Didn’t want to make a fuss during my time of relaxation but the room was more than I expected to pay and wasn’t as nice as I thought it’d be from the pictures online. Sheets are sticky probably from detergent or something. Bathroom smells bad. False advertisement of resort fees due at check in. You should work improving these things.

Room values do not match！When ordering at Booking.com, we chose to have 2 queen-size beds in a room, and there was only one King-size bed when checking in. We had no way to pay for an extra moving bed, and felt cheated.The most unhappy is the poor cleaning services.

Not satisfied with the room we booked,. Booked a deluxe room but got a standard.Overpriced Hotel. Never knew that hotel allowed dogs from the 5th floor down.. We were On 3rd floor andhad problem with smell and feet were itchy. Also very noisy.

Where do I begin. The moment we got in the door nobody greeted us. The front desk was to busy with their phones & conversations to say Aloha or acknowledge us. They will change you a "resort fee" but this is no resort. The bathroom was horrible, the shower had cracking & black mold!! The toilet flushed loud. You can hear the pipes with water all night. No alarm clock in the room & when I called the sevice desk for a wake up call (I also did a alarm on my phone) No wake up call!! Called to see what happened,there was no note left for a wake-up call. Bathroom is small. Front desk is Rude,people who are not customer friendly, horrible people to work in the hospitality industry. The morning crew treat you like gum on their shoes! Do Not Book Here Go Somewhere Else!! Pool ok. They charge $28 to park in their lot. The outside parking lot is way to tight!! The security deposit box didn't work. When you leave your bags with the bell hop,don't worry they check them for you. I'm missing $200 from my backpack. She says she's the manager, (long brown hair in a braid, glasses) she said I must have misplace it. It took 5 hours for our room to be ready. After check-in we gave the bell boy our bags. Because it would take 2 hours for our room. I am a Lesbian!! I was treated with disrespect, hatred in the foulest manner. I was with my wife.

If you really don't care about old and chipped things, this will be great. The water pressure isn't great but the service or the staff is superb. The beds were comfortable and the AC was perfect. The pillows are not great.

The hotel was not worth the price we paid. Hidden fees like “amenities fee” made the overall price way over our budget. Everything was grimy and we felt unsafe. Needs major TLC. The parking garage was sketchy for $35/night

We loved our stay and enjoyed the room amenities.We requested a microwave and they bought us one.Location of the hotel was great, bus stop in front of the hotel which enabled us to go on our daily bus trips exploring Honolulu..

I thought that while the staff was friendly, the hotel itself is in serious need of a remodel. The furnishings, walls, bathrooms are outdated. The bathroom itself is super old - you can tell that the tile walls have been painted over several times. The cabinets look like they're from the 60s or 70s. The window blinds are uneven and allow way too much light in the room. The pillow are uncomfortable and musty smelling. They should be replaced. The kitchen did not have enough utensils (missing knife) so we had to purchase one from a store. The price I paid (about $300+ per night) for the value I received was way too high. I've stayed in other Aqua properties and this one unfortunately did not meet expectations.

The Young girl who greeted us on both check-in occasions was not friendly, she may have had a bad day before we arrived... Rooms were small, decor was retro and scruffy not how it was pictured. Overall a disappointing experience.

bad environment not reall worth it to what is bee show on the internet. and i can not vere recommend it for anyy family or friend from mu idea , the hotel need a serious renovation anf proper upkeep. that it

The room was so bad that I had to find another hotel to stay at. I had a bad feeling about this room as soon as I opened the door. I could not even stay in this room for the first night as it made me so uncomfortable to be there. The room smelled, the carpet was dirty, the furniture was broken, the safe did not work, the bathroom was like a public bathroom rather than a hotel room bathroom. I found a room at another hotel within 2 hours of checking into this hotel. After got a room reservation at another hotel, I canceled my room reservation with this hotel.

Over priced. 28$ per day resort fee and another 28$ parking fee. Rooms outdated (1945), carpets old and sticky, holes in ceiling, corner shower so small we could barely bend over to wash feet. Cable tv had bad cable with fuzzy screen. Tiny pool. Only ice maker in outside rear parking garage and ice bucket holds 10 pcs ice. This is a booking dot NO hotel!!

Great location, but the rooms and the building need some renovation. Air quality in the middle to lower floor rooms are quite poor, due to dusty curtains and dusty airconditioning exhausts, and old smelly carpets. The 17th floor is better in terms of air quality. Generally, everything just needs an upgrade.

Well, where do I begin? On a positive note, the location is great & within walking distance to great shopping, food, activities & the beach. On a negative, the hotel is extremely outdated & for the price we expected better. I felt like I was in the motel from the movie Psycho, very 60’s & dark. When I was in the shower, apart from there being no water pressure I expected Anthony Perkins to yank open the curtain & stab me!!! Half the lamps didn’t work & the oven ( there’s no microwave) would spark every time I turned on the light switch. The carpet is dirty & the balcony railing feels like it could fall off at any moment. There are some cool vintage photos on the wall but that’s as far as it goes in an attempt to spruce up the place. The staff were okay but more interested in their conversations than actually assisting us. None of us wanted to get in the pool because it looked uninviting & miserable. In my opinion, find another place to stay that is welcoming, stylish & value for money.

They overbooked and when we arrived to check in they moved us to a sister hotel in a non-central location. I had also called weeks in advance to confirm we would be getting a room with two beds - they assured me the sister hotel would honor the same room type. When we got there they didn't have any available and stuck us with a one-bed room for three people. Staff was rude and non accommodating. Terrible experience.

The hotel is situated in a really great location, it’s walking distance to everything (the beach, restaurants, etc). However the hotel is very dated and not very clean. The carpet on the floor looks like they have not been cleaned ever. The bathroom doors were sticky. The walls and ceilings are popcorn ceiling and attracts a lot of dirt. The hotel staffs were friendly and helpful.

The room we stayed in was so dilapidated. Bathroom looked like someone's old apartment in a 60s movie and it had a strong moldy smell. Tiles were cracked, shower head looked like it cost a dollar and had no water pressure, and the shower curtain had stains and smelled moldy. The rest of the room smelled like a mixture of mold and bleach as well. AC air had a weird smell and felt like we were inhaling dust. Coffee maker in the room was used and not cleaned. The room cost us almost $400 a night after fees etc and it was just unacceptable at that price.

Room was small and dirty. The bathroom was dirty and very small. Furniture looked warn and room smelled funny. However, the housekeeping and staff were very nice and accommodating. I was upgraded to a larger, clean room with a great view.

The International Market, the popular Marukame Japanese Restaurant, Waikiki beach, St Augustine By The Sea Church, various restaurants and shopping are just few steps away. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Outdated building, disgusting carpet, and pool could not swim. some lights were not working in the room. Unfriendly and rude staffThe only good in this property is a their good location. It has easy walking access to basically all the main shopping, restaurants, and beach

This hotel is in a great location in Waikiki. It is however very old and dated. The internet leaves a lot to be desired. The kitchen be aware has no microwave. It has an old dated stove. The pool is small but adaquate.

The hotel provided a great friendly and good service. Rooms were clean tidy and staff helpful and supportive. The location is very central to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Would happily recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Good Location,but building is too old, you can hear the conversation of next door. Bathroom is also poor, TV didn't work.Would be better if the restaurant opens earlier.The ice tea at the lobby was very good!

A very tired and shabby hotel in much need of renovation and refit. Beds pushed up against walls so you have to climb over your partner to get out. The beds too are dreadful and should be thrown out. The fire alarms went off three times during the night. Chaos prevailed the first time with guests crowded into a minuscule lobby. No one informed guests what was happening. They were all false alarms. Never again.

My daughter and I stayed for 1 week, staff were very friendly and accommodating , however the a/c in the room was very weak, so they gave us a fan but it was still hot. Room was clean and looked after , however could use an update. Came with a kitchenette, very little utensils, and no microwave. At night it was loud from live music until early mornings, so a bit tough to go to sleep at a decent time. Over all enjoyed time in Hawahi.

While this hotel is situated in an awesome location...the owners should definitely look into renovating it, we did not have hot water for the first 2 1/2 days, the AC did not work well, we were extremely hot during the night and it leaked. The manager comped us $29 per day of no hot water...for a quick two day trip to Oahu I would recommend this hotel anything longer than that I would recommend you stay elsewhere.

ComplaintRoom 1591Day 1 blocked shower only 1 person could shower. Asked to fix and said technician gone home so other person couldn’t showerDay2Shower still not fixed blocked. Both of us couldn’t shower. Asked front desk and lady at the tours advice to help us find a tour and she pointed to get the brochure. Also asked how do we catch public transport. She said just Google bus times. No help with anything about the place town bus times etc not tours. Didn’t even give us a map about Waikiki etc. Day 3. No hot water and no one told us about it. We got back at midnight and I was about to shower and it was cold. I called front desk and they brushed it off yet again showed no concern or emotion and said. Oh. Yeah. No hot water. Said to shower in another hotel room at 1am. Very poor. Day 4 complained to management Paulette for all able and she said best she can do is Move to another room. This room was just as bad. Warm water. Ugly and old and dirty shower. Toilet gurgling. Very loudly. And shower was leaking water everywhere on the floor like a massive puddle. Dangerous As that is where he toilet was too. It collected water with two towels drenched. Reported this and she couldn’t care less. Then again asked at front desk with help on how to get to the north shore. No help then they Said go see Aston waikkki. Their Other sister hotel many blocks away. Poor service. Bad bad bad service.  Day 5 Made complaint again for all above issues and beat they can do is a 15% off restaurant which was too expensive and already in the local coupon book for everyone. So nothing exclusive. Gave voucher for bus said it was to go to the biggest shopping center. It doesn’t. It actually goes to the ghetto instead. So again another slap in face and rip off. I demanded a refund of amenity/resort fees. Paulette management said best she can do is only two nights of resort fees returned after I check out. Not good enough. And won’t keep their word as their slack and did nothing to fix all the above room issues. Every night unable to sleep with sound from shower dripping water and all Over the floor and the Toilet gushing noises and Noises from freezer all night. Couldn’t sleep Then by day 8 still no hot waterNo hot water. With a new surprise we now have Bugs crawling in the hotel, the shower, bathroom, toilet and table in our bedroomGuy came in with fly spray. That’s it!Dirty disgusting showerFront door doesn’t close. Asked 4 times to fix it. And still didn’t. The Elevator takes over a 15 minute wait for it to arrive every time. Then for 4 days straight no air conditioning. After 4 days they gave us a fan. And we were to go home the next day. When I asked why it wasn’t fixed. Lana the supervisor showed no care in the world and said. They will do what they can do. That is a fan. Pathetic. They gave us tickets for 2 days to catch a bus and it doesn’t work in our area so that is ridiculous. Waited 90 min for a bus and still no bus. So walked 40 min to our destination in the heat. Spoke with a Michael to discuss air con. And he didn’t care either. Told him door won’t close and ants and bugs. And cold water still. Didn’t do anything. I asked Lana for resort fees refund and she yelled and said no way. Speak to manager. I said I can’t as I’m leaving and she said bad luck. I finally got 12 nights of resort fees $28 usd. But still paid $2100 aud for hotel that provided nothing but issues and disgust. Out hotel did nothing to help or make us feel wanted helped. Nothing. No information on what to do. A map nothing. And apparently their are free bus tokens but they won’t give them out. Their own night worker told us. I will never stay there. And I warn you also not to. Worst hotel I’ve stayed at in my entire life

The rooms are in DESPERATE need of refurbishment. Furniture looks like it is from the 1950's. Serious lack of electrical outlets.Two sets of outlets in the living quarters of which 2 are taken up by lamps and 1 by a $10 alarm clock. The sad looking kitchenette doesn't have a microwave. An almost essential appliance for reheating food. The pool has limited room for chairs and lounges. Because of the limited space, this time of year lots of shade.On the positive side, easy check-in. Lovely staff. Great location and the price was decent. I guess you get what you pay for. If I had known this property was seriously outdated, I would have spent a few more dollars to be elsewhere.

Terrible place!! The Aircondition doesn't not working i was have to more 3 time in till they find a room that Aircondition to work very dirty and very sticky place I Suggest that to not Booking this place . They allowed pets in that Hotel but that's not the issues but they don't clean after is small pee and very very old...

The worst experience out of all the times we have visited Honolulu. The price of the hotel is decent, but with all that went wrong, the price should of been $40-$50 a night, the price of our cheap motels on the mainland. We will never step foot in this place ever again nor will our friends and family.

Staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was convenient.Lack of basic amenity (hot water) chilled my stay. Travelers were not informed about this and were forced to discover themselves that such problem existed.

Classy hotel - cold water!A good but tired hotel in need of tender, loving care.Generally great staff. Front of hotel staff were particularly good - maintenance staff less so.Check-in and check-out particularly pleasing and efficient.

No hot water they also kicked me out of my room never let me extend because they sold my room before giving me the option to extend The day shift was good very friendly staff too bad all the staff isn't friendly

We did not have hot water for both nights of my stay and didn’t receive word of its fixing status the whole time. More care and consideration should be put into remedying the situation. I felt that if I didn’t ask or was upset about the situation and grumbling to someone, no one cared about my experience

I would have never checked Into the hotel knowing the crap that I would of had to go thru.At the beginning It was a screw up the fro t desk was unprofessional and nasty. Than to have left my coat there by accident it was a bigger problem they wouldn’t accommodating me by sending to the airport I was on a trip before my major surgery I was so upset how I was treasured than my boyfriend went to ask for crreamer but because he didn’t get it from in the restaurant at the hotel he was told no. It was so disappointing I would never stay there again. They only had 1 cleaning woman pre floor do it took her hours to clean the room.’the lace is so out dated they put up fraud pics so people will think it’s a fabulous hotel it is not. Managers are rude and nasty and unprofessional also. It was the worst hotel I’ve ever been to . Never again
user_name:
monicaromeo2018
New York City, New York

review_body: The first impression as you walk into the hotel isn't the best it could do with a total revamp. The female member of staff on the front desk was really friendly and helpful. The rooms are adequate but tired and old the carpet in our room needs a deep clean. Plus side the beds were comfy and the Aqua Ohia in a really good location it's on the main street and only a 5 minute walk to the beach.

Friendly staff very central and close to shops and restaurants. It is an older hotel and has seen some refurbishments but could do with some more. Bathroom was old as were fixtures but beds were comfy room tidy. No shuttle bus anymore which was included in resort fee.

This is the worst hotel ever. Bad service, bad smells, filthy. Nothing like the way they describe theirselves. Termite droppings, maids didn't clean (they never swept even once in the 2 weeks we were there, froze up tiny refrigerator, burners on stove had food burnt on them, flimsy wore out kitchen utensils, pans were scratched up tephlon coating with burnt on food, no kitchen towels(had to use hand towels and bathroom wash rags to do the dishes), filthy painted over shower that was peeling. Very unhappy!

Staff was amazing, the hotel could use a makeover and make sure you verify all additional expenses. The website I used stated clearly kids under 2 stay free in a crib but that would have been an additional $35.00 per night and the parking is an additional $28.00 per night which was not mentioned. The beds were small and uncomfortable and the room looked nothing like it did on the website. The building is in need of repairs and new equipment but if they made some repairs and inform you of additional charges it would be great. I have never had a better staff experience at a hotel.

Needs maintenance badly. No hot water for 3 days, dirty dishes in the cupboard and just no general maintenance which brought down the whole appeal. Spoke to front desk about issues and no follow up from manager or compensation for the $200 service fee considering services were non existent

We were in Hawaii a little while ago and we stayed at the Aqua Ohia. The location is good, lots of places to eat nearby and very close to a number of shopping places. The hotel itself is pretty dated. As far as Waikiki goes, it's one of the less expensive hotels. The room was spacious, although very dated and the bathroom was tiny.Hotel staff were a mixed lot - some very helpful and others seemed irritated at having to provide service.The resort fee is a definite hidden cost if you are booking through Agoda or a similar booking agent. We believed we had paid in full for accommodation only to be slugged with a US$250 resort bill for our 9 night stay that was payable on check-in. When we questioned what this was for we were informed it was for the use of beach towels and wifi. The wifi was dodgy at best and the beach towels were threadbare so we were unimpressed with this. I now know that a resort fee of anywhere between US$20 - US$40 per day is payable at all hotels in Waikiki so be aware of this if you are not booking directly with the hotel.The pool at the hotel is very small for the number of guests and has no real ambience. The fact that we were a short walk from the beach meant that we weren't so worried about the pool.It wasn't terrible, it wasn't great.

Here you go. 10day vacation.3 women 2 babies 11mth 12mth 4 year old.Day 1 hallway carpets wet.Day 3 aircon leaking on stained carpet floor. Day 4 babies uneell.. Day 5 complaint.aircon leat mould on floor. Ph no work.Day6 BABY 11mths admit ICU.BABY 2 Not well still. Day 7 8 9 10 11 Icu. 12 Finally out.SOME VACATION.MOULD EVERYWHERE TOTALLY IGNORED COMPLAINTHERES SOME PICS.

The room was very comfortable and relaxing. Very clean quiet and private. Balcony has amazing view from 9th floor. Uber is always available in one minute. Pool clean and the sweet green tea is amazing. I enjoyed the complimentary bag w chocolate and cookies

I booked this hotel the same day I checked in - my previous accomodation had ended up being a quite traumatic safety nightmare and I just needed somewhere clean, safe and reasonably priced to move to.All staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. I wish I knew the name of a specific bellhop - when I checked in and he gathered my previously stored baggage for me and waited at elevator door beside me, I couldn’t hold the tears I had been holding in for the last 15 hours any longer and he asked if I needed help etc and was just generally comforting and I thank him for that. I loved the decor in my room and it was clean and I felt very safe here. I had a lovely view from my window. My only complaint is that an awful lot of dryers were out of order in the laundry but this is a small price to pay. Thank you for being my safe haven.

Room was terrible, carpet was carpet wet, room smell moldy, shower had mold n hair in drain, shower curtain had cockroach, tv was blurry n lines brought it to front desk attention, because of third party booking can’t go anything, next morning check out spoke with front office mgr. again was reminded I booked through a third party n said he can only waive amenity fee, I also took photo of room wet carpets molds and hair and cockroach and sent to property Ohia email

This hotel is tired and so are the staff. They are singularly unwilling to be helpful in any way. Rooms are musty and hot water service was out of order for 2 days of my stay with no apology or notice from staff. Lift was out of order for 4 days of stay. Again no signs on the lifts to say only one of the 2 were in operation. May be cheap but you pay for it in other ways. I did not enjoy anything about this hotel stay

I hope that whoever is reading this doesn’t think “get what you pay for”. Even though this is a cheaper place to stay in Waikiki, i don’t think it gives you the excuse of having junky accommodations! I spent $464plush another $60 for off site parking because there wasn’t any for the amount of guests you had. That’s $524, for what? A room that had an old run down bathroom and ac system with no central air in the hot and humid temperature of HAWAII and just 4 fans and no trade wind (because the sliding glass door couldn’t stay open because a bird almost flew in!) to cool off a “suite” with 5 women occupying it. not at one point we were compensated or even offered compensation with all these problems. shame. so shame.

I have stayed at this hotel before and i chose to stay here again because it is a great location. Conveniently close to many restaurants and shopping. A block away from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Centre and very close to the Waikiki beach. There is an awesome alley way of souvenirs thats across from the hotel. I like that there were complimentary beverages in the lobby. 1 elevator was broken which made the wait a bit longer, but i could take the stairs.

this hotel needs major painting and touchup - There should be matching, coordinated furniture instead of 2 different kinds of chairs at table - But it is a nice size and it is not crowded - It would be nice if lighting was more convenient - mattress and pillow very good

The worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Old,Small, smelly, dirty, tv not working.Guests complaining.The foyer is tiny and always overcrowded with guest and their luggage filling the space making it hard to get in and out.Don't stay here.Cheap and horrible, gives Waikiki a bad name.

not very helpfull at all when dealing with my freind who was hurt while staying at your motel. No offer of acknowlegement of her well being after the insident . You would think that someone would check but no very dissapointed in the staff

This hotel was in a great location, very walkable to everything in Waikiki, also right on the bus and trolley lines so very convenient to take public transportation. The rooms are very outdated, old patio furniture on the balconies and by the pool. Very much felt like what it might be to live n the 70s with the decor. However, staff were very helpful and friendly.

It’s the best deal you will find for a clean, safe, hotel in Waikiki. My dad used to be an airline executive and I have been to Waikiki 50-60 times in my 33 years on earth. When I became an adult I couldn’t afford the good stuff but couldn’t give up Waikiki! It’s usually better prices than any Ohana. Also, very close to Moose McGillicuddy pub which has great food specials and 1$ drinks 3 nights of the week. Right across the street from what the new “authentic” into marketplace is (the stalls in the alley). Dukes restaurant is just a block away from the alley as well and definitely worth making a stop at while in Waikiki! The pool is fine, but why would you hit the pool when the worlds most famous beach is two blocks away amirite? Best value in Waikiki, also their Hawaiian tropic toiletries are awesome!!!

Although the price was great, I would not stay here again. The room and especially bathroom were barely adequate, and the room was never properly cleaned. The staff are very friendly and the location is great, but I still would never stay here again.

Pros: -easy check in-in the heart of waikiki (convenient)-friendly staff-Cons:-doesn't feel safe-broken door in room-dirty rooms with mildewOverall, Not clean at all with false advertisement (showing nice rooms). Needed to check out early after one night

This hotel is not worth the price they charge. This was absolutely not what i had imagined at all. Would not stay here again. Nor would I recommend it to my enemy. Staff was Great. Very kind people. By!

Parking was awful with no direct access to lobby. Plan on making multiple trips outside and up steep stairwell to stairs to entrance and lobby area. I don't mind dated and clean, however the musty smelling air conditioning was unacceptable. No USB ports and CPAP users plan on exploring behind furniture not moved in years. There was always lots of staff standing around. It would seem that when you ring into the garage a bell person could at least be offered if not Johnny on the spot when you are rang through.

Good location , economy hotel , old doors & shabby paint Beds new & comfy ,kitchen unit outdated Stayed 2 nights , was quite quiet being downtown WaikkikiRestaurant attached poor quality food.Staff helpful & friendly

It’s an old outdated dirty hotel. Walls are stained, carpet is stained and dirty. Shower didn’t look clean, roaches crawling all over my stuff. WiFi was down for 20% of my stay. It has central air conditioning with no temperature control, it was always warm in the room. Plus the $28 resort fee plus the $28 parking fee it is quite an expensive hotel. Would not recommend and will not return.

Very outdated, dirty, just to say pillow cases were stained. Strangers were in our room and took 20 min to check in and an additional hour to get our room to find out there were people in our room. Floors are filthy.

The staff at the Aqua Ohia was exceptional. They made me feel welcomed. They took their time at the front desk and were very helpful. The room was very clean. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job. I will recommend this hotel to my family and friends. I really enjoyed my stay.

This hotel is not as pictures shows, It is old, not clean, has an old smell, and way over priced due the surprising additional fees they charge at check in. $28 a day parking and $28 per day amenities. Will not stay her again

I'm honestly shocked at how high this hotel is rated. I can handle the hotel being dated, but the cockroaches had me on edge the entire time. We avoided using the kitchenette all together as they appeared there the most. Unfortunately, we were stuck at this property since we had pre-paid for the room. Do yourself a favor, and don't ruin your vacation by staying here. Our balcony view was of a condemned building next door with a bunch of junk. I'm including some of our room pictures so you can judge for yourself.

This was an amazing hotel in an amazing location, it was my first time in Hawaii and I would definitely stay here when I visit again. I recommend staying here, staff were very friendly and very clean.

I stayed at the Aqua Ohia Waikiki and staying here was the ABSOLUTE WORST part of my Honolulu trip!Upon arriving, I found the room/ kitchen that were reserved in my name very small and dirty looking with no ambiance. I upgraded to a suite which was a little bigger but with dirty looking carpet, dim lighting, and very hot and dark. Air-conditioning NEVER worked. Worst, housekeeping was unreliable and inefficient. Next day, we returned to messy room and previous day’s garbage and wet towels. No one cleaned the room. Front desk told me “Housekeeping ends at 4:00pm; I’m sorry”, which was startling to hear. It was ridiculously embarrassing the number of times I had to call Housekeeping to remind them to clean the room. The hotel charges $28.00 daily resort fees! Why?If all of these issues weren’t enough, several times during our stay one of two very small elevators was out of service, which of course was highly inconvenient as we were staying on the 15th floor.With all of these endless issues, the staff, though apologetic, displayed a nonchalant attitude as if they are accustomed to similar complaints and, unfortunately are either not empowered enough, or simply just don’t care enough to improve these issues for guests. Don’t ruin your vacation only for a location! ALL hotels in Waikiki are centrally located! PLEASE AVOID this hotel at all costs!

Overall Ariel was so busy and I wanted to do was just relax. So I had a good time knowing that it was in a good location. Parking was available. The only thing the elevators wasn’t working the walk to the parking was weird and a hassle

hotel need a complete remodel appears to have been built in the 1950's there is very little parking available one of the 2 elevators was not working we were staying on the 14th floor which was scary because the one elevator that was working shook and gave the feeling that it was going to quit working happy to get out of the hotel and very glad that we only stayed only 1 night after having been downgraded and relocated from their sister hotel due to an emergence maintenance problem. I would have never booked a reservation at his hotel and i would recommended that no one ever stays there and they would not compensate for the downgrade !!!

Best location at an affordable price. Kuhio Avenue properties have been upgraded considerably during the past ten years and three new mega projects are in the works. The two shuttered properties next door are on the market for $19.5 million! A new building with a height limit of 350 ft is in the near future. That will bring the gut remodeling of this Aqua hotel and higher prices like The Laylow across the street! If you just want a place to sleep while you enjoy Hawai'i, spend your savings on all the new farm to table restaurants in Chinatown and Kaimuki.

Had to negotiate for hours to get 2 rooms with 2 beds on same floor.  Had requested this 3 times prior to arrival and was not told this was impossible.  On arrival were told not possible and that when we book we book room size not bed configuration??  Also 'couldnt downgrade us to a room with 2 beds as our travel agent wouldnt like it' .  Many excuses until finally we noticed cleaning staff cleaning a room with 2 beds on our floor so we knew there was another.  Again we had to push to get this room.  Not a pleasant start to our holiday.  Condition of room 1.5 star.  Old  shabby condition and couldnt walk on carpet in bare feet and balcony floor stcky from spills.  It was grubby.  Pool area was grubby too.    Pluses:  towels fluffy, bed comfy, location good, free water fountain, room service were quick to supply a kettle and fan as air con was too hot.

Booked a room at Aqua Oasis but bumped to Ohia due to “unexpected” maintenance. Not compensated for change from 3 to 2 star hotel. Ohia very old hotel and not clean. Mosquitos bit us in the night and had to escalate to hotel staff but no resolution offered. Personally had to pay for $15 mosquito repellent at nearby Longs pharmacy. Nightmare one night stay.

The property was not what it seemed on the website. It was outdated, internet was extremely slow and shower/water pressure was low and temperature was inconsistent. The pool was extremely small and old.

I loved this hotel. The staff were wonderful and the location was fantastic. Great Pool. Bathroom was a bit old but clean. View from the balcony was wonderful and very minimal street noise at night in the room. I felt quite at home here. Very reasonable price and I would stay here again.

Very outdated and does not live up to the pictures. The room had a smell and the showerhead was small and not very powerful. Was pretty disappointed overall. The staff were lovely and professional at check in

The best things about this hotel are the location, service and comfort of the beds. It is an older building but everything worked sufficiently. Microwave would have been nice instead of stove and oven

Excellent location public bus stops outside, restaurant / bar next door,. International market place few min walk which provides several eateries, bars, and dukes lane is across rd from hotel which has bar, bakery, ice creamery and supermarket.

The friendliness of the staff was top notch, front desk was very welcoming, housekeeping was super lenient and nice. The rooms were definitely a 2 star hotel. Very basic, stained walls, stained carpet, wall paper coming off. When we walked through the halls, I would see cockroaches scurrying up the walls. Bathroom was an standing shower that was poorly maintained. But I figured, who needs a nice hotel when it’s super cheap, as long as there’s a bed and AC we’ll be okay. Wrong. They’re AC unit is old and poorly maintained. Even on High, it did not cool down the room. The vent was dusty and rusted.Like my title says, you’re definitely getting what you’re paying for. Cheap price, cheap hotel. Other than the cleanliness, staff was on point and always willing to help us out or answer our questions.

1) Their "Going Green" incentive should be either $5 off the total bill and not just $5 discount at the Lava Restaurant. I am a very green traveler and it just irked me that because I am vegan, I was not able to really experience the green incentive the hotel was trying to provide. There was not even one Vegan option in the resto.2) My problem the whole time was the aircon. Hawaii was very hot for me during my trip there, and when the electrician came in, he apologized because he said it's not a localized thing, the whole centralized thing is faulty. He said that they have been getting a lot of complaints and it turns out there is no improvement nor even cleaning made on the AC system, still!. I think I believe him! I took pictures of the vents of my room's AC and it was super filthy. It's a risk esp. to those with respiratory problems and I have bronchial asthma. The electrician was courteous enough and he offered me an electric fan. He said he will advise the front desk but alas, no one called me. I did not make an effort anymore because first, it was centralized; so no matter what room I switch into it's futile. Also, I already settled in and having a bad case of jetlag/cabin fever I did not want to go to the motions already. The 3 days, 2 nights I was there I felt like being broiled slowly into my death.3) The exhaust in the bathroom, I do not know if it's working, but like the water sprinkler in the room, it's rotting. There was a lime green scale thing growing out of the fixtures. I took a picture of them too for my reviews. I feel they just renovated the lobby and pool but with the other essentials in the rooms, they have forgotten about it. Perhaps it was just a facade. On some good points I commended on their survey 3 awesome staff members. Also laud their 7 layer filtration system fountain since I get to refill my tumbler all the time. Plus, it is mindful of travelers' water needs. This is an eco-conscious move for them.

Great location a few blocks from beach & central to Waikiki. Reasonable price for quality of room. Could use upgrades in bathroom and flooring in room. Pool was small but refreshing. Enjoyed cocktails and meals next door at Lava Tube.
user_name:
Esmeralda M
San Diego, California, USA

review_body: Great affordable property. Rooms are compact but good enough for 2 people comfortably. Loved the kitchenette. Parking just too small for even a mid size car, steep awkward driveway that wasn’t to safe to come out of.

We had coffee the first day but we drank it and she never left us another bag of coffee the next day and all she did was fold the blankets and she never emptied our trash cans and she never left us any shampoo and soap so we had to go and buy some.

This is the second time staying in this hotel. Can not fault the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff we encountered. Checking in late at night was easy and quick. The pool area is small, but just nice enough to get a little sun in the morning and shade in the heat of the afternoon.There’s a shuttle bus free and it takes you to a variety of places, Ala Moana shopping centre for one. Which is huge and great to go for a day. The bus was air conditioned and the driver super friendly. Our room was tight, for two single people. But still ok for us. The beds were super comfy. My friend didn’t like the sheets saying hers kept coming untucked and scrunching up. I didn’t have that issue. Twice the room wasn’t made up, though I thought sheets were clean enough anyway. We had the kitchenette and in hindsight didn’t really need it. Thought we’d make coffee etc. there’s National hire car directly across the road if you’re looking to drive around the island. If you want a mustang, book a couple of days in advance and book it from open time so you get one. Otherwise you may get other type of convertible. Now, although the tiki bar in the hotel complex is apparently not part of the hotel, it’s still there and I have to mention this. Having sat in there having drinks for majority of the afternoon, hosts were very friendly, however we believe something was amiss with our bill. We didn’t get an itemised bill as one of our party out it on their card. But the Aussie dollar conversion for the bill was $684 dollars.Now - we might be able to drink a bit, but we would not have drank that many drinks for the bill to be that high. So my warning to anyone staying at this place, CHECK YOUR BILL if you go into the bar off reception. Other than that this stay was very good

Air Conditioning was not cooling the room well, even when set to high. TV was very old, did not have any modern ports. Front desk was not able to supply any adapters.Bathroom and kitchenette were very old and dirty. Cups were not clean. Floors had numerous stains.The twin bed in the room sloped outwards, making it uncomfortable to sleep on. Parking and resort fees increased the room rate by almost $60 per night, so add that to your budget. Street parking was very difficult to come by, in fact, they did not even have a temporary area to park your vehicle so you can pop in to check-in.

Very nice hotel, very pleasant staff, easy access to beach and surrounding amenity in the core of Wakiki. We have bright room on high floor, which has a very nice view, the room also has a kitchen, so it is easy to do some family cooking. It is just 5 minute walk to go to beach, or for driving to the main roads for travel, and lots of entertainment right around corner.

My travel mate booked Aqua Ohia for our one-week stay on Oahu; I was told Waikiki Beach is quite expensive and this was our most budget option if we wanted a private room. While the location is good, I found the property to be a bit lacking.The lobby is well maintained and appears modern and the staff were always friendly and welcoming. There is a beach towel service that was very handy and a water bottle refilling machine in the lobby. The pool is very small and there are pool washrooms for hotel guests (using a key card to access).The room was clean and just roomy enough though it is a little dated. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom, however, needs significant updating. The shower head was quite weak, and the toilet was located in an awkward spot facing the counter, with very little space to maneuver.Secure parking is available for a fee each night HOWEVER vehicles were double parked almost every single day we were there; we had to drop off the rental car keys to the front desk every time we parked so that they could rearrange the cars as needed. This was less than ideal as the parking garage is already very small and hard to drive through without vehicles being double parked.The location of the hotel was fantastic if you plan to be at the beach or out and about most days, and do NOT need parking. There's a number of restaurants, shops and bars nearby, some located right downstairs and across the street.Overall, we had a decent stay aside from the parking garage hassle but I'm inclined to spend a bit more and stay somewhere nicer on my next trip to Oahu. If you're on a budget and want a private room, you get what you pay for.

I stayed at this hotel 6 nights, it is a two-star hotel so you can't expect too much, but Wi-Fi in NOT FREE. I spend in addition to the room price $ 28 a day for parking (and I believe that 90% of customers have necessity) and $ 25 a day for each room for a fee for using Wi-Fi (in my room on the 12th floor it doesn't work so much , and when there was a little signal I could not even download the mail!), towels, and newspapers, and coffe/tea. The room was cleaned only the first day, I asked for coffee for the coffe machine every day, I used it and don't refil it, same thing for the products of the bathroom. the location is good, everything is in the area, but the restaurants are more expensive than other ares . the staff is not very prepared on the uses and customs of the place, but however is very friendy and kindly . Overall you can choose this place but don't forget that your vacation will cost more than you would have thought, for this price you can fondo a better place!

Very good location in Honolulu, but the hotel is old and the furnishings and bathroom should be renovated.The pool is very small and unattractive, while the shuttle and the garage services are very useful.

Bed was good, plenty of hot water, otherwise a very tired building with nothing to recommend it Staff work hard but they’re fighting a losing battle . Location is very convenient but noisy at night. Definitely no frills.

The staff will definitely make you feel welcome and work to ensure that you are taken care of. Location is also exceptional, enjoy the view, distance to the beach, shopping and eating places. Mahalo for the exceptional service...

Pros:- Excellent location. Marukame is right next door. Duke's lane is right across the street. Bus stops are right across the hotel. Airport shuttle drops you right at the hotel. Beach is just 5 min walk away- They provide towels to bring to the beach- Free hotel shuttle to Ala Moana and back is provided- Filtered water machine at the lobby- You can have you luggages stored for free- There's a kitchenette in the room. Stove, sink, refrigerator Cons:- Room may be dirty. The room I stayed in had stains on the floor, hair in the bathroom, and tiny ants crawling on the floor and on the tables- Shower is tiny- Check-in process is horrendous. The staff needs to explain the amenities fee to every customer. It's $25/night (before tax) and a little over $27/night after tax. The fee covers internet and.. who knows what, but you have to pay for it- Elevators are outdated, tiny, there's only 2, and are slow. Expect to wait for the elevator more often than not

fix your toilet. it is not working after you flush it one.jsonfnfdkkdkdkdklsjslfaslkjlksjdflasjdlajfklsjfdlasjdflasdfsdkljflsadjflsdjfkdsjflksdjflsjlksjdflasjdfsdifelkrjldsjflsdjflsdjflksdjlajjkdsljfalskfjlsajflsd

While the staff and housekeeping were friendly, and the location was great I would not recommend staying here. The pictures are not accurate depictions. The shower was small with incredibly poor water pressure and had holes in the shower walls. The carpet in the room was filthy. The halls had a musky smell and the lobby furniture looked dirty. I have no intentions of staying here or any affiliated hotels in the future.

My fiancée and I arrived to the hotel around 10am. We asked what the fee would be in order to check in early and were told that it would be a full day charge. The front desk offered to hold our luggage while we either lounged at the pool or walked around the city. We chose to walk around. We were able to get our room right at 3pm. We were highly disappointed because the pictures do not accurately represent what the rooms really look like. We had reserved and paid for six days, and it was non refundable. The carpet had stains and looked filthy, the bathroom was not only old but did illicit feeling of cleanliness. The shower had holes in the wall and was incredibly small with very low water pressure. We tried very hard to not touch the walls, or shower curtain and showered wearing flip flops. There was dust build up between the bed and the walls. Although we would not ever recommend this hotel, nor are we willing to stay here in the future the hotel is in a central location. It is within walking distance to several tourist attractions, there are plenty of food options in the area, Waikiki beach is a few minuets walk, the zoo is a mile away etc.. The hotel chain offers a complimentary shuttle that runs every 30 min. back and forth to all of the different “Aqua” hotel locations and the Ala Moana shopping mall. The staff was friendly and the housekeeping was sweet and accommodating. Unfortunately the hotel is just in desperate need of a renovation. On our next visit we are most definitely willing to pay a higher price in order to stay in a hotel that we feel more comfortable in.

The place is kind of old, the pool is very tiny and the room is average. What I like most is the location of this place. it is closer to the mall and foods. just cross the street from the studio. The waikiki beach is in the walk distance.

Hotel was Old as are many of the facilities in Waikiki, however it was very clean and the staff where excellent, always smiling and happy to help. Great position with everything in easy walking distance for Beaches restaurants and a short bus ride to Diamond Head. Would recomment this place for anyone

This accommodation was just ok, we were not in our rooms much therefore it was just what we needed. It is on the cheaper scale and as i said you pay for what you get. I would recommend this of you just want a room to lay your head.
user_name:
Kerrilyn J
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Booked through Trivago, Love Holidays and they did not forward my payment to the hotel. As a result, hotel charged us again and put us in a basic room for the night when we had booked and paid for a deluxe room. Check in was 3pm, they made us wait until 6pm whist they tried tracking down the payment. This should of been done before our arrival. Stayed 1 night and left. Filthy room and disgusting bathroom.

Not too bad for the location. Only thing that bothered me was that the beds were pretty uncomfortable to the point where I kept waking up multiple times throughout the night. Oh, and no jacuzzi, just a small pool. No smoking property, even on the balconies, so had to go outside down stairs to smoke every time. Pretty sure it’s a pet-friendly environment, which I didn’t mind at all.

Two nights without sleeping due to extreme noise from street bars traffic. Fifth floor junior suite old and run down. We were "upgraded" to this hotel from the Aqua Oasis sister hotel after complaining about the total absence of hot water in our room no and with no timely solution in sight.Out of the frying pan and into the fire!! Ruined our three nights in Waikiki.

Travelled to Hawaii for the first time, with my sister. Ohia is in such a great location, close to shopping, food, block and a half from Waikiki beach, fabulous!The staff were so friendly and efficient and although the bathroom was a little tired, the room was big enough, quiet enough and (a big surprise for me) the beds very comfortable and very clean. Would highly recommend the Ohia for price and proximity.

Overall this was a decent room, friendly staff, and great location. The only issue we had was that housekeeping disregards the do not disturb sign. They entered our room while we were away even though we had the sign on. Make sure to rent a small car as the entry to their parking garage is really tight but the parking attendants are very nice

There is no swinging door for the bathroom l, just a sliding door that still stays a little open so there is no exclusive privacy. There were little bugs in the shower. The room itself was clean, but small.

Not much to complain about. I understand it was an older hotel. Staff was friendly. Aside from the AC smell ling like filter was old when first walking into the room, everything else was clean. I don't notice the smell once you're inside for a bit though. Overall great experience.

Roaches everywhere, parking was terrible. We found several roaches in our room, and the parking was very very limited. They told us we can leave out car keys and double park for now, which I didn’t feel comfortable with cause it’s my rental and responsibility for damage to the car.

The hotel is in a very good location and the staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms need to be upgraded and the cleanliness should be better.If you want to enjoy the island fully and do not need to spend much time in the room it is good value for money.

This is a great location in Waikiki as you can get to the beach and all shopping amenities, coffee, international market and other amenities very quickly. The staff is very friendly and greeted me upon arrival and departure as I went in and out of the building. Comfortable beds and a balcony to enjoy morning coffee on made my trip!

I’m disappointed in this hotel. I’ve stayed at multiple aquas and this one is the most embarrassing hotel ever. I was given attitude and constant eye rolling from the front desk. The manager hid in her office and didn’t even explain the situation to me. I was irritated and frustrated since I just got off of work. Not worth it! I informed the hotel 3 days before my stay that I couldn’t get off work early. The pictures are misrepresenting. Some Outlets didn’t work. Oh and the curtain rod in the shower fell on my head. I would suggest you stay at another hotel rather than this one. THIS IS AN EMBARRASSMENT!

I selected this hotel primarily because it fit my budget and was in my desired location - downtown, close to the beach. Overall, it was decent. Not fancy, but it served its purpose. The AC was a major letdown (didn't work at all), and there were some minor maintenance issues in our room (squeaky doors, wear & tear, stains, etc.). Also, there were no blackout curtains, and the walls were super thin, so it was pretty noisy. However, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room other than to sleep, so it was ok for what we needed. I liked that it was so central to all the shopping/restaurants, and that it was a short walk to the beach. Don't go expecting something super swanky, because that's not this hotel. If you just want a place to sleep, shower, etc., this is a decent option for the price. Bring a sleep mask to shut out the light (I ended up buying one on the second day we were there), and earplugs if you can't sleep through noise.

Great Property. Reservations very helpful. We had a great time. The property was just perfect for what we needed. The whole trip didn't start off so great but it ended up being good after we got to stay in this property and close to everything.

We did have a great time staying at the hotel. Location is perfect, everything is within your reach. Love the beverages too while waiting to check in. Having a lunch at the pool side is cool while waiting for our check in, the smiles of the employees every time we meet makes it a plus, very convenient location. We love it.

Aqua Ohia Waikiki has super friendly and helpful staff, it's location is great, walking distance to most places. The free shuttle to Ala Moana is great too. Although not flash & fancy it is great value for money and very comfortable

The facility was clean. It was clearly an older building but has been maintained. The staff were wonderful and gracious as we were there before 'check-in' and didn't leave until after 'check-out'. There were very accommodating with our luggage and answered all our questions. I would stay again.

So we had a situation in which we had to find a place to stay fast in Waikiki. Our Air BnB wasnt as advertised so we started looking for another spot. We found Aqua Ohia and they were able to accommodate me and 4 of my friends the same day. They were very helpful and sa ved our trip. The only complaint thatd I'd have about the hotel is that the air conditioning in the rooms needs some work. Doesnt get nearly cold enough to sleep very comfortably but luckily they offer fans that help circulate the air. Over all though, a great stay.

There has been a lot of mixed reviews about this hotel before we stayed but overall it was great value for money. In relation to Customer Service, 5/5 (Staff - Very helpful and friendly); Location: 5/5 - The most central location you can get to both the beach, International Market Place, Nostrum Rack and Great Coffee); Cleanliness: 4/5 - Well Maintained; Hotel 3/5: Aged and needs a major overhaul; Value for Money: 5/5 (What you pay is what you get). The location, Staff and value for Money outweighs the aged look of the hotel.Definitely, somewhere to stay if you want something that is central at great price!

Motel very old, very rundown. Bathroom unclean hair on tiles. Tv wouldn't turn off. Lamp light wouldn't work. Kitchenette extremely old, paint falling off cupboards. Room very small. Corridoors very noisy.

Roaches in the room, horrible parking, no organization in the lobby, minimal care for hotel, a lot of fees for no reason, air conditioning was horrible, no microwave, no free breakfast, only provided shot cups in the lobby for the coffee

Great value hotel, great service, very friendly staff, nice rooms. pretty clean. very tight parking garages if you have a large rental car. good location, nice comfortable beds, plenty of space in the room.

Great Staff, the staff treated my Dog Capone and I excellent. I will miss my stay there. They made my PCS very easy, even though I was going to high amounts of stress. They made me forget it. I will def stay here again.

Hawaii is very hot this time of year. The room was was warm even at night with 5he air conditioning running I was sweating I would think for the money that the customers are paying the stay should be comfortable

Was happy to find a reasonably priced room in a decent location last minute on July 4th holiday. We had a vacation rental cancel on us after the check-in time and were scrambling to find a decent place to stay at a reasonable price and the Aqua Ohia seemed to be one of the better values available last minute so we were very happy they could accommodate.

If you’re staying here as an incoming or outgoing TLA Family I would 100% avoid this hotel option. Go stay at the Best Western Plaza or the lodges. This place was incredibly behind the times on paperwork and will cause your reimbursement to be delayed but still demand an upfront payment in full- which we were prepared to pay for IF we were given the zero balance receipt for doing so which we were denied until checkout. We stayed one night in the most ridiculously laid out “suite” and checked out the next day in favor of the BW which was a breeze to check in to. If I could give negative stars I absolutely would.

Pros:-Cheap-Close to beach, restaurants, and gay night life (Tapas, Bacchus, Wang Chungs)Cons:-We booked two king rooms months ahead and checked in super early before 3 but were still told none were available.-Outdated rooms. Our bathroom wasn’t even finished. Didn’t have a sliding door at all for it’s closet. Bathroom shower pressure is abysmal. I couldn’t even wash the sand off my body majority of the time, let alone the shampoo. -WiFi very slow-Walls are like cardboard. Hear entire conversations next door.-Pets: while good for pet owners, our entire week stay was filled with dogs barking on our floor. Also... us and our friends in there room were sneezing left and right whenever we came back to our rooms.-Service: The don’t seem to care much for the customer. We had one day where we were told that we had to stay and wait for house keeping to make the room because they were going home and it had to be done while we waited there. Friends were really confused.-Extra Charges: Ok so we paid a resort fee tax on check in that added $25 ish per night... and then on check out another tax on the tax? I mean... hidden charges left and right.

One of the very few hotels that accepts big dogs and you’re gonna pay $35 a night in pet fees with no evident reason for it. Our pet room was so disgusting the Health Department would likely condemn it. Disclaimer- the staff and management are very friendly and responsive. This hotel just flat out has a serious housekeeping problem and the property owner is clearly not interested in investing money to repair/renovate. The bright, fresh looking rooms on their website is not what you will see when you get there. We had two water leaks, one in floor and one in ceiling, standing water in another location of ceiling from a leak somewhere, housekeeping did not service the room for first five days because she was afraid of our dog even though we secured him in his kennel, our mattresses were stained with pee and blood and had to be replaced, carpet had pee and spill stains, the sliding glass door to balcony would often come off track or stick (my husband was stuck on balcony one night for about 20 minutes), lack of hot water, bugs, the smoke detector was detached and inoperable, and there were smears of god knows what all over the walls. The laundry room reeked of must and mold. All of the washing machines were very rusty and 6 out of the 10 dryers were broken. I met with management a few times to discuss issues and she appeared concerned. The last meeting I had with management was the same day we left and went to another hotel. After presenting all of the issues we encountered, we were offered zero reimbursement or the like for a very substandard stay. If you want a good location and don’t mind a disgusting place to sleep, this is your hotel.

I wanted to give this hotel zero review. this is junk hotel.they over charge you without ur notice. you can only find out on ur credit card statement.abt extra charges. there is bugs in the hotel rooms. its dirty but yes its the next street to the main st Kalakaua is only good thing.

I went on a family trip and had my two toddlers with me ages 1 and 2. When your in a room with 5 people and 2 of them toddles things get a lil messy. I didn’t ask for house keeping they came into my room and “cleaned” it. And because they had to vacuum the room not just make the bed they wanted to charge me $150 because that’s not what they do when they clean a room! ‍♀️ Wtf seriously they don’t vacuum a room that’s next to a beach?! Making a bed isn’t cleaning so what’s the resort fee? What’s house keeping for?? If that’s not in the housekeeping guidelines then they should provide the guest with cleaning supplies. Especially when I wasn’t notified of any charges or possible charges when I checked in. They don’t clean the rooms no wonder they have roaches as big as your palms!

I enjoyed my time at this hotel. It was very close to the beach and was also near a mall. In my opinion this hotel would be good for a family vacation. Though the pool is a bit unsanitary and the room is quit old, I think its price matches the quality and service they serve. ( I would NOT recommend the pool though)
