It was such a pleasure for both myself and husband. Everyone always made sure we were okay. Staff members always greeted us all the time. Need more people like them. Hotel is situated in the right area. We didn't have to go far to grab something to eat.

I enjoyed interacting with the staff. They were helpful and personable. Although the room was a bit shabby, the staff's overall personality and all around aloha made the stay at the Aqua Ohia worth it.

Housekeeping is lazy....Backed up toilet, hair found under the sheets, sheets didnt smell fresh, room to small to have 2 beds in it. We could barely get out to the lanai because the bed was in the way

Welcoming staff were unwelcoming, it was crazy stuffy and no AC or ceiling fans. The Bed was hard and overall cleanliness gets a 2 Location was great to walk to Waikiki. That is the plus. The only plus.

The location was perfect; sits in the heart of Waikiki and very close to all the shops. Loved the professionalism of the staff and the size of the room. Check in was a breeze. The parking is a little tight, but manageable.

The whole building needs to improve! Bathroom doors are coming off the hinges, TVs barley word, the showers are ridiculous small like you’re in jail or something! The elevators smells HORRIBLE, AND you have bugs!!! Have the nerve to charge $25 A DAY for things I NEVER received! This was probably the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at!

Staff was friendly, but room needed paint and update. Beds were comfortable. Would have liked a tub in the room instead of just a shower. Size of room was good. Cost was fair, but asking an additional $35 per day "Resort Fee" was ridiculous! This is not what I consider a resort. Noisy street even though we were on the 14th floor the balcony sliding door was old and thin so it did not offer sound proofing.

Great location but rooms are severely lacking. Who uses a kitchen on vacation. They should really look into redoing the room and expanding the bathroom, putting in better lighting, better beds, modern air conditioner, and newer tv.

The Ohia is an older property on Kuhio, across from the new International Marketplace. It is nice that there is parking available, the elevators work well, and that there is a small kitchenette in the room. It is one step up from Aqua's lowest priced option, the Ewa, but it is definitely in need of an upgrade.

Great stay overall awesome, employee named Paris was very warm and helpful during our arrival. Check In was great and went smoothly, didn’t have to wait too long and overall it was a chill spot and great location next to the shops and restaurants. Great find.

The room and bathroom is old and poor construction. This hotel best equates to a low end Ramada. I was placed in an outside room and asked for an inside room. The inside room was very small. The bathroom was a little better than the first room. Poor construction of the room. I checked out the same day because I was so disappointed. Also $28 per night for parking. The place reeked of prostitution and murder.

Centrally located in Waikiki, Aqua Ohia is steps away from shops and dining and convenient for the business traveler. Friendly staff keep fill the front desk with "ALOHA." Thank you for a pleasant stay!!

reasonable price and good location. house keeping could be improved but overall good price for what we were needing and in central Waikiki which made it easy to get around. Great friendly team at front desk, made us feel very welcome.

Not the best for the price. Bathroom was too small. Random door between the bathroom and beds. Utensils in the room were dirty when we got there. Blow dryer amd coffee pot didnt work properly. Even though prices were cheap online, still had to pay another $450 for hotel fees and a room upgrade becauee they didnt have the room with the bed I had reserved.

The location is great but the hotel is in need of a total bathroom renovation to begin with. Cracked vanity top. Small shower with tiles painted over and mould showing around the base. Leaky taps (faucets), grime around the shower screen and a musty smell in the hallway. The fridge didn’t work and food spoiled on the first night. It was replaced the next morning but not good enough. There was also another broken fridge under the TV. No where to sit and eat despite having a stove and sink. Only a desk or sit on the bed. No table on the balcony either. Two dinner knives supplied. Nothing to cut food for cooking or even cut bread. There was used soap left in shower recess and dirty used glasses on vanity. The resort fee was unreasonable when the pool was stuck outside the foyer in a position no one would use, and as far as I saw that was it as far as resort goes.

Service: staff is helpfulRoom: adequate for sleeping, but not if you will spend much time in the roomLocation: walkable and convenientAmenities: kitchenette includes small fridge, stovetop; no microwave ovenBest about the hotel: locationLeast liked: Hotel needs major and complete overhaul/facelift The walls are all in badly need of repainting, the wallpapers are stained, the carpeting is old and fraying, light fixtures and cabinetry needs to be updated.

The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki within easy walking distance of the beach, shopping, and restaurants. The staff were all really friendly and made us feel welcome. The hotel may not be the fanciest in Waikiki, but we felt it was very good value for money. The room was clean and comfortable. . We didn't go to Waikiki to sit around in the room, so why spend significantly more elsewhere when this hotel met our needs very nicely. The small kitchenette was also a nice touch. You could make a snack in the room if you didn't feel like running out to grab something to eat. We definitely will stay here again next time we are in Waikiki.

Most likely to comeback. Location wise 4-5 min walk to Waikiki beach. Housekeeping was efficient and very friendly. Had problem checking in, I reserved 3 beds room for us but when we arrived they had a prob of looking for one. So we had to wait 10-15 minutes. Shuttle service a plus too. Very nice drivers always on time. Shower room quite tight not good for people with Claustrophobia.

We requested a kitchenette room hoping we’d have some basic facilities to reheat some meals, but we found that what was provided didn’t suit what we had hoped to do. The lighting was poor in our room as well. Bed was clean and comfortable though.The concierge desk is brilliant, hands down had the best luau recommendation. Great local advice offered.

A value hotel in a great location. You'll get friendly service, decent rooms with kitchenette, and a location near everything. No need a car, walk, take a shuttle, there's shopping, restaurants, beaches, the zoo, and night life all around..

ladies at the front desk where great. perfect location, public transportation right outside the front door. walking distance to shopping. pool area small, rooms could use alittle up grade. i would stay here again

Room and location ok but they add extra USD 25 charge to each room calling it a compulsory amenities fee. This was not mentioned on the websites.This is important if one of you main selection criteria is price

Staff was not educated.Bathroom doesn't have bathtub, only small shower. Cleaning stuff enter my room to clean even I put DO NOT Disturb sign and throughout my personal stuffs. Next day in the morning fire alarm goes off and have to go to the street until they check all rooms at 8am.

Could have a somewhat better review if better customer care was given. If you’re looking for a bed to sleep on and nothing more, this is an option. Better hotels out there for the price paid on our stay.

We had a wonderful stay at the Aqua Ohia! Everyone was super friendly and made us feel at home. We enjoyed the free coffee and newspaper in the morning and the water and passion tea in the afternoon. We will definitely stay here again.

Was happy how close the hotel is to everything, but the resort fee is a bit much for what they offer. Rooms are very nice and is very clean. The coffee is a bit weak for the in room service. And no shuttle to airport provided with the resort fee, must pay an additional 14$ per person, so it's better to take the bus instead.

Service was awesome including from desk. Parking was just overbooked and overpriced, but other than that everything was good. The beds and rooms were clean and towels were provided at all times as we requested

Rooms are outdated and in need of redecorating and remodeling. Pool area is tacky and not of a place to be expected. Rooms need a complete overhaul but reasonably clean. Staff are great and helpful. The attached and walkthrough Lava Pit restaurant/bar is dodgy but may not be officially linked to hotel.

Nice very friendly staff. Clean hotel and rooms. Could use some updates bit good enough for us as we were out most of day. Great location minutes from shopping and food. If you’re looking for a nice friendly place to stay without all the fancy bells and whistles, this is a great place to stay.

The rate for the room was reasonable. It wasn't fancy, but clean. I liked having a refrigerator. The room was cleaned well while I was there. I couldn't get into the place my family was at and this was close by so I decided to give it a try and was happy with it. I got to check in early and that was a plus.

The rooms are in need of serious remodeling. They don't look like they have ever been remodeled. The bathroom is disgusting, bed frames yellow from being so old and the kitchen area has a strong odor. They also did not give is the bed type requested. The location is great but could not recommend this hotel to anyone.

The carpets in the room were filthy, to the point that my feet were dirty just walking around the room and there were quite a few bugs in the kitchen. I reported these to the reception staff who said they would send someone up but no one came up. This was a suite so I expected it to be better than it was.

Do not stay here! I get that Hawaii has COCKROACHES but this place is infested with them. Walked into my room and at least saw and killed a couple. They also messed up our room and didnt give us the room we booked! It is worth $20+ extra a night to stay somewhere different! We were booked for 4 nights checked out and moved hotel because this hotel was completely disgusting and smells horrible!!!

Room for price was not bad at all and you get a nice little balcony where you can sit and enjoy the breeze when not at the beach and loads of eating options nearby beach was walking distance and not that far away overall nice place and good location

We had a wonderful time in Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel shuttle was very convenient. Always someone around cleaning or sweeping. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone.

The Rooms Are Very Nice & The Managers Ms. Melissa & Ms. Christine Are Very Helpful & Resourceful!!! The Front Office Staff Cleaning Crew IAre Very Nice Also!!! I Enjoy My Stay Here, So I Keep Coming Back!!!

Bathroom was dirty (floor and shower), Kitchen utensils were dirty. No Microwave, Furniture was inadequate (only one desk chair) and the music across the street was loud. Pool furniture was old and the pool was not inviting. Staff was excellent!

Very nice Hotel, central, close to shops, beach, zoo, restaurants, free shuttle around Waikiki.Like to recommend this hotel to every one, single, families, business, young or old. etc.Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

If the room was made darker with rubber backed material for the curtains and the window pane reset from clanging from the wind, it would make it perfect to sleep as that is what you need the most to be able to walk all the streets of your beautiful Honolulu Streets and go on all the tours.

This place was great if you have a pet, specifically a larger dog. Only one of two hotels in Honolulu I know of that accepts larger dogs, and this place was fantastic compared to the other while I was waiting on my personal belongings to arrive when I moved here. This is the place I’d stay again if I had to do it again.

My husband and I needed a place to hangout for a day while waiting for our flight home, after it got changed to a red eye. We couldn’t get late checkout at our vacation rental, so were pleased at the price at the Aqua Ohia. The staff were friendly and helpful with arranging an early check in. The room was comfortable enough and had everything we needed (hot shower, sunny lanai, fridge, and a comfy king size bed to stretch out on for a pre flight nap). The “Lava Tube” bar and restaurant has a very funky decor and a great breakfast, and $4.99 Mai Tais! We also appreciated the handy location for quick access to Dukes Lane for those last minute gifts.

We arrived early to leave our bags, prior to heading to our business meeting. Rooms were ready, and we we're allowed to check in early. The front desk was quick, courteous, and professional. They even let us leave our luggage after checking out so we didnt have to drag them all over Oahu, As we had a late night flight back home

Came from Kaua'i for two-day convention. Location of hotel was very handy to bus line. I used public transport to and from airport, and to attend my convention. Staff was super friendly, helpful, and made me feel comfortable. My room was simple, not too fancy, but very clean and comfortable. The street noise at night was a bit troublesome, but after all, it's the middle of Waikiki! If you shut the windows and turn on the AC you might not notice the street noise. I will certainly return when I have business in Honolulu.

Excellent location to Waikiki shops and restaurants. We only stayed one night, could do with some refurbishing. Has a pool. Shuttle to shopping centre available, cost included in amenity fee. Good for budget.

I enjoyed my brief one night stay at the Ohia. I'm a simple kind of fella so as long as my shower has hot and cold water, my toilet flushes properly, the A/C is cold, the room is clean & comfy and the staff is nice & professional, I'm a happy camper . And I can't complain about the price and location; great value and near the bus line!

with money put into this place by the owners it could be nice but the way it is i do not think you will get repeat business not from us for sure first night i knelt down to pick up something and ruined my capri pants because the flooring is so dirty and needs replaced the cleaning people can only do so much

This hotel is a place for someone on a budget.We booked here because it was showing 3 stars and the reviews were Ok. I personally think this place is a 2 star. Very run down and out dated. We also did not get the room we booked and it smelled. When we complained, we were told that they give what they have available and it doesn't matter what you booked a head of time. That was the first time I have been told that in all my travels. So they upgraded us to a studio for extra $$$. I took it because I was tired and wanted to get out of the smelly room. It is close to the beach,food and shopping.The staff is friendly and accommodating. They are trying the best they can with what they have to deal with. Rent a car so you can explore the island.

The rooms are very run down. The website pictures are nothing like the rooms. The bathroom is terrible, the shower is prison like, the toilet and sink facet need to be replaced. You can her the room next doors toilet flushing.The location is fantastic and the lounge downstairs was great.

This hotel is perfectly located amongst a ton of restaurants and within walking distance to a lot of stores. There is the international marketplace right next door and a great ramen restaurant located nearby as well. If you like to shop designer brands, you are within a ten minute walk and same with the beach. There is a parking but it is tight and you will pay a daily fee but that's normal in Waikiki. The room size was great because we got the suite with 2 beds. It was a definite plus having a kitchen because we were able to make some meals.

All the staff members were very friendly! The room had a fridge, stove, and oven! It also had a balcony. Loved the room and how comfortable and relaxing everything was! I plan on visiting again. Great price rate for the room!

The rooms were disgusting and smelly. The hotel itself needs to be upgraded, baseboards are rotting and grout has been put on over and over. Carpets are old and worn. Sheets were clean and bed was comfy.

Room was booked knowing there was issues with the hot water. Spent close to an hour trying to get another room, it was like pulling teeth. No supervisor was ever available to deal with the situation. Very unpleasant to deal with after 10 hours on a plane to not be able to take a shower!

The location of the hotel is great! The front desk was informative. When i first reached to the hotel, it seems pretty normal until i reached my room. It was smelly, and everything looks so old. We had to change the room due to uncomfortable smell. later we found out that the smell was from bug spray. don't recommend the hotel.

The room was well worth the price. The location is prime and secluded all at the same time. The room was a hotel is on the older side, but for the price, can't complain. Our room had 3 beds 2 ice box, stove, sink and dishes and dish soap..plus I seen people catching a shuttle that the hotel provided..beta yet.

I have never left a review for anything before but Kathy, Nikki, and the amazing staff at the Aqua Ohia have left such an impression on me that I had to share my experience. I've been at the Ohia for about 3 months now and can honestly say that it has been the most fun and at home that I have ever felt while traveling, from the complimentary drinks and food on mondays to the extremely courteous staff greeting you every time you arrive. My room was awesome! It had a small kitchenette that was perfect for cooking up meals to save some money, an extremely comfortable bed, and the view from my room was amazing! I had zero issues with my room and when I requested something the staff was always quick to help. The Ohia is great because of its location in Waikiki, it's walking distance to everything but it's slightly set back from the majority of tourists so it's the best of both worlds! I'll definitely book again at the Ohia if I'm ever back in Oahu. Thanks again Kathy and Nikki for making my stay so welcoming!

Nice hotel, room is spacious for the price and balcony had views of the river and water. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Limited kitchen facilities but that isn't an issue if you are planning on eating out. Located within walking distance to lots of shops and eateries and close to the markets. Enjoyed our stay here very much, the room and bed were very comfortable and we had no issues.

Hotel needs update fresh paint would make a much better over all view. Mold removal in bathroom would help. Cigarettes in pool should have been removed. The staff is wonderful so helpful and pleasant.

Housekeeping doesn't clean the room daily.Over priced for what you get.You won't get a good nights sleep either because there are losers screaming and fighting in the adjacent street at 4:00 am almost every night.The receptionists harass you with disrespectful remarks for no reason when you walk past them to get to the elevator.If I could give this place a 0 I would. I'm going to get a refund on my stay because I have proof that housekeeping did not clean my room.As far as the receptionists and their disrespectful attitude go, that will take care of itself.

Awesome definitely recommend to others worth every minute of our stay the staff were very nice and helpful great customer service, minutes walk from everything you need from the beach, food to travel well located feels like home

We stayed here one night while waiting for our Airbnb to open up and it was just ok. Hotel is very old. The rooms were clean but you could see they had been painted so many times, bathroom does not have a tub, just an old stand up shower and the rooms are not sound proof at all. We could hear the people next to us constantly opening and closing their patio door, there was a rooster that started crowing at 5 in the morning, and all of it sounded as if we had the window open but didn’t. The “resort fee” is a joke, it’s just a way for them to be able to charge extra money. Internet was terrible. Would not stay here again.

Rooms are not very clean. Bathroom is disgusting, the floors and showers do not get cleaned. The shower curtains smells like mildew and throw up. The carpet floors are gross. They need to do some upgrades and more cleaning. The price of what they charge is not worth it.

Good location. A five minute walk to Waikiki Beach. 2 minutes to International Marketplace Breakfast place next to hotel and Duke's Market and grill across the street. Every staff member was friendly and helpful.

What I really like about this hotel is the location and it's value...it's walking distance to the beach, almost across the International Market Place and bust stops is just a step away. They give towels

We're booked 17 rooms for our group. Overall for the location, services, rooms size Studio Suite w/ Kitchen and the cost for the rooms, we're very please and we'll come back in the future. We stay here for 7 days and I'm as a group leader I did hear any complaint from any one in our group,

Had a great stay. The folks that worked the front desk were pleasant. The room was pretty good in size, was clean, and the beds were just right. Had a nice little in-house restaurant as well. Stay again.

It was my daughter 16th birthday so I had her invite friends to celebrate. I had my man with me. I got two rooms one for my daughter and her friends and one for me and my man. Was a great stay I live in Hawaii but sometimes it's just really nice to get a hotel to be able to relax for at least one night

The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The pool though small was clean and great for laps.The room is old especially the bathroom and needed major upgrades.It was one of the cheapest places you can book in Waikiki, plus the location was is great only 2 blocks off the beach and close to restaurants and activities.
user_name:
Craig C
Rancho Santa Margarita, California

review_body: Can't beat the location of this hotel. It is walking distance to everything, restaurants, shops, International Market and the beach. Also, 9 minutes away from Ala Moana. Very friendly staff and very clean rooms.

Last time the bath room was painted was surely during the mid-70's. Beds are ok. But with little efforts from Management, the hôtel could get a good quality/price ratio. For the time being it is quite overpriced with around 200 usd a night in the middle of March (low season).

Everything was fine except the rooms were very old (Nothing like picture I saw on the booking.com website) which was very disappointin! Room wasnot modern at all and room had an odor my wife could not stand. Staff were Very Very Nice and great drinks at bar!! Great location, and great price!!

Hotel very noisy especially the back rooms, to go crazy,two beds in a tiny room,the housekeeping is not done properly, we reported the paper and knife under the desk when we arrived, but it stayed until we left, and surely there is still !the state of the bathroom Oh My God,parking fee is theft, the entrance with the car is not practical, it is necessary to get out of the vehicule to ring and show a paper, it is so narrow that it is very easy to scratch the car, when it rains water seeps through the ceiling of the car park and we have the impression that it will collapse on cars, very impressed.

Staff was friendly. But parking is $28 a day additional fee, no ßhuttle from airport but there's a shuttle for a few places in town. On top of hotel charges there is an amenities fee, and cockroaches. They will spray your room but we still seen them 2 days later. Understanding it's by the water it's hard not to have them but you don't want to bring them home.

As a local Kamaaina who lives in Hawaii I enjoyed the staff at this location. They were helpful and suggested activities for us to do while staycationing in Waikiki. The beds were comfortable, shows to watch on cable tv was great, and cooking was easy with the full stove. Wish we had a microwave in the room but there wasn’t any.

I stayed at this hotel and my whole vacation was spoiled because my room was not cleaned by the house keeping crew. Despite my multiple attempts to notify the front desk, my room was not cleaned during my stay and we had to go out to the street frequently with the hope that the room would be cleaned when we come back but that was not the case. Finally, the room was cleaned by a security guy at the hotel around 10:00 PM on Saturday night 3/02. My family missed the Hawaiian Festival on Saturday night 3/02 just because I had to spend my time with the hotel manager to go over the issues and to voice my complaint. This was a horrible experience for me and my family.

The staff was excellent and very accommodating, but the room was very dated and smelled musty. The room was very small for a double occupancy room. It was equipped with a kitchenette, but did not have a microwave. We found it difficult to access the balcony as the bed was six inches away from the sliding door. We had to shimmy along the bed to get to the door.

Rooms dated and smelled of mildew. Power outlets sucked. Shower sorta did what it wanted, temperature wise. be ready to leap out of the way if it starts to run hot. Parking was easier for work trip though. they incorporated it into the cost of the room.

Don’t get a room by the elevator because you won’t sleep at night unless you’re dead drunk! I was in room 295 and the elevator noise was louder than street noise at night. Also room is very old and needs renovation.

Hotel is nothing flash, it's a bit tired, but its clean, tidy & comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. Great location for the beach, shopping & food. Nordstrom Rack straight across road. I would consider staying here again.

Don’t stay here. Bad service in the front desk! The room is so bad and have very loud sound from elevators. We have to change the room. And when we change the room, they not do a good service for our customers. Very very very bad experience in here. And we won’t come back here anymore. It’s terrible !

Love the employees . Ohana means family and they gave me and my family a huge hug before we left .. that’s ohana ! Will always come back ! Kudos to Imelda our housekeeper and jhaya one of the front desk and the bell man such wonderful people !

You pay for what you get. Great location. It very old and not that great of service. Housekeeping make many excuses why beds not made and bathroom supplies not refilled unless requested. This building is a old hostel for students and not updated.

The website pictures are very deceiving. The shower was like a jail cell. Bed was very uncomfortable. Stains on the carpet. The hotel maintance man told us that people try to break into rooms so make sure you keep everything locked up. The check in process took foreve as they made me fill out the same information twice. Staff were busy chatting with themselves instead of paying attention to the guest.

If you want Pacific Ocean views and resort ammenities, look elsewhere. If you are looking for a budget hotel to crash in Waikiki, then I rate this hotel as “OK”. I booked 48 hours from arrival through Agoda and paid around 145USD per night before tax and resort fee.My plane arrived at 6:30am. While official check in was 3pm, the front desk checked me in at 2:30pm. The hotel is really busy at this time of year. The lobby is small with an adjacent restaurant. There are loads of places to eat nearby and the beach is a 2 block walk.My 7th floor room was clean and the queen size bed comfortable with thin pillows. Air conditioning works but I left my lanai door open. Kuhio Avenue is really busy and there is a lot of construction in the neighborhood, which makes the room noisy with the door open. However, there are nice breezes. I did hear the people in the room next to me operating their taps in the shower. There was a funny plumbing noise.Wifi is part of the resort fee and is not great. I had trouble streaming movies on my tablet.Shower is small (no bath) and the water runs hot and cold. I could not see a hairdryer but the hotel provides shampoo, conditioner, soap and moisturizer.There is a small in-room kitchen which I did not use. No milk or tea provided but there is a filter coffee pot and a coffee bag.February is peak tourist time in Waikiki so I don’t know if there are better deals out there.Attached is a pano shot from my iPhone from the lanai.Mahalo

It was a very horrible experience! I am a aqua person n stay at ONLY aqua properties and this one by far is the WORST! I called to confirm my reservation and also asked about parking because I did have a FULL SIZE SUV FORD EXPEDITION! I was told there would be NO PROBLEM with parking such a big car, parking is spacious an BIG! I got there my car did NOT FIT IN PARKING GARAGE!!!! I did spoke with Ricky who told me “well you jus need to find a spot and park on the street because our upper parking is full!” and I still got charged 28.00 for parking!!!! we get to our room that we had to walk thru the hallway and out the exit door and around the corner. Room 658, I believe. Room smelled horrible, beds were NOT MADE! I was told id have 2 Queen Size Beds. They were maybe a full size!!!! Furnite was damaged holes in chairs. The tables n counter had bugs crawling. The AC was on high but could hardly feel air coming out. Lighting was horrible only 1 lamp worked. The bathroom was so small, kindergarten size toilet not even the bath rug could lay flat with how narrow the shower was.I called dow stairs again n spoke to ricky and told him of all of my concerns and asked to change rooms. He told me to call down stairs in AM. I called at 6am and spoke with Anna who told me they ca change my room if I pay another 30.00/night!!!! I was already paying 200.00/night. So i asked ti speak with a manager which she told me one was not available. I made accommodations at another hotel where was cheaper n WAY BETTER! I packed up my family and went down stairs to check out and all of a sudden there was a manager! Who den offers me an free upgarde after all this! We checked out did not get accomidated for parking or the nights stay! I call

Our keys never worked, if we went out they locked the front door at night and we got locked outside the building. Our keys never unlocked our room, NOT ONCE. We stayed there 5 days, It wasn’t even worth one night.

Inexpensive, but very dirty and uncomfortable. The staff was excellent and very friendly. The location of the hotel was very good in Waikiki. There were a ton of shops and food places nearby that we enjoyed very much. Overall, we would not recommend this hotel simply because of the accomodations in our room.

We wanted a good value with close access to Waikiki beach.Aqua Ohia has all this. The room was a bit small,dated and the elevator brought back the 80’s. No sea view but 5 minute walk and you were there. The parking situation is really bad on Waikiki. Ohia has a agreement with a neighbor hotel. Worked with 30$ /24h. Expensive-YesWe had a good vacation and the staff was always very friendly and helpful.

We chose this hotel b/c of its low rate and b/c a rental car was included for one day. Pool was small but nice. Not much of a lobby. It was clean and fine for our family trip. We only stayed there one night as we had points to use for other nights at a different hotel.

Booked though hotels com and got a good rate. Nice clean room. 10 mins walk to beach. It's located in the center of all Waikiki attractions. Good food is close. Waikiki is not really for the budget traveler. Most meals were close to $20. The location makes this places worth it.

The staff, was wonderful, easy check in, and always very pleasant. We were in one room but wanted a king bed, so moved us easily. The hotel itself is need of some updating but they keep it very clean, and will try to make it an enjoyable stay. The restaurant that there is great. Good drink selection, good food and seems to always be quite busy. We had the loco moco and it was delicious, also tried a couple of their drinks, one served in an entire pineapple, and the other served in a coconut. Also tried some of their shots they had on the menu. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars is the pool area. We have stayed at other Aqua properties (bamboo) , and this pool is not one that we felt we would lounge by if weather was nice. We were though only a few blocks from the beach chose to hang out there. Price can't beat it, location great, food great, rooms a tad worn, pool update. STAFF IS AWESOME!.

Friendly professional service on all levels from the moment of arrival to check out. Reasonable distance to Waikiki Beach and the stores. Shuttle bus, comfortable rooms. It is not a Five-star hotel but excellent for the price we paid.

Poor customer service Poor housekeeper serviceI would not recommend this property to anyone due to the roaches and black bug issues found around bathroom ,unclean closets from previous guest. I also recieved a refund email that was intended for another guest concerning roach issues with his credit card and reservation information. A

Was my first stay was good but due to some sort of event a lot of rooms were full so prices were higher then what I was told by friends but good place overall. Wish they had a eating place downstairs. Elevator was a little slow.

This hotel is in a great location. My only complaints are that the air conditioning did not work well and the bed was not very comfortable. We both woke up sweating. Other than that, you get what you pay for.

This place is in very poor condition. I would not recommend it for anyone. The location is not bad but some neighboring facilities are also uninviting. The facility needs to be completely reworked. It is a former dormitory with a lot of wear and tear. The staff at the desk and in housekeeping were friendly but could not make up for several sub-par aspects of the facility.

The hotel is in an excellent location, close to everything. The staff was very successful in making our stay very pleasant, especially Connie, looking very well after our room.Our room had kitchenette with everything 2 people need.

Good price and location. Parking structure is dangerous with people coming in and out of the same entrance. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The elevators are like old freight elevators. The building is old and needs an update. The rooms need to be renovated. The chair at our desk in our room was falling apart. A blind broke while we were sitting on the bed and it fell on us. There was a gross odor in the room, but I bought air freshener and that helped. Overall, I'd give this an average rating and would possibly return if I need to skimp on money and need a central Waikiki location.

Is ok for a few nights but the place needs to be upgraded it seems like they haven’t make an update to the building and rooms in a long while. I like the fact that it has a kitchen and the location is great.

All team members helpful and cheerful. There was always some one available too. Good accomodations for the price as well as good location close to Wakiki beach. Great package deal with room and rental car. Will be back.

The quality of the rooms and hotel are terrible. It is difficult to unload your bags as the hotel doesnt have a place to pull a car up. Parking is $28 a day and an added $25 for a resort fee that provides nothing. Rooms are extremely outdated. The only positive was the people at the front desk who were nice and understanding.

If you want an expensive, central location this hotel is great. Can use some upgrading, but for the age of the hotel and price you can't go wrong. The staff were always kind and helpful, we were close to everything. Carpets, plugins, shower fixtures need up dating, but room was clean, beds were fine. Having fridge and stove were great.

Room was quite nice BUT the bathroom could stand some serious work. Vanity interferes with commode ( intrudes into knee area when sitting on commode ) and shower is rough, looks like1952 vintage and hasn't been touched since.Plus side room had nice little kitchenette .

Room was tiny, dirty, and depressing. Smelled like mold. Building was incredibly old and in need of a renovation. This property is more like a hostel or tourist dormitory. If you are looking for comfort and cleanliness, this is not the property for you. Staff was friendly, but that was not nearly enough to make up for it.

If you’re looking for a place with that old school Waikiki feel, then this is the place. Not a cookie cutter hotel like the chains. Not for everyone’s taste but I like it as it is. Great retro bar/restaurant attached.

This is a clean hotel with really friendly staff. The property is just old and tired looking. Shower door didn't fully close, nor did the actual door to the bathroom. But the beds were comfortable, linens were clean, and the large patio was nice for natural light. Biggest bonus: just 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach!

I was told before we left to do Waikiki, that everything was getting dated and a 3 to 3.5 star review was pretty standard now for a family hotel in Waikiki. I believe 3 is what this hotel is worth at the most and struggle to rate this low without a serious complaint. BUT I dont want to raise any expectations of people that this is a modern hotel. The bathrooms are weary and hence dont feel that clean. The carpets are thread bare, there were no glasses for drinking juice or cool drinks in the kitchen or knives for cutting fruit like pineapple. There was an oven but I dont know what for as there really werent facilities to cook like enough utensils. The fridge barely kept things cold and certainly didnt freeze the ice cream we bought. So damn it we had to eat it all at once :) .The doors were hard to open and in general this needed a fair bit of maintenance.The staff were pleasant and check in was easy. Great to have swappable towels for the beach. Would have been nice to have had a wee kick back like at other places when you dont take up room service each day.It had a pool which was cool and refreshing with lights the kids loved at night.Fresh cool tea and water at the lobby was nice. A great large waiting area and loved the 12 noon check out. We didnt need it but I can see how it would allow you to go out for a swim and breakfast before you left.There was baggage storage facilities if you were early. I was glad about a free shuttle to Alamoana shopping center....... but we caught this one day and it did turn up but on the other 2 days we waited over an hour to have nothing turn up and we had to catch the pink line one day and a friendly shuttle driver from another hotel took us the other.This Hotel was in a great spot for both getting to the beach in 5 minutes walk and getting to dinner and eating at a wonderful selection of pplaces just across the road.

Great location. Only one block over from the beach and the International market is right in front of the hotel. Everything is in walking distance. Rooms can use some renovations and water temperature to be fixed.

Dirty rooms, kitchenette without anything to cook on or cut with, had a cockroach in our room. My legs had bites on them after the first 2 days so possible bedbugs. Each room needs a good cleaning like a deep clean!! A paint job and some basic maintenance as both sink taps were leaking.

False advertising on rooms cleanliness quality of building itself. Bathrooms were gross the bathroom door hit the toilet to shut, water quality was terrible we had to by bottled everyday for our trip.

Bed could use an upgrade but overall a nice stay. The tiny kitchen is definitely a plus! Limited parking but the location is great for those wanting to walk around the Waikiki area. For kama’ainas (local people) I felt the extra discount helped me to chose this hotel.

The location was great and the staff were really good which are the only 2 positive points for this hotel. The hotel is in desperate need of a renovation or being demolished and rebuilt. All the properties on this block are abandoned and derelict. The hotel is very noisy because of it's location and the fact that the windows are very "flimsy". The hotel is lucky their manager's are so efficient and courteous to the guests as I am sure this hotel receives many complaints. It was a disappointing and expensive holiday.

I did all of the registering for this hotel on my own with my own information and credit card. At the age of 24, I was not allowed to check in to the room without bringing my mother in from the car to confirm. I did not make a scene about this but was frustrated.We also felt that our room was lacking. The bathroom especially was gross looking and we worried about getting athletes foot in the shower.Overall,not my best hotel stay, considering the price.

reasonable price, perfect location, kitchen availibility, enough space room, good bed matress condition, safe place to go out at night, supermarket, restaurants near by, friendly staff, enough parking space for $28.

Great Location. Close to Trolley Lines. Lot's Of Shopping. 4 Blocks or so to Beach. Nice Restaurants in the area. No Pop or Ice Machines on floors. Rooms need upgrading. Connecting Bar has great Mai Tia s and breakfast specials.

The hotel was great to stay at! A reasonable price and amazing location! It was less than a 5 minute walk to the beach and right in the center for Waikiki! Tons of food and shopping options all around the hotel. Would stay there again!

Overall a nice, centrally located hotel with great personnel. Has refreshing, free drinks in the lobby, a free newspaper every morning to read by the pool! They have free shuttle service and the bus stops are close by.
user_name:
Gail F
Groveland, Illinois, United States

review_body: A bit of an older building but great staff, location and price more than make up for it. If you like to look on the bright side of life then consider it charming. They also have a pool and their in house restaurant makes some mean coctails. Try the Java Lava if you're into coffee.

Reservation was cancelled last minute by management. Had to settle for smaller room. Hotel in need of rehab and pay raises for stressed out staff. On the plus side? One block away from Murakame Udon Waikiki!

All staff was wonderful and friendly. The hotel room I was given did not match my reservation description. The rooms were needing a little more love. This hotel was fine for our 4 day stay, but I wouldn't do it again with more than two people, unless guaranteed a specific room.

When we saw this hotel in the Booking, it looked better than really was. Also was more expensive than other apartment we rent days ago. The lobby looks good but the room, old and dirty. The bathroom was very small and the shower has no power. The only thing good was the bed.

When I booked, I made a mistake and booked for Dec 1 instead on January 1st. The December 1st was in my price range. When I realized my mistake, I phoned and changed to the reservation. I had to pay over 100 more to keep it. When I got to the hotel, there was another 28US for parking and 25US for the facility fees. At the end, I paid over 500 CAN dollars for a noisy, stinky and dirty room with ants over the counter in the kitchen area. We spend almost 2 weeks on the Island. We had 2 hotels and 1 airbnb in Honolulu and 2 airbnbs around the island. Ohia was the most expensive and the dirtiest.

Location great, charged additional daily amenities fee upon arrival-unexpected, pool not really usable, front desk staff very busy not particularly helpful, and assistant for tour packages totally unhelpful.

Too expensive for a room like that but good staff members and service. Really good location. Too expensive. Have to improve the showers and light in the bathroom. Nice gift for departure. Cleaned rooms
user_name:
Relax53707419587
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a 1 star hotel. It's old. Located near a bar so its loud especially on karaoke night. Water is cold in showers. Update is awful. If you need a place just to sleep it's okay. If you'd like a comfortable room. Go somewhere else and pay the extra.

Booked this hotel because it was one of the ones available. The location of this hotel is great but the hotel rooms need major update. The rooms are dirty and outdated. The ceiling leaked and the carpet in that area was always wet. The bathroom door didn’t close well and the shower walls were pealing off. The windows are very thin so you could hear everything outside, so it was hard to sleep at night, but the beds were comfortable. The kitchenette doesn’t have anything useful to cook and the refrigerator is super small. The pool area is also small and the pool water was super cold. The hotel staff was friendly, except for one of the doorbell man. It seemed as he was always upset, he never smiled even after greeting him. Also, I honestly don’t think this hotel should charge a resort fee because it sure doesn’t seem to be no resort, it’s more of a motel.

Bathrooms badly in need of remodel.Water power & hot water were sketchy. Gave us room with kitchenette Not ordered,charged us more. I made reservation for wrong day and staff quickly resolved problem. Ate breakfast at hotel restaurant, not very good. Attitude of restaurant very snippy and rude. Employees at desk were sweet and kind. Great location to all shopping and not far walk to beaches.

Shoddy place that needs an upgrade badly. The railing in our room was falling off. Our young children could have fallen and been seriously injured. Insane that there was such a safety hazard present at this hotel.

This was my 3rd stay at Aqua Ohia during last 8 month. Best pricing, location, and accommodation. Free coffee, kitchenette, Monday reception with music, clean laundry facility, professional staffs. Thumbs up.

Got the room next to the elevator and all I could hear all day and night was it going up and down...very annoying!!! Other than that everything else was fine. The parking was more expensive this trip costing $28 per day. Don't remember it being that high on our last stay here.

Okay price, but the hotel is really old and gross, ants in the building, and the parking garage is almost impossible to get in and out of, even with a small car. We got a refund for the second night of our 2 day stay, and stayed somewhere else.

This was my first time to Hawaii, I enjoyed the location of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff. If I visit Hawaii again I will use this hotel again. Also I would recommend it to others. It’s very nice and a good price, I only was in my room to sleep. Outside sleeping and showering we were out and about throughout the island of Oahu

Last minute trip, looking for a budget friendly accommodation. We were very happy with the location and appearance of the hotel. Convenient to shopping, food and nightlife. Beds were not very comfortable but compared to other resorts we visit before I find most beds uncomfortable or standard. We cooked at couple of nights and found the kitchen utilities very helpful. Balcony noise is a bit loud but not annoying. Water pressure and temperature was great. Parking is tight and might be difficult to locate parking late in the evenings. Overall we were pleased with the hotel price point and location.

The staff was exceptional. the hotel is very run down.I would return again if the property was renovated.The location is very good.Everything on the property needs redone. There are no microwaves in the rooms.

The property looks like the photos, the staff was awesome, the room was clean. The hotel isn't brand new, but if you are so concerned about its looks there are plenty of Waikiki options. For us, it was perfect. Close to food, coffee, Jamba Juice, groceries, the beach - and for the price it was awesome. My sole issue was that the fridge's freezer wasn't cold enough to keep ice cream. In the grande scheme of our amazing trip, one melted ice cream is nothing.

I chose this hotel because of its excellent location in Waikiki, reasonable price, and can accommodate a family of 5 in their studio rooms (3beds) with kitchenette. Lots of shops, restos around and about a 10 min walk to the beach. Room condition is ok, but a bit old. Bathrooms need to be renovated badly.

While we felt well served by the staff, we were very disappointed in the condition of the hotel. The other reviews we’ve seen are accurate and blunt, so we weren’t surprised when we arrived. We tried to cancel before arriving (family members booked for us before we read reviews), and unfortunately that wasn’t possible due to cancellation policies- even a month before our trip. We should have done our research and found much better value around Waikiki.

The location was great. Easy access to all buses, other shopping, eating, water. Even with balcony door shut the street noise was unfortunate, especially the 4 am trash trucks. Beds were clean, tidy and comfy. Bath was in need of update, but served its purpose. Kitchenette also served needs for breakfast and reheating food.

Problem with the safe - it was throwing an error message and refused to operate properly. We had to call for help, which arrived promptly.The pots, pans, plates in the kitchen were dusty and unpleasant to use. These should be cleaned regularly.The neighbors were loud and easily heard at 7am. Also, the roosters were heard since 6am every morning. Cars are also easily heard through the night. The quality of sleep was impaired. Please attend to windows insulation (at the least) to prevent sound passing. The paint in the bathroom was coming off the tiles. Why would someone paint porcelain tiles in the first place? The cracks in tiles also made us uncomfortable in its use. The water pressure was weak. Hot water interrupted every time someone else was taking a shower simultaneously. The constant loud noise in the parking lot is ridiculous.The parking lot entry door leading to the stairs does not close tightly half the times, leaving the lot accessible to trespassers.

Staff very helpful and friendly, good location, free shuttle service s amazing an overall great short stay. The hotel is in a great position for all amenities, rooms very clean and stff very helpful happily recommend this hotel to others.

This was definitely a good place to stay. The staff is good, there are a good number of amenities, and anything the hotel doesn't have is in available in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, and the rooms are nice.

Amazing location, great staff, comfortable room... A great value for money accomodation with everything at your finger tips. The kitchenette was a great asset to have with in the room. The shower had awesome water pressure. A very comfortable stay.

Excellent place for the price paid for accommodations. Nice people at the restaurant with decently priced food and awesome waitresses. The front desk staff at this hotel is the best ever. The front desk is filled with awesome, friendly, super model attractive workers who wants customers to feel welcomed and to have a super stay at this hotel.

The parking situation is horrible, there were a couple occasions when the shower ran out of hot water. The check in desk is so close to the elevators that the lobby gets packed, and the daily room service didn’t even make our bed but you get what you pay for. The only thing I enjoyed about this hotel was the friendly bell hop we met, and the distance to Starbucks and the market across the street.

Great location, good service, prompt help with tv and light problems, bathrooms need updating but room good, beds very comfortable. Didn’t use ala Moana shuttle. Didn’t find it convenient, used local buses.

The location is in a nice place.However, there is a case that a safe or a microwave oven does not prepare.If you need a safe or an electronic check, advance confirmation is necessary.Because the wall is thin, I hear the voice of the next phone.

My first time here and price was great. It is a moderate hotel not a resort. But makes up for in location to restaurant and shopping with beach three blocks away without those prices. I had room 1580 and it had a balcony with great views. Will stay here again and it had clean rooms with a kitchen I was surprised to have

This hotel is located in a great location and reasonably priced. Walking distance from the beach and huge shopping mall. The hotel itself is a bit outdated and walls are very thin so you can hear everything in the room adjacent to yours. I would recommend this hotel to college students or friends vacationing, but I don't highly recommend it for couples or romantic getaways. Parking is expensive ($28/day), so we parked behind the hotel and paid $18 per day. Overall, the stay was good and the staff were very friendly and welcoming.

Great location for shopping and dining. very close to the beach. high price for parking and limited parking around the block. Easy walking access to everything else. Nice and quiet bar right next to the lobby.

Great location, but would recommend somewhere else. Rooms smell and were dirty. Cheaper than most around, but that is what we felf we received from this stay. Would not recommend. You are next to many desired locations.

The rooms me and my family stayed in were not clean at all. I had to call management to show them how dirty the outside of the stove was and had to show them how nasty the shower was and well as the nasty smelly carpet. The smell was so bad in my room that they had to move me to another room. I was just so upset about how dirty the rooms were. Also, housekeeping only came to the room to clean if I called them. And they never not once changed my bedding.

This hotel is a typical older Waikiki area hotel, it is located right near the International Market Place and Waikiki Beach. The room was spacious, and clean, great comfortable large bed. The desk people were fine and helpful, as were the housekeeping staff. For the price and location, it's pretty hard to beat.

- Short walk to Waikiki beach- Right next to International Market with lots of food options- Very close to all the shops and malls- Close enough to other hotels- Lively part of the city- Fantastic location

I liked the hotel. But i did not like the parking system and i have to pay 28 usd for a single night. It’s too much. Other than that, the hotel was okay. Location was good and the staffs are friendly.

Very affordable price for the location. Friendly staff and efficient check in and check out process. Rooms a little outdated, needs some updating (old carpets, peeling paint off the balcony floor). Small size room and small shower, but still clean. Comfortable beds but unwashed throw pillows. Overall I would still recommend for great location, the staff, accessible parking, and good price.

The pictures on the internet are nothing what you will receive when you arrive. We stayed here 20 years ago and NOTHING has changed, and it was bad then. We booked a king size bed with a kitchenette and when we checked in we were given a room with 2 double beds, when we asked why they said that they don't have kings with kitchenettes. But the website isn't clear about this and the pictures show that they do. We were told you reserve a room not exactly the one you requested.

This has to be 1 of the few worst places I’ve stayed. Staff was nice at check in and check out. Walked into room to find large carpet stains, stove had rust, what looked like mold around the air return. Bathroom was even worse, shower was very dirty, had to stand on towel while taking a shower. Looked like mold in shower, and all around the bathroom. Air in room never got cool, mattress had stains, pillowcases had stains. Only stayed 1 night and left.

This is the single worst hotel room I’ve ever stayed in. The room was dirty, shower was worse, sheets/blankets were torn and hallway walls had holes. There was a terrible smell to the room and hallway. I only stayed in the hotel long enough to find another hotel to stay in.

Hotel was located in walking distance to everything imaginable in Waikiki...the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms aren't modernized but the housekeeping staff made it all worth it!

Security man and front desk agent was very kind. On the other hand, this hotel really needs improvement. Hallways smells like mold, room didn’t feel clean, and my special requests wasn’t made even though the front desk agent told me they did. I would not recommend this hotel.

The rooms are a bit old, specially the bathroom but is sparkly clean and that compensates it a little. The bad part was that if someone decides to take a 5 am shower, the sound of the water pipes will let you know. Nice amenities, all day shuttle to main parts of the city, chairs and beach towels, cold water and ice tea provided at reception during the day. If you want to go green and don't want your room serviced, then you get $5 coupon to use in the restaurant. The restaurant is something I would not recommend, the food was average and the service slow.

During my week at the Ohia, most of the staff were great although on my last night, one questioned me if I was a guest when I asked for toothpaste. Housekeeping and Bell service was amazing. I barely talked to anyone at front desk because they seemed unfriendly. Once you get past check-in, the stay is great. The location is perfect and close to everything. The value is great compared to other hotels.

I ended up checking in pretty late at this property because of my flight. I was able to check in with no problems. Niki the supervisor ended up helping me and was extremely polite and welcoming!! Here customer service skills were amazing :)

We booked the hotel for its location and were disappointed by he check in process. Our room wasn’t ready even by 3:30pm so we were given another room with two twin beds when we booked a room with one bed. The hotel was a bit tired, the bathroom and shower were awful. The shower had no water pressure and couldn’t even wash off sand! Shower wasn’t really warm either. Fantastic location if you’re looking for that, pool is tiny and seemingly in the car park, I’d recommend across the road at Dukes Market for a decent coffee. We were offered $5 off our stay in exchange for no housekeeping which we accepted due to only staying 2 nights. The room was made up after night 1 so we didn’t get the $5 credit. WiFi was terrible, better to use any free other WiFi in the area

This hotel is a great price. The location is awesome if you want to go to the beach or International Marketplace. The hotel is a bit run down, but rooms are spacious enough with a kitchenette. Great place to stay if you are out and about all day.

For the price it’s very nice except group of Chinese being too loud but cannot help, hotel has to accept them anyway :) staff very friendly, and good amenities that was not expected. The kitchen is useful!

Stayed here, was a little surprised how tiny the room was for 3 people, very weak air conditioning, we couldn't sleep for the first 2 days, thats how weak the AC was, the whole hotel had a 5am wake up as the fire alarms started. No microwave in our room, small coffee maker refrigerator and cooking stove was available as well as a toaster. One strange toilet though. A restaurant/bar is connected to the lobby of the hotel, i haven't eaten there but it was busy at times. Straight across from dukes lane market.

If you're looking for somewhere reasonably priced in Waikiki, the Aqua Ohia may be a good option. The rooms are fine -- perhaps a little dated, yes, and the kitchenette is *tiny*, but the air conditioner blasts very cold air even on low and every room has a balcony. It's an easy if uninspiring 5 minute walk to the beach down Duke's Lane, and the hotel is right on the main street for buses. I will say my shower was a real testament to how caulking can't solve every issue, and that the bathroom did need an update.

Aqua has many small, older budget hotels in HNL, the Ohia is very old, very small and offers little comfort. The location is very good so convenient for some, the pricing is also on the low end so some travelers may appreciate the value on offer. Beware when booking a "suite" room, there are no real suites, they just stick an extra bed or two into an already tiny room. Bed options are nog guaranteed which can be a problem for some. We booked a kind and two singles and got 3 singles. One person had to sleep on the floor. Nonsense. Hotel staff are not very polished, check-in system is slow and inadequate. Parking garage also problematic. This is an old hotel that has seen better days, it needs to a major renovation to bring it up to current standards in Waikiki.

The property is pretty run down and there was no hot water. The shower (no tub) got lukewarm at best an was mostly cold. The staff didn't really care. We reserved a king bed but got two full beds - the staff said that was all they had. We will not go back.

We stayed for 9 nights. The travel agent told us that although the decor was dated, it was still a great Hotel and a really good price. We weren't too worried about the decor so decided to stay. Bad move! Paper thin walls, single glazed windows means noisy, and when I say noisy, I mean, you heard everything from the rooms next door. The room was dirty and the carpets was stained. The tiles in the shower had previously been painted and this was peeling off. There was mould on the ceiling of the bathroom. And worst thing of all was the smell.... the entire floor smelt like rotting carpet... Has put us off coming back to Waikiki......

Arrived at 7 am extremely ill and no one did a thing to try and get me to a bed early left me laying coughing and sneezing like crazy in the lobby. I’ve stayed at this hotel before and the staff had been very helpful. Not so much anymore. Really pathetic they’d just leave a visible ill person suffering in there lobby for seven plus hours. I certainly would never want my friends or family treated like this so I hope this serves others to find another place to stay. Absolutely shameful!

Staff very helpful & friendly.Centrally located to shops. cafes & restaurants.Short troll to beach.Hotel furnishings & bathroom a little outdated could do with a makeover. Down stairs bar was convenient for breakfast & enjoying a few relaxing drinks with friends in the evening.

I was very pleased with this hotel and the room that I had. Keeping in mind that I did not expect this to be a luxury hotel, I was totally happy with everything about the Aqua Ohia Waikiki. I found the staff to be exceptional; they were friendly and helpful and everyone had a smile. When I arrived, there were many people checking in, so they must have employed a "all hands on deck" approach. They accommodated everyone in pretty short order and never got flustered or cranky. My room was comfortable and clean. The rooms and hallways are not super modern, but that is not a problem for me. Everything worked, was clean and well-maintained. The location is unbeatable. Parking was convenient and I appreciated that it was on site. I will stay again for certain.

A really good place if you need someplace just to put your head down for the night. Parking Garage is not handicap accessible. You have to go down steps to get to it. This hotel has a good location to almost everything.

I had a good stay at the Aqua Ohia Waikiki. The best part of this hotel is its location right in the center of Waikiki. I stayed in a nice sized room on the sixth floor with a lanai overlooking the pool and part of Kuhio Avenue. The beds are very comfortable. The bathroom is very old and definitely needs refurbishment. I really hope the hotel makes an effort to improve the bathrooms soon, as this is really the only downside.

The staff are friendly and can't help you enough. I had a maintenance issue at 10pm and it was fixed within 10 minutes. The hotel is dated, but very clean and in a good spot for sightseeing. My only issue is that they don't have teabags in their rooms. I'm not a coffee drinker and had to buy my own.

Older, small, but comfortable rooms. Had a couple problems with door lock and T.V., but were resolved. Friendly, helpful staff and good location are the highlights. Also, good restaurant downstairs. I would return but my husband would not.

Rooms need remodelingBad quality of bathroomsOlder building but its possibke to give the building some loveService was terrible infact very depressing and unwelcoming moods on all staff. Very rudeMajor change in personel needed Over all the views from the rooms are amazing and the balconies on the higher floors are quite pleasing yet the rooms do need a different floor idea and bathrooms can used some upgrades and remodeling. Shower heads are clogged with lime and need replacing.

The room is budget friendly and the location is middle of Waikiki, probably its only selling points. The air conditioning needs an upgrade. The hotel is warm and uncomfortable ESPECIALLY during the day

whilst this hotel is older and does need updating it is in a great location, the staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and there is a great little restaurant attached, we would stay there again

Thanks for giving me the room I stayed in back in 1974. Much appreciated. View hadn't changed. Could still see St Louis Heights! Just across the road from the international market place and five minutes to the beach, but still cheap.

The room smelled bad, the shower had hair stuck on the walls and dirt on the floor, the internet did not work and was told to call the provider for help, the carpet looked like it had not been cleaned since it was installed. There was at least an inch thick of dust on the vents and the air filter looked like it was installed in 1990 and never replaced.

I stayed at the Aqua Ohia from October 22-29. Again, excellent service, friendly front desk staff, friendly Concierge staff.Room / the pool was clean, there was always some one who was using it. Front desk lets you borrow beach towels for the beach. That’s very convenient. I tried the breakfast at the restaurant attached to hotel. Again, service was excellent. The next few days i has breakfast at Dukes marketplace. Another great cost saver.We used the hotel parking - there was a cost of 28.00 which is standard in this area however the biggest feature is the parking at the hotel as in/out privileges. Not many hotels have this. My room was spacious , clean. My balcony overlooked the side street. This is a great hotel for the price. We had friends in different hotels and they thought our hotel was great. I will be back next October and will be staying once again at this hotel. I highly recommend everyone give this hotel a chance. This hotel will surprise you. It’s in the heart of Waikiki. We did miss the filming of Hawaii Five-O on the Wednesday. That would have been awesome to see. Our balcony would have overlooked the filming. I have attached photos of my room. Again.. I highly recommend this hotel.

We really did not enjoy this place. The pool was filthy, the rooms were old and dirty. We were on a level with pets which smelled. The aircon wasnt working properly.There was nothing enjoyable about it.

Really good location not far from the beach, close to great eating options and public transport. Rooms were old and run down. Very comfortable beds. A bit overpriced for the quality of the rooms. Most staff were lovely.

NOT disable friendly or friendly at all for that matter. I would give it a zero if I could. Drove for 45 minutes trying to figure out where to park- they have a construction sign in front of their sign. I go to the front desk and they tell me to park down in the garage, I finally find it and the only way up is to lug your luggage across a very noisy parking garage up small narrow stairs. Rude girl at the desk said I could use the bell service.... this does not make the hotel disability accessible. Asked for a refund. Rude girls said they would charge me for the night stay- as that is what the manager on duty said. Not happy at all- son and dog waiting out in the heat. Would not do anything just kept saying “we have to charge you”. Tore up the paper and walked out. Bell boy refused to help carry the suitcase and laughed as I walked away crying. Rude girl had taken my retired military ID. I called to tell them I needed it back. Rude girl two said it wasn’t there. They lost it. Asked to speak to a manager. Rude girl 2 said manager was not on duty tonight- hmmm then who was rude girl 1 talking to. Rude girl 2 said “ well we can’t find it so I don’t know what you want us to do about...hahaha hope you have a nice evening.” Nice way to treat a retired disabled vet! No aloha at this place. Found another great place to stay. They were horrified at the story I told.

Enjoyed the short visit in Waikiki to catch up with old friend on Oahu. Reasonable room rate and parking rate. Great location, close to beach and restaurants also had nicely furnished clean room and bathroom. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful.

The location of this hotel is great! The staff is quick and friendly, but the hotel cleanliness is awful. The decorative blankets were stained with white stuff all over it. They basically fold it nicely so you could see it, which is worst. The dust in the A/C vent was disgusting, it looked like it had been at least 6mnths to a year since anyone has wiped it down. The curtains were stained and full of dust, the carpets pretty nasty . If you do t care about the cleanliness then the deal is good but don’t expect much sleep as you’ll hear people fight in the alley all night long. I won’t stay here again.

We rented the penthouse and for me -- it was a pretty amazing price in comparison to other hotels of higher tier than Aqua Ohia, but smaller room space. Our room was amazing and more than enough space for just the 2 of us. As for the entire hotel -- it is older, but pretty much all the hotels on the Waikiki strip are. The 2 elevators are small in space, but both worked well (even with a little jolt here and there), and we took delight in the air freshener dispenser being used. The swimming pool is not very big and we didn't use it, but there was always someone in it every time we passed by it, and it looked rather clean and well-maintained. The parking can be a little arduous, especially if you're trying to park in the lower level. SLOW & STEADY for turning in and getting out of the lower level gate! And if you're in a SUV -- even more luck to you that your vehicle doesn't reach the overhead pipes in the lower garage (I actually saw a SUV that had 1 corner touching a pipe). If anything -- you'll learn how to maneuver and park like a champ in their parking area! We found the staff we interacted with to be very helpful and going above and beyond (Robert at the front desk and Maricel with housekeeping!!). We found the location to be perfect despite boarded-up vuildings next door that can appear frightening on your first day. Aqua Ohia is a block from Waikiki Beach, basically across the street from the International Market, and there are all types of restaurants and shops around you. You're pretty much at the heart of the Waikiki strip without being right on Kalakaua Ave's noise. I'm not sure if I would rent one of the regular rooms here, but the stafd we dealt with were amazing and made the stay more pleasant (kudos to them for the hard work and dedication to customer service!).

We tried to check in early, but no room was available. Hotel was nice to hold our baggage and let us park in their parking lot while we waited for check in time (3:00PM).Room was clean, beds were comfortable, view from balcony was good.My only complaint was that they need a proper smoking area. I do not smoke, and most people who did smoke stood right in front of the main entrance so I had to walk through the smoke and cigarette butts on the ground just to get in and out of the hotel lobby.Other than that, it's a good hotel.

I liked the good location but the hotel is too old.It needs renovation.I have never seen a bed in a hotel with no headboard!It needs to be updated esp the washrooms and kitchen.The cleanliness need to be improved too in the washroom and kitchen.The garbage needs to be emptied regularly.

Excellent location but housekeeping and reception staff may keep us away from this place next time. We enjoyed the iced water and tea provided in the lobby. We asked for a wake up call as we had to leave by 4.15am and this didn't happen .

A group of us,111 people, stayed at this hotel and man were we conned. It took them 3 hours to process our hotel keys. You would think they would be ready, since we booked this trip over 6 months ago. The pictures on their website were nothing like the real thing. I honestly believe the pictures on their website were pictures of another hotel. I don't know where to begin with this review. The bathroom had peeling paint on the shower walls. The plaster was crumbling due to moisture buildup in the bathroom. Each time I went to bathroom, I wore my rubber water shoes. Iwas afraid of picking up a fungus. Rooms had very poor lighting. The kitchenette had "metal" cabinets!!! I noticed mildew on the walls in the hallway. The lobby was so small, only 40-50 people could fit inside at a time. Their restaurant where they had breakfast only seats 30 people. We had to submit our breakfast order one day in advance. There was no continental breakfast buffet like they promised. The choice was: (1) eggs, bacon toast, (2) waffle or pancakes, (3) cold cereal, milk. The food was cold and we could only choose one of the three. Take my advice and stay elsewhere.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Room size was ok. Very dirty room and bathroom. We were happy we only booked it for 1 night. Price is not justified! Parking not possible in their valet parking, so we needed to go to another hotel for valet parking.

The staff were very accommodating and friendly. The hotel was clean and tidy. The pool area was very clean, comfy beds! So close to everything.. Only recommendation would be new carpet throughout otherwise fabulous holiday......

Studio Double Room was very, very small. Only we had pre paid for our room we would have not stayed here, plus we could not change our booking. Location is good but if you are booking this hotel do not book a studio.

Everything was perfect except that I had to sleep in different beds after i arrived there there was no parking I had to pay for parking which Is twentyeighth dollars which I did pay but over all it was a good place to stay

This hotel has a good price for what it is considering the prices of other hotels in Waikiki. If you are dead set on staying in central Waikiki but don't want to pay the price of a big name hotel, this is a good option for you. However, the rooms are musty, poorly lit, and don't feel very clean; the lobby and elevators feel old and are often over crowded; and there are no real extra amenities to speak of. If I return to the area I will likely save money by staying farther from Waikiki for a nicer experience, or else just pay for a big name hotel.

This is an older hotel with great personality! Nice location for shopping and good walking distance to the beach. The tea in the lobby is the best! When we needed directions, the front desk staff looked up maps and printed them for us. If you are looking for great amenities, the free admission to Bishop Museum and discount to the Aquarium were awesome!

It is a very average hotel - bed is average, paint on the walls is a neutral color, no weird smells, clean enough but nothing luxurious or cute about it at all. The only reason I gave it a 2 instead of a 3 was that at check in they slapped another $60 in amenity charges and parking fees on what I thought I'd be paying. They said booking.com should have made it clear but in my opinion it should have been made more clear. I would definitely stay a couple blocks down at Vive Hotel instead which has way more comfortable beds, no hidden fees and is cuter and more welcoming for the same price and it has free parking and they just treat you better all around for the price. I don't work at Vive or anything, but I stayed there recently and it is my honest comparison.

Our stay @ Aqua Ohia Waikiki was good enough. However the hotel/rooms & Laundry area needs upgrading. Other than that the location, schuttle service, price & people were great. Thank you, & to return someday.

I failed to enter the one real complaint we had which was a barking dog that barked until 2 a.m. when my son finally went to the front desk to complain and they evidently called the room because the dog stopped barking after that. the front desk knew right off which room it was so I don't believe we were the only one complaining.

I would highly recommend Aqua Ohia. Our group loved our rooms, the pool was perfect and it was in a fantastic location. The staff were extremely helpful, especially Kris! I loved dealing with her and can’t wait to come back again in 2019!

The location is awesome, people are super friendly but the rooms needs major renovation/updating. The room we had have a kitchenette but missing microwave. We were able to use stove to warm up soup but that was pretty much extent of it. The faucet by kitchen sink continued to drip. The refrigerator didn’t really get cold enough. The freezer was broken. Turn the setting to coldest but still couldn’t keep ice from melting.If the hotel gets updated maybe we’ll stay there again but otherwise we won’t be. The staff were the friendliest which made us feel very welcome. Over all if not for the staff and being tight on funds we would have switched hotels. Guess you get what you pay for in a sense.

We will not be returning to this hotel the location was great but the rooms were old and not very clean. They told my husband that we owed $98 per night for taxes we finally got it straightened out. We ended up paying a $98 amenity fee which we never used. The maintenance man who came to our room was extremely nice and friendly that was probably the highlight of our visit with the staff.

The rooms were moldy and, the so called kitchen was still dirty after we FINALLY got to check in. We didn't even use the "kitchenette". It was so small, and the stove was not ventilated, no counter space, and no glasses in the cupboard. The bathroom was moldy and the shower curtain needed replacing. The beds were hard and uncomfortable, and the room was so tiny! Never would I stay there again! When I complained to the staff about it, I was shown a room that was worse off than the one I was already in! I have traveled all around the world, and this place is definitely one of the worse places I have ever stayed in! This really put a damper on my first experience with Hawaii! :(

Wonderful friendly service, beach towels and chairs, free shuttle, on the bus route, close to everything. We have stayed in Waikiki several times, but this hotel is the best yet in our opinion. It met all our needs.
