Excellent accommodations at a good value. Richard Boyd was so helpful in facilitating our last minute arrangements - kind, pleasant, and efficient! Really felt that they cared about you and your stay. Thank you, Richard and Aqua Ohia Waikiki!

The staff are very friendly. The hotel is old and smelly. Infested Cockroaches and other bugs. The hallways stink. Would not recommend this hotel. Would never stay there again. It is in a decent location. Parking is poor and they charge $28 dollars a night to use it.

Perfect location, good value. i like the free ice tea and water at the reception, pools seems very small, parking is extra, should be mentioned. before booking, rooms are pretty nice updated. slept very well

Needs a facelift and more attention to detail such as tea making facilities, but clean, comfortable and in a great location. Resort fees were too high for minimal offerings. Housekeeping staff very friendly and attentive.

We were not in the room very much, on the go, so for sleeping and showering it was fine, the Pool entertainment was fantastic, had everyone singing. I would stay here again. However did not know of a $24 extra service fee at time of booking that was explained at checking.

Last time it was better. in our stay 14th to 15th September we had a room with a renovated bath.This bath was so old so that would not go in this room again. The situation of hotel is very good.The rooms in general should be renovated. The carpets were a catastrophy. The tour counter was efficient.

This hotel needs a total revamp or be knocked down. There is mould everywhere. There are stains on the curtains and lampshades, the fridge is hot and smells. There is no water pressure......NO, I MEAN NONE, to wash the shampoo out of your hair is a epic journey.....ending in failure usually. The showers are so small you cannot turn around and the drains are all rusty. We booked months in advance and were given 2 single beds...... avoid avoid avoid. Staff were nice though.

As the title suggests.Great location but some money needs to be put in sprucing up the bathrooms and kitchens.My toilet was loose and very low lucky I was not fat ,old or infirmed .Ths staff were friendly and the idea of getting food vouchers to offset unnecessary housekeeping was great .Anita

We recibed a dirty room, and a dirty restroom, dirty curtains. Then we ask for clean bed sheets and blankets, and housekeeping for bathroom; they said we don’t have clean bed sheet only blankets, no housekeeping by this time. Then We Ask another room, negative too. They Only sent blankets, towels and a man to our room to clean only the WC, but the orine smell still remained. The second day we went to beach, expecting the housekeeping but they never get to clean the room. We went to front desk to complain again. They told us, our policy bed sheet changing is every three days. That it’s inconcebible it’s a risk for our health if we arrived, the bed sheet must be clean. Finally they offered us refound 50% we had paid but it wasn’t enough, our room would still remain dirty. Then we asked again for a new room a clean. Finally they changed us. Really this was the worst hotel we had stay in.

The front desk staff is top notch and friendly. The property does not look like the website portrays. The rooms are outdated and not very clean. The bathroom in our room had mold and the paint was coming off the shower walls. The air conditioner was dripping water onto the carpet and did not work well at cooling. The Lava Tube restraint was great with good food and good prices. The per night charge for our room was good and it is right in the middle of all the fun thing to do. The pool is very small but clean and pretty area to relax. If you are looking for a bargain and not luxury this would be the place. I think next time I will spend a bit more for a better room.

This hotel is horrid. There is mould everywhere. Lampshades are stained, rusted showers and NO and I repeat NO water pressure, you cannot rinse your shampoo out. The air con is arctic and you cannot adjust it, the fridge is hot and mouldy. The put us in single beds even thought we booked months in advance. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Cheap hotel compared to others in the Waikiki area. However watch for the resort fee and the parking fee to be added to your hotel reservation bill. It might not be as "cheap" anymore after the addition of these fees.

The hotel itself is well situated, and seemed to offer what we needed for the last two nights of our Hawaii trip.Unfortunately, we had a bad experience with the management after we found two bugs (photo) in our beds during the first night. I’m no expert, but if you look on the internet, they really look like bedbugs. The decision was quickly taken, not to stay in the hotel.I brought one of the bugs to the reception at midnight, the receptionist had a reaction of disgust, said she would report to the manager and gave us another room. Of course, as the doubt was in our head, we had a very bad night, with lights on to make the eventual bugs stay hidden, looking in every corner to be sure that our luggage would not be infected…On the next day, the manager met us, but didn’t really believe us. He told he didn’t hear from the bug we brought during the night. “I wasn’t there, so I cannot say”. The housekeeping controlled the room, didn’t find anything. A specialized company was called afterwards, and didn’t find anything as well. Well, I wonder how they didn’t, while we found two. Anyway…We left after the first night, the second night was reimbursed. But the only compensation we had for the horrible first night was the refund of the service fees (26$, youhouhou!), we still had to pay the night. Though, we had to get all of our luggage, clothes, etc., cleaned when we came back in our country, as we all know that bedbugs are the worst nightmare of your life once they colonize your place.Once again, I have no proofs that these are bedbugs, bud the appearances are what they are and once the doubt is in one’s head… it’s hard not to be careful.I will never come back, and don’t advice you to go.

A pleasurable experience for our first trip to Oahu. Accommodation was cozy and location was perfectly situated. The room had many positive aspects, just don't plan on sleeping much. Right on the main road and foot and vehicle traffic was present all hours of the night. Quite noisy through the thin windows .

This hotel located in Kuhio ave Which is right before the international market.very convenient ,close the resterant most of the stores as well as the beach. But the style is kind of old and AC has noise. the price is good and it is just ok if you have planned to have long time stay. The parking lot is underground and the way to access is very narrow, not recommend if you park there and it will cause 28USD per day.

This hotel is in a great location.Hotel was slightly run down - faded carpets, older furnishings in the rooms. The double room was quite small. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. Overall it was average. Ok for the price.

This hotel is so old and tired I couldn't even stay , checked in and out. It's not in the best area, it smelled unpleasant , the furniture was so stained I wouldn't sit in it and the carpet the same. In desperate need of a renovation!!

Every square inch of this hotel needs updating, especially bathrooms. Personnel and location are great but it ends there. Lots of plumbing issues. My room rate changed daily! I was told it depended on hotel occupancy! Crazy! They do not say that when you book at a fixed fate. I will be contacting Aqua administrative offices.

Aqua Ohia Waikiki is a friendly, quaint, centrally located Waikiki hotel. The lobby is small, and the pool is basic, but clean. Check-in wasn't until 4pm, so our early flight arrival meant we could store our luggage and spend the day at the beach.The bed was comfortable, room size average, the bathroom a little dated, and quite low water pressure in the shower. But overall this is an affordable, no-frills hotel option in the heart of Waikiki.There is a small fridge, oven with electric stove top, and coffee maker in the room.We would stay again!

Very outdated hotel. We found a cockroach in the bathroom and my friend was beaten by bed bugs! Dirty bathroom. Very old furniture and old carpet. We moved to another hotel after insisting for at least one hour they help us. We were told my hotel manager we need to find another accommodation ourselves! This is by far the worst hotel I’ve stayed in. And I travel a lot. Our holiday in Hawaii was ruined by this experience. We now are hoping we are not going to bring those bed bugs home with us!

If you are looking for a quiet location this is not the place as the Laylow is across the road and the bar has music most nights. The staff are very friendly and helpful and The Bus has a stop very close. The hotel shuttle (that you pay the fee for) is good although you can get to Ala Moana quicker on the bus but because you are paying the fee you want to use it. This fee is outrageously expensive at $25. There should not be a fee for a discount at Macy's! Overall I would not recommend this hotel except for the friendly staff and ease of accessed to transport and through Dukes Lane to the beach.

The location of this hotel is great, it's in the middle of everything, i would stay at this hotel all the time, service and the workers are all great people, it's cheap and the bar great service too. What i love the most it's right across from international market, dukes lane, like i said the location is great.

Stayed here for 4 nights and it was okay! The room was big with balcony however the room was in serious need of updating! The bathroom was clean but again so outdated! The price we paid was ridiculous for what is offered! The pool is not appealing one bit! The positive is the location right in Waikiki. Would look elsewhere for a better deal!

My husband and granddaughter had a wonderful time we didn't even need to rent a car car cause everything was in walking distance and we ate at different places some was ok and some was good we will come back

We were staying at the Marina Towers Waikiki, the accommodations as substandard for $$$ paid in advance. The room seriously needs a lot of repairs and improvements. Customer service was poor and unwelcoming. Called Hawaiian Airlines and complained. Went on line found Aqua Ohio last minute. Checked out the dump Marina Towers Waikiki in morning and checked in at th Aqua Ohia..we were pleased and felt welcomed

Wasn’t great with check inIce machine is located on bottom floor near poolPool is tiny Bed is comfortable Bathroom is dated - think 1970’sWe will spend more next time we visit hawaiiOverall it was average at best

Don't expect to be treated like royalty here, but if you are traveling on a budget this is a great option. Hotel is old but fairly clean. We stayed on the 14th floor which had a nice view of the city and some mountains. Room was nothing fancy but comfortable, small shower and kitchen with limited supplies. Pool area small but private, small restaurant downstairs as well but we did not eat there. You are within walking distance of some great places to eat and shopping!Most who visit Hawaii spend a lot of time outside of the hotel exploring during the day, so if that is your case this place is recommended. This is not a resort that you just sit by the pool all day and get waited on. Staff is friendly and helpful, parking is tight and a bit awkward for the cost ($28/day). Overall a good stay but again do not expect anything fancy!

The pics make the hotel appear newer and cleaner than it is. Our rooms were filthy...used bar od soap, food spilled and not cleaned up, stained bedding. They moved us and the second room still had rice on the stove.

Parking is 1way in1 way out, only a number of stalls available... You must get buzzed in for the parking gate to open. No elevator from parking area to lobby, stairs needs to be taken or up entrance/exit ramp for parking garage (not sure if able to use on foot) ... Air conditioner on High will keep you at a "comfortable" temp... visible in room from outside (no tint on glass door) need to keep curtain closed for privacy... minimal space between lanai door and 2nd bed for walking...

The Aqua Ohia had a comfortable room with a kitchenette that included a refrigerator, stove, sink, cutting board, cookware, tableware, utensils, and a dinette table. It was not a fancy hotel, but it was cozy and it felt like a home away from home. The staff was friendly and helpful. The in-house restaurant had a cool beach feel. The complimentary ice tea in the lobby was refreshing. We also appreciated complimentary pool towels and daily newspapers.

Location is so good near Loyal Hawaiian Center and beach. Nice ocean view room with balcony. Great room, bed, furnitures, amenities. Free water service is so nice. I hope come back again. I will recommend to my friends.

There was roaches everywhere and the toilets we're broke and the room was dirty and they didn't have enough soap so that we could do the dishes and they never did fix our problems when we called down to the main office

Connie ,the lady that took care of my room,was amazing,very nice and attentive.She made sure I had everything I needed.I stay here every three months,and I hope I have her every trip.Connie was very professional ,and also very friendly and courteous.

Overall, my stay was very good, The staff was friendly and courteous, they do make you feel welcome.I would recommend staying here anytime. The hotel usually has a little welcome get together on Mondays with lovely music and great appetizers.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel because it is in Waikiki area with lots of attractions and good restaurants. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The room is small but the room rate is great. We rarely stayed in the room anyway. We were out mostly eating and shopping in Waikiki which we did not find any reasons to before. It is a pleasant vacation for us.

The room was dirty n carpet smelled, restroom was dirty. Closets..dirty.. just to old .. location was great but not this hotel n was so expensive . Lamps for light not enough.. noisey in hallways n smelled.

Previously mentioned concerning Shuttle Service & Housekeeping attitude. Pool area was not very attractive. A Complimentary Continental Breakfast would be nice. Overall Front Desk Staff made-up for any lacking in other Dept. Front Desk Rate was Excellent.

Not a bad place for the price, I think the parking was way overpriced however. The staff was friendly and the hotel is in a central location. I stayed there for two months and my housekeeper Connie really went above and beyond to take care of me. My room was spotless everyday, she even did my dishes for me. Thanks Connie and all the staff. I will see you on the next trip.

Bathroom is old but everything else was fine. Hotel charges a resort fee that I did'nt expect. I also did'nt park in their parking because it was also overpriced. The room was ok and clean enough for me!

An older building. Excellent location- directly across from Nordstrom Rack and International Marketplace. The staff- especially the reception desk is absolutely exceptional!! They went the extra mile!!

I reserved a room on Aug 3 for Aug 11th for military leave (short turn orders that I wanted to add leave to and appreciate the island). I found out on Aug 9th that my Commander rejected my leave request. I attempted to cancel my reservation, (almost 40 hours in advance) I was charged in full, quoting a 72 hour cancellation policy. After contacting them, they were still unnameable to a full cancellation rate (40 hours in advance) quoting that if they were "flexible" then their "policy" would be "guidelines". Then, after going to their website I was appalled that their main website advocated their "military appreciation". I am disgusted that this organization bears the image of military members, yet lacks the flexibility that sometimes comes with the job. I get to mark "not sure" for the rest of this questionnaire, because I legally can't go to this hotel for my reserved date to observe the cleanliness of the rooms and they are unwilling to grant me a refund (40 hours in advance).

Waikiki beach is only one block down the Duke’s lane. Supermarket and Nordstorm Rack are just across the street. Ace car rental just 150m. away. Staff was nice. The room as described however, the bathroom is a little out dated but that wasn’t a problem for us. There’s a bar opposite the hotel but we didn’t find it noisy as it is a nature of this area. The room is big enough to fit 6 of us and you couldn’t find a place with this price around Waikiki area.

Your staff was amazing, very friendly and welcoming! They were very helpful both during check-in and check-out. The location is great with eating places and shopiing very convenient. I would recommend this to other family and friends. Once you park your car, there's no reason to take it out again because of the shuttle service, shopping and eateries close by.

Booked this room during peak season a week out. Great views of beach and mountain in room 1189. Great sized room with comfortable bed. Lovely products in bathroom. Utilised kitchen for breakfast. Excellent location to international market, beach, bars and public bus

Good location, great service from staff. Average quality hotel room, very old bathroom with weird layout, poor lighting and lime buildup on shower door. Room was better with a comfortable bed.Very basic amenities available.Lobby was renovated recently and looks lovely but does not reflect the quality of the hotel rooms.

Hotel location was goood.Hotel price was low.There were many shops and restaurants aroud the Aqua Ohia Hotel.I was satisfied with drink service of coffee tea water at lobby floor.I want to stay Aqua Ohia Hotel again.

Husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary and my birthday in Hawaii. We stayed in this hotel and one thing that stood out is the great service of Yuta, one of your staff. Overall, he made our stay in your hotel memorable - He always gave a helping hand, always willing to go the extra mile. My husband needed a room with very good wifi connection for his work. For days, he was not able to work properly. But when we finally talked to Yuta, he immediately transferred us to another room with a good internet connection. Good job, Yuta!

Horrible stay. Way uncomfortable for 4 people but the room advertised for 4 people to that room. Not even enough room for a microwave or a place to sit to eat. Disgusting carpet. Furniture and room very outdated. Would not suggest a stay at this hotel to anyone.
user_name:
Deanne W
Louisville, Kentucky, United States

review_body: I stayed in this perfect hotel for 17 nights with my kids for vacation, really enjoyed and i highly recommended for another people, it's very clean rooms and lovely staff, and the location is near everything you looking for

Overall my stay was comfortable. Spent most of my time in the room. So, the cleanliness and accommodations of hotel was very good. No issues with stay or employees. Would recommend this place to anyone else.

Dingy room. Noisy even on the 14th floor. Parking lot is a NIGHTMARE - cramped and tiny. 28/night parking - legal robbery. They replace sheets/towels only occasionally. Stay away. Room was tiny and the curtain let in light at night. If you prefer a dark room, you won't get one. I complained but was told I had to find a different room, and even that might not be to my satisfaction.

I will say my review is biased from my first check in experience. Showed up exhausted from travel. Took me an hour to check in because of the line. I have never experienced that before...I'm not sure why it takes so long here. Finally got to my room, I would say it is very average. Entire hotel could use an upgrade for what I paid. Location is decent- you can walk to most places in waikiki probably, though, so that is nice. They do waive amenity fee if you are active duty, which is great.

We needed a hotel in downtown Waikiki and we found a very nice hospitalitable one with friendly service and with an excellent appointed room. It is a great room to use if you would like to occasionally cook your own meals and prepare the odd snacks.

The room was atrocious. The shower head was broken and the walls were peeling. Mold on walls and picture frames. Carpet sticky and smelly. No parking. Elevator walls were peeling. Housekeeping could barely understand English. An old dirty rubber band on towel hook. Bathroom light and air conditioning did not work. Just BAD. NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Dont do the go green, unless you go to the java each day.The room was a good size and was fresh smelling. The tapware and shower wasnt very clean.Comfortable bed and fresh clean linen.Location is excellent.The hotel shuttle servjce is great.The concierge service is great.Our overall stay was great, easy walking distance to beach, clubs and shops.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ohia. Great location. Room was upgraded. Was able to waive housekeeping for restaurant food vouchers, which was nice for our short stay. Room smelled like smoke and had a broken outlet.

Can not get video to load of loose balcony that if I had leaned against would have fallen. The place smelled. Worst hotel I have been to. And I am 70. Checked out after we went to have dinner elsewhere and we across street to a beautiful Hyatt for the same price. Also the would not return all our money.

Originally put in a room with two doubles but were moved to a room with a king 1 day in which was much nicer. Location is great, close to restaurants, shopping, and the beach. Shuttle service is very slow, so I would just Uber around. There were a plethora of problems in the beginning of our stay - given two doubles instead of a king, bug found on a bed, dirty towels in the bathroom, dirty dishes in kitchen area, broken door parts, etc. Customer service here is subpar, no one seems to care if there is something wrong with your stay, and housekeeping is inconsistent, but how much time do you really spend in the hotel in Hawaii anyway? If you plan on spending a lot of time in your room, or can afford to, do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

It was an enjoyable, wonderful relaxing experience to have my little dog w/me. It made my stay~cation extra special w/family also...The four nights was affordable and well spent.Thank you Aqua Ohia Hotel Team!!

Great ! I'm a Retired Union Ironworker that came back to recover from Surgeries... Rest and relaxation is what I needed and your hotel provided that. I will be back with my Women to enjoy another Vacation in Waikiki...

This hotel had unexpected fees and parking fees. Staff was friendly. Nice area close to the beach and coffee shops as well as other shopping. Air conditioner worked which was AWESOME! Parking at night was a little difficult, exit and entrance through same drive way made it difficult and some time very dangerous. People smoked near parking entrance and that was dangerous.

Go ahead and pay for the parking garage. There is virtually no parking close by. We loved being able to walk to so many eating and shopping areas nearby. The hotel could use some updating but frankly I thought the décor rather charming.

Both bed linens obviously were not changed. One had hair in it and the other had rice in it. Bathroom is way below par. We wore our sandals in the shower. Their answer to mold is to paint over it. The location is good though, close to the beach shopping and restaurants. We stayed out of the room most of the time and explored the island. Also parking is very tight and there is no elevator to the lobby so you have to carry your luggage up a flight of stairs, not fun.

The checkin took a long time. The bathroom was very dirty. The bed cover was stained in multiple locations. The noise in the surrounding area was so much, that we couldn't sleep till 3 am. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

This hotel is severely dated, moldy, and stinks like oily skin. My room was located behind elevator shaft. Heard nothing but loud whooshing noise all night long. This hotel could be a museum piece from the 60s.

Bathroom was run down and needing renovation. Staff were lovely. The rooster which resides at the bar next door continually crowing from 4.30 in the morning was very annoying. The bed in the room was comfortable and the location of the hotel was close to bars and nightlife. A little walk from the beach but not too far

Very convienant for me it's right across my job. Walking distance to everything, food, restaurants, bars, beaches, etc price for the hotel very reasonable, just the parking area kind of tight though but could bare. Oh yea when I made Saimin in the room there was no forks at all only spoon. Thank God the instant saimin bowl came with a fork. Other than that my stay was nice and relaxing. Hope to go back soon in the future. Already told people about this hotel.

Across the street and within walking distance to Waikiki International Marketplace. 1 block from beach and 1 block from a food mart. Free shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Center. No frills hotel that wont break the bank. Staff is very nice and friendly.

I booked this hotel as I was just staying two nights in Waikiki and I knew it was in the centre of everything which it was. It’s a basic, older hotel with big rooms. I had a room on the third floor above the pool, so I heard lots of kids squealing all day (I was sick one day so stayed in bed). If you’re not looking for luxury and just want something central, this hotel is absolutely fine.

Great Location and Friendly Staff - just a little run down and dated. Bar at hotel is small but friendly staff, cold beers and clean Pool small and the advertised free food / drinks manager’s special was pretty bad.

First Impressions 4: When you walk in the door to the lobby, it doesn't look as fancy as some of the other hotels in the area but things were laid out well. There was free tea in the lobby and access to the restaurant next door. Instead of a big glass sliding door like the other hotels, this one has a normal glass door that you pull open. The check-in desk area was nice and uncluttered but since it's a small space, can be congested during check-in/check out times. Service 5: The front desk personnel were friendly and served up "aloha" with every interaction. We had some issues that weren't their fault, but they helped us in and were very friendly. The bell-man and housekeeping were exceptionally good (Glenn and Connie). They were always smiling and friendly and were always there to help us with whatever we needed. They are truly exceptional and deserve recognition. Room 3: Here’s where you are reminded that you paid less than the other hotels. The room was old and felt like it. The walls were this off-white/yellow color and the fixtures were definitely dated. However, the upside is that you paid less (hopefully) and you’re in an excellent location with OK views. You’re in Hawaii and should be outdoors anyway, so making small sacrifices for a less than stellar room are ok and expected. It wasn’t dingy by any means, but it wasn’t the magazine picture some imagine when they visit Waikiki. But don’t get me wrong, it was more than acceptable for the area. Overall 4: We had a great stay and while I wish there were more amenities (Bigger pool, gym, hot tub…) the hotel did have everything you’d normally expect. The parking was pricey but if you didn’t bring or rent a car, you’re ok. The absolute best parts were: Location and Service! Sure it’s not as nice as some of the pricier options, but this is a great value for those wanting to stay in the heart of Waikiki without breaking the bank AS much.

Hotel was decent. Definitely could use an upgrade but if you are looking for a central, location with not many frills, this will do just fine. The washroom isnt huge - dont expect to get changed in there.

Had great staff to work with. Poor things have to deal with the most irritating customers. However... paint job, new carpet, new throw pillows & blankets, a good deep cleaning/bathroom scrub and better replenishment of toiletries are definitely things that they need to work on.

I wish I had a glowing review for this hotel. For our 10 night stay, it was fine. The front office staff were lovely and always said hello to our kids every time we walked through reception. It is the issues that have occured after we have left that have really left a bad taste in our mouths, and has changed our whole opinion of this hotel.Let me start with the few positives of this hotel. Good location, friendly reception staff, the water/iced tea/coffee a nice touch in the lobby. Usually always a doorman to help open the door if we had hands full. No issues asking for more towels, WiFi good. They allowed us to check in early as we arrived at the hotel by 7am, I think initially they weren't going to, but we were travelling with our two young children and our 4 year old had fallen asleep in their lobby once we arrived, and we were told when asking if there was somewhere we could change our baby they let us know they would put us in another room (why this wasn't offered initially to us if it was clean and available, I don't know).Now, the negatives. Room was too small for two adults, a 4 year old and a baby in a portacot. I am well aware of the type of room we booked, but I think we should have been advised when booking that the room is quite small, especially once a portacot is set up at the end of one of the double beds, so then we had an opportunity to either book a larger room, or look elsewhere.You pay a service fee daily but the room is not serviced daily. We were 4 people in a small room and the room was not serviced daily (maybe every 2-3 days if we were lucky, and staying 10 nights with kids, we would have thought it would be done daily). When it was, it was fine, and we thought housekeeping was lovely (AT THE TIME OF STAY).We checked out of our room around 4am for an early flight back to Australia. My husband left an expensive item behind in our room. He mentioned it to me in the taxi to the airport, but as we were only relying on WiFi on our phones, we could not contact the hotel until we were back home. I fully expected that we would have had some sort of contact from the hotel when we got home to let us know we left this item behind. Anyway, we unpacked all of our suitcases the day after we arrived home to be sure the item was not mistakenly packed away. It was not. I have been in contact with this hotel for over a month now, who say this item was 'not found' by housekeeping when they went in to our room. We were told security cameras would be checked, and the general manager would be notified. To this day, I have not heard anything in regards to if anything was seen on the cameras, and I continue to ask for contact details of the general manager which these requests keep being ignored. The way this has been handled is horrible and does not fend well for the hotel itself.In short, this expensive item has virtually disappeared from our room, from when we checked out to when housekeeping entered the room. I am annoyed as we paid a service fee each day to housekeeping that not only took the generous tip left behind by us in our room, we are also lead to believe that this expensive item was taken too, as there is no other logical explanation. I feel sick to my stomach that over a MONTH later, there is still no resolution. There is also a terrible lack of communication, I have sent through all requested paperwork to them and there hasn't even been an email of acknowledgement to advise it has been received and things are in process. And when I say 'things are in process', I don't even know what the hotel is doing with all the information I have provided them (photos of the item, a step by step account of our morning before we checked out, hand written accounts, where exactly the item was left in the room etc), I personally believe some sort of compensation to us should be provided, for the item and for a level of the service fee because why have we paid for a service fee when an item has mysteriously disappeared from our room after we checked out???I would not recommend anyone I know to stay at this hotel due to the reasons listed above. I find it horrible that a hotel thinks this sort of behaviour is okay, and to drag a process on for over a month with no resolution is actually disgusting for the customer. And if the hotel do read their reviews, I would very much appreciate some contact from the general manager (asking for the fifth time now), as the way this is being handled is disgraceful.

This hotel is perfect if you're looking for somewhere to have a little get together for the weekend. I paid to do an upgrade into a JSTE & it was probably the best decision I've made staying here because even though this hotel is on Kuhio Ave & not beachfront, the view at night was amazing to look at. Most of all, the staff was very accommodating, the popolo guy & the elevator guys were EXTREMELY nice and very helpful! I wish I remembered their names. Mahalo again & I will becoming back.

We first got to our room the Wifi didn’t work! It smelled funny! The second day my husband was taking a shower and the shower was clogged! He was standing in ankle deep water in our shower! I called the front desk 5 times finally someone picked up I even called house keeping and no one answered! Finally we got someone to answer! They sent maintenance and he tried to plunge it! That didn’t work so he said he would be back and vacuum up the water and snake it. He said he couldn’t snake it until 9am because people might complain! 20 mins later he still didn’t show up to vacuum it! We left came back and noticed he used the towels and didn’t have anyone bring more! The WiFi wouldn’t work very well! I did the environment friendly program! They said the credit was good for the restaurant! Never once said couldn’t use it at the bar! They also told us they would empty our trash every day no one came until I brought it up 5 days later! The room was in very bad shape! I took pictures of it! There was mold in the shower mold and in sliding door track! Some thing was drooping from the wall! None of the lights were plugged in except the one on the desk! The oulet plugs couldn’t keep my charger plugged in it kept falling down! Their was a electrical cord capped off but hanging in the sliding door area! The restaurant/bar smelled gross! I wanted to extend but they wanted to charge me like $60 more a night so I found a better hotel for way cheaper and so much more cleaner! And all the other issues I mentioned above about our issues is why I won’t recommend it to anyone!!!!

Aqua Ohia Hotel was one of the few hotels that allowed us to stay with our pet. The hotel was reasonably priced and the staff was very helpful and pleasant. Hotel is a little dated but clean and our room was a nice size. The internet connection was good and the AC and cable TV worked fine. Only issue is the hotel is connected to a bar that stays open until 2:00 am. Additionally the hotel is just a couple blocks away from another bar that stays open past 2:00 am. The room has louvered windows so you can hear all of the foot traffic and police sirens after the bars close. The hotel is on Kuhio right across from the international market place and there is quick access to restaurants and the beach. Overall, good hotel if you have pets, are on a budget, and enjoy the bar scene.

This hotel is very outdated. It is in a terrible neighborhood and the parking and the entry and exit to the parking is terrible. The room was very outdated and there was mold growing in the bathroom. The beds were very small and uncomfortable

Location is good being close to the shopping malls, restaurants and convenient stores. One block from the beach, easy, fun walk. Our original room was tight for a company of 5 and there was plumbing problem on the first day which was addressed immediately. We were transferred to a junior suite which was nice and spacious with a nice view. The roll-away bed was old and uncomfortable though. The housekeeping was awesome, beds and the room were always immaculately clean. The hotel itself is old and dated but being made clean made it so relaxing and cozy every time you come in. The housekeeper Nori Rosal was always prompt and accommodating with our requests -made the stay enjoyable. The rest of the staff were nice and helpful too, specially Jason the supervisor who helped us with the transfer. Over-all, it was a wonderful experience. You get your money's worth.

It’s been hell. Our first room was smelly, the air conditioning didn’t work after making three complaints about this we were given three fans to ventilate the room. The beds are small and does not accommodate more than four adult travellers like the description which says “6”. We asked for a rollaway bed on day one and have continued to follow it up cause the communication of staff is the worst I’ve seen. On our final day we were told a rollaway would be $35 extra a day We resulted in moving the beds together to find a vomit stain on carpet.Our shower was clogged and filled the bathtub as we showered to our knees. A panel in the shower roof started leaking in our first room. It then started to seep into the carpets outside the toilet. After making two phone calls and going down to reception to seek answers we were told “pack your bags you will be moving”. There was no assistance from any staff to help move our luggage to the lobby, then to our new room. There was faeces stains on bathroom wall. The lamp and chair are broken. The power point in room don’t work. The toilet door handle was broken and didn’t lock. We asked for extra pillows on day got them on our final night The shuttle bus took an hour to get to Ala Moana we decided two dollars spent on the Pink Line Bus was better and safer than using the Shuttle again Staff took an hour and a half to address our concerns about room number one moving us at 11pm on a Saturday night with no assistance. No notes were made in computer. When we asked about previous requests or problems no one knew anything about previous complaints. We were paying a service fee and our room didn’t even get cleaned on day four, we saw housekeeping as we left and let her know we left. We were told cause we had the do not disturb sign on our door, however on the previous three days housekeeping has ignored this sign and come into the room at 7-8am. It took 15 mins to get a fresh towel after once again making a complaint. Housekeeping left our room open for over an hour whilst we were out  With a travel party of four who work for an airline we know a thing or two about customer service and hotels so I can 100% guarantee I will not be recommending this hotel to any future passengers or fellow crew who are travelling to Hawaii!!

Staff friendly and efficient but the owners of the hotel have not invested a dollar in replacing worn fixtures and fittings or modernising the facility. More like a backpackers' low standard place to sleep only, but you won't get much sleep. Noisy surroundings and transparent curtains.

Pretty average hotel for a cheap price.The carpets were dirty, small rooms and the swimming pool took forever to be repaired as it was being repaired during that time last year 2017. I would give it a 3 star rating.

I did not feel it was a good place to stay for the price. And charging a resort fee with really having nothing to offer besides a pool was upseting. I would not be starting there again. However the staff was very friendly

I see previous reviews are not very nice. I found the Staff of this hotel to be WONDERFUL! This hotel is well worn, but the clean beds and towels, friendly and helpful staff, location and reasonable price make up for dated furnishings. I will stay here again. Our room was 1584 so maybe 15th floor is quieter? All I know is I am very pleased with our choice to stay at the Aqua Ohia Waikiki.

Everything about this place was HORRIBLE. Dirty rooms, inadequate maid service, unfriendly staff. The shower was dirty and had hair and human discharge. The maid had to be asked to refill shampoo, toilet tissue etc and didn't keep the room tidy.The only redeeming quality to this hotel was the location as it was close to the beach, shopping etc. Other than that a filthy dive in dire need of renovations!

The hotel was fine - the staff were friendly and helpful, and there was everything I needed in the room. My only complaint is that the curtains were not wide enough to cover the sliding door/window so there was a strip of uncovered window right by the head of the bed - not ideal at night. The shuttle bus also doesn't run early in the morning so I had to take an expensive taxi to the airport.

Don’t stay here. Entire hotel smells bad. The shower is so small and old. Someone urinated off the balcony in the room above us in the middle of the night. Such a bad experience, we are never going back.

You can read the other reviews, and yes it is older and a bit run down; but we found this a good value for our needs. You’re in Honolulu, how much time do you really spend in your room. We found the location excellent for walking to the beach, restaurants, shopping, and catching tour buses. The room was adequate for 3, small and certainly nothing fancy but had a microwave and small fridge. Onsite parking was a plus and the staff was sincerely friendly. Would I stay with my children, probably not; but adult only traveling was fine.

Very old and not well maintained. The staff tries to be friendly, but you can tell that every one there knows this place is a total flop house. The bathrooms are dirty and barely function, the A/C in the room sort of cools, but not really. The parking is the worst I have ever experienced - I damaged my rental car bumper trying to push the out of place button to open the gate. DO NOT STAY HERE.

We are lucky to call Hawaii home, but after 8 years away and having seen the world, it is sad to admit that our beautiful ohana is dotted with some seriously outdated amenities.In the last few years, it is encouraging to see efforts in modernising some facilities and particularly when tourism is such a big contributor to our economy, hotels are trying to revive their looks and offerings.As home is on the big island for us, our stay on Oahu generally consist of hotels near or along Waikiki. We have tested many hotels - some hits and some serious miss. This time, we decided to go back to a trusted brand but one of their many hotels along Waikiki. Aqua Ohia is nicely situated in the midst of the action. It may not be on the main stretch of Waikiki, but Kuhio Avenue is the on the back end where it’s not as busy as well. So we give location a huge tick.Service by the staff were wonderful. They truly bring you the aloha that you expect - extremely helpful and friendly. Even the security guys are hands on in helping the guests. Yet another tick.As for the rooms - on the positive side, the room is extremely clean, tidy and adequately furnished. The bed mattresses are comfortable and there’s enough storage space if guests needs it. There is a safe, bar fridge (not loaded though) and surprisingly, even a stove with pots and pans. However, like much of Hawaii, the building structure and interiors like walls, hallways, and lifts are deeply in need of upgrades. We can tell evidently that the hotel have attempted to give the place a fresh coat of pain, and the carpets may perhaps even be changed recently. However, the corridors are dark, musky and almost a bit too depressing. The bathrooms and it’s vanities and shower are also very dated and holding up just enough to do the job. Overall, like most visitors to Hawaii, if you are looking at spending most of your time out of your room and only returning to rest your nights, this hotel is not too bad. It will do the job with not much frills other than comfort, cleanliness and the staff’s friendliness. Aloha and enjoy your trip.

Rooms and bathrooms are dark and seem dirty. They need updating. The bed was broken. We had to carry our luggage up a flight of stairs stairs because there was only a service elevator in the parking garage available which we were told we could not use. The walls were so thin you could hear every little noise.

The rooms are clean, very dated, need to be refurbished The foyer and pool area are very clean compared to the last time we stayed in Oct 17Over all it is a good place to stay for the location and price

Fee charges are exhorbitant. We did not get much for the fee charges of USD 52.36 for two nights. The Hotel management should review this fee and justify their expense. During our visit this was not the case.

Very helpful staff. Great, big, clean, comfortable room with a fantastic bed. And its all for a reasonable price. Fantastic balcony overlooking the city. Very close to shops and entertainment venues. The beach is also not far away.

I went to Waikiki last minute for a cheap quick break and most hotels were either fully booked or very expensive, so I ended up staying at Aqua Ohia.Very happy with my decision!!! Not five star rooms and facilities but clean and mine had a mini kitchen. The beds and linen are better in real life than what it looks like in hotel photos.The location was fantastic for what I needed - just a short stroll to the beach and restaurants as I didn’t want to spend my precious few days ubering or walking to get to places. It is located on the non beach side of the newly upgraded International Marketplace (just across the road from restaurants and shopping!!!), so you just walk straight through the marketplace and pop out on the other side in the main street (Kalakaua Ave) for more shopping, restaurants and the beach!Great service and there is a separate desk in the lobby where I noted what seemed to be a very experienced travel agent helping guests arranging various activities and trips around the islands.Great value for money!

This hotel was in a great location and the staff were so helpful and friendly but it was so dirty. On our first day we were told our room wasn't ready until 3pm because it was being cleaned. We left and returned after 3pm told room was finished so went up. We had to call the front desk straight up as there was chips on the floor and coffee drips dried on the cups which were in the cupboard for us to use, the knives and forks had to be washed as well as these were so dirty. The doors on the wardrobes wouldn't work properly. We had a room that had its own kitchen facilities BUT we had to go and buy a Kettle, sharp knife, oven foil trays (nothing to use in the oven) and we had to use trays to use to put food into them (no plastic bowls). There was one chair so one of us had to sit on the bed to eat, sit or watch tv. You couldn't walk out onto the balcony without shoes on because your feet became black.Like I said the location and Staff were great but the dirtiness of this hotel Unit 1185 really lets it down. We had a conversation with other people who were changing rooms because they were so unhappy with their room.I do have photos but I'm going to email the manager and bring this matter to their attention.

We stayed at the Aqua Ohia in a King Junior Suite and had a great stay. Room was clean and tidy and cleaned daily by Housekeeping. This is a 3 star property in a fantastic location in Waikiki. To get this location for the price is great! The Aqua shuttle service is included in the rate, whihc runs to schedule and takes you to other aqua properties around Waikiki and Ala Moana Mall, drivers were always friendly and knowledgeable. I would stay here again for sure and reccommend to others for a value stay.

Located right across the street from international marketplace, lots of restaurants to choose from, shopping mall, convenience stores. The hotel room has a kitchenette, mini fridge, stove, oven, coffee maker but no microwave. We didn’t use it as we were always out all the time and would go back to the hotel only to sleep. There is also a pool and you can avail of the free towels to use. In terms of cleanliness of the room all I’m concerned about is the bed sheets and the bathroom and they were clean. Since this is an old hotel don’t expect everything to be nice and shiny. I just hope they will install an elevator from the parking garage going to the lobby as it is very hard to bring up the luggage on a narrow staircase.

Really kind and helpfull staff in front desk. Room not really clean. There were some stuff from previous guests. Really good location, close to the beach and to Conference Centre. Really good restaurants and bars close.

In spite of its great location the hotel's service level and cleanliness is questionable. I would think the local tourist authority would have shut down this hotel due to its poor and unhygienic room and surrounding cleanness.No staffs care about anything in this hotel. No lifts from the car park to bring suitcases to the lobby and no help offered.Rooms were smelly and dirty plates and knife/forks in drawers.Learned our lesson!!

Never again. Don’t trust the pics on the website-it’s photoshopped. Moldy bathroom, smelly kitchen, no kitchen utensils, dirty balcony/ furniture, smelly rug. Staff ist fake-friendly, except the 2 parking guys :)

My wife and I travel a lot and the last time were where in Waikiki we stayed at the Hyatt. This time we wanted to have our own kitchen/Kitchenette. The location of the hotel is great, the people are great but the Kitchenette is poor. very min equipment, we had to was it all before we used it and there was no table to eat off. We had to asked for wine glasses which we got but we could only really cook breakfast in our room. Would I stay there again, possibility but speaking with others there are better places with Kitchenette. The place is tired. Please look at upgrading it in the future.

A great location, very central to everything in Waikiki. Easy Trolley Waikiki accessibility downstairs as well as Nordstrom, Ross's shops and a fabulous fresh noodle shop across the road. Waikiki Beach access is only 5 mins away and also very close to the Cheesecake Factory too..

The staffs were very friendly. The room is old and needed major upgrades, but it was one of the cheapest places you can book in Waikiki, plus the location was great. If you plan to be out more often than staying in the room, then this would be an ok place to stay.

Lobby nice and modern looking, but room could've used some updates. Didn't have time to use the pool or other amenities. Seemed like a good location - close to International Marketplace Mall, other shopping and many restaurants. Staff was very nice and accommodating.

Tired and in poor condition. Rooms not properly serviced each day. Only changed the towels and emptied the bins. Did not clean the bathroom or toilet.Good location.What you see on website is not the room given.

Hotel is extremely out dated and is in need of a remodel. Lobby is clean and modern, but the rooms are dim and grimy. Hallways are dimly lit and has an oder to it. During my stay, the cable was out and was being worked on so no TV entertainment; internet speed was decent. Very little hotel amenities that it isn't worth the daily charge. Unfortunately loud early in the morning because of the garbage trucks that do pickups. Hotel location is good. Conveniently located close to multiple stores and food locations. The beach is a 5 minute walk away.

Hotel a bit tired very good location central to everything staff friendly if on a budget can't go wrong good bar connected to this hotel The Lava Tube highly recommended for very reasonable food and drink prices. Our overall stay was enjoyable.

We expected a lot more. The quality and cleanliness of our stay was poor. We also didn't expect front desk staff to be wearing shirts with sharpie name tags. We expected something more professional...

first I thought the parking entrance was too narrow, carrying our luggage up stairs was hard, they should have a guest elevator to the lobby, lobby is small looks big in the picture.. my room was nice and clean, I enjoyed my 3 night vacation, some guest was loud they should practice indoor voices , the staffs was pleasant, its nice walking distance to restaurants and the beach.if the price is right I would stay here again...

We had a lovely holiday. The room was greatin the 15th floor with a great balcony. We got out requested 2 beds. No knife or decent drinking or wine glasses for the fully stocked kitchen and tv not working for 3 days was frustrating. Overall a good place to stay. Would definitely stay there again

The whole hotel was dirty old and disgusting. Underground parking structure was filled with garbage and smelled horrible. Pool area was old and beat up. Nothing like the any of the photos. Beds were hard, carpet heavily stained. Cable tv was broken for 3 days. Room was dirty. People partying all night.Pots and pans in the room were old. Decor was mismatched and cheap. Did I make my point? Don’t stay here even if it’s was free.

Arrived at “hotel” 1:00 in the morning because we had a late flight and there was NO PARKING ANYWHERE! Down stairs & upper level parking. Our car couldn’t even fit in the lower level parking with out having the racks hit the pipes on the ceiling. After insisting that it should fit the guy at front desk said to park my car on the street and give him my keys in case they had to move it. Mind you the street was lined with intoxicated and probably drugged people along with NO PARKING signs. Tell me why I would give my car keys to someone I don’t know?!?! Park my car on the street and have it towed?!?! Ridiculous! We never even set foot in our room that we had paid for and front desk refused to give me a refund!! Don’t believe the pictures online because once you get there you’ll see it’s probably not what you expected! I was VERY DISAPPOINTED and my family and I didn’t feel safe at all! At 1:30 a.m. my family and I had NO WHERE to stay thanks to this ghetto aqua ohia and their staff who could care less!

Could not watch tv when we got there and check out kids could not watch so that the only problum and they never give us a card for the pool towel other then that everything was ok just the tv so that was my concen

Very good location, closed by to everything. Very friendly and helpful staffs. Good price for the room. Facility needs some upgrade such as hot tube, laundry room and repaint. But overall stay is very nice

The hotel is old! Room wasn’t clean, AC leaked water out, which was a safety hazard because the hotel still had acoustic ceiling. Bathroom was small and didnt have enough lighting. Cable tv was out of service during our stay. Location is good. Other than that, good price, but it might be worth it to book another hotel.

Went on family holiday booked 2 rooms 1 for a double and 1 to sleep family of 4 and family of 4 were given 2 king single how do you sleep 4 in that no help so had to pay for another room not an expense we needed

Property needs refurbishment but does have very comfortable beds. Check in did take several hours, but I did arrive early and check in policy was 3.00pm so could not complain about that. Check out was quick and easy.

Pleasant hotel in a great location but the rooms need a lick of paint. I had to ask for a microwave as they apparently do not have enough for every room which in this day and age is stupid. A microwave should be available for every room.

We got a studio had 2 double beds and 1 single , a small restroom a stove a coffee pot a refrigerator. Very small. The beds were not comfortable to me but that could be because they were small beds. The employees were friendly. They have a small pool and it was cold. You couldn’t get to many people in it. We stayed on the 7th floor and you have to go to the lobby and out passed the pool to get ice. They do have a bar and lounge by the lobby. You step out of the building there is an adult video store right outside the lobby. There is also a club. The air conditioner didn’t cool down. This resort doesn’t have a hot tub either. I believe I would find somewhere else to stay if it’s for a long period. Thank You and Have A Blessed Day Terry

I stayed for a few months for work and the customer service is amazing! Among desk agents, Jason, Megan & Yuta really stood out, they greeted me by name and consistently made sure that i was satisfied with my room and stay. I was even more impressed by Glenn and Ditrick, two staff members that went out of their way to help me with requests. Even while they were on break, they would still help without hesitation. Great location central to everything and walking distance to the beach. I would rate this as excellent, but the rooms and hotel in general are really overdue for a renovation.

My son and I were on a college visit to Hawaii Pacific and the hotel that the university recommended was booked so they recommended their sister property the Ohia. The hotel is older and hasn't been kept up. The rooms are straight out of the 1960's and I feel its over priced for what it is. Great location, friendly and nice staff, but again over priced for what it is.

First time in Waikiki with my daughter. The rooms are comfortable and great if you're not planning on much room time. We couldn't access the internet in our room. The kitchen facility inroom was great (cost saving to be able to make breakfast).Noisy location, but very handy to everything.

Aqua Ohia is a home away from home. The location was accessible to the beach, shopping centers and restaurants. Perfect location. Staff are great. I would like to commend Ms. Honey Pagaran for her hospitality, dedication and efficiency. Truly an asset to your company. Will definitely come back. Kudos.

I believe that this hotel is in a great location to get to everything. The reason that it is a two is due to the size of the pool and the nature of the rooms. The rooms need some serious updating. The showers are really small and some don't have bathtubs. Staff are very friendly.

Only a couple of blocks from the beach and very close to the shops, restaurants and transport. Great big balcony to enjoy sitting and watching the sunrise or just watch the people going past. Great bar to enjoy a quiet drink in.

Great location, worth the money and very accessible to anywhere you wanna go, just needs a little renovation on the bathroom area, very outdated but overall the service is great and also has an option for parking which is very reasonable price!

The hotel is a few blocks from the beach, surrounded by great shopping and restaurants. They have an underground garage if you rent a car, but try to reserve a space, there are a limited number of spots. No this is not a sprawling all inclusive property, but I really enjoyed my stay there. It's convienently located, has fair pricing, and great staff.

Service was good with friendly staff. Great location a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach and International Marketplace and restaurants. Free dvd kiosk included with stay but parking is extra. Beds were very comfortable but the room we stayed in was in need of an update. The kitchen cabinets and appliances screams 80’s. Fridge rocked back and forth. Bathroom paint, door, sink, and shower needs major reno. Needs more insulation as we could hear people talking in the halls and in the adjacent rooms. I would rate this more at 2.5 in room quality and 5 for staff friendliness.

This is a super cozy and comfortable hotel great for getaways. The staff were really friendly and made staying here so enjoyable. The rooms came equipped with mini kitchens that came in handy. Great place.

Small hotel, good service, the movies and kitchen were great. We were able to save money and not have to eat out all the time. No noise from the neighbors, and unlimited movies for the days when the sun wasn't out. Close to all the shops without all the noise of traffic from Kalakaua. We were able to walk pretty much everywhere, including Ala Moana and the Zoo. The only thing we missed was a microwave, and wish the fridge had been bigger, since we stayed for a week and brought food with us.

Guests on floor smoking illegal drugs and noisy. Cooking in their room raised the smoke alarm but no guidance from hotel staff if it was an emergency. Had to ask the guests if everything was okay. Security is low- anyone can access the guest floors. Hotel resort towels were very old - said that it was $30 to replace them. Very low quality. Rubbish trucks very noisy. Rooms basic and old. Carpet in foyer threadbare. No washing up liquid in room or tea towel provided. No drinking glasses and cups very small.

From the check-in experience to the overall room stay it was the worst hotel we have stayed in. There was confusion overt he room we booked and after many international phone calls, no records of conversations were recorded in reservations system of any kind. Had to renegotiate a new room which took half a day to organise. Rooms were so tired - the decor was on par with a very old backpackers. Light in the room wasn't working next to the bed, TV remote didn't work, no central lighting - only bedside lamps. The pool was very cold - no instructions from front office staff about obtaining and disposing of towels that were included in 'resort fee'. The lobby area was frequently overcrowded- check-in staff slow to process guests. Management drinks consisted of iced tea or a watered-down cocktail with little crackers. It as though this hotel has given up on itself. Staff are not engaged -rooms need a complete refurbish. Location is great though

WORST HOTEL EVER. I am not kidding when I say it's 4:26 am and I am writing this review with no sleep at all. The upstairs neighbors were cat calling and blasting music even after we told security and front office to call the police. I felt very unsafe and never wish to stay here again. When I first got into the hotel and checked in we waited 4 hours, then the room was too small for 5 people so I complained to the manager and he suggested a room updgrade... oh but don't worry, I had to pay over 200 dollars. Ridiculous. This hotel ruined my trip and Chance at relaxing. Still currently listening to blasting music.

Wonderful location, reasonable price, amenities were good. Spacious lanai, comfortable bed, great views from high floor. Staff were friendly and helpful. Small kitchen was very convenient for making snacks and light meals.

We stayed there for 7 nights and the hotel is very well located, near the beach and good restaurants. The room was clean and the staff was really attentive, helping us when it was necessary. We had a good time in there.

We read terrible reviews on Yelp after we booked the room and those made us quite nervous. Turns out, those reviews are completely incorrect. This hotel is not 5-star, but it does the job! Comfortable, friendly staff, location is great, shower amenities, laundry facility, mini kitchen in the room, microwave available on request, beach towels available, and it’s just perfect!

My partner and I had a truly wonderful stay at the Aqua Ohia. The staff are superb and truly embody the aloha spirit! We are especially grateful to Ahn (front desk) and Noridel (housekeeping) for their excellent service. Noridel especially kept our room absolutely spotless, which was not an easy task as we were always hiking or at the beach! The PlayStation 3 and free DVD rentals are a lovely touch, as are the free pool towels and complimentary coffee/iced tea/weekly cocktail in the reception area. Be sure to request a quiet room (as we did) if that is important to you, as Waikiki is always busy at night. We had a clean, comfortable, and convenient stay at the Aqua Ohia and hope to return again.

Good place, excelente location, rooms, but i made the reservation on despegar website, and don’t specify that the hotel charges $26 usd fees a day extras that the web site charge.Buy all the other things are excelente, have a little pool, good service .

Good location, short distance to beech. Cheap noodle house across the street, Dukes has great happy hour burgers for $5.00. The rooms are squishy for a family of four. The kitchettes are okay, however, there is only seating for three (including the two deck chairs). The build up of grime around handles and switches is an indication of cleanliness. The stafff is great.

Very pleasant stay in a nice hotel. It has seen some wear but is still going strong. Price is good, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I was sad that no bathtub was in the room, but on the other hand, it had a stove, fridge, coffee pot, and microwave. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel only for one night before flying back home. We were surprised on how well located this hotel is. Just a few steps from the shopping mall and only a couple blocks away from waikiki beach. It is an old building, but the rooms were comfortable and clean. They also have a garage which was important for us , a bit expensive at $28/day , but everything is expensive in hawaii.

Horrible rooms horrible service everything is dirty there and or broken. I told them shower head was broken and still 5 days later not fixed. Gave me wrong room said would charge me upgrade fee for what I had already booked.

Location was great, beaches are walking distance. Shopping is right outside your door step. One major issue I had was finding roaches inside my room. Rooms were outdated, but for the price you get what you pay for.

remodel the rooms all the help were very friendly very convent to the beach and the stores pool was addaquit for having a beach close by hotel was a great value for big family seemed to encourage family stays

We stayed 2 nights. Lobby is nice, wonderful location.Room on second floor was terrible. We had wet carpet in 2 places due to air conditioner leaking. Although it was clean inside the room balcony was disgusting with bird poo and some cigetett buts.Used “beach” towels one day and were given white regular room towels... I don’t mind paying a resort fee but should at least be given what is promised. Front desk staff didn’t really care when I told them about wet carpet in the room and the DVD machine not working.I am sure we had stayed her before with a better experience. Disappointing.

The hotel is in a great location, and the women on the front desk were extremely lovely and helpful, but when calling up to request if something could be fixed in our room the male staff member told us he was too busy and hung up on us. The cleaning is very half assed, old food from previous people in the fridge, dirty cups & plates in the cupboard. The walls are pretty thin so if you have young kids or aren't here to party be wary of the sounds from the clubs nearby. It's not an expensive hotel but there's definitely better places to stay for a similar price.

A worn out hotel that has seen better days. They charged a $25.00 a day resort fee for Beach towels and the tiniest pool I have ever seen at a hotel. Plus the sun never actually hit the pool area. The only good thing was the location. In the middle of the Waikiki Beach area and only an easy 5 minute walk to the ocean. Otherwise not even close to being a good deal. The only thing that made his hotel bearable was the excellent friendly staff.

When my son and I arrived, we discovered that our room had a king instead of two doubles, and we were told that even though I selected double beds, it wasn't always guaranteed that's what I would get. (I didn't understand that and wasn't a happy camper.) The next day I saw that a room with double beds on our floor was being cleaned so I asked the maid if the people had checked out, and she said yes. So I went to the front desk to inquire about switching rooms. That room was taken but another one was available and we were moved. I will say that the second room was smaller but in much better condition and cleaner than the first one we had, even though it was considered a downgrade. Overall, our stay was a pleasant one. The staff were extremely nice and helpful, and the location was great--just five minutes from the beach!

It is close to Waikiki Beach, so around the hotel there is not crowd, so I can do it slowly. It is a hotel which is a bit old but recommended. I think that it is very good for staying long in a family.

The rooms were cheap but parking situation was bad and my room wasn't serviced for 2 days. And we pay for the service. Bummers..... Hopefully in the future they have more parking available for guests!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were looking for a budget hotel with a kitchenette to help keep our costs down on this 2 week trip. Booked the least expensive room, but did request a king bed. We were 'upgraded' to a corner studio room on the 11th floor with a king bed and a kitchenette at no extra charge. It was quite large. older building with even older carpet it seems - that was ok because we expected it. Pros: friendly staff, free shuttle, free newspaper, morning coffee, water and ice tea in the lobby. Free movie rentals, beach towels and beach chairs (have to ask for the chairs). Great location - short walk to everything. Bus at front door almost. (I was told that there is a kitchenette in all rooms - so do not pay extra for this). Nice city views except when you look down - old buildings and some garbage. Cons: roaches in kitchen. No knives. corners of floor and bathroom on the whole are not cleaned properly. Lots of traffic noise if you have the balcony door open. If you have noisy neighbours on the adjoining balcony, you will not like it. Luckily, this only happened to us 1 night. Tips for saving money: Use that kitchen for breakfasts and meals as much as possible!! Shop at Safeway,(a 15 minute bus ride), not at Food Pantry that is close by. We actually took the bus to Costco and bought rotisserie chicken ($5), frozen veggies, eggs, fruit etc. Go to Walmart. Take a few small grocery items with you (tea bags, coffee,salt, spices, etc so you don't have to buy everything). Ask directions to the local farmers markets. Read the "free" events in the elevator each week. Use the Bus ($5.50 for a day pass) - we traveled the entire island this way, the drivers are great. Talk to Earl on the free shuttle - he has a wealth of great information to share.

You get what you pay for. It took 1 1/2 hours to check in and we were given a room with one full size bed for 3 adults 1 child. had to come back downstairs and change room for one with 2 fullsize that smelled of strong clorox. Chipped paint in the shower very dim lighting

Stay away from this place. Nothing like the pictures in the web. Rooms need to be completely updated. From paint to rugs. Bathroom was horrible!!! Not enough lighting, sliding door that did not even cover entering way. Useless kitchen.

Was looking for a reasonable priced accommodation after spending a few days in Maui & was getting low on funds at the end of our holiday. This place fitted with in our budget ended up with a room with a kitchenette which we were able to get suppliers from the Foodland store about a block away. The bed comfortable and conditions ok, your not far from anything and the pool was clean.

You are not paying for 5 Star amenities or services. For a budget stay where you have access to central Waikiki with a bus stop 200 metres away, it’s great. We could walk to most places & buses were convenient & cheap. Things to be mindful of if you are a fussy traveller;1. It’s 2 Star Hotel - so I think you get what you pay for including the dated decor2. The amenity fee is $25 a day which horrifies me but I’m told it’s standard here3. We got a deluxe double room & it was still a tight fit for us, but we made it work4. The staff were lovely but to get a wifi issue resolved I had to speak to several of them & I ended up having to escalate it to the supervisor - who was good & moved us to a room where the wifi worked (thank you Jason)5. Check your bill, make sure you only get charged what you should pay - better to be direct then leave uncertain or with unanswered questions.

I traveled to oahu with my dad and me just to visit family. The hotel was easy to find using google maps, however it can be slightly confusing. When you first arrive you need to park in the parking garage with the blue button. The button pages the front desk and they will let you in if you’re checking in. The drive way is very steep and narrow, but we managed. Pretty nervous trying to park. You head to the hotel though a far door at the other end of the garage. Might be difficult to maneuver if you have large bags.The front desk was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were small but cozy. WiFi could use more strength. BUT the LOCATION is perfect! You have plenty of shops, restaurants and bars within walking distance. Perfect location with a nice reasonable price so you can spend more on your trip then where you stay.

Despite the pictures, this is a hotel that is well dated, the extremely small kitchen counter area had veneer peeling off, the burner pans on the stove were very dirty (a cheap fix!), the bathroom was moldy and very old, and the fire sprinkler head in the ceiling was so rusted and dirty, I doubt it would even work!. Look around for pictures I will try to post on other sites. It is a lower price, but these are basic items you would expect even the cheapest of hotels to have clean and in good repair. We prepaid the bill, and they tried to make us pay for the resort fee again when we checked in. There is no parking area to check in, so you have to find a spot on the street somewhere, then check in to get a key to the parking garage. Beware, the steep drop on the drive to get down into the garage is steep enough that our compact car scraped on the cement at the top coming in.

Hotel itself was okay - some of the fixtures were a little outdated and the bathroom was way too small (especially the shower stall). Also pretty poor lighting in the room. Bed and towels were pretty good though. Worst part was the lack of parking - 2 very tiny lots with no room to turn around - that was filled when we returned to the hotel at night in the pouring rain. No instructions were given as to what to do when the lot was full - although they obviously gave out more parking passes than they had stalls - and NO ONE answered the phones when we tried to call for the 20 minutes we circled the block trying to figure out where to park (the street parking was all taken around the entire block).

My girlfriend and I will recommend to friends and family. Our view was beautiful and our 'special request' was granted. Uber was not necessary. Shuttle service was very convenient. Shore is a short walk from the hotel. Lots and lots of shopping centers and restaurants near hotel.

I'd rather pay more for a hotel closer to the beach and with easier access for a guest with a car trying to check in. It's outdated and dirty. I had to wear slippers in the shower and walking around the room. Tiles in shower and shower curtains need replacing. Great location to shops but wish it was closer to the beach.

This is the second time my children and I have stayed here. We booked it for the price and location.The staff are very friendly and rooms are clean but are a little tired looking. The outside of the building is modern and fresh

Great location and friendly staff, but this hotel needs a serious update. There is a great udon restaurant right across the street and an international market that leads to a huge variety of shops and restaurants. Unfortunately the room was not great at all. There was no temperature control in the room. There was only a dial that said fan control that had off, high, med and low options. Needless to say the room did not cool down with a family of 5. The bathroom door did not lock and you had to shove it to close and yank it to open. The shower walls were cracking and peeling. The popcorn ceiling is very dated. The curtains are not black out curtains so there is always some light peeking through. There are only 2 elevators in the entire hotel and there were several times we had to take the stairs because they took forever. The floor buttons in the elevator don't light up when you press them so it's a guess if you stop on your floor or not. Again, friendly and helpful staff and a great location but sadly I won't have a return stay at this hotel.

We stayed for 8 days for joining the Ukulele Competition last February 2018. Since me and my husband are 1st timer here travelled to US; we wanted to get a place to stay that good in everything but in affordable price for sure. To be honest we quite shocked with the hotel's rating here and there and how people had written bad things about this hotel; but thankfully we just believe with faith and not by sight lol so we booked this hotel straight away.Aqua Ohia just amazing! Good price, good location that near to the Waikiki beach, ABC supermarket, Nordstrom Rack, International Market Place, IHOP, Ross Dress For Less etc. There's nothing we could ask for more!!!Their facilities and amenities are rock! Free shuttle to Ala Moana, free beach towel, swimmingpool, disc voucher on macy, IHOP and even free entry to Bernice Pauahi Bishop Museum. Clean room, clean bathroom, super cold aircon (until we need to turn it off hehe), complete kitchen facilities (stove, oven, small fridge and etc) that make us able to cook. This hotel just as real as what they explain themself on website or hotel booking website. I definitely will book this hotel again in the future!I post some detail pictures of this hotel. Hope you like it and get a picture beforehand :)Alohaaaaaaa from Singapore ♥

Very central location and friendly staff make this a good choice, when staying in Waikiki. But don't expect a modern room or surroundings, this hotel is in desperate need of a facelift. The balconies overlook piles of rubbish and some other sad looking buildings

This hotel is in a great location very friendly staff. So close to the shops and beach. Easy walking to major shopping centres. The people are very friendly and helpful. Use the public buses just a 1 minute walk from the hotel.

Location: Amazing. Hotel strip, plenty of stores, restaurants and walking proximity to the beach.Room 1083 has a beautiful side view of the mountains. Compact room. Clean. The staff was great. Wifi is strong.

The hotel is good for the price and centrally located front desk and concierge was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed staying at this property because it was walking distance to everything in Waikiki. Everyone at the hotel is very helpful from Front Desk to Housekeeping To Engineering.

This may not be rated as a 5 star hotel however if you want to be close to everything, and have the hotel provide you with beach chairs, towels, excellent service then this is the place to stay.. Excellent value for your money and a van that takes you to the mall.

We were checked into an extremely dirty room. There were bugs throughout the room and bathroom. In the morning, I complained to the front desk and provided photos to show the situation. I was told that the room should not have been given to me, and all I was given was $50 off! Just terrible.

It was our first time to Waikiki and I had read all the negative reviews about Ohia Hotel. To be honest, its an older hotel compared to Hilton etc and knowing that, I wasn't expecting 5star hotel.
