All we wanted, were beds with clean sheets, bathroom with clean towels, stove that worked and we got that. We were well looked after. Anything we needed, the staff accommodated. To those who gave negative reviews, just stay at another hotel. You can't expect to pay cheap rates and get 5star accommodation. I think we got our moneys worth and were satisfied. Also, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I think the shuttle service, the bus stop just outside the hotel were very convenient if you wanted to go outside Waikiki and everything inside Waikiki, was in walking distance. Thank you so very much for making our holiday memorable.

The rooms were hardly cleaned if anything at all. The rooms are also extremely outdated and falling apart. There was even mold growing around the AC unit. The only good thing about the hotel was the location which was good for the price.

When arrived had dried food on runner of bed. Chocolate on cabinet hanles. Plastic bag tied around shower nozzle to collect water from serious dripping. Killed 2 cockroaches within hours of arrival. Stove had lots of crumbs in bottom tray that you could see by just standing in front of it. Changed rooms. Next room unclean again. Had fleas in room. Condition of bathroom terrible. Shower dripped non stop. Tracks from sliding door very dirty and like daylight all night from exit sign outside window. Would definitely not stay here again.

Good location and friendly staff. Only issue is transportation to airport it's a bit far. Some of the events might not have pick ups at this hotel. City bus and trolley stops are 3 minutes away. Beach is 2 blocks.

Our room was dirty with outdated furniture and appliances, and a shabby spring mattress. It was like a dorm room, which I read in another review that it once was. The shower was the worst. It was stained and leaking from the bottom onto the floor. I had to wear my flip-flop sandals in there just to take a shower--there was no way I would stand in there barefoot! The bathroom didn't have a real door, but a sliding door (like a closet would have). Then to top it off, our room was located OUTSIDE of the building. So we had to walk down the hall past all the other rooms inside the hotel, then go out the door to our room. Oh, and let's not forget the "amenity" fees and extra charge for parking that are not worth it. The fact that they call anything an "amenity" is insulting. I would not recommend this place to my dog!

Didn’t have any major problems. The only thing is that I don’t remember a resort fee on the website and that was tacked on when checking in. It isn’t really a resort, either so maybe they should be more transparent about the price.

It’s about location and Aqua Ohia has it. Close to shops, restaurants and beach.Unfortunately, we were advised about the night club downstairs and music goes on majority of the night until the early morning hours and its extremely load. In-house Coffee only complimentary for the first night. Internet constantly crashing. Pool lol next question. Room are clean and small. Toiletries are not supplied daily. It’s not bad for the price -

The cleanliness of the rooms were quite poor, stove was dirty, old coffee was left in the coffee pot. Information about our check out was not clear and adjustment to our bill was not made. Hotel did not accommodate us when error on check out was realized.
user_name:
constructony
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is located in a good location. Nearby lots of shopping and restaurants. This is an older hotel but is okay for the cheap price. Like that they have a secured parking structure for guest of the hotel.

This Hotel features a small shabby lobby with mismatched furniture.Hotel Front desk staff that are Inexperienced Ignorance accompanied by very poor Hospitality attitudes in particular , evening Front Desk " MOY" or " MOI "The property does not reflect any standard of hygiene and thus is in a deplorable state. Pets are allowed to stay and it is not unusual to see dogs in the Hotel Pool ! and Dog poop in the limited hotel grounds space. There is a Daily Resort fee charged for unknown services.Although based in a central Hawaii Location, it is a sad reflection of such a beautiful Island. Would never recommend this place to anyone.

This was my first stay in Hawaii and we chose this hotel on the recommendation from a family member but completely based on location. She hadn't stayed here and knew nothing about the accommodation but said it was in a good spot. She was right about that! It was in the perfect central location, only a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach and HEAPS of restaurants, bars and supermarkets. The room was super average - clean but old and worn, outdated decor but good enough just for sleeping! We weren't in the room much except for night time. The day staff behind the front desk weren't great - but this was probably due to them always being busy, which is understandable. I have worked front office in a hotel before and understand it gets frustrating having so many people in front of you at one time but they really let it show that they weren't happy. There was one day were I tripped out the front of the hotel and split my leg open quite badly, my travel buddy went and asked the front desk for alcohol wipes and bandages and was told they didn't have a first aid kit (I actually thought they HAD to under law) but nevertheless my friend had to run to the closest supermarket to get the supplies. The afternoon/night staff were AWESOME. I wish I got the names of 2 who were particularly helpful, a girl and guy who worked together a lot, they were always asking how our trip was, giving us recommendations and always had a smile on their faces and said hello every time we came down the lift. Overall it was a good enough experience and definitely prime location! Would probably go somewhere a bit fancier next time (would definitely prefer a hotel with a nicer pool and a fitness centre) but for a budget trip to Waikiki this hotel is good.

Whilst quite dated this hotel does comeUnder the Aqua Hotel Group and the lack of modern decor in the rooms is made up elsewhere. I stayed in a room with an oven as I thought that saving occasionally with eating in maybe the way to go. The room was very tired but had a good size TV, coffee brewer and two fridges. The hotel has extrasWhich you have to pay for daily, these include Beach towels, Internet/WiFi(good speed and available throughout the hotel.There is complimentary coffee and iced lemon water and ice tea in the reception.The hotel is well located I would not personally pay extra for the being able to cook as eating out and buying food in he shops I did not find there t be too much of a gap.

This hotel was so dirty. I noticed crumbs on the floor and dust, which are not so bad, but that made me look closer. The bathroom floor was disgusting and the sink was not too clean either. As we left the next morning I told the desk my room was dirty and needed a cleaning. When we returned later the crumbs and dust were still there. They had left a wet towel in the bathroom so I wiped it lightly across the floor and it obviously was still dirty. They moved us to a different room, which was a nicer room, but still dirty. (After a few days was looking for my slipper under the dust ruffle and found old opened sauce packets!) We were traveling with another couple and there was really no place for us to sit and play cards. The rooms had a stove, but where were you supposed to eat with only one chair in the room? The desk staff was nice, but the cleaning staff should all be fired!

I have trouble walking long distances so had a motorized scooter, the lay out of the property made everything accessible. Also the staff were so helpful from the first phone call to check out. I will definitely stay at the Aqua Ohia on my next vacation in Hawaii.

The rooms were OK and the location was very good but all of the floors in the rooms were very dirty and nothing was done in the 8 days we stayed thei ro improve thie condition. We did enjoy our stay but dodn'tlike the dirty floors

With one night in the city, this was perfect. Besides the price and location advantage, we found the room comfortable and the hotel staff very welcoming and helpful. The 'resort tax' is annoying but I don't think you can find a room in Waikiki without having to pay it. Tourist scam.

Ick. Dirty smelly. Mold popcorn ceilings. Old beat up furniture no amenities. Filthy carpet. Windows so dirty you couldn’t see through them. Noisy neighbors. Bars, porn store and strip club. Needs to be torn down and redeveloped

Friendly staff. Great location - easy walk to shops, food and main strip. Our king bed room is spacious, but my parent’s room with double bed was very tight. Bathrooms could do with renovation. I had a leaking shower. My parent’s room had a smell and they were quick to give them another room.

Filthy!!! Poor smelling. Poor customer service is an understatement. Lack of “make it right” hospitality. Felt the lace wasn’t very safe. Extremely outdated. Needs a huge renovation makeover. Place used to be student housing 2 years ago (reported by locals in the area). Would not recommend this place to anyone. Blood found on floor and mattress. Urine found on mattress, unchanged from previous guest. DON’T STAY HERE!!!

This hotel is perfect for a Hawaiian getaway! My friend and I stayed here for a week this month and loved it. The staff are so friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a perfect location. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were well looked after. The rooms perfect for two people and we managed to get a room on the 16th floor. The hotel room looked just like the pictures and we definitely made use of the pool after spending long days at the beach. Close to everything and tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the beach strip. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Great value for money!

Enjoyable very good location during our stay in Waikiki.Frendly team in front desk specially Katreena Czelica,Yuta.Y. We been from Dec 2016 to Jan 2017 in Ohia and back 2018 for few weeks too.We will be back again .

We didn’t expect too much at this price point, and the Aqua Ohia Waikiki didn’t deliver! Our room was very small, we asked to pay to upgrade, and they only allow for you to stay in the tiniest of rooms with a pet! The pool area feels like a motel, not a lot of atmosphere.We were here during the ballistic middle crisis, and the hotel staff was useless in assisting guests!Great location though, but next time, we’ll stay at The Laylow.

is the best place ever we love every one they are very helpful and we feel like we are home , and we will be back when ever we come to Oahu this is and excellent place , thank you so much ! everyone is wonderful this place is the best

Location was excellent but the rooms were very shabby, old and dated. Bathroom felt like a public restroom and they weren’t cleaned very well. They tried to put 3 of us in a room with a double bed. Wheelchair ramp was so steep it was very difficult to wheel a stroller or your suitcase up it

stay away from this hotel unless you enjoy noise, filth and unsafe surroundings. Photos appearing on website obviously did not belong to this hotel. Completely misleading and disappointing. Will not be back to Oahu or the Aqua Ohia Waikiki

We had a GREAT experience for our first time to to Hawaii. I wouldn't change anything at all. We loved all the extras they offered. Smiling and welcoming faces every day-all day. Free beach/ pool towels, free DVD rental (no extra charges for the service-it's already figured into your fees) and daily freshen up for our room. Parking at additional cost, but so worth it. Easy access to beaches and shopping. Very comfy beds. Our room was upgraded because I signed up for their A-Lister Club and the room was available. We will definitely stay here on our next trip. I reserved on their website and had an easy time scheduling. We are truly not excited to head home. We had a beautiful city view. We reserved from January 17th-24th and arrived a day early and they fit us in without skipping a beat! Awesome!! I can go on and on about how GREAT this place is. Thank You to all the Aqua Ohia Waikiki staff, YOU ROCK AT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

Close to everything very good staff and well worth the money. Food and drinks downstairs good and a fair price. Only blocks to the beach and across the street from center mall.cannel behind hotel half block , corner diner very good and cheap plenty of food. Taco stand on other corner very good too. Star bucks across the street. Rooms are clean and quite.

Checkin time will be 15:00. Do not get there earlier at all! I get there around 10am, waited for 5 hours doing nothing at the lobby without going to the restroom since I had $20,000 valued camera equipments.

Its an OKAY place to stay if youre looking for a central location and somewhere to literally lay your head. Not a place you want to spend much time at though. Pool area is small with no redeeming features.

A very reasonable hotel along the popular khlo avenue, close to All the shops, night clubs and famous Waikiki beach us just stone throw away from the hotel. Shuttle bus provided to famous ala Moana shopping mall.The rooms quite loveable n one cannot complain with very affordable price.Family to single rooms available. Totally recommended
user_name:
wencyn2017
Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: Bad experience. Messed up reservations. Run downed. Expensive for the condition of the place. $160 was ridiculous. Could of stayed somewhere nicer for that price. Was supposed to be closer to $100 a night but apparently our reservations was 2 days not 3 like they told me in the phone. Be careful of parking I heard few people complaining about being over charged when I was at the front desk. But recommend somewhere else.

I love the location since it is close to everything. The price was reasonable but old property. Minutes away from Waikiki beach, free shuttle to Ala Moana mall and back. Friendly staff and very accommodating. Will recommend.

Our overal trip was average. The location was very convenient. The price was reasonable. Cleanliness needs improvement. You basically get what you pay for. The fact that the first room had the stove on when we entered was very concerning.
user_name:
Q2959NBmatthewj
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Was looking for a cheap stay not too far from everything in waikiki and ended up here for a cheap price. Room was good for the price, would recommend staying if you need a cheaper place to stay at not from far from everything.

We stay in a lot of high end hotels, however we are away for 5 weeks on this trip and needed to keep cost down on some of our accommodation. This is not a 5 star hotel, but the service was 5 star. Friendly staff, location 10 min walk to Waikiki beach, make this a perfect place to stay. Yes the rooms are basic, and a little dated but if you plan to spend time in your room, maybe save your money and stay at home!

Comparing it to the other hotels in the area, this was a very adorable hotel. Military gets a discount.Rooms were quite simple, but clean. My sister was annoyed with loud hotel guests on their balconies, but I slept right through it. Free DVD machine much like Red Box in the lobby.

Rooms are a bit dated but the price reflects this, some rooms have kitchens which is rare and a wonderful way to save money for those who want to cook for themselves to control diet or to save money. Families and others will fine the location to be great, one block from beaches and in the heart of Waikiki.

Great location, lackluster service from room service to the front desk. Requested an additional bumper pillow and told no. Really? For a pillow? Also, I wouldn't say it's riddled with roaches, but we've seen dozens in our time here. The walls are thin and the music from the night club below us and a rooster in the mornings has left us sleep deprived. Cleaning service is took our tip, left fresh towels, but didn't clean anything. In it's favor, great location and it's affordable. Just temper your expectations.

A double booking didn't help the situation so were placed in a small box where I had to climb over one bed to get to the balcony. As a gesture to make amends, we were not charged the "resort" fee of $18 per day to get access to wifi and towels. A "resort" fee in a two-star at $190 per night? Pretty rich.

We get to this old hotel to find that our room had been double booked so were placed in a small box where I had to climb over one bed to get to the balcony. As a gesture to make amends, we were not charged the "resort" fee of $18 per day to get access to wifi and towels. A "resort" fee in a two-star at $190 per night? Pretty rich.

Aqua Ohia Waikiki is in a good location. Only a 5 minute walk to the beach. Great for beach and shopping. Hotel is also a reasonable price, which was great We chose this hotel due to availability and location and that the hotel provided rooms with a full Kitchen. Unfortunately, the full Kitchen turn out to be a half kitchenette. Not enough space to cook a meal, oven trays/ were unavailable. This was very disappointing, as we chose Aqua Ohia because they are one of the few hotels in Honolulu that provide this. Lighting in hotel room was terrible. No main light, only very bright light in bathroom area and side lamps at bedside table. Staff were Ok, but were not friendly or welcoming.

You are one block away from beach, Walk out the front door and there are buses, restaurants all around you and even a market place right there not old run down places new and bright lights at night, very happy and felt safe at night

Simply a sham, not the pictured hotel. Not been refurbished in 40 years... It stinks, is noisy, smelly and mouldy. If you have any self respect, you'll not go near this place. Run by dishonest charletons!

Would not recommend until the hotel rooms are renovated, dirty and unsanitary. The rugs, kitchen, windows, bathroom, closets all need to be replaced and upgraded. The doors are hollow, windows so old you can hear everything on the street. Cost us $519 for one night. It was a horrible experience.

Mold, wouldnt walk on floor carpet too many insects, soap scum, dishes coated in greasy film. Very expensive, next to strip joint, not a 3 star property as claimed, close to a dive hotel. I wouldn’t recommend.

durty bathroom and room, room with bugs, staff not polite, resort fees that was not specify on the reservation. Terrible parking with high fee. Good location. Bad experience, never come back to any aqua hotel.

It’s a roof over your head It is very close to Waikiki and had very friendly service not much more. The bathrooms are quite old and our room for six had a king bed and two twins and a rollaway everything was just OK

We were extremely disappointed with this hotel. We had booked a room for the family and had chosen the 3 bed option but when we checked in we were told that this room was not available anymore. We had booked at least 4 months prior. We were then put in a room which should have only accommodated two people but we had 5. Cannot believe that the hotel can just do this without notice. Extremely disappointing stay.

Love the location of the Hotel. Right on the Heart of Waikiki. The locations is so close to the International Market also there are a lot more shopping areas around. The hotel itself was nice and the staff were very friendly.

It's really good location to walk to Waikiki and other shopping area. There are lots of good restaurants nearby. Though it's a little bit noisy during night due to bars. We had to pay for parking fee $25 per day and $18 for amenity fee, and it's worth to pay considering convenient locations. All other things are pretty good with kind staffs.

Hotel is OK, not the most luxurious, but depending upon what you are looking for it provides solidly appointed rooms with all of the necessities. Location is excellent if you are on the go and want to be close to the action, but not necessarily family friendly after dark. (Adult theater next door, gun club and three bars share the block, the human behaviors that go with this are evident) The staff is competent but not extraordinary, not rude but not overly pleasant or helpful. Overall an average to slightly below average experience for the money. (Tons of families with childeren when I visited, so the pool area was like a Disneyland Holiday Inn)

Expected a bit better quality based on the website and some reviews--essentially a 3*. This hotel is about a 2-2.5*. Here are some pros and cons we found:Let's start with the positive:--staff were amazing. Always polite and helpful with anything we asked, from front desk to housekeeping. --location is decent for walking around Waikiki including a short walk to the beach. --shuttle around Waikiki is free and mostly convenient although there are times you may wait longer than it takes to walk. --pool seems to be kept clean although it's cold and fairly small --ice cold water with lemon and cold tea in the lobby. --free DVDs to rent for your rooms Cons:-- fairly dated. Rooms (we had several in our group and all were in the same state) all need updating badly! Paint, carpet, furniture, fixtures, bathrooms. Our bathroom didn't have a door but instead had a pocket/accordion type thing that did not close properly. --Noisy!! We had rooms on both sides of the hotel and both sides could hear traffic, people yelling, noise/music from the bar, and a rooster!--No blackout curtains (not a big deal if you don't sleep in)--King bed is really as midge bigger than a queen. --Resort fee daily for beach chairs and pool towels. At times there were no pool towels and were given white shower towels and even hand towels!!--stained carpets in rooms. So, wouldn't stay here again but if you are aware of the pros and cons then you can make your choices with full knowledge. I'd simply try another area next time.

The room equipments are kind old. Same as the smell of the room. Noses from the other room is kind loud due to the wall material. Bedroom is small, and shower head water power is very less. Most importantly, comforters and sheets made my skin irritate. House keeping team doing a really poor job. I gave tips, however, they only make your bed but not clean the bedroom floor, wipe sink and throw trashes. Over all, low price of the hotel, low quality.

The hotel was okay. Price dropped significantly after we booked. Unfortunately price adjustment was not accommodated by either the hotel or the travel web site where we made the booking. I would rather pay a bit more for somewhere nicer.

This is located on the way to the famous sights so you can easily take the public transportation. If you want perfect clean and cozy place this is not for you but if you want reasonable price, this is for you.

We do this every year as a vacation from no cleaning, sleep late,eat where we want to, play tourist and enjoy the hospitality of the hotel. Our doggie enjoys her stay at the hotel also. The staff always greets us when they see us.

small room with efficient space managemenbt and old fashion charm, management and attendant takes pride of this hotel. great location, situated on non touristy yet quite and down to earth street Kuhio.

I like the location of hotel and my room have a little kitchen. I can cook every day. It is not too far from Hotel to Waikiki beach and there are many restaurants and supermarket near the hotel. It is so convenient to go anywhere

Room is old, bathtub is especially old. Parking is small and limited, but otherwise everything is good. The reception desk is very nice. There are drinks at the first floor to prevent you from dehydration. Free DVD rental is a nice addition.

Our stay with my husband at the hotel was very nice and pleasant. We stayed for 10days and it was so good. it is like 3-5mins away from the class review is the purpose of our trip. The room was comfortable, we had a nice overlooking view in the terrace. The airconditioner was excellent, you can adjust it to low, medium or high and can turn it off for an hour and still the room feels not too warm and I liked that because I have cold intolerance. haha. The elevator is fast even we were at 14th floor. The housekeepers were friendly even the staff in the parking are, they helped us. Thank you Ohia!

This place was good for the price, the room is small, and the walls are somewhat thin as I could hear the neighbors as well as the noise outside which is beyond my control. But overall I had a good stay.

This smelly, mouldy, noisy hotel is deliberately using images from a nearby sister hotel to cover up the fact that it hasn't been refurbished in 40 years! If you are respectable, don't go there! Absolute shame!

As I said "Good location, that all". Old facility rain water leaking at parking garage, very noisy nigt time, unfriendly and unprofessional attitude at night shift front desk.Upon chek out, I saw another guests having trouble at front desk.Sorry, we never comeback this hotel.

A great place. A bit old, so there are some fixtures management could program, but the amenities and services were exactly as advertised and the location-price relation is unbeatable. I had a great time

All good until....the bar man shouted out my room number to the bar staff and other customers. As a single female traveller I was afraid. I thought to let the hotel know in case it made other travellers feel uncomfortable.I emailed the hotel and got reply. My travel agent contacted their wholesaler and still no reply after one month.......very poor customer service.

All was going well with the hotel :-) I was placed on the 5th floor with a balcony out onto the street (could be noisy in the mornings with the bin lorries etc). I had ordered room service on a rainy day. The food was good. The next night I decided to order room service again. I went down to the bar to get a drink and the delivery man shouted out my room number in the bar....as a sinlge traveller I immediately was sacred that people had heard my room number. I left the room at 1am that morning because I couldn't sleep with worry. I was prepared to sit in the foyer to I was collected to be taken to the airport. I emailed the hotel that night while I sat in the foyer and I not no reply. I also informed my travel agent....after one month I got no reply.

Will likely to stay for my nxt Hawaii vacation. Good location to stay. Kris May was prompt in replying email for my reservation. I feel safe even when I reach hotel late at night. Walkable to Ross and the beach. Wonderful!

Please read my review. As I believe it will help future guests have a better understanding of the property. Overall it was a good price for the accommodations. Would have been nice to be warned about the night club downstairs. Did experience some noise.

Our stay was an interesting one. We were travelling for our anniversary. The building was extremely dated, but was particularly cozy. We aren't ones for staying up all night, so our sleep was aided via the use of earplugs, even on the 10th floor. The large sliding glass doors made up one whole wall which allowed all manner of noise in (including several police chases, and even a take-down right outside of our window!!!). Privacy was not an option if you have loud speaking neighbors. There is a view of the beach, but only around several buildings. Shopping options are numerous, if you enjoy spending the money. You have to dig for good food places around the area. Of which we found two. Traffic around the hotel is horrible, so it's much faster to walk or take public transportation for $5 all day from midnight to 3:30am the next day. The hotel provided us a place to stay at the end of the day, of which we're very thankful for, but nothing more.

Frontline staff and Security was friendly and helpful, but the rooms was not what we expected it to be. It did not look anything like the ones advertised. It was small old and the smell just didn't help.
user_name:
peterteiti
Southern Cook Islands, Cook Islands

review_body: I stayed at this hotel 8 nights. Location is awesome! There is so many restaurants, Cafe, International Market Place, Super Market, Convenience Store, bus stop near this hotel.Room is good size but cleanliness is poor...

Very good location near Waikiki Beach. Building and rooms quite old but very clean and large. No good Wi-Fi in the room, and some noises at night on weekends because of a near pub. Beds very comfortable.

Good Location but that is all that it has going for it. Would recommend look some place else.Don't Let the rate make the reason to stay. Any price is too much for what you get!! Staff not friendly / parking small / does not feel safe to stay here.

This place wasn’t too bad. I like that it was close to restaurants and bars. The parking was horrible and the hotel may need renovations. The hallway to the room reminded me of the movie “the shining”

Overall stay was ok. The hotel rooms were old but functioning for what was needed since kitchenette was a good addition. Beds were comfy but lighting could be improved. The lights were all yellowish but luckily we had large windows that brought in natural light. Showers would turn hot or cold suddenly in the middle of use, not sure why. Parking is available but can be limited. It turns to a valet type of service once all spots are taken at night in which you would park and leave your keys with the front desk.

Okay for the price. No valet service noted as asked in question. Room needs lighting and electrical upgrades. Bathroom needing repair and some cosmetic work. Location is good, but it is cheap so don’t expect too much!!

Nice View on Higher Floor with huge lanai. Good bed.Room itself is old and needs to be renewed.Price okay. Location close to beach.Housekeeping sometimes not coordinated. Beach towels and newspaper available.

Overall it was decent. Service was good. People were friendly, the restaurant is good. Rooms need to actually be cleaned, not a cheap price to pay for unclean rooms but was the cheapest hotel available.

I was moved to 3 different rooms before demanding a refund and checking out. I couldn't even stay one night due to the filth. Bed bugs, mold and stains all over the comforter. The first 2 rooms still had wet carpets from "cleaning them" and smelled so strongly of bleach, it burned my eyes. The third room still had spit toothpaste in the sink and bodily fluids (?) On the bed. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Older Hotel and pricey. Loved the location though that was really convenient to our dinner location. The Staff was so efficient and polite... If this place got a good upgrade I would love to come back, also even though I didn't use the range I thought that was great.

No blockout so awake at 5am by bright sunlight - on holiday not good Neat with remnants of a past era kitchen area wasn't clean & smell in corridor from people cooking was off More info on amenities needed

This has been a very disappointing stay at the Aqua Ohia Waikiki. A reservation was made on 11/21/2017 (3 weeks prior to the reservation date), but the agreed upon reservation was not delivered. Upon arriving to Honolulu we visited the property to verify our reservation with the receptionist who confirmed the 2-day stay for two & assured that everything was good to go. Further, on the day of check-in, we called the hotel at 1:00pm to see if we could check-in early, but we were told to call back at 2:00pm. Where the problem lies is that we booked a Studio/Kitchen (400+ sq ft Rm & 2 Dbl beds), but were given a Small Room (Room 790: 200+ sq ft room with one King Size Bed, & partial kitchen—e.g., fridge & Stove). After spending 1 minute in the room we decided to go back downstairs to the receptionist & point out the difference. The hotel's response was to not charge the $18/day resort fee so long we accepted a Standard Room (Room 1492: 2 Dbl Beds & partial kitchen, e.g., Stove/Fridge). Given that the initial charge was for the Studio Room, I expected them to at least refund the price difference of the rooms or waive the $25/day Parking Fee for not being able to give us the room that was confirmed three weeks prior.I called Hotels.com to explore options & was given the "Run Around" with 2 of 3 calls dropping in the process, which further complicated the issue leading to no resolution.Below are photos taken of the reservation room provided versus the expected room.

Comfortable hotel close to the beach , helpful staff , a little bit noisy ( outside noise) , curtains too thin ( bright light inside in the morning ) , information " no smoking even on the balcony " should be pointed out on website.

Before selecting this place you need to sort out three things. How much do want to pay, what level of accomodation and the location. This hotel while dated, is one street back from the main drag and and beach, is close to the international markets and several great eateries, especially the noodle place just down the road which wont miss as there is a never ended queue. You won't get anything for this price or level of accomodation . The staff are all fantastic and friendly. The beds are comfortable, the self contained facilities are ok. Bathrooms need updating, but more then adequate.Book a room on the side away from the night club or up high if you can't as its open from 11-4am.

Booked online after reading mixed reviews but the location and price suited us for 11nights. On arrival early we were greeted by friendly staff checked our bags and then gained our key at 3pm. Room for two was quite small but sufficient the bed was comfortable and we had a balcony overlooking the main strip. Considering we were hardly at home it was purposeful for sleeping washing and dumping all our shopping. The pool was nice and deep and cold on super hot days ALL STAFF we encountered daily were amazing and friendly. You can’t beat the location of this hotel! Bars, shopping food surround the hotel then a quick cut through the international market place And the Cheesecake Factory is the beach. Everything you need is in very close walking distance which saved us money on a car cos we didn’t need one! I do recommend this hotel!!! Loved it!

Staff couldnt be more helpful. Only thing I would change is the $28 extra a day charged we whereby aware of this charge and had to pay an extra $300 that wasn’t expected was in a great location close to everything.

Rooms are dirty, smelly and bathrooms are almost unusable. Location is great, value is ok but the experience is terrible. Pool is shaded and tiny. Housekeeping was hit and miss. Staff were disinterested in customer service.

Not impressed with the extra $18 charge per day for things like "complimentary coffee, water, towels and shuttle to the shops. By definition these things should be complimentary! Rooms were clean and tidy but old and in need of some renovation. Housekeeping and bell service staff were very friendly.

The rooms were is poor condition (dirty carpet, dirty pots/pans in the kitchen, poor house-keeping, poor lighting, lot of noise from from outside). In addition, the bathroom as not comfortable at all to bath. Nothing special inside the room to feel pleasant about the stay. Hidden charges (such as parking and amenities) which were not disclosed during the booking the rooms online. We were told about those charged when we checked in in the hotel at late night.

We decided to stay one night in Waikiki before heading over to the big island. Good thing it was only for one night. Great location, cheap rate, but there are just too many negative to give this a higher rating.It's noisy even at 17th floor. The room is tiny. No room to move even with just a double bed. Yes a double bed for two of us. The room is old and electrical cords are hanging loose. Also the tv is mounted in a way that i'm sure someone had banged their heads on it.

Excellent central location, across the street from International Marketplace “mall”, low cost breakfast $4.95 per person a block away....beach access a block away...rooms were small and dated but clean. Bathroom dated but clean.

Only people who frequent 5 star hotels all the time would complain about this place. I have stayed at every kind of hotel on the island and I see no difference except for the rate (which cant be beat!) size of room (perfect for 2-3) or age of the building. Location is PERFECT! We cooked on the stove many times, place was quaint but perfect for me since I dont spend all my time in the room. If you plan to travel on a budget this is the best place to be! It is worth waiting until check-in time to get a higher floor. 14th was perfect. The view was great day or night and we had a partial ocean view that was unexpected. You pay for what you get and considering the location you are getting the best deal on Oahu! All staff we encountered were professional, efficient and super nice! Will stay again.

Good location but very overpriced for the condition of the rooms. This hotel has very dirty carpets. Shower stalls are old and grimy with holes. Paint is splattered everywhere and in very poor condition. No blackout drapes. Cupboards are old and paint chipped. Lots of nighttime noise from the club below.

Great location in Waikiki, close to everything; few minute walk to the beach and free shuttle to shopping centre. Staff very helpful and friendly and great price. Hotel pool and pool area was very clean and nicely designed. Definitely would recommend.

We received a certificate for a stay there. Everyone was super friendly and always willing to help but the rooms are not as they seem on photos. Prices are cheap but you get what you pay for. Location of hotel is awesome and close to a lot of shops or stores you may need.

This place looks great in pictures, but once you are inside of your room. Everything is old with mildew and funny smell and broken furniture. The hotel needs a facelift; it’s very old. Too bad because it’s in a great location!!

Hotel was in a great location, able to walk to transport, restaurants, shopping centres and beach. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Large rooms the facilities were great the staff were very helpful.

This hotel is good value for the price. The hotel staff are ultra friendly and accommodating. Hotel has free shuttle service to the Ala Moana shopping centre as well. It is located across the road from dukes lane and the new international market place and Norstrom rack. A great location. The only draw back is the noise from the night clubs. In saying that I have stayed in 4 different hotels on many trips to Honolulu and there is always night club noise. Will definitely be a returning customer as I really enjoyed my stay.

The staff are helpful, polite and kind. The bell staff go above and beyond! The accommodations are dated, uncertain, and unsafe. The kitchen was old, chipped and I dared not use the stove. Both the front doors and the patios doors did not lock without special attention that I have not had to pay to any other hotel or condo. The sound in my bedroom 3 floors above the pub was not enough to provide me with a restful nights sleep

The hotel price is reasonable and the location is close to main street.The entry direction for paking lot is bad as the drive in direction is not align with the road.It is super difficult to use the parking lot.

I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights to attend a conference at the Convention Center. The location is really fabulous: near the International Marketplace, shopping, restaurants, bars, cafes for coffee, the Ala Wai Canal, and just a block from Waikiki. I walked to the Convention Center in 20 minutes. A walk to the Zoo takes about 30 minutes. My room was clean and the WiFi worked well there. But in my daughter's room across the hall the WiFi did not work. There seems to be kitchenettes in almost every room. The water pressure and temperature in the shower was great. The reason I feel that staff needs safety training is because of the following, and yes, I have informed the hotel management about how I feel about this incident:The fire alarm for the entire building went off at about 4:30 PM on the 2nd day of my stay. It was a false alarm set off accidentally by a maintenance staff person, but guests did not find this out until about 20 minutes later. I understand things happen and I am an able bodied person who was able to run down 11 flights of stairs to calmly evacuate the building. But I encountered another guest who was so frightened by the experience that she was basically in shock. She was staying on the top floor (19th). What was so very wrong with this situation is the total lack of any information being given to guests as they emerged from the outer stairwell as to the false status of the alarm. I had to walk over to and ask a staff member who was just standing holding a clipboard (which is how I surmised she was a staff member) about 15 feet from the exit and chatting nonchalantly with another employee. She really should have been standing right by the exit at the ready as guests emerged to reassure them that there was no real emergency and to APOLOGIZE for the inconvenience and possible anxiety this mistake had caused. I put "apologize" in all caps because not one member of staff ever said they were sorry on behalf of the hotel. Not that employee nor any of the ones in the lobby as guests were coming back into the hotel. It felt as if no one was in charge at the hotel. By the way, no staff member came outside to tell the guests we could go back in. We had to figure that out on our own. In conclusion, it seems that staff have had little to no training in what their roles should be in an actual emergency, and that is a very scary prospect.

The rooms and especially the bathrooms need to be updated. The overall cleanliness of the room was okay, but definitely not the best I've seen in Waikiki considering the price. This hotel is in great need of renovation, it looks as if it's still in the 60's but not in a great way. Location is good and the staff is nice.

Unfortunately this hotel looks much better on various websites photos but not in reality. It is very old and the interior smells everywhere. The rooms' furniture is old but clean. This hotel is in a fairly central location, just 5 min from Waikiki beach and shops.

No hot water, Bugs on table and kitchen, not clean. Maintance came up 2 times. Had to take shower head off if you wanted to take a shower after waiting 3 to 5 minutes. Slider door didn’t close properly

Super old, disgusting bathrooms (like I did not shower in here because the shower floor was black).  Walls, cabinets were chipping. Convenient location but not worth putting up with the small, cramped, dirty rooms.

This is a nice hotel in a great location to walk to the beach, zoo, stores and restaurants. It's great to have a kitchenette in our suite. We would have liked a small sofa or two comfortable chairs to sit in the evening but there was a table and two chairs on the balcony. The bed was comfortable. There was a lot of noise on the street below when the garbage truck and delivery trucks arrived between 6:00-6:30 am. Our room was on a side street but it was a busy one. They do have a pool but we were gone a lot and didn't use it. Try the restaurant called The Street as they have lots of choices.

I chose this hotel for my Hawaii vacation because it was about $500 less than others in the area. Next time, I think I'll just pay more money up front. Organization:This hotel is all over the place. Their website is pretty confusing because there are so many different room rates to choose from. I ended up calling to book. I was told that 1 night deposit would be taken from my card immediately and I would be sent a confirmation email. I never got the email. I called back a few days after booking and someone ended up sending it to me manually. I then noticed a few weeks later that the deposit was never taken from my card. On the email they sent me it says amenity fees are an additional $18/day but on the website in one place it says $25/day and in another place it says $26/day ... again, this hotel is very confusing. The employees also seem to be a little confused. I decided I wanted to check out a day early and the first employee I spoke with told me she "didn't know" the refund procedures. When I finally did check out, I was told I'd get $50 back on my card from the security hold. After a week of not seeing the $50 I called the hotel and the first employee told me my card was over charged by about $40 then the 2nd employee I spoke with said my card was charged the correct amount and I would not be seeing a $50 refund because the hold for incidentals was never taken. Now, its about 2 weeks since I checked out and I still have no clue exactly how much my room cost. Renovations: The pictures posted on their website and the modern feel of the lobby are very deceiving. Everything in the room from the carpet to the toilets needs to be replaced. The rooms are very small. The shower is even smaller and needs to be resurfaced. There's a stove in the room but it seems pretty unnecessary given the size of the room. The pool is also pretty small, but the beach is very close. The balcony was nice but the table out there was full of dirt, grime, and cigarette ashes. Our balcony also overlooked an alley that appeared to be the hangout spot for local bar employees when they got off work. Every night starting at around 3am about 5-10 people would gather in the alley playing music and speaking very loud. It woke us up every night. Despite the negatives there are some nice things about this hotel. Pros:Great location! We walked to the beach and shopping areas. The local bus comes right out front and we were able to take that into downtown Honolulu. Nice staff. When I checked in, the bank put a hold on my card since such a large transaction in Hawaii was out of the norm for me. The employee allowed me to pay cash for my first night until I worked things out with my bank the next morning. If you're a college student or a minimalist, this hotel might work for you. But if you are looking for a nice relaxing vacation but inside and out of the hotel I wouldn't recommend Aqua Ohia. #DoItWhileYouCan

Internet was not stable and no hot water at night time. Hotel location is perfect. Easy to go anywhere. If internet and hot water were not the issues, the price is worth for the value. Wish hotel can fix those problem.

I was really disapointed about the bathroom and the kitchen. Some renovations are needed. It was clean, but old. That's why I wouldn't return. The service was ok but not exceptional. The thing that we appreciated id that they let us park after the check-out time on the day that we left.

Great location for what we had to pay. Extremely polite and helpful staff. We were assigned to a wrong room, I let the staff know and without hesitation, they switched it for us. They were able to cater to all of our requests with extreme politeness. Very good customer service. I will definitely stay in this place again the next time I go to Hawaii.

The employees were very polite and helpful. The room was OK — presented nicely however chair at the desk was stained, overthrows on the bed was stained, the bathroom was DISGUSTING (small hairs everywhere, mold, reaked of bleach, the trash bag was not replaced as there was little bit trash left over. It’s as if they flipped it upside to dump the trash.)

The curtains are terrible they do not block out any sunlight and the beds are very uncomfortable. The bathroom is very old and needs to be upgraded. I hope these comments will be taken seriously as I have spent a fair amount of time filling out this survey.

They are great! Good customer service 100% From when you check in till when you check out you will receive legendary customer service. Will recommend this hotel to anyone looking to relax. They treat you like family.

Ohia Waikiki this hotels is overall a very nice hotel to stay at. Centrally located to various amneties.lots of various scenery to both view and visit. With a very different social life late at night.

This is our 7th visit to Hawaii and due to availability we thought we'd try a new hotel. Aqua Ohia Waikiki not too far from Waikiki Beach, staff pleasant, beautiful views, close to bus stop, restaurants, international market

Checked online price was $99 went in to checkin and they start charging me all this stuff and comes to total of $209 for the room. Not Much to say but thanks for the last time oh by the way front desk crew was awesome.

Was not happy with the malfunction of no hot water in our room. And there was no solution other than being told that we had to run the shower for at least 15 minutes to even see if there was hot water.

As per my heading Omar really did save our entire holiday and experience, everything else was very average. The rooms were very noisy, even at the top levels due to the bars around as there is no double glazing. Booking system is extremely confusing and although we saved some money on rates the amount of trouble we had to go through with the booking manager and the staff at the reception( except for Omar ) who did not communicate just wasn't worth and we will pay extra to stay in a quieter more modern hotel with a proper pool and customer service, sorry

I reserved and paid extra for the Kamaaina room with one king size bed and kitchenette. The room I received had a terrible view two full sized beds. The kitchenette doesn't include a microwave.Kamaaina deal is for locals who live in the state. I felt unappreciated because my room was in poor condition cosmetically, and I had no hot water when I went to take a shower after two hours they got the water working properly. The parking fee per night is insane. $25 per day. I was compensated but when I go to stay somewhere I would rather not have to complain about things.

The room and bathroom were dirty for the whole week. We brought this issue to the hotel staff but nothing changed.The hotel is in a really good location, although there are some local pubs which are really noisy during nights.

This hotel could be a contender to those other great resorts in waikiki but whomever is in charge rather bank on its location than its interior upkeep/update. I understand that the price would change if it were updated but its not surrounded by beauty or desirable neighbors.

We stayed for 7 nights. It was a bit outdated and could do with a good clean. We had read reviews which said pretty much the same thing. However it served the purpose of somewhere we could sleep and shower. It had a pool and free shuttle to A la Moana which were two benefits. The staff were good too! Overall we paid for what we got. Cheap old with some good things.

The Aqua Ohia is situated in the middle of Waikiki. You can walk everywhere and at the same time see most of the scenery of the city. The hotel is not like the Carlton or Marriot but it offers good amenities like DVD movies, beach towels and chairs, Wi-Fi, and my room had a kitchenette. Parking like everywhere is not cheap but I considered a car rental vs. buying tours around he island which it was cheaper than paying for a car and parking.

I stayed at the aqua Ohia from October 28-November 4. I have seen all sort of negative reviews about this hotel , everyone should disregard, this is an excellent cheap hotel.Rooms were a good size, beds extremely comfortable. The cleaning staff were very good. WiFi was accessible, and free, which is a bonus.Parking , yes there is a fee however I have stayed in hotels that did not have parking onsite. Having the parking at the hotel is extremely convenient,The front staff , very friendly.I used the aqua shuttle (free) to get to Ala Moana shopping Centre, staff showed me an app on my phone, a gps tracking system in where the shuttle is! Very convenient.Upon our arrival we had no safe, we went to the Front desk and put a request in and by the time we were back from dinner the safe was in the room ! Very efficient.Okay the bathroom was small. Not that big of a deal. Our shower was clean. Always had fresh soap and shampoo, bathroom comes with a hair dryer. This hotel is right in the middle of everything. Everything is here ! I would highly recommend staying here. And when we return next year I will be staying at this hotel. I wish I would have known about this hotel years ago!! See you next year!

As mentioned, the hotel is a bit older. It could use an upgrade in a few areas (shower, carpet, cabinets, etc). The location was ideal to see what Waikiki has to offer. There are a lot of places within walking distance.

not worth even talking about.has got to be the worst experience that my wife and myself have ever had the misfortune to experience, would never ever reccomend this hotel to anyone else nether alone us ever thinking of coming back to this particular hotel or any other of the aqua hotels,

it was ok. customer service was great. but room was not up to par. did not have any hot water in the room even after calling maintenance twice. location and price was amazing. room could've been cleaner.

The room and the hallway smelled like smoke the furniture was old and ripped and dirty the bathroom was tiny the carpet was filthy when we arrived in the room they were beer caps on the floor .there is a bar below that stays open all night long with an outdoor area where people partied till 6 AM and then a fight broke out and we witnessed a brutal beating It was the worst night sleep I’ve ever had in a hotel I will never go through this website again to book a hotel the pictures were very deceiving the hotel needs to be torn down and rebuilt it’s disgusting

The location and price are great you are just a couple of quick blocks to the beach and all the shopping you could want is outside your door. The staff is super friendly. Parking runs $25 a night. I didn't find this bad but I'm from a major US city compared to our prices... The kitchen worked ok for us cooking breakfast with a small fridge. I agree with what the majority of the recent reviews state.. needs updating, fresh paint carpet etc. And it isn't even all that clean as I had to move a night stand to plug in an appliance and found wrappers and trash. I think I was an episode of the show "The Profit" where he was trying to help a failing hotel and that was one of his things was the importance of staff cleaning and accountability with cleaning. If you are on a budget and want to be near the Waikiki Beach you can manage with the kind staff. But I was glad our stay at this hotel was short. A little TLC in the rooms would go a long way as you have a good location.

We booked 7 Nights here based on the pictures falsely advertised!!! Must of taken the pictures when it was newly renovated. My partner and I who was suppose to be on a romantic getaway fought the whole time as he hated it so much he couldn't let go on the condition of the hotel. Immediately after we got there we had to fight for not paying parking as it was included in our reservation. We then had to search emails and email the manager our proof. We arrived on our floor and as we entered the hallway to the room, the toxic bleach smell coming from the room was overwhelming. Thinking they may have only just cleaned the room we entered to a grotty room with a bed on an angel because the casters were missing off the front of the bed. Mind you we were in the top paying room. The shower, you could barely lift your arms up without touching the sides, power switches and light fixtures included lamps were all old and falling apart with no actual light in the ceiling to turn on. All décor was extremely out-dated and falling apart. After procrastinating for half an hour or so we decided to call management as the bleach smell was still so bad it was burning my sinus's and making us feel ill. We even offered to even pay more to upgrade and there was no upgrade and was told we will be put in another room. Hours later, we were put in another room with no smell but the condition of the room was still the same and the air conditioner barely worked. You could barely cannot on the internet as well. So poor. For $200 a night this was extremely unacceptable. As this was a non-refundable room there was nothing we could do about it unless we persisted and continued to ruin our time in Waikiki, we wasted more than half a day sorting the room out. We were on the 15th floor and thought we would at least get some quiet sleep, however there was a nightclub located next door that played extremely loud music most nights and it felt like we were on the first floor. When we checked out they then argued the parking again and try to charge us at 4am in the morning on the way to the airport. They did charge us but days later refunded it. When I asked to speak the manager - The manager had resigned...No wonder as so many other complaints were going in when we where in the lobby as well. The pool is basically the size of 2 spas so don't expect to do any laps. The staff however were polite. I've stayed in many hotels and I am definitely not a person to complain but I booked this through flight centre agent who also did nothing about it and thought if I booked it through a travel agent it must be decent. The hotel did not offer any type of compensation nor a personal apology. I will never recommend this to anyone.

This is a perfect place for me to stay. It's close to every place that I want to go. I can't ask for more. Everybody are friendly and all smiles, ready to help. We are happy that we didn't make a mistake in choosing your hotel. At first, we were reluctant to book, but when we experienced the services of your staff, especially the front desk, we found out that we made the right choice. Keep it up.

We arrived Oct 14-21 service was great. Hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Closed to all the fine food, eatery and International market place. Step down the street to local bus service. It will take you all over the Island. Great service front desk and cleaning people. Pool area restaurant and parking garage. Will stay here on my next visit. Great Place to stay.

This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had ata hotel. What we saw on your website was completely different from what we saw when we got there. It is just too bad that we couldn't cancel our reservation after.

Nice property & staff...Beds very comfortable...BUT the Shower was very bad...Because of the shower I had to wear my shoes while showering, it truly grossed me out. We did like the location and the staff was very friendly too. We were given a card for DVD's but didn't know how to use the system in the room, we had to have a worker come to our room to show us how to use it...maybe you could leave instructions in the room for the guests.

Good hotel in walking distance of everything, the service was great very friendly and helpful staff, the carpet in the hallways and the room needed cleaning, and the shower we cleaned but over all it was a very nice stay

We stayed at this property for three nights - we needed something clean, comfortable and a cheaper option - this hotel ticked all the boxes.We arrived around 1030am, and were lucky enough to be able to check in straight away. The receptionist was very friendly and welcoming.Our room was on the 17th floor so provided a great view of the city from our room & balcony.The room was extremely spacious, bed comfortable, room clean, WiFi worked well, air-conditioning good, free movie rental, complimentary beach towels & chairs.The hotel was in close walking distance to the main street and to the beach. The hotel also offers a shuttle to the shopping centre and has a swimming pool.Highly recommend if you need something slightly cheaper than a beachside hotel.

Mahalo this was a very special occasion for us, our 15th year anniversary. I really enjoyed our stay here. My first room was not suitable for me and when I expressed my concerns to the staff they quickly changed my room and made sure I was satisfied! Mahalo

Room had blood stain on bed sheet protector, tv didn’t work, windows rattled constantly. Moved rooms to a horrible smelling room for the night with single beds for me and my wife. Moved again the following day back to a king bed but it again had blood stains all over the mattress. Don’t know how this is safe for customers to stay in. Would recommend this hotel closing down or undergoing major changes to make it safe. To top it all off the manager didn’t even want to come out of their office, right beside the front desk to apologise or deal with the situation at hand, instead they made the poor receptionist go back and forth to deal with it. At least they offered us a full refund but we’ll wait and see if it comes through to our travel agent like they said.

In addition to room rate, $25/night “convenience” fee for:Beach towelsInternet accessNewspaperPhone callsIn-room safeIn-room coffeeTwo stores down from a “gentlemens” club and indoor shooting range. Our balcony offered wonderful views into the squalid lives of the area blue collar’s finest...almost a free sitcom itself.

There used to be super friendly local people at the front desk.. now there is a stone faced Japanese interpreter and a manager who looks looked like she was covering someone's shift and not happy about it. I stayed there 6 times this year and this was the only time i felt like an imposition instead id a customer. Check in was awful and hoped check out would be friendlier but I was sadly mistaken.

My travel agent booked this hotel for me cause I was unfamiliar with Waikiki. Here are my takeaways of this hotel. My negatives were room looked old and bathroom was small. The amenities fee of 18 dollars per night was ridiculous as this only gets you towels and Wi-Fi and small pool. And the parking fee of 25 dollars a night was insane. I was staying 7 nights which would have been 175.00 dollars. There is street parking if you don't mind riding around looking for it and walking a little. Street Parking is free from 6pm at night till 7 am the next day and free on the weekends. I was lucky to find street parking on 5 nights for the total meter cost of 10.00 dollars as opposed to the 125.00 I would have spent if I parked in their lot. Also they have no business center with a computer so if you don't have a portable device you have no access to the internet. I did not bring my device and had my itinerary on it so I had to call my agent for my schedule not easy when her time zone was 6 hours later then mine. Had to get up a 4am Hawaii time to reach her. Also had to call some places to confirm reservations cause I could not print out my receipts that were also on my computer. Also maid service was not to good, was supposed to get new bed sheets after 3 days there but came back that night and bed was not even made and no change of towels had to call maid to fix this. My positives were the front desk staff were friendly and courteous. Since I could not print directions I had to get them verbally from front desk person. The directions were right on the money. The price per night was reasonable except for the amenities fee and parking. Also close to shopping and restaurants If your plan is only to sleep and shower here and do not care what you room looks like then this may be for you. I would only stay there again if there was no other vacancies.

I will NEVER stay with at this hotel again. For $20 more, I could have stayed at a much better hotel with better customer service. Our room was not worth the $95 plus all of the fees (which at $43 is ridiculous). Our room was located outside of the main building (#1689), our sliding door to the lanai had no seals so the wind kept whistling in, making it a sleepless and hot night since the ac kept escaping. The bathroom was so small my husband could barely fit, and the water in the shower got only luke warm. When notified, we were told it would be taken cared of, it was not. When told about how uncomfortable the room was were told that's the kama'aina room, and that's the discounted price. Since it was too late to cancel and go to a different hotel, we endured it. However, we will never be back, and we have advised family and friends to spend the extra money and get a hotel with warm customer services and better rooms!

Very good value for my money, Nice room, good housekeeping , good stores and restaurants in the vicinity ..Staff was very friendly , service very good ,The location is problematic , very loud , noisy at night .I had to use ear plugs to get decent sleep because of the extremely noisy night club or whatever establishment it is next door..

First impressions were poor. We checked in to an extra $100 Bill for parking and convenience fees (totally changed my budget and meant I didn't get to go scuba diving, settled for snorkeling) and a room that smelled strongly of mildew. The big positive was their bell hop staff. He really focuses on watching the guests and assisting whenever possible.

Location is great as it is close to everything. If you need somewhere just to crash it could be ok. But overall not overly happy. The staff were lovely to deal with in general. Reception is nice and fresh, obviously had an overhaul, but that is where it stops. The room smelt musty like there is mould growing and the air conditioning doesn't really cool the room that well. The curtains in the room are so thin they may as well be taken down, the listing doesn't say they are blackout but still. I hung a blanket over the curtains to try and block the light too but that wasn't much thicker. my room also faced a night club located right next door which cranked on to some time between 2-3am depending on the day. I used my coffee on the first day and it wasn't replenished after that either. I'll be staying elsewhere next time I go to Waikiki

Building Maintenance and room amenities could improve, great location, friendly staff, elite concierge was very helpful, close to the reassurance and beach, public transport was right in front of the hotel which was great

This hotel is good value for the money but don’t expect the ritz, staff are very friendly and helpful, and even gave us extra coffee when we asked for it, location is very good, parking can be a bit tricky at first a little hard to find all in all we had a good experience.

Hotel found in the heart of Waikiki. Convenient for moving around for visitors without car. Comfortable beds. Bathrooms could use a bit of upgradation specially on lower floors. Tour booking desk in the lobby was very helpful in deciding and arranging on activities priority, specially if you have limited time on the island.

it's in a convenient location to everything. I rode the city bus everywhere so was easy to catch buses within a block of the hotel. The beach is a few blocks walk. All the shopping you wanna do is within a few blocks of walking. restaurants are everywhere, the one next to the hotel is nice and I ate there several times during my stay. It was a fairly clean hotel, housecleaning left our door cracked open all day while we were gone one of the days so luckily no-one came in and helped themselves to our things. this was one of the least expensive options in Waikiki so we went with it. It was about what we expected it to be.

Friday night the party street noise was very loud and had to sleep with ear plugs in. Shower floor in our room was worn out and looked dirty because of them just painting the tile trying to give it an up dated appearance. Staff was friendly and helpful. Never going back to Hawaii TOO hot and humid for us. Too many homeless people and they ask for money all the time. Away from the city was okay, driving around to see the lush areas of the island. My opinion is the whole place is over rated.

Great Hotel and great Location, as the beginning that we arrived, we felt the hospitality of the place. Very comfortable beds, the kitchen was clean and good functional. Everything was great, congratulations to all. I will recomended the hotel to my friends.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the last night of our holiday as it was cheap and allowed us to get to the airport for an early morning flight.The check-in process took a little longer then most hotels, however the front-desk staff were friendly. We were directed to our room which was "outside the fire exit door at the end of the hallway". After a ride in the tiny elevator we walked down the hallway where we could hear voices through every door! Opening the fire exit we found our room...and a pile of dirty linen bags. Great!Upon entering the room we were greeted with original 60's furniture and carpet. The room felt as though it had been cleaned in about 2 minutes. There was still garbage in a bag under the kitchen sink and hairs on the shower wall.Some of the high(low) lights are summarised below:- The door to the balcony whisteled every time there was a slight gust- The bathroom vanity was rotten and mouldy and painted over- The mattress was very squeeky and old- The kitchen has water damaged that has been siliconed up- Vinyl stuck in base of shower to cover cracked tiles was loose and slimy- Shower head was ridiculously noisy and had to yell to my wife who was on the other side of the shower curtain- No hot water, staff told me they were "sorry the place is ghetto" and were helpful- TV is blurry- Noisy AC, with no temp control, only fan speed- Could hear noisy plumbing all night- $18 resort fee is steep for this 2 star hotel from the 60'sThis hotel has friendly staff who obviously put up with annoyed/dissapointed customers on a daily basis. If you can only afford to stay here, dont even bother going to Waikiki.**I divulged this review to the hotel upon checkout. I requested an email for management, which was unable to be provided. I requested the email from the hotels website directly and have not been contacted.**

Well, this hotel is in a good location. It is across the street from the international Market place. There are a few markets and food places nearby. There is a Ross on Seaside Ave which is open until 1am, just in case you need anything. There is a club place nearby which can get noisy on a weekend night. So, there will be noise after hours and if you need the sleep. There is a free DVD rental - one at a time. There is free coffee in the morning and tea all day long. I call it shots because the cups are 2oz size. The lobby is small inside but it's okay and clean. There are beach towels to rent to use for the pool free. So far, it's a decent place to stay, nothing fancy.

Nice place. Some problems though. No place to park upon check-in, no microwave, parking on-site is expensive. On the other hand. Very nice location to all the local shops and beach. I suggest cab until check-in then rental car. Trust me. I parked on the sidewalk and hoped it wasn't towed away.

If you're looking for a budget friendly, clean and tidy hotel with friendly staff in an absolute central location then this is the accomodation for you. Rooms on the higher floors are best, with peeks of ocean views, gorgeous city views and large balconies to enjoy the sunny days and balmy nights. A very pleasurable stay.

Our stay at the hotel was pleasant. Rooms were comfortable, the only small issue I had there was the AC in our room wasn’t very cold. Called maintanance and was told the tempouture was due to being on the top floor, was offered a room exchange but felt it was not needed. Would stay there again.

Stayed here over night due to a flight change. Very nice staff. Friendly and helpful. A bit old on the inside but the rooms were clean. The shower was a bit small. It was a good place to lay our head.

Noisey rooms and outdated kitchen and bathroom. Bad lighting. Not enough staff on front desk. Pool dirty. Poor lighting in rooms. Smelly noisey cramped parking. Location was good. Nothing else good to say.

It would be nice if the both room was more clean and comfortable.I hope they would send back my jacket which I left over in the room.Even I confirmed it on the phone to the front desk, but it is not realized yet.

Wonderful place to stay. Great staff. Good location. Nice rooms. Good price. Our new go to hotel in Hawaii. Staff make the place. Dripping faucet immediately repaired. Questions answered kindly. Parking available.

Cheap!! Really need to work on making sure the rooms are clean before setting guest in there to stay. Also when guest of 2 are checking in. Ask if they need a single or double beds. Was mad me and my boyfriend had to sleep on a twin bed.

Good overall stay close to the beach close to all the shops. Where a Ohia is is central in Waikiki.It is co for table and the bar people are the nicest people you will find in Waikiki You are able to cook in some rooms so this gives to opportunity to save on some meal costs

This is a great hotel for families on a budget that still want to be right in the heart of Waikiki - close to everything, including beach and yes it's a bit old and tired, but well looked after for its condition with great staff.

Room safes already locked in my room and my sister and brother-in-law's room. No staff had a master key. They had to be drilled out and replaced. Sink was mainly blocked. TV remote packed up. Room not cleaned every day, house-keeping phone not always answered. Initially overcharged on my final bill, which was amended when I pointed out the discrepancy.

We had a great stay within walking distance to the Waikiki beach, bus stop to Pearl Harbor and Diamond Head right across the street, fully equipped kitchen, we could leave our luggage there after checkout and spend more time in the city before going to the airport. Definitely can recommend this place.

Booked this hotel for a few nights for my 10th year wedding anniversary. Pics from website were extremely misleading. I suggest they post true pictures from the hotel and allow the customers the right to choose to accept it's conditions. This caused me to check out of the hotel after the first night and check into one down the street.

No parking while guests checking in. Limited parking space in hotel parking lot. Room not clean, lots of hair along wall of shower when checking in. Can hear people yelling along Kuhio in the middle of the night.Staff was nice and tried to help.

Enjoyed the room and location , close to beach, shopping and shops. Will recommend to my friends,close to most anything that you want to do in Hawaii. I would recommend the hotel have a shuttle for their guest

Good location and pricing. The beach is not across the street but is an easy walk to the beach and everywhere else in the vicinity. Amenities are good: free movies and video games. Certain times out of the day they have cold water in the lobby and coffee in the morning. They have towels you can use at the beach, make sure to bring them back. Beds are sufficient for a good night sleep. Kitchen is a nice option but no microwave - that would make it better. Staff does not problem solve very well so it's best to speak directly to the manager regarding issues. Staff is more "this is how it is take it or leave it". We told the check staff that we planned to use the free shuttle, nothing was mentioned that we needed to obtain a ticket in order to use it. We were stuck at the mall. The shuttle app is difficult to use, to predict when the shuttle will arrive at certain locations. I spoke to the manager who was on that day who helped us get home. FYI carry a the local taxi # with you in case you get stranded.Rooms don't have a view but we did not mind, they kept our room clean & smelling fresh. There is a pool but did not use it. No GYM. There are only 2 slow, old, elevators that are hot during the warm weather, none the less, lucky to have an elevator. Service was marked a 3 of 5 due to the shuttle issue causing great stress.

The location of the hotel is great. So easy to get to the beach, International Market place, shops, buses, Kalakaua Ave etc. The hotel amenities on offer such as the free shuttle service to Ala Moana was even better. With a large family and kids, it made our life so much easier to get there and back. The beach towels, chairs, free DVD rentals was also an added bonus. However, the major downfall of this hotel is simply being so outdated. It REALLY needs a major revamp!! Because the rooms and furnishings are so old and behind the times, unfortunately it really brings the standard down. The rooms don't look and definitely don't feel clean or hygienic at all. It would be impossible to bring the standard up unless a full hotel renovation is done. It's quite disappointing as it has a lot of potential to be such a great hotel. Luckily we were only staying for 2 nights, otherwise I probably would have likely relocated elsewhere.

I felt uncomfortable because of my reservation and other bed, but I was able to help inform and receive information regarding the kind of employee and information.Thank you for the appropriate measure and kindness.

Though old and needing TLC, this hotel's location is PERFECT!!!You walk out of the doorway, you're right smack the tourist area, convenience stores, fast food chains, food markets, bars and other restaurants, and 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach!!!No need to fuss about the room, the decor, the bathroom - you're outdoors the whole day!!! You're only there to sleep and bathe anyways, it's location, location, location.

I was a Timeshare guest. When I checked into my room, there were four old messages on the phone (why did housekeeping not see the light blinking), the sliding door to the balcony didn't open properly, a hinge was off the dresser door, the carpet in front of the fridge was saturated and the chair had a hole in the back. In fairness, within 30 minutes reception staff had arranged for the door and the dresser to be fixed.The decor is tired with several chips off the paint and although the room had two double beds, the only drinking glasses were two small ones in the bathroom.My room backed onto the elevators and they created a droning noise.The pool is very small.There is no bar or restaurant so it's not even a real hotel. A separate bar operates immediately adjacent to reception through double doors but you can't charge back to your room. Its cutlery and plates are of the plastic picnic variety. However, there are heaps of eating & drinking spots of excellent quality close by.A redeeming factor is the staff. All were friendly and very helpful, especially Honey and her friends on the front desk.I'm sorry I can find little to be positive about and hope other parts of this place are better.

If you're looking for privacy or quick check-in, this is not the place. One star because I can't make it zero stars. The only upside is the proximity to a lot of restaurants, souvenir shopping and Honolulu Cookie Company. So let's start from the beginning.. I booked this hotel through booking.com beginning of September for 2 double beds and was quoted $388.32 for 2 nights INCLUDING taxes and resort fee. No mention of parking fee. Okay sure, we're in the middle of the city, $25 a night is worth not having to deal with break-ins or finding parking. One of my travel partners is actively coughing so we decide to ADD a room. It can't be that hard right? As long as you have availability? So I call them at 8am this morning to try to arrange it if possible, otherwise we'll keep our reservation.
