They say they have rooms but the girl I spoke to had no idea what kind of room we have. So she suggests to get there early and try to work it out in person. Fine, I can do that, that's reasonable since it's last minute. Fast forward to 1:30pm, an hour an a half before check-in time. I show up with my group of 3, and try to book an additional room. Omar is helping us. He says we can get an equivalent room with one king bed, and it's just a lot bigger. And we add another standard room for my travel partner. He says it's $288.94 for the additional room for 2 nights. So I put it on my card. We get a receipt, and he says to come back at 3pm. By the way, we signed the agreement, put down our card information, etc. So when we return we should be able to just pick up the key cards and go to our room. 3pm rolls around. The lobby is packed because a bus of tourists are dropped off. We stand in line to wait for the 3 receptionists to get everyone checked in. 20 minutes later, we get to the desk and Honey is taking care of us. Oh surprise! You only made half of the first payment. And the new standard room now has a resort fee and taxes on top of the $288 we JUST paid. So I have no idea what the final total should be. We're 45 minutes now on the 2nd round of checking in, so I'm so frustrated, I just want it to be over. Honey finally gets our room keys ready, I gather all the receipts and promise her I will make sure they are right later after the payments have settled. Not ONE of the charges on any of the receipts is the same. See attached picture. So I will blame their terrible system here, it's not really on the receptionist. BUT the one thing a receptionist should get right? Making sure the room they just assigned you is cleaned and unoccupied. Nope. I use my key on room 280, and run into a poor man in his underwear. Who freaks out and closes the door on me. No words. No goddamn words. If I was a cartoon, you can see the flames from my head. My husband and I go back to the lobby and ask for the manager. We get the supervisor instead who puts us in room 1190. He takes off the $20 resort fee for all the rooms (4), and somehow it comes to $75?? Whatever. After we return from an excursion, we find they have left macadamia candy, cookies and water in our room. A free night might have been better. Additional reasons not to stay here: hotel past the lobby is dated, smells of bleach and chemicals, shower is dirty and looks like a 5 year old did the caulking. And it's over $200 a night. Bed seems to be okay, towels are soft enough, and there's water pressure and hot water. I suppose if you're desperate this will do. But don't be surprised if someone walks in on you while you're undressing.

The location and staff are great, the rooms themselves could really do with a proper overhaul - not just painting over bathroom tiles.The bathrooms felt dirty with visible mold and peeling painted tiles.The rooms were dark with only lamps for light. The lamps were pretty ineffective and you were unable to see well enough to read a book.Curtains on the other hand let too much light in - totally transparent. If on a lower floor it's also extremely noisy with a bar next door.We haven't had much luck choosing accommodation in Waikiki. We've stayed in 3 different 'moderate' hotels and we wouldn't return to any of them unfortunately. We had much better luck with moderates on the US mainland.If going to Waikiki, spend more money and choose a chain. Next time we'll go with Holiday Inn I think.

This hotel is located center of Waikiki. Easy access to renovated New International Market Place and other shopping, eating places.But this hotel is old building. Room is confortable, but it depends on the room. The room I stayed was a one of connecting room. so neighbour soud was very noisy.Except this matter, it was good to stay.

This hotel was a great find in the heart of Waikiki. It was well within our budget with some high quality services. All of the front desk staff were wonderful from check in to check out. Kris was especially friendly! She set us up with a pre-check in procedure and let us know about all of the hotel's features including free wifi in all the rooms (included in resort fee) and the best feature- an unlimited DVD rental kiosk in the lobby to use for the PS3 in each room. So cool! We were able to store our bags with the bell hop so we could go explore Waikiki until the 3pm check in time. We ended up getting a very private room on the 14th floor that was through the emergency exit door. We thought it was a bit odd given that we were so secluded but it was so quiet and private. The only downside is that all of the housekeeping trash was kept outside our room door on the balcony. Other than that- we loved our room. A bit small with a tiny bathroom but it came stocked with dish-ware and a tiny stove for cooking. They even provide beach towels for you to use during your stay. We also loved being able to to see the city from our balcony! Overall or stay was super affordable with amazing customer service. All of the hotel staff was professional and friendly.

Affordable hotel considering its proximity to Waikiki beach access, bus stop, and airport. Friendly staff, beach towel service. However, the hotel rooms itself is VERY run down, leaky shower head, 1 non-functioning power outlet, OLD carpet. Hotel lobby and hotel rooms do not equate. If you're just looking for a cheap, basic, central waikiki place to stay the night, this is ok.

Staff friendly and helpful, Our room was clean but a bit hard to find as it was out through one of the exit doors - signage pointing the way would be helpful. Bathroom very sad looking as was pool area.

Excellent Hotel, service, and staff. They treat everyone with respect and loyalty. We will definitely be back at this hotel because we have 4 children and 2 adults and they excepted us with no excuses.

We had a pleasant stay but still have things to improve. The condition of the carpets in the common areas leaves something to be desired (quite a few tasks). The one in our room also had tasks. Our fridge was leaking, so the carpet was wet.

No problems, fast check in, close to we went to a block party, the mall, red lobster for food, took Uber. Can’t go wrong with this place. We found street parking. The meter takes charge card and it’s free after 6pm an on Sunday

Its very affordable but definitely needs upgrades. Bathroom and carpet and AC needs major work. But it does come with full kitchen which is good if you are staying awhile. Bar and grill downstairs is awesome.

Good place for the price. Will definitely recommend to anyone that's on a budget or just looking for clean and safe place to lay their head while on vacation in Hawaii. Walking distance to the beach was also surprisingly very close.

If you need a place to sleep it's ok, but other than that it's not worth it. When we tried to locate our room, we couldn't find it. Why? Because it was outside on the fire escape. You heard it right! Our room was located outside on the fire escape. Past the private employee service elevator where all the dirty linen and trash it located. That's what we had to look at before getting into our room. On top of that the AC wasn't as cold as we expected it and the sliding door couldn't open. Not staying there again!

You get what you pay for. The hotel was cheap and the room came with everything needed to cook meals in your room. For how much you pay, it's worth it. Not the most updated place and could use some improvements in the rooms but it's cheap and close to everything so it's good. Although while we were staying there someone got shot and killed at the bar next door :(

I was given one rate over the phone, something totally different upon check-in. I'm military PCS'ing off the island so this was just added stress! I cancelled my 2 week reservation. Don't recommend for TLA!

It is a good choice for a night or two in Waikiki. The beach is only 5 minutes away and many shopping and dining facilities are in the vicinity. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to Ala Moana Center as well. If you are on budget and want to spend a night or two in the heart of Waikiki it is a very good choice.

Wifi was at times poor with connection issues more often than not, small bathroom and the functionality made me scratch my head. For somewhere to lay your head this is really all it's good for. Strange that after having the linen changed on the bed the sheet was too small for the bed exposing the mattress protector, did they run out of sheets?

This is our second stay at the Ohio. The staff were friendly - they did their best to accommodate guests. Would like to commend Kristine at the front check in - very nice, friendly and helpful. The hotel room is a little outdated, but the location can't be beat and the hotel has all the amenities you need for a relaxing vacation. All the staff we interacted with were great! We would stay here again.

While this property is in great location it is in need of an update rooms and foyer. Also front entrance needs some work as it is difficult to get your luggage in and out of front door and as there is always heap of guests waiting to checkin needs to be more comfortable seating

The photos on the website are quite misleading. You think you are going to get a standard room, but this is barely a notch above motel. The popcorn ceilings, stained carpets, and peeling paint from the walls and bathrooms really need to be showcased so guests know what to expect.

Staff was very friendly, clean rooms only stayed for one night. Older hotel needs some updating, but did not go to Hawaii to stay in room. Good for sleeping, lobby small and not very accommodating. Would definitely choose another hotel if I had the choice.

The staff are friendly and helpful. We stayed in a double room for 4 people. The beds wouldnt have been any bigger then king singles. The bathrooms are old and dirty. The kitchen doesnt have a microwave. If you are located where we were in the hotel, outside is a local hangout for the drunk partiers up until 5:00am every day.

Don't be put off the bad reviews on this place, those people were probably used to luxury places. Aqua Ohia has been a fantastic place for me to stay for 15 nights while here in the amazing Waikiki area of Honolulu, From the 2am arrival (because of my flight) , check in was fast and easy and was provided everything I needed to know upon check-in including the resort fee. The room was lovely, though there was a few more beds than requested, that didn't bother me as the space was very nice and the area was very clean! The room is cleaned daily in the morning by wonderful housekeeping staff and provides fresh linen, soaps, coffee. Having a kitchenette allowed me to cook my meals and avoid paying high prices at restaurants the closest supermarket is Food Pantry however other great places to shop for food. The resort fee was great as it included free WiFi which is fast and reliable, DVD's and games, coffee, iced water, iced tea, free shuttle service to other Aqua hotels and Ala Moana Center plus more! My experience here has been outstanding their service and attention to detail to making your stay as comfortable as possible. While this isn't a luxury class hotel, it is great for a small family, couple or solo travelers, the rooms need a bit of a refurbishment eventually but is simple, safe, secure and accessible to nearby beaches, parks and tour pickup locations. In humid months, the air con in the room is fantastic and can be adjusted to suit your needs.

The check in process was extremely slow and disorganized. There was no parking available at the hotel so we were given vague instructions about parking at another hotel. The room was outdated, old, and dirty. The shower was so dirty that we waited till he got home to shower. Even for the relatively low price we overpaid for this hotel room.

The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki. The nice reception area does not reflect what the rooms are actually like. I stayed on the 5th floor. The bedroom area is fine and has been updated. However, the bathroom and kitchenette were extremely old and in need of renovation. These look like something from the 1960s or 70s There was black mould on the grouting in the shower, taps almost falling off the wall, wonky cupboard doors and peeling shower resurfacing. The kitchenette has cutlery and utensils and an old stove but no microwave. 3 of the exact same cheap prints on walls looked tacky. Lots of loud music coming from a nearby bar/venue all night long made sleep disturbed. If you want to listen to a DJ on the mic in the early hours of the morning this is the place to stay. The view from the balcony of rubble and roof tops was terrible. Remember you will not be able to check in before 3pm no exceptions but they will store your baggage. A/C was good. The resort amenities fee of $18 per day is a rip off and should include at least a basic breakfast. This is definitely no resort. The pool area is absolutely tiny and gets shade in the afternoon so you would be better off using the beach. There is good wifi in the rooms. There is also free access to DVDs if you have nothing more interesting to do. There is no gym facilities or fitness centre. At least the reception staff were good. Do your homework and stay elsewhere is my recommendation. I would not stay here again.

wonderful front dssk service. poor housekeeping and room very hot. ac never blew cold. location was perfect. wonderful pool and clean grounds. parking very tight but appreciated the accommodations for parking.

Clean and comfortable, budget friendly with nice staff and excellent location. Nothing fancy but it didn't need to be.The only downside would be that the air con didn't always feel comfortable enough and the building itself could do with a bit of a spruce up, but it was definitely good quality for money.

Great and friendly service. and great deal. car and room package for a sweet low price. Only issue was the WiFi was a little junk at certain times. Other than that everything was excellent and being dab smack in the middle of waikiki is a hug plus.

Wonderful location to walk to shops and beaches. All amenities were in good condition and staff helpful. There was noise that went on into early hours of the morning. I was informed of this before taking room on 5th floor. I can understand how a light sleeper would not be able to sleep on that side and low down. Not an issue for me.

Ohia is in a handy position for the beach and for shops and restaurants.Rooms a little tired, but were clean and with enough space. Only issue was no safe and no electric jug?kettle, just a coffee maker. Get a bit of noise from street below but not to point of being disruptive.

Good Service, great location, everyone is friendly and helpful. Got to watch the filming of Hawaii 5-0 from our balcony. restaurant in hotel is great and has the football and or baseball games on to watch.

I have traveled a lot. All around the world. I am not picky and for a good deal I usually am content with the basics. But this hotel takes basic to a whole new level. More than anything the rooms were not clean. And to charge $18/night extra for a resort fee is an absolute joke. This is no resort. Good location tho!

The rooms are very dated and the bathroom was dirty and old but if you want a cheap place to stay and do not mind the VERY tight quarters well this hotel is for you however you can find much better deals on Homeaway or AIRBNB we stayed in this hotel for one night until the condo we rented was ready but I will never stay at this hotel ever again

Hotel has location in 15 minutes walk from the ocean behind the International Market. I was unlucky to arrive before 3 p.m. and stood in the line three times. I got the room in 11th floor with cockroaches in there, dirty windows, dusty carpet, poor light in the bathroom that makes good room miserable. I had have a kitchenette room but never used.Everything be side this was not bad.

We were charged double for our stay and there were no explaination about the additional charge. Even after calling the hotel multiple times. There was mold in the shower. Besides that, the hotel is in a great location. Within walking distance of many restaurants and shops.

The location was great and would like to stay the next time. The room is to be selected but is suitable for a family with small kids. Just have some difficulty with the parking area limitation but is convinient.

Check in was a bit bumpy. But once rooms where sorted. Found staff pleasant and helpful throughout stay. Great central location to all sites and amenties. Hotel bus service and pick up for trips was good. Tour guides were very knowledgeable which added to the experience.

A very pleasant stay,staff friendly,clean rooms and most of all handy to everything including transport.When we needed anything it was promptly attended to all in all a very pleasant stay that I would recommend to family and friends.

The staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean. Not the best views from the balcony, but a close enough walk to the beach to see the actual thing. The room was small and our beds were switched to 2 doubles instead of the king size we asked for, but that wasn't the end of the world. They provide beach towels, have free movie rental, playstations, and kitchenettes in the rooms

The location was great - walking distance to the beach, shopping, dining.The staff members were very friendly. It is reasonably priced. The hotel room had everything we needed; just needs a little maintenance work done in the bathroom but still clean. I would recommend this hotel to someone if it's there first time.

My twin sister and I decided a long time ago that we wanted to celebrate our 21st birthday in Hawaii! What we didn't know is what we wanted to do when we got there and where we wanted to stay! After some research on hotels in the vicinity of the airport we decided to give the Aqua Ohia Waikiki Hotel a shot and I'm glad we did! The Aqua Ohia Waikiki was everything I expected and more! Everything from the free beverages, free DVD booth, to the free shuttle services, helped to make The Aqua Ohia Waikiki hotel one of the best I've been to! Thanks for a 21st birthday to remember!!!

Comfortable beds, clean public area, free coffee and iced tea in the lobby, great location, good wifi, free shuttle to Alamoana mall, free DVD rentals, free PlayStation in room, Excellent value. Great location.

The location is very good. Especially, this hotel is near by Marukameudon. Then I can take a breakfast easily. I recommend this hotel for many Japanese travelers. Staffs are kindness. espacially the bellman is kindly.

Easy access to shops and restaurants. Although the building is old, the hotel tried to update to current with clean lobby and some amenities that I think are pretty nice. Parking is limited, and it is kind of stressful that I to buss every time and show the parking ticket and wait for the gate to open by the front desk.

the room was decent except their is no bathtub. I liked the fact they have free rental dvd. I liked the lounge area, it looked pleasant. I notice our room wasn't matching what was posted on the website.

Convenient location, good staff, excellent help re: tours, transportation. Rooms not fancy but clean and good beds. If you are okay w an older hotel property and want reasonable rates this is a good choice.

Price is good. Rooms are small and shower is about the size of a postage stamp and not very well maintained. Very hard to get luggage into the hotel. Only room service is from the Bar downstairs. If you like bar food it is fine.

The location was great and staff was so friendly. The bathroom in my room was out of date and not the cleanest. I wore flip flops and it was fine. The staff was helpful in getting places and with answering questions. I would definitely stay again!

Great location and price! Staff very helpful and friendly! Would recommend to everyone for business or leisure. Will definitely stay here again when traveling to Oahu. Love the free shuttle to Ala Moana Mall!

Disaster from the start .. requested early check in,was told room wasn't ready,they let the lobby get jam packed till 3pm when they knew rooms were ready ... housekeeping told us is was vacant even yesterday... carpet was damp by fridge,shower drain clogged... had 3" of water standing by the time I was done with shower,Maintenance was notified..still clogged..moved to another room..ended up being infested with bugs.. they came and sprayed... bugs didn't dieOn a positive note employee Paola was great as was the shuttle

The staff was friendly but the facility was old and poorly maintained. Patch jobs on walls and ceiling were not done well, mold in the bathroom, old faucet sprayed all over the place if you turned it on more than a trickle, etc. should have been much cheaper to stay. We won't stay there again.

We chose this hotel because it was a good price for a large family of 5 like ours. It's also in a good location and lots of shopping is in walking distance. Aqua also has a free shuttle that takes you to other Aqua hotels and the beautiful outdoor mall called Ala Moana. The shuttle runs every half hour which is great. This hotel also had a pool on site which lit up all different colors at night, my kids loved swimming during this time. This hotel needs to be updated the room we stayed in had old elements like the bathroom shower, stained carpets and holes in the chairs. Overall for the price and location it was ok, if you don't plan on being in the room as much it's a good for large families.

Don't let some of these reviews on here fool you. This hotel is amazing. The staff I dealt with upon check in was amazing. Even during my early morning checkout it was amazing. I stayed on the 12th floor in the studio apartment room. Pineapple room.to be exact. The room had all the furnishings you would need for an extended stay. Fridge and stove. Plates. Bowls. Pan and pot. Silverware as well. The soaps and shampoo/conditioner that were provided were Hawaiian tropics and smelled great. The room was spot on clean. Bed was made with fresh linen all around. The bed had a long pillow that said "ALOHA" on it. Was a nice touch. The only problem I saw in the whole room was that they shower curtain had mold at the bottom. But to me that wasn't a big deal. Everything else was clean and smelled great. Plus the price of the room was a bonus and was worth every penny. The hotel is two blocks from public beach access. There are plenty of restaurants within a five minute walk. You can literally walk right across the street and there is a ton of great food right there. There is a gentlemen's club or two a few doors down from the hotel. But if you don't go out late at night you wouldn't even know they were there. Overall this hotel is perfect if you are looking to stay in wakiki and don't want to pay the ridiculous prices for resort hotels. I could stay here for a week and the price would be about ten times lower than other hotels. I cannot say enough about this hotel. I was only here for a night due to an extended layover from my trip back from the Philippines. But I will be coming back and booking this hotel again.

I stayed in this hotel with my son on our recent stay in Oahu. It was in a perfect location, only a couple of blocks from the beach. The room was great much better than i thought it was going to be. Two double beds as requested, which were very comfortable. Plenty of room to move about, great little balcony. Staff were great and always wiling to help. I would definitely stay here again. The little restaurant next door was great for breakfast or there is a McDonald's about a 2min walk away. ABC shop across the street. Would recommend this hotel. We stayed in room 1287. Nice view from the balcony too.

Like how the store are walking distance from the hotel, but most of the time we were out using the car. Came back to the hotel with no parking. Wish i knew before hand that i would have to park on the street then i would have not pay for parking

Lobby looks promising but rooms are old and need quickly renovation. Looks dirty and old. We had bedbugs in our bed. Got bitten! No hot water in shower. Lot of noise from the street. Only plus is the location and friendly staff. Stayed one night.Happy to check in elsewhere.

Pros: Location!, price (when there's specials) amenities (DVD rentals, shuttle to Ala Moana, free wifi, not an overcrowded hotel. Cons: Room wasn't cleaned (hair in sheets and it smelled like body odor), paper thin walls, could here outside noise

We stayed at the Aqua Ohia for 1 night. Not as expensive as some of the larger chain hotels, but quite central to most things. 2 blocks from the beach. This hotel, once past reception, looks more like a dodgy 80's style hotel, seen in cheap porno's, or old style Hawaii 5-0!The room was old fashioned, the walls of the tiled shower were painted and peeling, the carpets worn thread bare, doors falling off, wardrobes that stuck, thin see-through curtains that didn't block the light, no lock on the sliding door to the patio (wished I'd taken a photo of the screw that was shoved there instead), and the noise! Paper thin walls and street noise to make one imagine you were sleeping in an alley. And we were even on 8th floor. We won't be staying again.

It was a nice and simple place to stay if your looking to stay in budget. The parking is terrible super tight and not a lot to park in. The room is small not slot of room to walk around. The beds made me itch and had serval bites all over my body.

Bathrooms are a disgrace and need urgent renovations. Plastic contact on the floor of the shower was lifting and dangerous. We needed maintenance for leaking shower, dripping shower head.Central location, good room size, a bit noisy. Plenty of eateries nearby. Easy walk to the beaches and shops.If you have a family, I imagine the free DVD rentals included would be a bonus.Small pool and not much sun except early morning.Laundry facilities onsite.Locks on balcony doors are not easy to lock.
user_name:
Sally H
Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Was awesome to come out of the hotel and be right on a busy street, with many restaurants and shopping available, the kids loved the city. The rooms were small for us, but we managed as we were only there for a few days. Would use this hotel again if we were to stay close by the action. Beach towels being provided is a big plus, you can trade them in and get clean ones when they are wet or dirty. We booked a tour and they picked us up right outside the door, which was very convenient.

Nice hotel, excellent location, poor housekeeping service, and poor costumer care attention. Small rooms, not week isolated, i was at 14th level and there was a guy singing on the street who I could see it clearly. Need so many improvements.

Overall, I'd rate the hotel a 1 out of 5. The bathroom was falling apart, the vinyl in the shower was peeling off and the layer of paint on the counter was also chipped and peeling. There was also pee stains on the toilet which was disgusting. The sliding door and curtain Did nothing to block out the noise from outside and the hotel is located in a busy area with another hotel across the street and that hotel always played house music that could be heard from inside the room.

We were there Aug 3-8. Thought the room would be bigger and would be able to cook dinners. Just felt it was misleading. For not being in room all day it was fine but room should be bigger with a kitchen and there was no table.

Staff were busy most oof the time so the wait to get and return towels was often long. The bathrooms could do with some paint as they look a bit sad and dirty. A small table o the balcony would be helpful given you have cooking facilities but no where to sit and eat. Fix those mall tings and the property becomes value for money. It would be nice to offer return customers a discount or incentive of some sort.

The hotel website would have you believe that the hotel is a full service modern hotel. This is not the case. The rooms are very dated and in need of work. The curtains are very thin, allowing the bright sun to come through in the morning. The WiFi is not very good at all. Had a very weak signal. The onsite pub that served breakfast did so on plastic plates. Not at all what I was expecting.I was supposed to be on a pre-paid reservation, but found out that they didn't charge me properly and the resort fees had not been waived as I was told. Thankfully management honoured that request.Overall, over priced and not really worth what I paid.

The resort is a rundown dump in a good location. Insects everywhere in the rooms (not bed bugs but still...), poorly done repairs, and just generally not clean. Rooms are very noisy from outside traffic and the window coverings provide no privacy. There are much better deals out there.

Great little apartment with a kitchen and a great location. The staff was very nice and the food prices are very reasonable. The pool is very small and the grounds are very small so there is no areas around the property.

Hotel was in a great location and the price was just right. Hotel staffing was great, a little congestion in the lobby when arrivals come in but overall check in process was quick and great. Staffing is nice as well. The bathrooms can be kept up a little more.

This was the most ridiculous stay I have ever experienced in any resort. There was no parking available because THE RESORT's garage is on first come first served. In other words, there is not t enough parking spaces for every quest. I had to pay $35 per parking per entrance at a another resort's garage more than 3 blocks away from my resort (every time you exited it was $35. That was a $120 for a day and a half of parking, plus an additional $36 dollars resort handling fee. Towels were limited and no coffee in the room.what was supposed to be a $369 dollar stay turned into over $525 for a day and a half stay. Sure everyone knows parking is a premium, but your guest should be able to park in their own resort (no exceptions). There wasn't a loading zone.

The room felt very cramped. Bathroom was also very small. Toaster didn't work and it never got replaced. The lobby was tight. Service was average. Location was good, close to everything. Kids enjoyed the pool, but it was also small. Got crowded fast.

Wet shower mat, visible dirt on bath towels & wash cloth. Old coffee filter in coffee maker. I could go on & on. Located in a seedy part of Waikiki right next to some dive bars. Not worth it for the money!

Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location with wonderful staff, truly went above and beyond to help make our stay memorable, and helped us out of a sticky situation. Could not of asked for more from a hotel

I will definitely be returning to this hotel. Great staff , location and value for money. Free shuttle service was also a bonus. I had a room with a fridge and cooking facilities which was great so that I could have a few meals in my room as I have fairly specific diet needs.

Great hospitality - staff were friendly and very helpful. The location was wonderful - we were close to shopping areas and several dining choices. Our room was clean and reasonably priced. We recommend Aqua Ohia to our family and friends.

STAFF COULD NOT DIFFERENTIATE THE SIZE OF BED from KING SIZE TO FULL BED! Front Desk Staff unfriendly and no available manager or supervisor to resolve issues! Bathroom is too small and doesn't have a sink and mirror inside!!!!

Bathroom smelled awful. Check in was a nightmare. Sent a security guard to fix tv and wasn't able to actually fix it. Overall it was an awful experience. I felt horrible that my dad had to deal with this place and that I booked it for him. Would never recommend.

Had stayed here back in 2016 for my birthday, great service and had a great room. Staying here again and Anna the conceirge is really a great help. Had some trouble with a room that we had booked and they resolved it instantly (Room was clean, just had a weird smell to it). Great service and would be coming back. Gotta come back next year.

I believe that your hotel does need an upgrade. The bathroom door handle is ready to fall off. Their was a clump of hair in the back of the bathroom door. You needed to run the hot water from the kitchen sink to the bathroom sink and the shower and not only that we ran it for 30 min. I called down to the front desk and Tim told me that it does take a while, but it will get hot.They ran out of towels. I called to have more additional bath towels and he told me he was sorry, but he had no more to give. He did give us 4 hand towels to dry with.The beds are really hard it made my back hurt where it was hard to walk the next day. It is nice to have a kitchen in the room, but it would be nice to have a light above the sink instead of turning on the big light. Just a suggestion oh and also a larger trash can for larger items that needs to be thrown away. Lucky we had a larger bag to place the trash in. And in the shower maybe place some type of holder for our wash cloth or even the amenities on the shower floor.I did ask for a late checkout and it took them until we were ready to checkout to tell us oh don't you need a 1 pm. We were already packed and the bags were In the car. No matter where we stay we always pickup our room and strip the room and yes we leave a tip. Another thing is my mom had eye surgery and so she was resting and the housekeeper came and she only knocked once and didn't even announce who she was and walked in. That's not a good thing. We both are also housekeepers and we all know you knock twice with announcing who you are then slowly open the door. I did ask if you offer medical stays and they just ignored what I was asking. I'm not to sure if you do, but it would have been helpful. Communication is always the number one key.

After a week in Kauai, we decide to extend our stay in Waikiki and found Aqua Ohia Waikiki last minute at a good price. There was a science convention and everything was booked. Nice value and close to everything in waikiki.

Unfortunately I got deceived by the reviews and pictures I saw online. I was very upset at myself when I arrived at the hotel and noticed the BIG mistake I had made booking this hotel. The room, the hallway and even the elevator was nasty!!!!!If cleanliness is important to you DON'T STAY at this place. I called Hilton at the same moment and five minutes later I was out of that nightmare. NEVER AGAIN!!!

This place is great if youre not planning on staying too long. Rooms are comfortable, and very clean. Housekeeping staff stops by often to make sure you have everything you need. Hotel on a busy street but also close to many shops, restaurants, and just a very short walk to the beach.

Room was very clean but in need of updating. Could not change room from street side and on front of hotel due to being sold out, although the "vacancy" sign was lit -- even two hours after telling desk clerk. Friendly staff.

Turns out Hotel charged me an $18 per day resort fee even though my Hotwire reservation said $10 per day. Hotel would not budge, but hopefully Hotwire will fix this. No attempt for staff to bend a finger. Beds were great, hotel ok for the price and location. Decent place, but lax staff put a huge damper on the taste and experience.

Good location but Rm 989 is dirty carpet wall and got roaches. The noise from bar near hotel bothered me all night so I could not sleep. I paid $290 for this nasty room. I won't stay this hotel either same group hotel.

An enjoyable place to stay, easy to navigate your way around Waikiki from here and close to central pick-ups for tourist activities . Staff are knowledgeable and friendly and efficient in carrying out requests.

Counter Staff very pleasant and helpful. Opted for room with kitchen and it worked out very well.... Room comfortable and relaxing. Evenings after coming back from beach would sit out on Lanai and enjoy the view, breezes and relax. Great way to end day!

Bathroom extremely run down. Pictures on website are not accurate to what you will receive when you go. Very outdated hotel. They made 1 of 2 beds and didn't clean the bathroom. Couldn't get parking at the hotel but they did give us an alternative parking area.

Will not be coming back. Very disappointed that PlayStation wasn't working and maintenance was gone for the night when we did try to use it to watch a DVD. Power also went out the next day for a couple minutes and made the tv inoperable. It was frustrating since the only amenity we were going to use was the PS3 and we were not able to use it. Also tried calling management and haven't received a call back. For the price we paid it was definitely not worth it!

The price advertised on website was not honored upon check in. The reservation booking agent charged more than room was worth. Also, room was dirty. Not worth $287 a night. My family of 4 didn't have enough space in the room.

Very old property, in excellent condition. Location is terrible--right next to a VERY loud strip club, and a very busy street. Deafening noise from the club until 2:00 a.m. and loud street noise (unusually loud) starting at 7:00 a.m. If you don't like sleep and enjoy strip clubs, this is your place! Otherwise look elsewhere! Staff is very friendly and accommodating.

This is an old hotel. There is no parking available. You must use on street parks no that is metered. I would not recommend this place. This place is not in the best of shape. I won't be going there in the future.

We checked in today and while the hotel is very conveniently located, that is about all it has going for it. We reserved a room with two beds since we are two adults and two children. Upon check in, the staff told us they made a mistake and we had a king sized bed, FOUR PEOPLE sleeping in one bed after a 24 hour travel day. The staff was very unaccomodating, when we asked for extra linens, we were housekeeping had left and were offered all of two extra towels to make the hard floor more bearable. Our room was through an EMERGENCY EXIT DOOR which no one told us so after trekking up with all our luggage to the 14th floor, we couldn't find out room (who would think to go through an emergency exit door!?!?!) so we lug all our luggage and two jet lagged kids back downstairs to the lobby to an unapologetic and unhelpful staff who simply said "go through the hep emergency exit door". The staff claims there is no manager on call which is bizarre, the sign outside the hotel says there are Vacancies but when we inquired about getting another room, we we're tol do they are at capacity. Again, very unhelpful and unapologetic staff. We definitely will not be staying here again. Save your money and go somewhere where they will appreciate your business. I have calls in to the general manager, guest service manager, and the president/COO (the numbers are left on the nightstand) so we will see if they call me back to remediate the situation,

Very nice property and friendly staff ready to help with any questions you have. This hotel is convenient to all the shopping stores and beach. I would highly recommend this property to friends and family.

Rooms were clean and nice and cool! Kitchen did the job for us. Staff were amazing!! Always had cold beverages in the lobby! Staff went out of their way to accommodate all our needs when we needed it!

The hotel staff were friendly and attentive, the rooms clean and well maintained, it is centrally located close to amenities and transport, and the hotel supplies it own free shuttle to and from Ala Moana Shopping Centre. I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay and would happy return again.

My bf and I enjoyed our stay. Our room had a great view and for a great price! It has a great location too, in the middle of waikiki. The employees were friendly and very accommodating. Thank you Aqua Ohia for a fun weekend! We will be coming back next month lol.

Nice staff great location good price. Bathroom run down with patches in the shower floor and lots of roaches. Grossed my wife and mother out. On the good side there is a playstation in the room with free game and movie rental in lobby. Kids loved this. Walking distance to the beach. Walking distance to shops, lots of places to eat. Waikiki was alot of fun Lots of free things going on, music, hula shows. $5 concerts at the zoo on Wed. Diamond head hike 2 to 3 miles away.

The price is too high for what is is. It's old and a bit run down the carpets are horrible. The beds though are great! They didn't price match when I got there saw a bit better price on their website, asked for it , they stayed no, I don't think that was nice since it was the same day I called and made reservations .

This is my review of your site. I would appreciate it if you would please read my comments and take it to heart. I had a good experience and would recommend your hotel to my family and friends. Please read this.

This hotel certainly shows its age and management's neglect. The room was large, but oddly designed (altered?) because it had some weird doors, a large area with practically no furniture (one armchair) in it and a fully fledged kitchen installation along one wall. Must admit, this kitchen was well equipped as it had enough pots and pans to cook for a crowd. The one bed was big enough to accommodate the two of us. The room was in need of serious re-designing, repairs and a very thorough cleaning.It was also very noisy, one large window opened over the very busy street below with rampaging people till the early hours. Another window opened on a very dirty flat roof. No safe in the room, but a written warning that valuables shouldn't be left in the room, but handed over to the reception.Never mind, we only stayed for one nigth - and it was enough. Not recommended.

Although, there's no beach view, it's till okay, close to the stores of all sorts. The building itself is a little outdated. The people are nice, helpful and courteous. Stayed only for two nights but enjoyed it especially at night, beautiful lights and lots of people.

We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly and our room size was perfect for us. The location was perfect. Everything was close. The staff made our stay comfortable. Our stay was a great one.

The bed was great but the stove area and bathroom were not renovated like the rest of the room. The shower is small and old the tiles were painted over and over. The parking lot was over priced compared to other hotel in the area.

Parking VERY limited and it's possible one may not even get a parking place. Hard to get in and you really have to do some serious maneuvering to get out. You have to use an intercom/camera thing to get a hold of someone to raise the gate to park. I had to get out of my vehicle to use the intercom. Be careful as they are quick to close the gate and could damage your car.Checking in was an eye opener. Building is old like '60s old and I found out later used to be student housing. Got to the room on the 11th floor and it was very dated. Old bed, old carpet, old furniture, pretty much old everything. Railing on lanai was very flimsy, definitely dangerous. After wiggling the rail, we did not go on the lanai again. Very loud music started about 9pm that lasted till midnight was so loud it rattled the sliding door to the lanai. Asked the front desk the "acted" like they never heard of such a thing. Finally one person said it was a gay bar next door.I honestly cannot recommend this hotel. I feel sorry for anyone who stays here and this is their only impression of Hawaii. By the way we live in Hawaii and this is the worst hotel we've ever stayed in Hawaii.

Only bad thing was the curtains because they were so thin. Sun beamed into the room even though curtain was closed. I would recommend black out curtains so you can sleep in. The tv didn't have much stations to watch. I think there was only 12 and a few of them were blurry or fuzzy.

Good hotel with a good location close to Internation Market and other shopping centers.. Only a couple of blocks to the beach. Room was good, with a decent view. Room had stove and fridge but no microwave. Decor a bit dated but acceptable. Staff was helpful, helped line up shuttle to airport.

We selected Ohia Waikiki because of the reasonable kamaaina prices, great location and availability. We enjoyed our family stay in Waikiki and look forward to our next visit. The staff was friendly and professional. We appreciate the hospitality!

Rooms had a weird smell... Not really clean. You need new carpets. One day we came back and only one bed was made and the other one was not made. Trash was left on the floor from our rubbish. It seems like housekeeping was rushed out for something and forgot to finish cleaning our room.

Stayed one night for a flight connection. Priced right for one night with a great location. Close to everything. Hotel was a bit outdated and rundown. Room was ok but cramped.Bathroom was cramped and a bit dirty. Nice balcony with a view. For one night it was ok because we were in the area. Staff was very nice and very helpful. Stored our luggage for the day for our night flight perfectly. Worked out good for not being the best in town.

I drove around town for an hour because the hotel wouldn't let me park in the parking lot until I registered and got a parking pass. There was nowhere to park, it was 11pm and I was not about to walk around town in the dark by myself. I kept calling and the front desk was not very helpful. I finally just parked in the parking lot driveway, called again, and asked if someone could just let me in- I was tired and very upset at this point. Parking was horrible, there were only two spots left and in horrible places/angles that required so many turns. Room smelled awful, like a gas leak although it wasn't, it was nauseating.. room was so hot because the sliding glass door was left open and ac was off. Not happy about a few more things and will not be returning or recommending others to either.

My partner and I stayed at this hotel for the last week. We wanted to be able to afford tours and events during our stay so opted for a cheaper but not the cheapest hotel in Waikiki. It was a good location, offered free shuttle to one of the big shopping centres, 1 free DVD rental per day and complimentary coffee and cold drinks in the reception area. Well the resort fees covered costs of shuttle and wifi but also daily housekeeping, ample supplies of shampoo, shower gel, conditioner and clean towels.The staff were friendly and helpful and the accommodation was acceptable.The beds were comfortable, there were cooking facilities, fridge, tv, ensuite shower, a balcony and good air conditioning.We were on the 14th floor but could still hear the noises from street level some nights. However when we were jet lagged and exhausted we just used ear plugs. All in all it was a good location and we had a good time.

The hotel was simply gross. I do not recommend this place to anyone. The showers were not properly clean, our room smelled like dog, and the beds were incredibly uncomfortable. Also room service never came. We also had to call four times, before we were brought extra towels (We were staying in a room with two double beds and were only given two towels).
user_name:
guest21453
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hotel location good(center of waikiki) and Internation market is next door.Very noisy by night club next the hotel evry night all nightThe hotel facitity is too old (shower, glass window, etc.)No security box.

Extremely noisy location. Expected better kitchen facilities, very cramped and nowhere to put anything. Only one comfortable chair in room which took up too much space. No table on balcony! Close to beach and restaurants which was good.

Great value for the location and added amenities such as the local shuttle, free movies, free wifi. The bed was actually more comfortable than I was expecting for a more budget hotel. Staff were all helpful

The upper floors have great views of the city, mountains and you can also see the ocean a bit. Sitting on the balcony is nice. The staff is very friendly and responsive. They were flexible and always helpful when needed. The beds and covers were clean, the towels were always clean and changed each day, toilet paper is strong (this is rare in the US!). Central location, close to everything (beach, mall, restaurants, food store, market etc). The rooms are a bit outdated and could use a bit of renovation here and there, but nothing is unacceptable. You get what you pay for, this is a fair deal. TV has many channels, and DVDs and video games are also available. I would go back for the price I paid.

My stay was OK for the price the staff were really great the location was good near a lot of good places to eat and not far from the beach the bar next door was good they had reasonable prices I feel like the housekeeping can do a better job they did not change the sheets on my bed daily

Did not live up to what was advertised. If you like night life that goes to 4:00AM and earlier this would be the spot for you. If you didn't too much care about how the hotel looked and its cleanliness then it would work for you. This hotel location worked for us only because of where it was (near the canal and was only a block away from the main street in Waikiki. But downsize to this hotel’s location is it attracted some characters to say the least. There is no exercise room, they charge you for pretty much everything that hotel I stayed provided as a service to its customers, it had no hang out spots to just lay back (Lobby area was a miss), provided NO computer work areas and the pool is really small and always crowded to the point we didn’t bother to use it.

Very reasonable rate, courteous staff, clean an comfortable rooms. This was a last minute booking, fortunate to find great rate during busy season. Staff and management very helpful in type of room and rate from original booking.

Although I thought the building was a little tired looking the location was great. The beds were very comfortable and shower was good. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the price to stay here was very affordable.

Nice location. Clean room, nice kitchenette. Some challenges checking in getting the bed situation we had reserved. They weren't going to help until I provided proof of what we had reserved. Nice lemon water at reception. $25/night to park.

Lovely hotel in 2nd block back from main street of Waikiki. Our bathroom was tired looking and carpet in areas very old. Otherwise staff very friendly and helpful. Affordable accommodation within walking distance to beaches and shops and bus stop.

I checkecked in on April 4 and stayed for days. the staff was very friendly and accomading. General manager Paula Steingrebe was very sweet and professional. The hotel is located coviently in central Waikiki and walking distance to everything. The room was clean with a nice balcony. I don't come to Hawaii to stay in the hotel room, so for me it was everything I needed and very reasonable rates.I will definately come back again. Mahalo to everyone at the hotel for making it a very enjoyable stay !

This hotel is in a great location. Short stroll to the beach. Close to shops and restaurants. Bus stops to attractions right outside. Pool is on the ground floor and only get the morning sun. The hotel is outdated. The carpets could do with an update. Heaps of storage in the room. Also has a kitchenette. Have added a photo of the shower - as I didn't have a problem with the size of it - it could do with a better shower head, it is outdated. Stayed on 7 floor - did hear the outside noise of pubs close when door open and muffled noise at night. I do agree with other reviews on the house keeping- it did seem to be hit and miss. Changing towels was done daily even when towels hung up - but bathroom could have done with a clean daily. And vacuum of the floor daily- especially when going to the beach with sand. The staff are very friendly. Would totally stay here again.

Very good location, great staff very helpful,great pool,24hrs laundry,Room old and small,should be renovated (carpet,the shower),there was no microwave in the kitchen room,Carpet not very clean and wet, internet wifi quite correct

Hotel is run down, but the staff make up with their friendliness and fine spirit of Aloha! Room is outdated, but the location is perfect! Very nice to have a kitchen, made our own ice and hot chocolate, saved on eating out for breakfast. Room is very spacious.

I arrived June 02. The next day, housekeeper was a young guy on the 11th floor.He did bed make-up only. Did Not prepare towels, bath mat. Did Not clean up trash basket .And, did Not put a new coffee pack, which include daily hospitality fee.On the following day, woman-housekeeper did do her job completely.However, the next day, the room was same state as June 03. But, I did not meet the guy on that day.

Great staff and nice high floor view light night lovely and smell beach,, enjoyable seat patio watching the people in other hotel window lol... one is suck in bathroom shower is old mold wall grr.,rr and bed is okat

Upon checking in they automatically assume you are going to pay for there parking which is $25 a day. Charged to bank account. There was old food and beer cans left behind our tv. The A/C was terrible. Requested fans because front desk was not wanting to hear us. They sent the maintenance man who came around 9:30pm. Two burners on stove was non working and people were smoking at pool side. First and last time I stay here!

The location of this hotel is great : near waikiki beach (10 minutes walking) and near the great shopping avenue. The price is correct but the room could have been a little tidier; the bathroom could be redo

Resort fee makes the room $20 more per night. This fee was not disclosed until showing up to check in, and by that point they know you won't turn down a room after a long travel day. The room was ok at best.

The old saying if you can't think of anything nice to say don't say anything at all ,this is what I think of this hotel ,sorry didn't enjoy our stay.Old ,noisy .1 plus the air conditioner works the water was hot, if you can fit in the shower

I've stayed at this hotel twice within 1 year, and can say it's the best value in Waikik at the moment. Is the overall building and room a bit old? Yes. Is it uncomfortable and/or unpleasant? Absolutely not. You can tell the sheets are taken care of and the staff does its best to provide a good conditioned room to guest. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. I was traveling for wedding planning and had lots of boxes to move from my car to the room, and each time the staff went out of their way to help me. Also, the location is top notch. Highly recommend!

I chose this hotel only due to location and price. The entire room needs upgrading - shower door rusted, floor covered in stains and burn holes, fridge rusted along the sides, outdated A/C which sometimes pushed out air that smelled like food, dingy carpet, etc.

Incredibly strong fragrance in the lobby. Made me ill... Shower was incredibly small & awkward. Shower head was awkwardly placed making it difficult to shower. Room was out of date. No microwave in the suite.

The staff was fabulous. Room size was nice. The bathroom (tub and floor) was dirty. Issue was quickly taken care of. Couple blocks from the beach - nice easy walk. Since we were there for 9 days, it was nice having laundry facility on the premises.

Thanks I had a good stay with my family. However the air conditioner wasn't fully working and would randomly shut off. The bathrooms were clean but also had cockroaches in them. But overall the staff made our stay incredibly enjoyable. They're awesome!

Motel in good area , we were on 16th floor so had great view . Carpets very greasy & dirty wouldn't walk on it without shoes , Could hear noise in pipes when people next door had shower & out door furniture was disgusting shredded , rotted , faded belonged in the tip

A beautiful location, hotel and Staff !!!! We had no issue with our check in to our checkout. The price was very competitive and the location was brilliant . We were always greeted politely and the staff were always helpful to our requests. Thank you so much !!!!

Just a relaxation vacation. Stayed in room most of our stay. Good location to shops and restaurants. AC unit wasn't as cold as usual. Movie access is great along with morning and afternoons refreshments . Looking forward for our next stay.

I selected one of the least expensive locations and I now understand why it is one of the least expensive locations. The people were all fabulous, but the hotel was very run down and the room was not clean. I had to fix the patio door so that it would close and latch. We would spend hours without internet service at the hotel, not good when working. If you simply need a place to sleep in Waikiki, two blocks from the beach, this is a cheap way to do it.

We had a great stay at the Aqua Ohia Waikiki! We want to thank Kathy for making our romantic getaway special!! Also to Sarah and Dawn in housekeeping that prepared those wonderful Love Swans that made our room special. Thank you again and we will be back to stay again!

Housekeeping did not once vacuum room or cleaned surfaces. After first day, housekeeping removed all "excess" towels from bathroom and left 1 towel of each size in bathroom (for 1 person). Repeatedly requested additional 2nd toilet paper roll as backup but only once in 7 days did I get already open and 75% used roll of toilet paper. Housekeeping did not once in 7 days change white pillow cases or white bed sheets. Noise from bar across street until midnight made sleep impossible.

Loved the location. As a resident of O'ahu, I was pleased to find a new nightclub and lounge through my stay at this hotel. The staff were very courteous and professional. Parking is indeed a nightmare though. This hotel offers a very small underground facility with only one way in or out. The room was a bit smaller than anticipated, but fair considering the price. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel.

The bed was comfortable. We came in and found hair on the pillow and toilet. I didn't care too much about that. I get it, it's a tough job for housekeeping to clean everything. The main thing that bothered me was the smell and had to open the sliding door to get some air blowing through to help. I feel like the ac vents or something in the room caused me to have green flem that I had to hack up the next morning. I felt so bad that I took a shower and hurried to check out immediately. It's definitely not a room you want to stay in.

We stayed there and loved it. The hotel is very convenient located and not too far from the beach and main bus routes. The front desk stuff was very helpful. Paola was our first contact with the hotel and she was amazing, helping us with all our needs and give us some useful informations during our first part of the staying. Without her out stay would not have been the same. The room was spacious, comfortable bed and the shower had an amazing water pressure.

The hotel location is very good. Apart from that I would recommend spending a little bit extra on your accommodation as we were not overly impressed. House keeping was not all that regular and we had been double booked when we arrived so therefore were not in the correct room. But if u are on a budget and need an average place to stay it's not bad.

There were roaches everywhere including inside the fridge. I'm from Hawaii, so I understand that roaches are just a part of our life here. However, they should not be above the first floor and they should not be in the fridge.

The staff was very nice and the cleanliness of the hotel was also very good. If it wasn't for those factors, I would've rated this place terrible instead of average. I truly appreciated the help from the staff, they truly made my stay that much better!

Hotels in Honolulu are becoming more expensive and with all these resort tax additions which are in my view a ripoff...at least the wifi worked well in my room. Carpets are grubby in the public areas and it looks like an upgrade is necessary. My room 287 was OK,but not worth using the balcony as it overlooked the back yards of some broken down apartments and a bar.Half the curtains were hanging off the rail so it was apparent to me the maintenance people were not doing their job. Using the shower was a dangerous activity as there was no way to manage a constant temperature..one moment cold and then boiling hot- I was jumping in and out of hot and cold water trying to wash myself..the front desk staff were uninterested.

Location was good, service was alright but staff were pretty much to themselves, the hotel in the pictures looked very upscale but in reality was like an old apartment building, leaky pipes, good cookies.

We loved the staff here. they went out of their way to help us out and order transportation, movies and just got us where we needed to be when they said they would. The restaurant food was good and we enjoyed happy hour both nights. our room cleanliness left a lot to be desired though. The bathroom was dirty and gross.

Upon arriving my Wife and I found overwhelmed staff that had to tend to two large Tour Reservations. However, Staff recognized our lengthy wait and apologized for the delay. We had a two(2) week stay and enjoyed our stay in Waikiki. I think there should be more centralized lighting. Rooms should have more soundproofing with double-paned windows. All Staff were extremely warm cordial.

We stayed at the hotel end of April 2017, hotel definitely needs to be renovated. Location is great for Waikiki. The housekeepers were great, especially Connie who took care of our room most of the time during our stay. The other staff members were also friendly and welcoming.

I was happy with the professional standards set by all team members. My room was pleasant and the bed was very comfortable. A good nights sleep is paramount to enjoying each day.Privacy was respected at all times.Check in and Check out were quick and easily managed.Position is excellent to shopping, restaurants and coffee houses and only a few blocks to the beach.

The housekeeping staff were so helpful and willing to go beyond the basics. My regular helpmate, she told me to call her Mari, did such a wonderful job and made my stay so pleasant. I also want to complement the front desk staff for their willingness to help, even in unusual situations. The maintenance staff were quick to respond to any request and very helpful and efficient. While the rooms could do with some updates, the great location and wonderful staff make up for any deficits. We had everything we needed and thanks to the best staff we are loving Waikiki.

This place is totally run down and dirty. We left after one night and really only stars the night due to a late arrival. It was horrible. Filthy!!! I can't believe I was given a recommendation by your staff member Tiana to stay here.

The location is really good, Right in the middle of Waikiki area, close to everything. Rooms are okey but bathroom needs to be upgraded/changed. Service was good. Hotel rates are affordable. We will still consider coming back and stay. But hopefully whenever we come back the bathroom is not the same anymore.

Very pleasant stay for 4 nights, location good, short walk to beach, offer free shuttle to Moana shopping complex. Rooms could do with updating a bit of wear and tear but did not affect our stay what so ever. Staff friendly and helpful

Bathrooms were horrible. Shower was leaking. You could hear every noise from outside and the hallway. Bathroom walls and floor were discussing. Had to wear sandals while in the shower. Woke up to dogs barking both nights.

Had a 4 nights stay in a Studio suite at this very centrally place hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, The furnishing, furniture and equipment in the Studio are in urgent need of upgrade. The higher floors give a chance of ocean views, which is a bonus. Access to shops and restaurants as well as the beach is excellent.

We were here for 4days on vacation. It took almost an hour to check in. Maybe they could have open the other check in computer? Internet connection wss really poor that we couldn't connect at all. Phone not working

The Ohia is a hidden gem, in a great location, and staffed by warm, Aloha friendly staff. The rooms are reasonably priced, clean, and comfortable. It will be my "go to" hotel for all future trips to Honolulu.

Booked a room for a week for visiting relatives and spent quite a bit of time in the room myself. The staff are friendly. The hotel has a great shuttle service to and from the mall. The beds were comfortable and each room had cooking equipment/ utensils/ pots/ cups/ etc. And the hotel is in a great location at a great rate. What more can you ask for? I'd book this hotel for family and friends again in a heartbeat.

My families and I spent two nights at the Aqua Ohia Waikiki for my college graduation. Check in process was fasts and painless, and the staff was very helpful and welcoming upon arrival. The central location of the hotel is a big plus for us. Since driving and parking in Waikiki is so complicated, being able to walk from the hotel to restaurants and malls was very convenient!

One thing I like this hotel is affordable, and accessible to a lot of restaurants and shopping mall. The bus is right there and shuttle bus is also available. You can go to any restaurant nearby without driving your car. Restaurants nearby are also very good.

The reason why this was not brought to the staff's attention was because we didn't fully check through the room until we came back late in the evening.The problems were the terrible state of the bathroom. I can see that the interior shower used to be blue but was painted over completely in white, some of the white paint pealed off revealing the blue tiles.There was hair on the bathroom sink counter, clearly visible on the white dish. There were remnants of roaches on behind the sink faucet. Neither my family or I felt comfortable walking around the bathroom on our bare feet so we actually wore our flip flops in the shower.Our room had a kitchenette, there was old food stuck on the sink catcher. Not sure why there were 2 mini fridges in the room, the one in the kitchenette was working but the one in the TV cabinet was not and it smelled like mildew.The bed was very uncomfortable, we can feel every bed spring digging into our body with every movement. Not to mention the hole in the sheets and the dirty blanket laid on top (there's no comforter, just dirty brown blanket).This hotel is no where near resort quality yet we were charged and $18 Resort Fee.There entire room had layers of paint that accumulated over the years, cracks were everywhere. We had a rather large patio area on the 1st floor but there were debris and cigarette butts everywhere. The view faced boarded up buildings, we had a second window that faced the hotel parking lot.When we asked the front desk for a parking pass ($25/night) he stated that he wasn't sure that there was anymore parking spots. The security guard was there (he was just hanging around the front desk not securing anything) said that there was one spot left the last he checked. But for whatever reason the Front Desk then told us the parking lot was full and that we would need to park at the Skyline hotel down the street for $35 a night!! My husband ended up parking our car on the street 5 blocks away! On his stroll back to the hotel at 11pm, he got solicited by a prostitute, that's how he found out that the strip club was next door.YES there's strip club next door! We barely slept because it was so loud, it was very rowdy outside with partygoers. We were so paranoid that someone would jump the fence and break into the room!We couldn't wake up early enough and high-tail it out the door.One good thing was the daytime front desk staff. They were pleasant and helpful and gave us Early Check-In. We were initially checked into a Single King Bed when I requested 2 Beds on the reservation. They quickly righted the situation and put us in a room with 2 Beds. I asked them at checkout if they had a business center, there isn't one but she was happy to help up check-in our flights online and print out the boarding pass. I used to work in the hotel industry so I know that they did the best they could with what was given to them. Overall, I would never come back.

Staff was rude. Hotel was like a trailer park. Towels was filthy! Icebox was dirty! Dvd player broken! Pool was dirty, Alawai canal is cleaner! The location and online photos is as good as itll ever get!

Great location, decent value, rooms getting old. Staff is wonderful. Free DVD rentals. Close to everything. Be cautious of some noise from neighboring after hours club on the Seaside blvd side of the hotel. Not much of a pools, but is there and clean. A basic place to stay and rest your head while exploring all day.
user_name:
Vincent H
San Jose, United States

review_body: we were on a budget but wanted to be close to the main shopping strip and not far to walk to the beach, this was a good hotel if you don't mind not having a view of the ocean. it was clean and comfortable but rather dated. The staff were friendly and accommodating.

Close to the beach and shops but in a seedy area with a brothel and XXX DVD shop next door. The area is geared up to the Asian clientelle with lots of Korean cuisine and shopping nearby. Most of the guests in the hotel were Korean or Japanese. We were annoyed that many guests were travelling in groups and were very rude and pushy. We were also often woken up by late arrivers or early departers who shouted along the corridors to each other and banged doors and luggage. My daughter even had a stranger enter her room in the middle of the night - using a key!! Would I stay there again? No way. The room furniture and fixtures felt old and tired and it was in an area of town where I didn't feel comfortable, especially at night.

A good location and price considering most of the time we were out and about doing activities. Could not see the point in staying at a 5 star resort since we are not the lounge about type people that need to be waited on hand and foot.... if you need that then go ahead and stay at the Sheraton or Hilton but those places are way over the top for our purposes and besides we would prefer not to be surrounded by a bunch of stuffed shirts.

So we've stayed in Waikiki once or twice a year over the past decade. Love Hawaii. All we need in Waikiki before hitting the other islands is something clean, comfortable, central, mid-range pricing to get some rest. Aqua Ohia ticked all the boxes. Paola S was very accommodating at check-in. We arrived super early at 6.30am, & she was so kind to offer us a double upgrade at no charge so we could get some rest, rather than dropping our bags until 3pm. Great size room (suite with kitchen). King bed (very comfortable). Clean. Great service. Thanks again to Paola. Will be back here & stay again for sure. Have also had similarly good experiences at other Aqua properties in Waikiki (Bamboo & Oasis).

Our room was a little out dated but clean and had everything we needed. It was very conveniently located to shopping the beach and restaurants as well. And the staff was helpful and friendly so who could ask for more.

If you are looking for a place to crash during the night, this hotel will suffice. The quality of the room is compatible with a motel from the mainland, and not the best ones, so do not expect too much. The location is good to get to the beach by foot (~10 min), and the main reason to go to the hotel is price - one of the cheapest options.

Clean room. Street noise too loud, even from the twelfth floor. Great to have daily water and ice tea. Everyone pleasant, cookware appears clean and not old. Ice cube tray does not fit in the freezer.

Pleas don't choose this hotel for vacations.Rooms are so bad and Staffs are not nice.I made a reservation of the room with 2 beds and kitchen but I couldn't use the room that I booked.Although I asked changing the room, Staffs just said no rooms.

We had a great stay in this hotel. Near by many things such as beach , shopping stores and all kinds of restaurants. Staff of the hotel were friendly and the rooms were comfortable and clean. They do have a dvd box in the lobby were you can rent for free nice movies

It's a nice spot, when you're really looking to spend more time outside than inside of your hotel. I really enjoyed the proximity of Waikiki Beach, so at any moment I wanted to sneak out to enjoy the sun or go for a swim I knew the beach was right there. 5 minute walk from the hotel. The TV was a little outdated, there isn't much to see, but if you're interested they have DVD rentals that you can access for free at any time, for staying at the hotel. Another thing I really enjoyed is the balcony, I believe every room had one. It was nice to just sit out and enjoy the weather. This place got the job done for me. I barely spent time in the hotel, just to sleep. So this was definitely a great place for that. And it had a kitchen, so in the mornings I could cook something fast for myself, and go.

Room are dated and facilities are old. Shower head is leaking heavily. No dining table is provided while all kitchenware are there. Room service is not good enough. They didn't provide coffee. Bus stop is only 20 meter away. Beach and all other shops are within walking distance. Staff are friendly and helpful.

service was great. I have not more comments. personally, it was a great pleasure to stay at this hotel. I will return next time to this great hotel. Employees are very friendly. Most likely will return next year or before.

We had to go back to Honolulu to bring Aunty back to Nevada with us, so every day we would go and clean out her apartment and pack things up. When we would come and go from the hotel Mathew was always there and greeted us very nicely. Couldn't have found a better place and they treat you like you never left the island.

We got the room through inter-val. It was OK could have been better. The room layout should be different. The room should have a micro-wave oven. The electric range is to close to the curtains, possible fire hazard.

I enjoyed staying at the Aqua ohia Hotel. This was the second Aqua property that I have stayed at.The location was excellent and staff was attentive and responsivs in a timely manner. I plan on staying here again .

Shabby room, holes in desk chair, bathtub needs better recaulking, board by kitchen sink not secured and leaning , bathroom cabinet crooked and leaning, dusty room , walls thin can hear other guests and doors .

It was very good that the hotel let guests borrow beach towels but the reimbursement of $30 USD due to the loss of the towel is a bit stiff. The hotel front desk is available for 24/7, which is good. Overall the service and the location are good but the front desk staff could be a bit more cheerful and volunteer more information for first time tourists.

Should only be used as a place to rest your head at night, if that. Was actually a great location, across the street from the new monstrosity that is the International Marketplace and pretty central to most attractions, public transport, and walkable to the beach. However, being adjacent to loud bars and adult video shops, there was noise going on until about 4am with questionable characters sitting outside the stoop of the hotel whenever we entered or exited. The front desk staff was also fairly incompetent, not knowing how to respond when we asked where to get drinking water at night, and had never explained check-in procedures. On the waiver I explicitly stated and wrote down in all caps that I was not parking at the property but at checkout was charged for 4 days worth of parking and the front desk had the nerve to question why I had requested a copy of the receipt as well. Would absolutely not recommend staying at this property if you plan on enjoying your visit to Oahu.

I came to Waikiki to enjoy the beach, and shopping. This room provided me with enough to enjoy left overs with the stove and fridge, get a good night sleep with my fiancee that had a clean bed to sleep in. It was quite worn down but overall I've been to way worse for double the money in los angeles and so this was a fair room for the low cost. Simple things like the bluray playstation with netflix and hulu in the room and the flat screen tv make the room a little nicer. Also the fridge was slightly larger than the average college apartment fridge so we could fit the tall bottles of water in there and it worked very well. The AC also worked extremely well. All the rooms have balcony's ours had alot of bird poop but with some shoes on you could still sit outside. Be sure to get a floor higher than the 3rd so you have some view. It's worth a few extra bucks. If you plan on walking around and being a tourist the location of this place can't be beat. The city bus stops right in front and it's $2.50 to ride it very cheap. The location is the best as far as I'm concerned even if the rooms are a bit run down. It's right next to one of the top ten restaurants in the U.S the udon noodle place. I ate there nearly every morning and I'm not a noodle guy especially for breakfast but made our mornings awesome there. The beach isn't far and your next door to two small nightclubs which were not overly loud and didn't prevent our sleep. But if you just wanted to hear some jams and have a beer or cocktail you didn't have to walk far. Be sure to ask around don't be afraid to talk to the bus driver and ask them how you get somewhere you can travel most of oahu on the city bus and when you see the fairs for taxi or uber you'll understand why I'm saying take the bus. It stops in front of the hotel. The #2 it's $2.50 to ride bring cash per person and you get 2 connections for free. So We went to the north shore for 2.50 got on at the hotel and returned to the hotel for 2.50 it's fast comes every 15 minutes and doesn't waste time getting somewhere probably the fastest bussing in the U.S that i have every used from new york to LA. There is so much musubi sushi things that are a rice block with a fried spam on top. If you have not been able to have a bowel movement in days eat one otherwise DON'T EVEN TRY A TASTE or you will not have a good time. As there seems to be NO BATHROOMS ANYWHERE that 1 are clean and 2 are not private.

Mostly front desk ladies didn't smile a lot. Some are not accomodating and not even smiling. Paul was great and the other japanese guy and the tall big guy who assist the luggage in a deposit or store room. Maleka the hawaiian lady is nice and appreciative. Above all, it's nice and pleasant. My bathroom and kitchen is old but clean. The hotel is pretty close to all the shopping malls. The beach is more likely 7-10 minutes walk. Tour guide day trip is funny - the great Uncle Mike. :)

I enjoyed the stay in Aqua Ohia Waikiki. Room was spacious and comfortable, personnel was frendly. Everything was OK except of very noisy and busy environment. On the other hand the location and amenities were very good.
