A perfect position, few minutes from the beach, shopping, the city. People in the hotel very very nice and professional. Overall Paola! Who helped us for our marriage. We love you! Thank you again, you are the best.

Maricel Mendez was wonderful. The entire staff was very accommodating. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The amenities were great. The staff had a lot of information about places to go see and do. I look forward to returning again soon.

The staff is nice, the front desk is nice enought. the hotel is older. The bathroom is badly redone. if you are tall it would be hard to use the stall w/o hitting your knee. Just noting. The area is ok. drug dealers on side of hotel. some down and out characters around.

Dear Ohia Management, My husband and I stayed at your hotel for 7 days and we had a very good experience. We stayed at PH 1791 room.We would like to reinforce the good things that we saw there and also we want to tell you the experience that we had that was not that good and also some suggestions to you. Overall, for sure we will be back to your hotel and we highly recommend it to our friends. Positive points:1- Your front desk is great. Everybody there are very friendly and they help us with all our questions. I had a good experience with all especially with Paula, she was amazing. 2- The green program was awesome! I did it and I was very happy to help to be green and they came to change our sheets on Wednesday and everything else I took care. It was great and on the top of that we got a voucher for 5.00 to use at the restaurant at the lobby. It was a great program. Suggestions:1- I would like to have a recycling trash bag in my room because I was cleaning the room and I put all the plastic containers and paper at the regular trash and if I had a recycling bin, I could put it separately from the regular trash and help more the environment. Bad Experience.1- One day before we leave I had a very scare experience at the elevator. I took the elevator around 6:50pm with a gentleman, and after the door closed he looked at me and he asked me here was my husband. I told him that he was at the elevator waiting for me and he looked at me and he said: Did you know that you can disappeared and I can take you anywhere I want? I was so scared and he left at the 14th floor. I went to the 17th floor and I started to cry. Me and my husband went downstairs and we reported what happened and the front desk was waiting for the management to check the video cameras. Luckily on Saturday morning we were preparing to leave and I went to the front desk and I saw the guy again, and I follow him and he had a van parked at Kurio street almost in front of the hotel, I called an employee from the front desk and he came with me and he took a picture of the guy and his van and he asked if he was a guest at the hotel, and he said yes, but the number of the room that he gave did not exist and he gave another room number that matches. He was smelling alcohol on Friday night.2- The second bad experience was with the Shuttle that should be around every 30 to 40 minutes and we were waiting for the driver for an hour. We were tracking him in our phone and he was not following the schedule. I spoke with the front desk and they could not do anything about because they did not have a phone number that they could contact the driver. When the shutter arrived I told the drive that we were waiting for him for 1 hour and he said that I was lying and from this point on, he was very rude.Final observation: Even with this 2 bad experience, we will be back because overall the good experience was much better and bigger than this 2 experience, but we would like to tell you what happened because this way you can know and you can improve this kind of situation. Have a great day from the Adachi’s

Better off staying at the Aston or hotel renew. Really noisy area but somewhat close to nearby attractions like ala Moana. If you want a good location near the beach and great value Hotel renew is what I'd recommend.

Great location and friendly staff although units are a little tired. Ice machine downstairs excellent and free. Very comfortable bed.A couple of things such as a screw poking through a seat and a faulty safe which were both rectified in a day or so. The house keeping left a bit to be desired and had to ask a number of times for toiletries and coffee to be replaced. Our bed not mad on a couple of occasions.

Functional room and super friendly staff but a bit run down and some dirtiness. Good value if on a budget though. Right on the middle of Waikiki, but because the building is older it can be really loud from outside noise!

In the beginning we had a bit trouble checking in, because things were chaotic that day but all the staff & especially the manger handle the situation very well. Got us to our room quickly & after that it was smooth sailing. Have a quite of few things in walking distance, my kids loved the pool & the bed

See through curtain too thin to provide total privacy. Kitchen amenities and bathroom can do with some needed renovations. Stove too old and kitchen amenities need upgrade. Overrated accomodation.The linen sheets were clean and the bed was comfortable,

The hotel is good for the money, it's biggest advantage is the location - really close to all tourists attractions. Personnel is friendly and helpful, rooms are clean. I would recommend it for people who don't expect luxury for the price.

An excellent hotel with friendly and informative staff. We had a room on the 16th floor which was clean and comfortable with a kitchenette. Hotel is within walking distance of shops, restaurants and the beach. Would definitely stay there again.

My partner and I were looking for a place to stay, and every Air BnB was about the same cost as this hotel-- the only benefit to those was saving money by having a kitchen, but we found the studio with kitchen offered here fulfilled all our needs, so we decided it made more sense to go with the hotel option. We were greeted by friendly staff and our room was bright, clean and inviting. The kitchen area was fully stocked with everything we needed to cook (though in truth, given that we were so close to so many amazing restaurants in Waikiki we only used it once for leftovers!) and we felt very at home-- the little welcome package of chocolate, cookies and waters was an especially nice touch! The free DVD rentals was a really cool addition, too. The only way I would notice it wasn't a higher star hotel was because the bathroom hadn't been remodeled and was still a little shabby, but everything else was just lovely and very clean and it was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. We really loved our room and our stay and wouldn't hesitate to come back again.

A great spot in waikiki for a good value money. Frenly staff. Lots of shops and restaurants around. The rooms have everything i need it although the shower is a little small and the lift is very old. I will come back

Good location--walking distance to beach, shopping and transportation. Staff friendly and helpful. Concierge very helpful. Building and furnishings very old and tired--needs lots of renovation and updating. Building seemed clean but with it being so old, it was hard to tell. First room we got had a bathroom so small you could not sit on the toilet but they quickly moved us to a larger room for $20 extra per night. Felt it was pretty pricey for the condition but guess they can get it because of the location.

We always have a blast when we come to Honolulu, it is really awesome to stay at a p[lace where you feel at home, and that is what the Ohia did for us. We had a couple of issues with the room keys not working,and the air conditioner was out for repairs the last three days of our visit. Staff were eager to help by bringing us a fan to bring us some relief. House keeping was very friendly too

i enjoyed my stay and the filipino girl was so sweet! she addressed me as maam and i thought she was so polite. he complimented me on my luggage and was so genuine with her compliments. she also hadd good energy and was really friendly.

Good value, good location, helpful staff. Towels are small in the bathroom. There were arrests made 4 out of 7 nights right outside our hotel. At night, kind of a sketchy area. XXX right next door. The Bus stop is right out front! Beach 2 blocks. Plenty of places to eat close by.

Rooms are not flash but location and shuttle service handy. The staff are very friendly. It's a bit noisy at night at times. You can walk to the main part of Waikiki very easily from here and there's lots if good shops nearby.

I stayed at the Aqua Ohia because of the brand reputation of other Aqua facilities. The location is convenient to Waikiki, downtown, the leisure water front, and the University of Hawaii. Famous beaches and familiar movie spots are within easy walking distance.I was on the 14th floor. That being said I could clearly hear noise, music, talking from the street level below which did impact sleeping as the loudest noises were between 0300 and 0500. This is partly due to the acoustic qualities of the surrounding buildings. Updating the exposed doors and windows to double glazing would significantly cut this down.

From the moment I got there and the time I left, I've never been treated nicer. I liked the bar and stores and restaurants all within walking distance. Parking was horrendous , so I didn't rent a car that was unaccommodating. I had a great time.

I guess to stay on Waikiki and be able to walk to the beach is this place's biggest plus. Otherwise, I would not stay here again.We were booked here through an organization for work. I knew through the TripAdvisor reviews that the place might not be so so.In practically every way, this building needs work. I understand that this is not a luxury hotel, however, It just seemed grimy and in need of some basic repairs. It's just so tired.The light above the door to our room was missing the panel so the bulbs and wires were exposed. The hall carpets need to be cleaned. The elevator carpets need to be cleaned. The room carpets need to be cleaned. Everything in the room has been painted, including the shower tiles, and there is peeling paint in many places. The shower floor (that also has been painted over) just seemed grimy - I wore my flip flops in the shower. The bathroom area is very small especially for two people sharing a room. The room was very small with two double beds. There are few outlets for charging phones, etc. The kitchenette area included a convenient fridge and old and grimy stove. The sliding glass door had a shaky lock on it, but the glass was spotless. The beds were comfortable enough with ok linens. The pillows were about 2 inches thick and were obviously quite old. Thankfully, the AC worked well. The nightclubs in the area are noisy and we could hear them on the 15th floor. The first night there, while just being dropped off at the front door, my husband was asked if he wanted to buy "weed." This was in about the 10 feet from the car to the front door of the hotel. Check in seemed to take quite awhile and they seemed to be unaware of the deal the travel agency made with our room that included breakfast in the place next door, etc. There is an "amenity" or "resort" fee - a ripoff - that included movies (we didn't use) and internet (that should just be included). We were given cards to get beach towels and they seemed to be overly nervous about getting these junky towels back (or they will assess you a $30 fee!) However, all the staff seemed friendly. Our room was cleaned the first morning but mysteriously not cleaned the second day, even when I called in the afternoon and was assured they would get to us. Probably the biggest "pro" about this place is that it is one street away from excellent shopping and the beach. And, as far as places go on Waikiki, it seems to be low priced. Our employer paid for it. If it had been up to me, we would not have stayed here. Just too many red flags in these reviews and they are all true. At one time this might have been a very nice place. It needs a LOT of work.

Was thrilled with this kitchenette in the sky with stunning views west, east, north and south! Also very pleased with recent enhancements such as two elevators vs. the just one elevator in the past. Plus, knocking down the wall to have a glass door to the renovated restaurant next door. Always was in a terrific location in the heart of Waikiki, now so much better inside!

Great Location, nice people, good price:) Close to Ala Moana Mall, it's also close to the Honolulu Zoo. Right down the road from Waikiki Beach. Very welcoming when you first arrive& there's a bar down stairs!

Good location but building is in need of some maintenance. Next to a night club, which gets a little noisey until about 11pm, even as high as the 14th floor. Some partial views of the ocean, but better view of Diamond Head.Staff we dealt with were polite and helpful, but while waiting for the 3 pm checkin they should send the guests next door for drink on the house.

Property very dated and needs modernization. Housekeeping needs improvement: empty trash, replace dirty towels, replace/clean dirty dishes. Centrally located in Waikiki. Parking for check in virtually nonexistent. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff.

I will definitely come back to Aqua Ohia waikiki. It is in a good location and the prices are reasonable. What I like is that there is a free shuttle service to the Ala Moana shopping center. It means that it cut down a lot of inconvenience of finding a bus to go to the Ala Moana shopping center.

Building is old but great location in Waikiki with great restaurants, beach and other amenities within walking distance. Rooms are very basic with no view but the staff are friendly, relaxed and helpful. Stayed here for 1 night for a layover and paid a very reasonable rate. If I stayed for longer I may have sought out a nicer hotel with better view. Bed was comfortable.

Room rates are great, but you get what you paid for. No parking (sucks). Excellent location. Probably will not stay at this hotel ever again, nor will I recommend it to any family or friends. It was just a last minute spur of the moment.

I would recommend staying somewhere else for a few more extra dollars. The location is really noisy and the place is outdated. we had missing items from room and AC seems to be out all the time. ......

The bathroom and toilets looked very old. I mean you pay for what you get right? I liked the staff, they were helpful and knowledgeable. The bed was the best thing about our stay. The cleaning lady came 2 hours before checkout and kept on knocking and knocking and that woke us up(I hated that). Parking costs additional money ($25 USD) and I think that was baloney, I mean we have already paid for the hotel and then amenities, shouldn't parking be covered in those? So at the end of the day, more negative experiences than positive.

The wall of the room is thin so you can hear the next voice.The Chinese want a separate floor so their voices are particularly large.A light is necessary in the shower room.Parking lot is difficult to put in.

What you see on the website is not what you get. I don't know where did they get their pictures from but definitely not in the room where we did stay nor the common areas. the hotel is so outdated and need a serious renovation. We were suppose to stay here for 9 nights but did check out after the first night.

Roaches in the room, kitchen area smelled like bug spray, The night staff stated this was expected with a kitchenette, I definitely didn't agree with that . changed the room for the remainder of my stay but won't visit again

Not recommended for a family type vacation. Pool is small and can get overcrowded. Staff are friendly and courteous. Keep in mind that there are no adjoining rooms and most likely won't get the rooms next to each other let alone be on the same floor. Parking is hard to find especially with suvs. I'd rather be out all day than staying indoors.

Nice and very helpfull staff. We have no operating safe and they change it at once. They helped us make an airport pick up reservation without any bad mood. It is also very nice you have free coffe in the lobby every morning. Also help a lot to get fresh, clean beach towel every day. Location is perfect, a step away Waikiki beach, next to the new Market place.Bad thing: wifi in room is very poor, we were on 11th Floor and we need to get out of the room or down to lobby.As you have at all the major streets wifi Access also at Market place that was not so terrible thing. Afterall expirience : very good

Rooms were small, bathroom shower is super tiny. Rooms don't have blackout curtains and curtains hanging are super thin and don't block out much light. Walls are really thin and you can here everything. Location is great and the bar next door for food and drinks is great

The overall cleanliness of the room was good. The bathroom was outdated, but clean. Great location, and good value for the area. This hotel is perfect if you are planning on being out all day exploring and not expecting to hangout all day in the hotel.

A dated hotel that has been facelifted to be a very comfortable budget hotel. Due to the location it was a bit noisy at night, but still manageable.The shuttle to the mall was a bonus, and the hotel is walking distance to Waikiki shops, restaurants and beaches.

Room was clean. Great view of the city and close to all the shops. Located across the street from International market a shopping center with great restaurants, boutique shops, cultural entertainment, and etc.Maricel, housekeeper, was very nice in taking care of my room. Very nice staff. Good hospitality.Only downfall that I didnt give a 5 star is the internet is really slow on the 17th floor. Great view and quiet from the streets below but good internet speed is necessary when you're on a business trip.

Our stay at this hotel was terrible. We had to change rooms in the middle of the night because there was cockroaches in the cabinets of the kitchen. Also, our safe did not work and when we asked to try and have it fixed, they did absolutely nothing. They gave us a key which did not work. One of the nights they came into the room to leave a paper and cookie because our check out was the next day and they left the door open! Anyone could have came in to steal something. I do not recommend this place at all!

When t comes to the hotel stay it was awkward to to start. The parking lot only allowed one of two of our cars. Other had to park in the street half a mile away. Didn't see any information that only one car was allowed and it's 25$. Check in was easy and now is the strange part. We were going to the 5th floor and we kept looking around and out room couldn't be found. We had to ask a house keeper where the room was. The roo. Was by itself but we had to go through a bright pink exit door. Pretty sure it used to be a storage room. Very awkward room and was warmer then the other because it was completely exposed to the elements. The surrounding area includes the international market place which is a great place to just walk around. I personally would not stay there again.

Parts of this room were quite rundown- the shower was a little dodgy and the cabinets in the kitchenette didn't close that we'll. BUT the bed was super comfy and we loved being close to shops and restaurants on Kuhio. It was a great value for a kitchenette suite in the middle of Waikiki.

Nice small hotel. Our room was not ready when we arrived but staff was friendly and accommodating. The room came with the kitchenette. It seemed to have been recently lightly renovated. The some people in another room complained of small bugs like fruit flies. no such issues in our room. Cleanliness of kitchenette was average. Our room was a missing the microwave and when we told staff they brought us one in about 15 mins. Very nice staff at front desk. Helpful with Wi-Fi issues or assisting us with our self guided tours/ directions. Housekeeping crew friendly. We didn't want our room cleaned everyday when we did get it cleaned - our linen had not been changed. On the last few days housekeeping staff on another floor came to assist staff on our floor and linen/sheets were changed. Bathroom/toilet/shower clean - great job. Waikiki is very beautiful and this hotel is centrally located, close to shops, entertainment, grocery stores, bus, etc. We stayed 7 days.

Friendly and happy to help staff always welcoming and greeting eveytime you enter the lobby! Rooms were old, and had a old smell to them, but still very comfy beds good size room and clean, we left $1-2 tip on our pillow every morning and the house keeping left l us a cute thank you note every moring! internet was really good never had an issue with connecting or speed and location is awesome! Very close to everything so made it easy for us

Mine and my familys stay here was quite enjoyable. Hotel services where excellent and so was our room. The only down fall that our room had was a few of our dishes in the kitchen where still dirty and the kitchen sink leaked but other than that it was an enjoyable stay and we're looking forward to staying at the Aqua Ohia again!

Average hotel, decent for price. Very noisy at night. Lots of partying. Rooms old and tired. Dirty. No microwave in room despite mini kitchen being there. Hood is full of homeless and druggie looking people. Small pool.

Excellent staffs services. Great location. Pool is not so great, but OK to soak, cool water though. Room is not in great condition, usable and location is fantastic. Free shuttle to mall is excellent.
user_name:
Soe L
South San Francisco, California

review_body: good hotel, if not for problem with tv, no problems at all. Oh, the coffee pot has so many buttons and uses, it just would not go on. just put a simple coffee maker in there, no need for all the timing things on it, I don't use mine at home.

It is at a great location since it is right in the middle of Waikiki. It is very convenient as it is close to everything like shops and stores, places to eat, as well as transportation. The bus line is right there on Kuhio Ave. Rates are very affordable.

This was the worst experience I've ever had at a hotel in my life. Staff refused to cancel remainder of stay. Said cockroaches are command to Hawaii and the air conditioning was out of their control. The room furnishings are outdated. I was afraid to open the balcony sliding door as there was evidence from the marks it had been pried open several times before.

Disappointed with what was said over the phone & website what was offered versus what we got. When it was brought to the attention to staff they did nothing but make excuses. Asked to speak to the manager & they never came out or called me back.

Booked to stay here just for a few hours, as I arrived late one night a day before my family who had arranged other accommodation for us all.Check in was friendly and the guy was really helpful and accommodating given I was only staying for a few hours. and leaving early.The car park is quite narrow and small, I rented a Chevy Tahoe for me family and found it a little difficult to maneuver.Also watch out for the driveway when you check in, if you miss it like I did you have to drive around the block because of all the one way streets!The room had two beds and a little kitchenette, view of the back of the city which was ok given my short stay. TV with cable etc, and a desk I could work from for the short time I was there.Bed was comfortable, decor was aged - but it's nice to have a mix of places like this in Honolulu so you aren't paying an arm and a leg.Location is great, right on the main drag - close to shops, clubs and food - short stroll to the beach etc.Would recommend staying here because of the service I received and that I found it to be value for money.

Upon checkin airconditioning throughout the hotel had been broken for a week. Asked for options staff was rude. Only when a student( school trip) was rushed to hospital did anyone do anything about our situation. Terrible

We got there and nobody told us that the a/c was not working. I had to call front desk and ask about it... they said that it would be fix the next day. We were there for a week and the a/c was never fixed. We had to open the sliding just to get air in the room but it was hard to sleep because there was a lot of loud people on the street till 4 in the morning

Perfect for those who want to be in the middle of the action and on a budget, as long as you are not picky about finishing touches. Not a fancy place, but has all you could need and more. Super friendly and professional staff! Plus a restaurant accessible right from the lobby, "The Big Kahuna"has awesome happy hour deals and yummy food!! Also the lobby area has free movies, PS3 games (all rooms have a console) free coffee in the a.m. and ice cold lemon water available all day!!

Strengths:The hotel staff was very nice and went above and beyond. Everyone from the front desk to the maids was very friendly. The hotel is also very close to the beach and a great location in the middle in everything. Weakness:The building was old and the bathroom looked like it used to be a dorm room. It looks like they have done renovations, but they still have work to do to make it look more like a hotel. Overall:The location was excellent. Therefore, it offset the weaknesses. I purchased a Groupon. The price was below average. However, there are other nicer hotels in the area that are the same price without resort fees. I would stay there again if the price was lower.

Bad service need to let the customer know what is not working, the front desk service was really bad, they just want to get our money, and not refund the money, try to call the manager but they didn't return the call

Staff was nice and check-in/check-out were fast. The A/C in the hotel was unfortunately shut down during our stay. We got the room in higher floor and got no extra service charge as compensation. However it is still not good without A/C.

Don't stay here. They didn't fix the air conditioning the two days we were there and it was too noisy to sleep with doors open. The parking was so inconvenient because it was so cramped. Awful experience for us

I would've paid more and stayed somewhere nicer. But if you are looking for cheap and good location this is it. The room was ok, the bathroom was super dirty. Also the AC and pool were unavailable during our stay.

Broken air conditioner, unclean floor/bed, horrible service, unsafe property for our 2.5year old child, she easily could have fallen from the lanai or window. Worst night of sleep I've had in awhile. Never going back.

For a Waikiki property this a good value hotel. Right across the street from the new International Marketplace. Lots of activities and restaurants within walking distance. Only three blocks to the beach. Friendly and accommodating staff - especially Matthew, Paola, Jhara, Treena and Connie who cleaned our room. Very clean but could use some updating. All in all good value and makes our long stay possible.

When you choose a hotel - you generally have three key choices to make - price, location, luxury. This one delivers on price and location - luxury is not on the menu. The location was superb - especially in the daylight hours. At night, it feels edgy, but not dangerous - there is a night club at the far end of the block that attracts a spring break party crowd. The front desk was quite helpful - and they police the entrance at night to keep the partiers (and pro's) out of the hotel. The room itself was fine, mine had a small kitchenette. The bed was big and comfortable, but the bathroom was a bit of mess. However - for the price and location, it's definitely worth it to overlook some of the faults.

Again, the only concern was air conditioning. Also my mother couldn't get a hold of me and had staff come into my room to make sure I was okay. It's fine that they did but my mother informed me that they did without trying to confirm that it was actually my mother and not some prank, thank goodness it was my family.

Check-in staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are not spacious, but very clean. It has cooking stove and refrigerator should you want to cook your own food. Parking space is also available and given its location, it is a plus. all-in-all, I totally recommend this hotel
user_name:
patrickcU697PB
Kolonia, Federated States of Micronesia

review_body: Customer service @ front desk not so great but house keeping (Maricel) was amazing...she compensates what others lack of. The hotel was close to everything. Nordstrom across the road & Starbucks right next to it. A new resto & bar just opened from the left side Nordstrom.

I have stayed at other aqua properties before but this one is by far the worst! Cockroaches all over the room. Run down room. No AC in the building the whole time. If your room is facing Seaside St good luck getting sleep. There is a club right below the building with people screaming and music playing till 6am! Even with the closed door is so loud! You can find a better place in the same area for same price. I don't like writing bad reviews but this one deserves it. They need to tear the whole building down and rebuild it. Juat remodeling won't help. Worst Hawaiian experience yet!

My entire review is based on the experience at check-in. We chose this hotel based on an overnight bumper in Honolulu between the Big Island and LAX since we were in on the last flight of the night and out on the first the next morning. For a single night, the price was a bit more than we had planned to spend, but the alternatives were far more expensive. Upon arrival at 11:00 PM for check-in, we were told, "Sorry, the air for the hotel is out and nothing we can do. We'll waive the resort fee of $18 and change, or you can find a different hotel." We had to be at airport at 5:30 AM, so scouring a city full of spring break partiers looking for a vacancy wasn't really in the cards. The room was showing some age, but overall it was clean. After some struggle, we got the balcony door open, but there wasn't much breeze. The hotel didn't even offer a fan to move the air, so after a sleepless night and a cold shower to rinse off the sweat, we were back to the airport and ended up sleeping on the plane, instead.

Condition of bathroom poor - toilet flusher would stick and had to pull out the sink stopper to drain sink. Very hot, no air movement until we slept with the balcony door open and the hall door open. Real safe... They gave us a fan the second night.

Check-in was very fast, we got a new room because our previous room was incorrect so they got us a new room and then we were cry happy. the check out was very fast too and was pleasant to see them say goodbye and see you once more.

Not worth the price! Toilet bowl location is really awkward, old carpet and carrying your luggage from their parking area is not convenient. Only pros is their proximity to everything around the area.

never coming back and recommend to people I know. What a sleepless nights without AC. Torture!! No air conditioning, no pool and compensation for the 3 nights torture was only $ 54.00. Management could have done better cop.

By far one of the friendliest hotel staff!! Rooms are clean and have beautiful views! They were very accommodating and the restaurant, Da Big Kahuna, was very very good! I totally recommend this hotel for family travel!

The bed was comfortable but the room was hot and uncomfortable. Staff was friendly but one of the housekeepers only cleaned when she wanted to. She did do a good job replacing towels & washcloths. There was no microwave & barely any movies in the little kiosk. This hotel is for quick stay not long stay.

Terrible experience. Would not recommend anyone to come due to low quality of customer service, not listen to customer experience.room facility is so small and 180 degree different from wedsite. Bath towels for rent by using card is subject to be charged for any resones.

Bit too expensive compared to places I stayed in different countries. It needs a bit of renovation. Carpets are pretty worn. Location of the hotel is good - walking distances to the Beach and shops etc

I don't ask for much, but a place for my family and I to sleep while we are away from home. Love that they have unlimited DVD use, ps3 with games, internet, 10% off Macy's and more included in the $12 resort fee. Staff is friendly always with ice water infused with lemons and limes as well as fresh coffee all day in the lobby. Like I said just looking for a cheap place to crash with a.c.. So all the extras made me feel like I got more bang for the buck! Also right smack in the middle of kuhio (omg) and right across the new international market place... only complaint was that in the mid morning the room would get hot... and the room didn't get as cold as I knew it should. OH and a bar down stairs so mom and dad can get krunk while babies are up stairs enjoying free movies. (Note children were not left unattended as I have an 18yr old LOL) highly recommend if u are into basic comforts and friendly hospitable staff!!!

Great location, reasonable price. Only issue was parking but luckily they have a sister hotel behind them and you can park there. Other than that the hotel was right down town of Waikiki and had lots of local places to walk to.

Wonderful place near anything food bars shopping and the beach wonderful friendly workers and clean rooms and see everything we just walked out of room downstairs and out door there is a bar and food right there in the hotel also there is parking garage very nice and safe place to park

This place is so old. Not at all like the pics. We arrived 1:00 am in the morning it was so bad and dirty looking I could not even go into the room. I almost ran out of the place into the dark. We walked around and finally found a hotel that was a lot nicer. We went back the next day and they gave us our money back. My hubby was sure there was a prostitute who came of the hotel. If they do not renovate soon they will have to tear the place down.

If you are going to waikikki to party and want an inexpensive place to stay, this place is for you. I went on overnight business on a Saturday and it was a huge mistake. The hotel is surrounded by a lot of clubs that play loud music throughout the night. Add drunk people screaming whoohoo throughout the night inside and outside the hotel it makes for little sleep. I got a total of 2 hours and was not happy at my convention the next day. So if you have young kids I would not recommend this place at all. The room was decent though with a little kitchenette. Bathroom was small but for 1 person it wasn't a big deal.

Bugs in the room. Like a lot of bugs. And the lights in the restroom weren't working the bathroom towels weren't very bright feel like they wasn't like super white like I'm used to. But I may be back I won't say it was a deal breaker due to the excellent location and fair price

disappointed for an aqua property. have stayed in other aqua hotels and this one needs to be redone, and updated. lobby area needs to have more room when guest are waiting to be helped. The bellman I believe his name was paul was the only one that smiled and was welcoming to guest in lobby area.

What I loved most about staying this hotel was the hospitality of ladies who did room cleaning everyday. They are very nice! One of the nicest people I've ever met :) I would love to show my deepest appreciation to the ladies. They made our trip absolutely a better one!! Thank you very much <3

For the price you can't bet it. The location is great. The mattresses are hard, the hotel is dated and there is gentleman's club very close by. With all that we still had a great time. Minus points for the unfriendly staff(a few were)

Horrible Communication and being charged additional fees for something ridiculous. The manager was not accommodating and I was robbed $250 which almost didn't allow me to get my flight back home. I will never come back and will make sure that everyone knows not to stay here.

We booked this hotel as it was fairly good value for money. It was very noisey at night as our room was right above a bar. We had to pay a resort fee which I found to be ridiculous as this hotel is very far from a resort. The wifi is terrible and was very slow. The location of the hotel is good with only a short walk to the beach. The room was clean enough but the bathrooms definately need to be re done. Overall it was an average hotel and I would probably look to stay elsewhere next time.

Live on the Big Island, needed just 1 night on business, everything was great, great location, very friendly staff at the front desk, room had a great view and everything worked! will definitely be back.

Nice simple hotel with a great staff who helped me in the best possible way to solve a flight cancellation. The location is strategic to reach Waikiki beach, and great shops and restaurants are at walking distance. The room was small but the presence of the kitchen was a plus. Some updating will help a lot.Surely I will be back.

My wife and I need a break from the family. We had stayed here before and found it comfortable. It's location , is ideal being in the center of waikiki. We plan to return at the end of the month for my birthday.

Overall I enjoyed my stay. I was grateful that I could leave my bag after I checked out. The staff was very friendly and helpful during my stay. Everyone was quick to help at the front Desk. They answered my question, helped Direct me to where I needed to go. a

Poor customer service and hospitality.Very small roomAir condition not working well in the hallway,elevator and lobby.Location is very convinient walking distance in waikiki beach and international market mall in across the street.

Everything was clean. Nice pool. Shops are within walking distance. The kitchen is small but it gets the job done. No complaints here. I loved it and can't wait to go back and book here again. It was everything we needed and more.

The hotel is fine, nothing fancy but it was clean. The best aspect of this is the Location, you are in walking distance to everything in Waikiki and most of the Tours not he hotel and will pick up there.
user_name:
Matt K
Tarbcuo Canyon, United States

review_body: It was a nice hotel. I can't understand why some people said it's so bad. It has more worthy hotel than price. Maybe 2 dollars chip is important to especially cleaning. Bed making and cleaning the room were so good.

Comfortable, clean, close to everything, greet price ... great value for a hotel so close to beach. Staff very nice and accommodating. Loved the location, close enough to action but not in the middle of it.

After two weeks in the aqua ohia I'm pleased with my experience. Maintenance has been quick to fix any issues, it's in a good location in Waikiki, and the rooms are comfortable enough for the money. The hotel staff are very helpful, particularly Connie, who was very nice and seemed to enjoy being there.

Employees are friendly and always giving greetings. There not enough parking in hotel, just so you know that the parking cost $25. The bar needs improvement, I always felt that the bar is a place to relax at an end of a day, I didn't feel or see that in the bar. It would be nice to have tea in the room.It wasn't a bad stay and would stay there again. It met my needs. Get better Mattress!

Huge lines at the front desk the whole time we were there. No one ever answered the phones. When we went down to the lobby, an employee just standing there said no one answers his calls either. Our "view" could not have been worse and there was trash all over the balcony. There was a cockroach in the bathroom. No elevator from the basement garage which also costs $25/day and is not mentioned at time of booking. Garage is so tight, there are scratches all over the walls. Lobby is recently renovated- but that's it! The rest of the building is old and smelly. We were on our second night of our honeymoon- no one cared- this place was terrible!

This hotel was not professionallying cleaned and in a horrible area. Everyone was nice but didn't know everything about the area and it was my first time to hawaii. I would never bring my kids there. It's right next to a strip club.

Great location - right across from international market place, walking distance to convenient stores and bars/clubs. Decent pricing/Decent room - Loved that there was a little kitchenette. Pillows are comfy. We had a balcony not the best view but still got to enjoy fresh air and city lights. Staff - Does their job, not over friendly but helpful.

I loved staying here it was great. Not everything in the building is perfect but it was worth the price. Parking is $25/ a night first come first serve, so we found parking somewhere else. Overall it was a pleasant place to stay.

I wasn't told of a first come first serve parking until I arrived, so I walked in pouring rain after finding a garage. I was given the wrong room and charged with payments I wasn't aware of. The staff here is very unprofessional, unfriendly and unwelcoming. Will never recommend or book another night with this company. One mishap and everything is fine, but this many in one night, INTOLERABLE!

Enjoy family time with my daughter.jus the 2 of us.my daughter enjoyed her self away from her cousin it was peace and quiet. Alot of action in Waikiki I liked our room we could see alot goin on we be back next year for our vacation

Checked in at 3 Air conditioner broken. Never got fixed called around 8:30-9ish ended up moving rooms at 10 pm. Called service desk said they send someone waited for 1 hr still no one came I have to walk downstairs to complain

Attended a wedding in Waikiki and decided to rent a room for 1 night so my wife and 1 year old daughter could relax afterwards. Chose this hotel specifically for the low cost and location. However, I now regret doing so. Several problems. 1. PARKING DRIVEWAY is a ridiculously sharp curve downhill ramp which has solid concrete walls on both sides. In other words, IMPOSSIBLE to drive through with a large car. I had a small car, so not a problem for me, HOWEVER, The terminal to open the gate or speak to a staff member is ridiculously difficult to reach due to the awkward curve of the driveway. At this time, it was a HEAVY DOWNPOUR. I literally had to get out of my car to push the button to speak to a staff member. Immediately was told by staff, "Parking is sold out". Informed staff I was a guest and had a room reservation. Was told, "Sorry, please park at Aqua Skyline" (which is about a 10 minute walk). Informed staff that it is raining hard, I have no umbrella, and would have to walk very far. Staff stated, "sorry, nothing I can do about it". Parked at Aqua Skyline, which was $30 just for 1 night. Don't even get me started on the terrible parking structure there. 2. Security guard was absolutely rude to my wife. I dropped her off along with our luggage to the hotel prior to me driving to the other Aqua's hotel for parking. From what she told me, she sat inside the lobby and a man attempted to enter the front door (which is locked in the evening). He began knocking on the door and kept motioning for my wife to open it. My wife opened it for her and then a security confronted her afterwards stating, "don't ever open the door for anyone. got it?" Very rude approach. Wife stated another person attempted to walk in and knocked on the door repeatedly. The security guard just sat and ignored it instead of telling them they can't enter. My wife was disturbed by each person attempting to enter. 3. After parking in the other hotel 10 minutes away and walking in the heavy rain (I was SOAKED), we finally checked in. Immediately upon entering the room, we were bombarded by a very strong smell which I can only describe as a mixture of old fish and bleach. There is a cooking stove in the unit which I can imagine has been used to cook (of course, the room will smell like what others have cooked in the past).4. Room is nowhere near sound proof. You will hear EVERYTHING from outside.NEVER AGAIN. I'd rather pay triple the rate at another hotel

Paola in the reception made you feel an appreciated guest, and she walked the extra mile in making our stay worth to remember.For the price was it spacy rooms situated right in the center of Waikiki. Wifi was functioning well.

Holiday was great good location everyone was so friendly Room was huge Had a great shower nice views of area we really liked the location because we love walkingThe restaurant next door was great and the restaurants around the place were great. The Japanese was fantastic Always a big que

Very obliging with anything brought to their attention, could not do enough for us with the room being cleaned and stock with soap and towels every day.The guys in the next room took showers at all times of the night

Nice place near waikiki beach and stores. The service is not perfect but for the price, it worth it. We loved the kitchen, we saved a lot of money. The parking is really expensive so be careful when you plan on renting a car around.

Aside from the fact that they didn't give us the room we reserved, the staff were extremely rude to us. Left the room keys in the room, they sent us with security to go retrieve them. Wouldn't let us check out without therm. Never been treated so poorly.

Hotel was older and run down. Needs a fair bit of work.Pool was freezing and you could see dirt/hair etc on the bottom from the sides.Verandah railing is really not child(walking 2 yr old) friendly we left our door closed the whole time.Great location easy to access everything.$25 a day on top of bill for parking is a bit rich.

Reasonable price and good location, but terrible physical condition. Very poor after hours access to the lobby and parking. Unfortunately, there was also a crowd of rowdy twenty somethings hanging around the entrance which made us feel unsafe. I would not stay here again and cannot recommend it despite the reasonable price.

Pictures are misleading. Bathrooms are outdated and definitely need to be renovated. Rooms are small. Parking is an absolute nightmare! The parking garage is extremely narrow and there isn't enough stalls for the amount of rooms they have. Hotel was supposed to be non smoking but while walking through the halls we could smell marijuana, cigarettes and e-cigs. Wouldn't stay here again.

It was really good I enjoyed. People were friendly the place was close to everything I had fun in Hawaii. I will tell all my friends about this place. The staff was lovely always willing to help thanks

Wow the whole room bs you not its nasty. Bed and the shower the AC was not working no one wanted to help with with it. I told them come change my bedding it has all brown stains on them. If not give me my money back. I'll never come here ever again.

Had some issues with the room but staff accommodating and responsive and changed our rooms (room was beside the bar next door - very loud music nightly). Good location and amenities like the shuttle was a nice touch.

Couldn't use form of payment for an Extended Stays so stay at another hotel. We were told that it's up to the manager to decide whether or not they accept it or not period doesn't seem like this company runs as a cohesive organization. This can't be there Flagship property cuz I stayed at others that are much better than this one.

Best value for its location with full kitchene and balcony. Rooms are clean and spacious. Close to beach and shopping - must see the newly renovated International Market Place across the street. It's outstanding how the designers preserved much of the charm of the original market place, especially the higantic Binyan Trees. Will stay here every time!

Positives: Centralized location good for getting around on foot. Friendly and accomdating staff. Negatives: Noisy at night (even on 15th floor), Room not as advertised (one full bed/not a king or even 2 doubles). Still having billing issues (paid in full on hotels.com sans a $18 fee; however, another $228.27 was charged to my card AND $159.42 still pending.) I cannot recommend this hotel.

Room1592. Location good. Room appeared clean but had ants. Bathroom clean but was very old and the new paint was peeling off. Strange ancient kitchenette. Beds and pillows very comfy.Curtains very thin and let light through including indoor light out. Window/door old, did not lock, not sound proofed with noisy street outside.On site restaurant was terrible and not cheap.

The smell caused a migraine not sure what else o can say the people were great but the room was horrible n I literally had to leave just to try n get the headache to subside. Gain the staff was trying to help but there was no relief

Everyone was very helpful & friendly Even the minor complaint was over shado wed by the kindness & the feeling of welcome was unreal not much that I can say everything was great indeed I will be returning.

Place was clean, convenient. Staff friendly and took care of everything we asked for. Would stay there again. Got us a free shuttle, arranged for airport transfers and had a free daily newspaper. Housekeeping cooperative and helpful. Price was right.

I enjoy myself. The staff was GREAT!!!! I called downstairs three times. At all times my request was Granted in a fast response. I love this hotel. It is close to everything. No need for a rental car, you can walk, take bus, or shuttle everywhere.

Old and antique building with insufficient ventilation, poor cleanliness, noisy and cumber-sum parking and unfriendly staff. Kitchen, bathroom and shower fixtures were old, water temperature fluctuates from super hot to cold while in shower. Ready to fall off doors and cabinet doors. There are plenty other places in the area in the same price range.

Amazing staff. Amazing location. Amazing bed. Clean bathroom. What more can you ask for?! The beach was about a block or 2 away. They even supply the beach towels. Fresh lemon water in the lobby all day. And fresh kona coffee in the morning. Thank you to everyone at Aqua Ohia for your wonderful hospitality! You guys are the best of the best.

I would like to thanks Mrs Paola ( FDO) for her efficient communication skills showed during needs , She has a very high capability to manage the critical situations either when out of duty , I wish the best for her Career in to Hotel Management

Building is old and rooms are not exactly like the ones showed in the pictures BUT it was a great place to stay! Great price and service. Staff went above and beyond to accommodate my requests.Good option in Waikiki! Shuttle service to Ala Moana Mall & Walmart was very handy!

Generally Good location, Kind staff, but Noisy. The kichenette was very useful! and Staffs were very kind, too.Originally, it was located in downtown with a lot of noise. Moreover, a building were under construction or remodeling (I'm not sure what exactly it was) across the road. They started working pretty early in the morning which made me wake up early. Of course, this is not a problem due to Aqua Ohia. I think if you visit there in 2017, you'd better check it.

The staff is super friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to assist. Rooms are small as well as pool but the ocean is just down the street. Centered perfectly.Great location in waikiki. A solid clean place to stay nothing fancy but the staff make up for this

Checked in as a pre-cruise night in Honolulu. Cannot tell you how disappointed I am. Picks are a total fabrication! Very old, run down, very loud crowd in lobby, if you want to park your car you have to cart your luggage out of the garage and up stairs to the lobby before getting to an elevator - which are old and slow. Staff is nice and place is clean, but way out of date. Safe didn't work, my mom didn't even have a lamp in her room, I reserved a king bed and got two doubles and was told there were no rooms to move us to. The bathroom door is one of those slide doors that is only suspended from the top and the bottom hangs free so it rattles etc. Only those on a really tight budget (like college spring break tight budget) should come here.Also very loud - as in no sound proofing at all.

The repair status of the building is poor. Specifically, the bathroom door was a heavy door rigged with wires... Not in a proper track. Furniture and room doors have been updated. Carpet heavily worn... Outside noise level makes sleeping almost impossible. Staff is friendly

This hotel front staff is always customers toooooooo long!!! House keeping staff is very nice !!The pillow of the room was with the hair of another person, it was disgusting only. It was convenient to have a kitchen!

We are 1st time in Honolulu. Room is clean ,location if perfect. Paola was very friendly, polite. Her promptness on our requests very satisfying.We should check in 3pm , but Paola helped us to check in 1pm which was VERY help for our Jet Lag.

My family stayed at this hotel for 6days, very clean, feels like home, staff are very accommodating, especially Maricel. She is very friendly & caring, she does a great job in making our room very clean and comfortable to stay. Her promptness on our request is very satisfying. I would loved to comeback and stay in this Hotel again and highly recommended. So close to the beach, restaurants, stores. Location is so convenient.

Room was clean and neat every time. Maricel was very polite and always asked if I needed amenities. Staff are respectful and always greeted you with an Aloha! The location is reasonable, being close to grocery stores and just a street over from the main street in Waikiki.

Our stay and previous times had always been the best. Staff members have gone beyond the call to accommodate us. I have recommended to our friends on the services that are provided to pet lovers. The hotel is located right in the middle of Waikiki.

We found it convenient to come and go easily, Each time the front desk staff would greet you. If we needed something they were right no it to get the answer for you. The staff was very sensitive to our reason we were there, a funeral in our family. The booking agent was nice and sensitive to me over the phone.

Overall all was great just when checking in room not ready by 3pm due to clerk said housekeeping still didn't turn rooms over. No early check in was offered says you have to wait till 3pm. But like I said room still weren't ready.

Great location,friendly staffs,clean rooms,comfortable beds,nice kitchen,clean bathrooms.Close to bus stops and is very convenient if you don't have to drive.Its also walking distance to the beach.Its also in the vicinity of the new international market place.restaurants are all around the area.Overall ,we had a great time ,merci

I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and enjoyed myself. They do charge you a resort fee which is not unusual now days. The parking fee is alittle steep but you really have no choice but to pay it unless you want to take your chances parking your car on the street and worry about the time limit or someone breaking into it. There are alot of homeless people around the area so please be careful with your belongings. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. You are close to all the stores and the beach is near by. The hotel offers you beach towels and you can get DVD and Wifi for free. Overall good hotel to stay at. Will stay at this hotel again. The only thing that I wasn't crazy about was the fact that there was no place to go to if you were a smoker. No ashtrays around. No place to sit and relax and smoke your cigarettes.

Don't know if all rooms have stoves, sinks and two refrigerators, but on my floor the smell from guests cooking in the rooms was horrible. Older building and antiquated plumbing plus extremely poor lighting in the room and bathroom.

poorly managed hotel. Stayed 10 nights and house keeping does not change bed sheet. Hotel phone does not answer in coming calls. Front desk short handed with long processing time for each room guest. Not very helpful and lack of warm hospitality services. Parking difficult to drive in. Small and limited lot space. Coffee service in the mornings ends too early. Suggest to extend to noon time.

Not recommended construction and noise all over the hotel Stuff not nice Management didn't care at allEvery day problem with baech towels not enough for all the people.They didn't mention in my booking the construction.Definitely not coming back to this hotel.

Flew in from Maui late at night for a morning flight back to Sydney got a taxi to hotel great guy Tony who we also booked to pick us up in morning reasonably price for an overnight stay friendly staff clean hotel

Staff not very helpful. Pictures on website very misleading.Called the front desk several times and no answer. Annoyed. Wouldve preferred to pay more than stay at this place! The bed is not very comfortable. Questions did not get answered. Asked a front desk personal for a map. He asked, "a map of what?" Seriously?? What do you think i need a map of. Waikiki my friend. I have no idea why he made it seem like i was asking for something very absurd. Not once on the trip did i see the shuttle that was suppose to be "free"

The Hotel is great, The desk clerk Jeremy was very pleasant and helpful, Omar another desk clerk is also very friendly and helpful. My stay there was excellent. The room was clean the bed was comfortable and it was a few blocks from the beach and is in the middle of most of the restaurants. I will definately go back there.

Have a good time stay at ohia waikiki my favorite hotel in waikiki and very nice staff like sean dilwith and the front desk staff and every body work at this hotel very nice to my family and me when stay at the hotel

The location is great but the hotel needs completele renovation. Room smelled musty, we were given double bed instead of King ,no soap or shampoo holder inside the shower and shower head is awful. Very poor amenities.

If you don't need high end this place is clean, convenient and excellent value for money. The decor is not the newest but it is spotlessly clean and the fittings in good condition. The staff are very friendly and helpful.The kitchenette and dvd rentals added to the value. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and family.

Great location, great price!! On main avenue, easy access to restaurants, malls, transportation, beach. Quiet, no noise in hallways. Friendly, courteous staff. Clean room although bathrooms need to be updated.
user_name:
Abigail C
San Juan, Puerto Rico

review_body: All the staff are very friendly and helpful, great location in the middle of Waikiki, and the price is cheap for the area. This helps to overlook the aging facilities (not enough lighting or outlets in the room, could be more ADA friendly, lobby is so small it's hard to move around especially when they have travel groups present) and the noise from the bars on both sides of the hotel keeps you up in the wee hours. I'll still stay here though as long as the price is right.

This hotel was secured for a less than 24-hour stay in Honolulu. The price was good for a pretty good location (across the street from the new International Marketplace and two short blocks from Waikiki/beach). Many dining options close by! Hotel itself looks a little run down, one slow,small elevator and tired,old shower but it was clean. Lanai off first floor room was with old patio furniture but big for hanging out beach towels/storage of beach chairs and water toys. But it was a clean room. Only complaint was room lighting...not enough. Note: there was a good reception at the small pool on Tuesday afternoon with drinks and lite snacks and an awesome guitarist/singer for entertainment!

There is no value in taking the lanai room - you will be tortured with street noise all night and there is nothing to see but the parking garage across the street - unless you are above the 10th floor. There are much better, nicer hotels near by.

Great location for a visit to wiakiki. We came to see my friends daughter who lives in Hawaii. We had comfortable beds and enjoyed the balcony. I would like to have had a microwave but we used the oven to warm up food.

The plumbing is terrible. Water pressure is decent. The kitchen sink faucet was falling apart and there was no bath tub, only a shower. The prices are not worth what you get. The rooms were clean and the staff was amazing.

The pervasive Nicotine smell in the hallways was terribleSome of the lights in my room did not work The curtains did not block out the lights from outsideThe shower curtain rod was not attached well and kept falling down

We were unable to arrive as planned as our flight from Edmonton was cancelled due to fog. The cancellation cause us to miss our connecting flight from Vancouver to Honolulu. We emailed the hotel regarding our situation but did not receive an acknowledgement,

To start I had problems arriving at the hotel because when I made the reservation on the booking I obviously made it for a couple and upon check in the clerk informed me that I was available a room with 2 single beds. I had to pay extra to be put in another room. Then I left my bags in the room to eat, on the way back I moved my bag and from there came cheap, when I saw besides being in the bag were scattered around the room. They changed us room but still had cockroach in the bathroom. I even took a picture. At check out they charged me a fee for using the services like Wi-Fi for almost $ 20 dollars a day. In the contract was specified. However I do think that this information should be in the past before reserving the room. I was very annoyed with all this happened since I made this trip with my boyfriend and we wanted something very happy and comfortable.

Great location, a few minutes on foot to food, beaches and shopping in Waikiki. Friendly and helpful staff do their best to welcome visitors in a somewhat dated and casually maintained building. The value for the money was a very strong consideration for us and so we were satisfied -- staying here is best if you are using the room as a base to be outside rather than enjoying in-room amenities and luxury. Rooms are pretty sparely appointed, but kitchenette/wifi/PlayStation3 worked as advertised. A/C was almost, not quite, able to cool the room in the warm weather. The toilets, btw, are awesome: it's like pooping into a jet engine, no risk of clogs. Not so much the tub -- for some reason the tub drain backed up a couple times during our stay. Maintenance is not on call 24/7 so it was cleaned up in the morning.

The hotel was built in the 1960s and not renovated. The shower was dark and small. There was an unexpected "daily resort fee" of $20 to cover such amenities as "chilled water in the lobby." The room "thermostat had 3 settings: off, low, and high. We asked for another blanket and it never arrived. I won't go here again.

These are always the best to stay at! This group of hotels is always the best priced and best locations! I have stayed at other locations and haven't been disappointed yet! Thanks for these options especially for locals!

At first we were given a room that you have to get out of the EXIT door to get thru your door and there is a caution tape on the railings that you have to pass thru and when we ask for another room, we were given a small room with one bed and not even a king bed for a family of 4. Too tired to go and ask for another room coz we check in late and we slept in the bed crosswise with our feet hanging. The next day we complain and we were given a room with two beds but we killed about 6 bugs crawling in the counters.

Great location and nice clean rooms. Lovely staff and maricel has been especially helpful. I stayed here for the last couple of days following a business conference and wanted to just relax, hit the beach and wander around Waikiki. I recommend staying here and will do so again! Cheers

Wifi works great...room comes with stove, refrigerator and sink. They provide coffee and water in the lobby with tiny paper cups so bring your own container if you want to drink more than a shot of water or coffee. Pillows are flat and uncomfortable and curtains were soiled and very sheer I had to sleep with an eye mask because the outside light was so strong. Electrical outlets in the bathroom and kitchen area didn't work. Otherwise the staff was great and the location along Waikiki is amazing.

Booked a 1 night stay for this hotel about 3 days prior to arrival date through a Kamaaina rate. I was super excited to finally be able to have a whole relaxing day with my boyfriend before a Christmas party that night. Then at 10 morning when we arrived that day, the front desk suddenly told us that they didn't have a room prepared and that we need to come back at 3 in the afternoon. We understand that there are lots of tourists that occupy the hotel and that the rooms need to be cleaned before another guest occupies it but they could have at least included (in the email) that there was a certain check-in time instead of telling guests on the spot. On the bright side, they offered to hold our bags for us at the front desk til the actual check-in time. Roamed around Waikiki for literally 5 hours and finally got to check in. Finally..The room was pretty good. Everything was neat and we were glad there was a game console to keep us entertained. Amenities are already included. You can rent up to 2 DVDs max. Got to enjoy the pool as well some time the day after.Only downsides about the room/hotel is the shower. It was hard to get it at a good temperature. It was either freezing cold or burning hot. We literally had to tweak it or adjust the knobs in small centimeters just to get it at a good temperature and for it to not suddenly change temps while we're showering. Also, we ended up waking super early because there was loud construction which sounded like it was coming from above the hotel. So much for getting a good night's sleep after partying.. Also, we didn't realize til that morning that our coffeemaker was broken. So much for that.Overall, I think this hotel is okay.

Located in a fabulous location, the budget traveler has it all at there fingertips :) staff at check in made us laugh and did what they could at check in, to make our rooms available for 8 weary travelers. The hotel may be older and not renovated but it was clean, and the staff attended to our needs as if we were the only guests, thank you for a lovely place to call home :)

A very nice older budget hotel. Central location. 10 min walk to beach. King size bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly. It was nice to have DVD rentals in lobbyCheck in at 3pm took too long with only 2 computers at desk. Pool area small

I guess you pay for what you get. The cheap hotel had terrible service at the desk. They cram in as many people into this hotel as they can and the common areas are not very clean. Good luck staying here

The hotel is in clean working condition. It's an old building on a dirty street though. It feels like staying in a cheap hotel. The rooms are old stale carpets and sketchy balconies. I would rather pay more for a resort on the beach next time.

Very busy hotel. Staff is nice but not property. Location is around everything which is great. Arrival date was 1/12/17 -1/16/17. Requested online late checkout due to late flight to Chicago. Never received a response. During checkout I was advised after 3pm I will be charged a full day but they can store my luggage until the shuttle picks me up at 6:30pm. I refused due to I've already paid over $500 for 4 nights. I checked out & had to wander around HI until the shuttle picked me up.

The hotel Staff was completely unfriendly. The hotel rooms are terrible and parking is terrible. The cost is way too high. There are way better hotels in the area for this price. The pool is very small.

Really friendly and helpful staff, we weren't there for a vacation and needed to check in early. The receptionist and housekeeping worked very hard to accommodate us as soon as possible. The rooms are small and could use updating but very reasonable for the price. And it is a really good location for vacationers.

Good location. Minutes to beach and all amenities. Reasonably priced for Waikiki. Kitchenette and good wifi. 16th floor great view from the balcony. Good staff courteous. Housekeeping good. Would book again

Check in was poor. Couldn't get into our room til 4:15. Room was small, but clean. Location was great. Close to everything. Omar at the front desk was great. Very professional under all the pressure from the guests waiting for their rooms all day.

Great location and great price. Hotel is located about 10 minute walk from Waikiki beach and only meters from restaurants and shopping center. There is onsite laundry machines and dryers. There are also beach towels and a shuttle service to Ala Moana center for free. The building is secure with hotel card access at night and security cameras in hallways. The pool is small but nice. I would recommend if you are going to Honolulu on a budget.

Good location to beach, restaurants & shopping, able to walk everywhere. No need to rent a car. Good price, but rooms are very dated, but clean. Small stove & frig in room. Nice staff, very helpful & knowledgable

Great hotel. Very clean and staff very friendly. Can't beat the location. Only issue was getting beach towels. We were given small white hotel towels for 5 out of the seven days. We had a great view off our balcony also.

Great Location and friendly service. Wanna give a special Mahalo to Matthew and staff who made our accommodationtruly enjoyable and memorable.Also Kathy G.for providing the reservation... Will definitely return to this establishment againin 2017!!!

My husband and I decided to stay the weekend at the Aqua Ohia Waikiki. We read the reviews and we're a little worried but we decided to give it a try. It's not the hilton but was a great room with a view of the ocean. We could also see the fireworks on Friday night from our room. The staff was great! We would definitely stay here again. Thanks for our relaxing getaway.

I stayed here for 7 nights with my family and we had 3 rooms total. This was the perfect location and it was close to everything in Waikiki. We rented a car and yes the parking was tight here but we ended up leaving it parked because we walked everywhere. I had the pleasure of meeting the general manager Kathy who was really friendly and allowed me to express my feeling on how wonderful the hotel was and the staff was great. I can't wait to come back next year with my family.

This hotel is in the perfect location & close to all the shops & 5 minutes from the beach. Can be noisy due to construction in the street, but if you're at the beach all is good. The staff are very friendly. I would stay again.

great price. great location. great service.hotel rooms need upgrades. bathroom is sad - shower pressure horrible and needs a facelift. kitchenette is cool, but smelling other people's weird meals is not ideal. also need to get some sound proof windows because there was a LOT of noise around 11pm. really hard to ignore. beds were pretty comfy but notably old. everything was pretty clean. found a few minor stains on towel and hair that wasnt mine. love the hotel amenities like dvd/game rental and the ps3 option. havent seen that at a hotel which is great and also the free coffee/water station is great. staff was great and beach amenities were good.

The Aqua Ohia is conveniently located 2 blocks from the beach and the price was great. It is clean and comfortable. If you want a high-end resort, then you will need to pay at least twice as much. This was an ideal alternative.

We spent time with family for a birthday and just to relax. It was a very lovely stay thanks to the Staffa she employees. Definitely will plan another trip and also recommend others about the hospitality and aloha that was shared.

The place is conveniently located in the middle of Waikiki and close to the beach. Shopping malls convention entourage nearby including Ross and Nordstrom Rack. Overall it's good value for money and clean and comfortable room to boot.

Staying here a couple of months for business. Hotel is staffed by very friendly and courteous employees. Front desk is top-notch whether it be for directions or local "hot spots". Our Housekeeper, Maricel is great! She went above and beyond what would normally be expected of a housekeeper. All in all the employees are what makes this place so comfortable.

Superb staff, and exceptional location. Beach, restaurants and shopping centers are close. Beach towels and beach chairs made me have fun on the beach. But there are certain items missing in the kitchen.

I am staying here for an extended period for work. The hotel is about what you would expect at the price point for the area. I spend my time outside my hotel as much as possible anyway. Location is key. It's a short 5-10 minute walk to just about everything.What the hotel lacks in luxury it makes up for with friendly staff. Everyone I have dealt with has been extremely helpful and attentive, from the front desk to the staff at the bar next door. The housekeeper on my floor, Marisel, has especially done a great job and made me feel at home during my extended stay.If you're looking for a reasonably priced place to stay where you will be treated well, you've found your hotel!

The hotel was clean and central location so no need to work far wherever you wanted to go this was very handy.We arrived at 12pm due to our flight being early and were told to cone back at 3 (check in time) our rooms would be ready this was no problem and they locked our bags away. When we arrived at 3 we were told they were still not ready and to come back around 5pm, I got cranky at this stage and explained no we want our room and get it ready, we received a barrage of excuses why it wasn't ready also offered a room on another floor, however this was a lower floor and a lot cheaper than we had paid for. I advised NO WE WILL WAIT FOR ROOM WE PAID FOR. Finally at 415pm we got our room (only because I stood at desk till ready).Overall the staff were polite and friendly the rooms always cleaned by time we got back from breakfast and very comfortable beds. The atmosphere and vibe in and around the hotel was always good. I would probably not stay here again only due to below note. Note: when doing washing stay with it whilst being done as a girl had hers stolen the hotel and police where not helpful at all. They people who stole it were unregistered guests in the hotel they were kicked out but nothing else was done the men were not charged and not offer of help was offered. This made me and my friend who were staying there feel unsafe.

No working safe in either room we had, they were "broken", not usable. I felt silly asking for a 3rd room. Loud thumping music every night from "Hawaii by Night" strip club next door on Kuhio. Ask for a room higher up or on another side of the building. Very cold pool, this seems standard in Hawaii. No knives except for butter knives, so bring your own for the kitchenette. I was told "we don't want to arm the public". No pan for the oven, not even a cookie sheet. Very nice staff. A small table on the deck would be nice, even a side table size. Need more lounger chairs at the pool, there are only 4. Close to beach, shops grocery, restaurants. Saves $$ by having the kitchenette.

We chose the place because it was one of the cheaper options and because of the location. Walking around Waikiki was really easy as you are 5 minutes from the beach, good restaurants all around and of course shopping. They have a shuttle that goes to the Ala Moana Mall and comes every hour but it is best to look on the website they give you to have a live view of where they are really at.There was a bit of noise each night from the pubs below and each morning from the street construction. The room had curtains but not black out curtains, which would have been fantastic.

This hotel should not be charging more than $100. It is dirty and smelly overall. My shower was leaking ( noisy). Another guest also reported at the check in desk that they had a leaking roof. Room will not be cleaned if you don't ask, it seems.Bathroom old and small. Hairs in the shower area.The service from staff is a major problem. They act innocent and only do the basic things ( after all they just work there - that's the attitude). I had to wait hours to check in and even when I came back at the 3pm check in time - room was not ready. The staffmember said " i will let you know when ready". Shortly after, her shift finished and she went home - I was still without a room. Check in time is too late - 3pm - the day is jusst about over.They wanted to put extra fees on me to pay even though my online receipt said that I had paid all the fees. Internet is slow - you pay for it through the amenity fees.Room had a big stove and kitchen sink.No green tea. No kettle.Hard to work TV - instructions needed.I asked for an adaptor but I was not helped and asked to go buy one.One helpful thing is the fresh lemon water they have in the lobby.As I said it is not worth more than $100 a night.

Had to visit family. Decent price for location and also considering it was a holiday weekend. Staff was excellent. Next time the wife and kids have to come as well, so we may decide to stay at the ohia once again.

The condo was average for the area. The service of the front lobby staff needs improvement. Don't try parking a larger vehicle in their parking garage, it will be difficult! The housekeeping staff was very friendly.

The hotel was just okay for the price. The water ran hot and cold, which was the main put off for the hotel--- cannot take a shower with being scalded and frozen within a matter of minutes. Spotted a roach in the lobby, and was put off by the fact that parking was full (instructed to park off premises so I had to check in, then my boyfriend and I had to look for parking and uber back to the hotel). Elevator is dingy, hotel is clearly old. However, for the price, it is "okay."

House keeping didnt show up for 3 days. I had to call multiple times a day for toilet paper and clean towels. I had to dump bathroom trash my self. 3 days worth of dirty towels due to no housekeeping. And had to pay gratitude charged for

For what we paid, our stay was most certainly comfortable! The hotel staff are very friendly, there are good amenities and facilities and the highlight for us was the free DVD rentals.Location is the best!

Stayed in the hotel over Christmas. Hotel covered all basic needs. Room was very big as was the bed, and comfortable too. Air con was great. Shower was very powerful and room cleaned everyday. Could hear noise from the street every night, and family with a room on the other side of the hotel heard a lot more noise from a nearby night club until very late at night, even though they were 12 floors up. Pool area wasn't great but that isn't really a problem with the beach being a short walk away. Loads of shops near by, including 2 big shopping centres and the hotel runs a free bus to another. Loads to do in Waikiki but would definitely recommend a trip to the North Shore
