Great friendly staff and very convenient location, good sized room but was a little dated. Had a room with a kitchen which would be good for a longer stay. Also hotel has a free shuttle service. Check in and out was quick and easy.

Ants infestation poor internet loud music needs updating no parking poor shuttle service it's clean and close to beach but we basically just slept in otherwise if you wanted to relax in room or cook not recommend

The hotel locates nearby a nightclub and our room has a very thin curtain. I and my wife had to sleep in a noisy and light place. Front desk'Tim' didn't help us at all. And he was very rude, told me to read the sign and hanged up.No upgrade or anything offered. The worst part is, when I asked him did he hear anything loud, he said no and acted like he didn't know this situation at all. Previously I thought there may be a concert going on and it is not legal to play music at 1:30pm. I told Tim I am going to report this to the police, then he finally told me the truth that there is a nightclub and it is legal for them to play music at night. I then asked him when will this music end. He told me 2am(so he is actually extremely knowledge). The entire process I was very polite. But he was rude and impatient. He told me to read the sign and he hanged up. The music stopped at 2:30am. But at around 6am, the music started again from a different club. I didn't sleep at all.

5min wild to beach and shops. Rooms are old and outdated but staff is wonderful. Pool is cold, Parking is tight and hard. We were never there except to sleep and take baths so it fit our needs for a good price. Rooms need a face lift but the Beds and TV are good!

After a challenging morning, we were checked into Aqua Ohia by the kindest front desk agent, Paola S., that made my day. They were unsure our room way ready but verified it immediately. After getting into the room, it actually didn't have the kitchen I expected. I call Paola and not only did she fix the problem, but she even surprised us with chocolates later in the evening. The room was nice, clean and comfortable, the free movies a great added perk and the location perfect. Great stay!

Front desk was very helpful with questions and explaining everything. I was very impressed with their Concierge. Since this was my wife and I's first trip to Hawaii. We relied on her input and advise. She looked out for us and made sure that we had fun with anything that we wanted to do. I give her two thumbs up. The hotel itself was decent, the view was great and it was right in the middle of Waikiki so we could go anywhere we wanted.

I stayed there for 4 nights and i wouldn't do that again first id like to say the staff was just ok. I didn't get much rest at night as there are like 3 bars/clubs on the same block out back as well as a hostel the only bright spot is the restaurant that i always eat breakfast at. There were people shooting professional fireworks off at night out back i saw flashes of light going up thru the curtains followed by the loudest boom i mean made a handgun sound like a capgun. There was noise all night long. They have a tranny strip club down there too. I could go on and on about the happenings on that block not good unless thats the crowd you run with but it is across the street from the new market place with new stores. I can't recommend this place as i won't stay there again in thw future

We stayed here for just a couple days at the end of a two week vaca that included airbnb-type accommodations on Maui and Big Island. So we splurged on those and decided to save a few bucks in Honolulu. The hotel is in a fantastic location for access to all the shopping you could need -- local boutiques, souvenirs, and a relatively new mall with high end, well-known brands. And restaurants galore. Great nightlife, too, I'm sure (we had a child with us -- and if you can discount the adult video store next door). We had no trouble getting around. As for the hotel...bleh. The pics here make it look better than it is. The bed was okay (I have back issues) but the bathrooms are small, dated and a bit skeazy. Had trouble controlling the temperature of the shower and sink. We didn't use the kitchenette, though when I needed a plate for a snack, it was not clean. That said, we found the staff to be pleasant and helpful...and we loved that towels and beach chairs were at the ready (that's what the resort fee covers...but not a bad deal, if you think about it). So for location and these positives -- and for the cost -- I give 3 stars.

I mentioned about the clock radio to a male front desk person. He mentioned you did not bring your charger for your iPhone. I told him I was going to use my iPhone on the clock radio. I did not bother afterwards - customer service was lacking.

I did not like not only the room the hotel period. I hope they know about renovation and parking is too expensive for this place. I will never leave here anymore until they repair it even the TV remote does not work. Nice thing they have a stove if you want to cook yourself.

I was only there for the night, all went smoothly and I was comfortable. The carpeting in the elevator and hall way can use a upgrade. It's a light color and looks dirty and worn. The staff however was friendly and helpful

Overall great stay. Great amenities such as free loaner beach towels and beach chairs. Cool dvd rental kiosk that is also free. Pool and amenities are great. Clean rooms. Dirt cheap for being right in the heart of Waikiki. Right next door is the popular Udon restaurant and the International Market.

Parking is too narrow, my husband was so scared that he might hit the wall in the lower parking lot. $25 per day fee is ridiculously expensive for that kind of parking space. The room is small with 2 double beds & a kitchen. Price is ok but has a resort fee of $18 per day.

Bathrooms are too old, stinky and antiquated. Seems like they have never been remodeled since 1960. Water will become either too hot or too cold. My kids almost got burned taking shower. The room and kitchen area were clean and in acceptable conditions. If the bathrooms are remodeled, this hotel would be a great value for money.

Paola at the front desk took care of my every need. ..definitely a 5 star rating as well as the other staff who helped me with the bags, taxi, movies, restaurants, shopping, nightlife, zoo...everything!!Da Big Kahuna, the lobby bar, had all the football games and the staff was always warm and friendly. 5 Star all the way round!!

Everything was good. Great service and help. It was my first time here and i will most definitely be coming back again with friends. Hopefully for a weekend next time. The beds were comfortable too!!!

A good place as a base for activities in Waikiki but with minimal in-house offerings other than a place to sleep. No information about what you get for the resort fee you are charged--did not find out about a pool until after we left. One must include resort fee in your budget even though tis is not a resort as we have come to expect from going to resorts. It isa hotel, specifically a re-purposed youth hostel.

The value of the ohia was good. I was hoping for a shower tub, but only a shower was in the bathroom. The pool was a nice size, but very cold. The DVD rental station ran out of copies of DVDs very quickly.

I came to visit my boyfriend who is stationed in Hawaii and who I hadn't seen in nearly 9 months. I chose this hotel not only because of the good price, but the location was really great. There are tons of restaurants and shops that are within walking distance, including the beach.The staff was wonderful and very helpful. It wasn't anything too fancy or over the top, but it suited us just fine. The only issues we really had were the loud construction outside that started at 5 am EVERY SINGLE morning and didn't end until well past dark. Also, we would have loved for there to have been a small sofa or love seat in the TV area instead of a single chair so that we could enjoy time together when we were in the room. Other than that, everything was perfect, and we had a really enjoyable stay here.

The hotel does need a general upgrade of carpets, elevators etc. However, my twin bed room was clean and tidy with more amenities provided than I could use. The DVD/Xbox player did not work and the bathroom was a bit dated, but really the hotel is in a good location, short distance to the beach & shops. Great value for a short layover between flights.

This hotel is on Luhio so minutes to the beach and shops. Rates at New Years were higher than our previous hotel right on the beach. When we arrived the cramped lobby was full of tired tourists waiting for their rooms. In several instances we did not find the front desk staff helpful. . Rooms are small and used to be a college residence.

Would gladly stay here again! Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location, short two minute walk to the beach! Love the fact that it was central to everything - great restaurants, international market, shops! A+++

Very comfortable with the price. Good location. Less than 10min walk to the beach. Surprizingly, the view wasn't bad at all. Rare to have a lanai with this price range hotel in Waikiki. Free shuttle to Ala Moana is nice.

Aqua Ohia was a great location with great, friendly staff. One minor problem in the room but staff took care of it very quickly. Located right behind International Place and near numerous restaurants.

Hotel location was great ,close to the beach , shopping. didn't have travel far ,no need to rent a car , used public transportation for any far away attractions. Friendly staff convenient laundry facilities.

Treena was very very helpful and advised us on some of the activities we should do...and we did . Thank you Treena for all your help..When we come back we will surely stay at you Hotel !!!! We will stay at your Hotel again in the future !!!!

I stayed for six nights at the end of October, and with it being my first time in Hawai'i and first time traveling international by myself, the staff at Aqua Ohia made me feel welcome and provided some much needed guidance on food / travel / sights.A great special thanks to Matthew, and Jeremy, at the Front Desk, both of whom gave me a great insight into Honolulu and where was best to eat and go drinking. The other staff I had the pleasure of meeting were all extremely polite and it was great getting to know them all.I had a great room on level 16 and I wish my stay at Aqua Ohia could have been longer as the hotel was close to the beach / the better food places / the bus stops / I really enjoyed the service the staff provided.I did notice they said there was construction going on, and while I did hear some noise, I wasn't cooped up in my room all day listening to the sounds of it so I couldn't say that this property was noisy or not.When I return to Honolulu I hope to stay here again!

located very close to Makukame-Seimen Japanese noodle shop on Kuhio central area, you can stay there very reasonable price. Even if you are planning to trip to Hawaii as non native speaker of English like me, staffs here are very friendly and kind. No need to worry!

We really enjoyed our stay here. Great location and room was ready when we arrived early. Room was small but all we needed and beds were so comfortable. We only stayed for 1 night but wish we had selected this hotel for our whole week in Waikiki.

For future guests, please note there is a bar on the side of hotel that will keep guests awake most of the night. Once the bar finishes the guests then mingle outside which is right under the balcony area. We were on the 8th floor and it went until 5am in the morning before people dispersed. We also had issues with party people on our floor which we asked security to talk to a number of times. The walls are thin so there was no sleep at all this evening. By 2am i had got onto booking.com and booked another hotel for the next night of our staff (which was our last night). Disappointing as the staff were friendly just the location doesn't give you much sleep.

price was right and a great location as wellI would probably stay here again if neededclose to many food places and buses and trolleys i would give clients the option for the resort fee as we didn't use it at all but still had to paythank you very much

As 3star HOTEL just get comfortable and enough to stay in Honolulu.Especially the location is good.you can walk to beach shops and restaurants.It was very helpful free hire beach towle and dvd,games. Also Macdonald is near by and most shops are open till late.But not suitable for a couple and familY.pub and clubs also near by so every night you can hear loud noise till 2-3am.The room is ok.beds are comfortable but bathroom is a simple and not enough amenities.

I've stayed at many different Hotels in and around Waikiki and this Hotel is as good as any if you're not fussy. It was all I needed and felt like home after settling in. It is close to everything. Friendly staff and certainly priced right. A nice surprise for the budget minded. You have to try hard to be disappointed there. It was a great find. Yes, for me, it was as good as a room costing three times as much. They gave me a free upgrade as well. I would recommend 'The Ohia Waikiki' to you.

Second time in a Aqua hotel in Hawaii and this hotel is very poor. Bathroom needs renovating. Rooms were cramped. If you touched the shower screen it would fall down. Poor Wifi. I guess you get what you pay for

The facility is old ansd some what outdated but I loved it, it is close to The Bus stops, food courts, fast food venues, short walk to malls and the beach.The hotel is old and somewhat outdated, but clean, and in prime location to food courts, fast food venues, I Hop, and more. The Bus stops right in front of the hotel. The New International Marketplace is across the street, which is a beautiful place to spend time in. I will defiantly stay there again.

I've stayed at a lot of places in Waikiki and I actually enjoyed this place. We got a good sized room for a great price! It was nice and clean and everyone my son and I interacted with was very nice. a

Great hotel for the price. We chose it due to the access of a pentry in the room and it was perfect for us. Nothing luxurious, but quite enough! Only downside was the cockroaches in the bathroom and in the cabinets of the pentry. Other than that it was good value for money.

Do not stay here. Unclean, rude staff, loud to the point where u cang sleep, housekeeping is awful and the room smelled and had ants, the mattess was stained black anf smelled musty. Its worth the extra money to go anywhere else. Only good thing was the location

Not efficient al front deskTheta are so dole but the hotel si well locatedAy night there is a lot of music it's not easy to sleep i was in a room with view to the building with the guns and music not so good

Pretty Good place to stay, the staff was friendly and helpful, very convenient to all other places. Good location for the bus routes. Easy access to all the stores. Nice location and good location for all other places to see.

Hotel rooms were older but not junky. The biggest problem was noise, but it is not because of the hotel just being downtown Waikiki there is a big night life there. The hotel was what you would expect for the price. They cleaned it daily. Everyone was nice.

Shown room 5th floor..smelt strongly of mould. Balcony door unlock able. Then shown another even worse.Finally put on higher level ..better..but the hotel needs a massive revamp.Kitchen..there is a stove shoved in next to a sink..personally think it's dangerous and would not attempt to use it. A microwave would be more suitable for the small room.Cleaners are friendly and courteous. Front desk staff ( apart from one lovely elderly man) seemed unenthusiastic..training needed how to greet customers and even if busy at least acknowledge you are there.Location is great for shopping and restaurants but I would not stay here again.

Stayed 4 nights for thanksgiving. First time in Hawaii and felt very welcome as soon as we landed, also when we arrived at the hotel. Staff was very nice and willing to help in all our needs. We had a little problem at the beginning of the stay, we found out that there were a lot of tiny bugs in the bathroom and, as my girlfriend couldn't stand it we had to call staff. They solved it immediately, and brought us to a larger room. We enjoyed a lot being at the bar and talking to the staff in there, had party and lot of fun together! We really could feel the hospitality of Hawaiians.

It's a good hotel for a good price. The location on kuhio is good and central.Only the bathrooms need more attention to be cleaned. Pool area is small but I had a couple hour of relaxing time there. Stuff is friendly and helpful. Food at the Big Kahuna next door is good.

My stay was only one night. Front desk was awesome all around trying his best to accommodate me as I check in. Stayed in 1684 love the room and the veiwing of the buildings and the lights. Plus it had a kitchen so that was great. Thank You.

Hotel was ok close to everything staff was terrific except the concierge who gave us not so good advise on time lines for events, no ,I towards in rooms but oddly two fridges, and the place had roaches, otherwise ok

Nice hotel in the middle of Waikiki. We had had negative reviews in general concerning affordable hotels in the area, yet this one has been remodeled and is a good value for price, considering Honolulu is expensive. Good rooms, a bit small but they have kitchen, so it can help save a few bucks if you are on a budget. Nice friendly staff, too.

Pleasantly surprised about my stay here because the price I thought was very affordable! but was great location, close walk to beaches, shopping, bars, and the place maintained well.. comfy bed and basic bath amenities but again very clean and no frills. I think great value for money based on location, room size, clean room and lobby and friendly staff. I was on 4th floor, if you are a super sensitive sleeper, you can hear a little bustle noise outside, but didn't prevent me from my sleep.. if u wanna save some money and be close to everything, don't care about too much fluff. this is a good choice.

This was probably the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Do not be fooled by the pictures on the website. The "Upgraded" rooms are not represented accurately. Popcorn ceilings, tiny tiny shower that sits 12 inches away from the toilet, dirty walls, glass sliding door locks were busted but its ok they provided a small piece of metal to shove through a hole in order to "lock" the door. There are gaps around the door big enough that we could see into the hallway when the door was closed. The best way I can describe the room is the feeling of an old run down college dormitory, everything is old, everything feels dirty and you have to wear sandals in the shower.On our second morning we found bugs in the bed. Immediately requested a new room, which was granted immediately. We then received a phone call as we were packing up our current room telling us we had to go back to the lobby so that a staff member could inspect to confirm there were bugs before they would give us a new room. 30 minutes later we started the process of packing and moving again. We both had bite marks which made us feel like our skin was crawling the rest of the stay, not what I would call a very relaxing experience.The second night the fire alarm went off, which in and of itself is not a big deal, however the interaction we had with the staff was alarming. When the alarm went off, we left through the stairwell and exited the building through the only doorway at the bottom of the stairwell, an "emergency exit" door. We were greeted by a hotel staff member telling us "You can't leave through this door, it sets off an alarm". The fire alarm was very obvious outside of the building, I explained that there was already an alarm, and we left using the stairs as is protocol for any fire alarm. He said, no you are supposed to use the elevators at the front of the building. I explained to him three times that no, elevators are not supposed to be used in a fire alarm. He walked away when other people started filing out of the emergency exit door, either not wanting to confront 15 other people, or finally realizing that he was wrong. This is pretty much fire safety 101.I would understand some of the above if this hotel was half the price of others I looked at in the area, however, this is only marginally less expensive than some of the highest rated hotels in the area. It is absolutely not worth saving a couple hundred dollars to stay here. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Great for the money. Very friendly staff in every way. Clean and accommodating. One block from the beach and a prime location. Will definitely return. We even recommended this hotel to friends and they stayed and enjoyed the hotel.

Average older style accommodation currently being refurbished but certainly needed. Bed was quite hard, not comfortable and very noisy. Room was treated with pest spray which was also needed as lots of tiny ants crawling throughout the entire room. Good location but also noisy area on main road with loud bar next door.

I comparison shopped for hotels around Waikiki, and based on the pictures, price, and location thought we found s great deal. We did not. Between the resort fee and parking, the price was equivalent to much nicer places in the area. We slept poorly from terrible curtains that didn't block the light, loud music blasted in the middle of the night, and uncomfortable bedding. The shower scalded is when other rooms used their water. The entire place felt old and unkempt. We will never stay at one of these hotels again.

Room in lower floors very small, no view, lightening poor. Advertised as comes with a kitchenette. 2 burner, rusted, chipped. No microwave, again, very small. Bath molded, old, dirty, poor lightening. Carpet worn to the ground. Elevator frightening, no stairs. left side of the hotel, noisy bar, and a gun club. Waking up for gun shots was not ideal. Pool very small, in shade most of the day. Pool towels, poor quality. im not sure this place is qualified as a resort and requires a $20 daily resort fee. I would give it a 2 star. Farther from the beach than we thought, have to walk through big hotels and construction sites to get to it. On a busy street, sirens all day/night. Bottom line, noisy, old, worn, dirty. Staff is very nice, so I feel bad for this review. Cleaning personal, and front desk staff are awesome and helpful.

This property is in need of a refurbishment but isn't most of Waikiki?! Having said that we had a great 5 night stay. The bed was comfortable the aircon worked well. Housekeeping were great and kept everything nice and clean which is important when the place is that old. The staff were all very nice. The best thing about this hotel however is the location. It's such an easy walk to everything in Waikiki. We had an enjoyable stay and for the price you can't beat it.
user_name:
SarahRevvie
New York City, New York

review_body: Came out to Honolulu ( my first visit ) to tick off a couple of Bucket List items .... the volcano on Big Island and the Pearl Harbour Base ... and to see a bit of Honolulu itself. Having done some considerable overseas travelling already this year , I was looking to keep my costs down , and , being a solo traveller, wanted to also cater for myself in an apartment style room . Plus points of the hotel first :A clean , good sized room with a comfortable double bed ( though I disliked the pillows ) . The kitchenette was EXCELLENTLY equipped with everything provided , including a microwave . The bathroom was adequate if not luxurious . The free WiFi was very good , and there were a reasonable amount of channels on the TV . The air conditioning worked fine , and I enjoyed having a balcony with outdoor chairs and a table . I was particularly impressed with the ( half hourly ) free shuttle bus service provided . Actually , I initially stayed on board the bus for its full circular tour , because ( being a first timer in Honolulu ) I needed to see the places it stopped at en route . I then used it on a regular basis as it went everywhere I personally wanted to go .I found the location of the hotel ( backed up by the shuttle bus ) to be very good , There are many eateries within easy walking distance , as and when needed . There is also a well stocked ABC convenience store virtually opposite the Hotel for any snacks and drinks needed at short notice .The staff were universally friendly and most helpful . They cheerfully organised a cheap fixed-fare taxi for me to get to the airport at the end of my stay .The only negative about this hotel is the fairly late check-in time , with apparently no provision for early arrivals . If you land early in the morning at the airport , you have no option but to wait for hours in the ( not very large ) lobby . All of which means that when the check-in time actually arrives , the crush of people at the two check-in stations becomes acutely unpleasant , and it takes an eternity !Having survived the check-in process , I then began to enjoy my stay at the hotel , and what it offered . I have no hesitation in recommending it .
user_name:
Jim J
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Very low star rating for this hotel. Very dirty. It does not look like the pictures in the internet. Very small. The lift had rubbish in it. The hall ways were dirty. The standard room was so much smaller than the picture.

Horrible wet carpet that stunk, awful view outside to low income housing properties and a woman getting best up in the very next room The strip club was going on all night. The lobby was old and the coffee you get was in a Dixie cup

The staff was very nice and helpful and the location of the hotel was great, but the quality of the room was just terrible. The bed was very uncomfortable, and they only used a top sheet on the mattress that would come up in the middle of the night. The chairs were very old and uncomfortable, and there was no comfortable place to sit and watch TV together, so we would put pillows and blankets on the VERY hard floor. Our room was right next to a construction site, and between the noise from that and the uncomfortable mattress, we didn't sleep well our entire trip. One day we were so desperate we even looked around for affordable massages to get the kinks out of our necks and backs. The bathroom was also very small, with just a tiny stall shower with an awkwardly placed shower head. The bathroom door was also falling apart, since it was a cheap one with laminate over the composite wood, and the laminate was splintering and peeling off at the top. The room also smelled really weird when we arrived, and we found out later that it was the AC; whenever it was on, the room smelled funky. If we had the sliding door to the balcony open, it aired out pretty quickly. I've seen the other Aqua hotels around Waikiki, and they are all much nicer than this place. This hotel needs a serious renovation, and quickly. Overall, I felt like they were asking for too much for what we got and we were very disappointed since we wanted something better on our honeymoon. Very little romance was had in this room because we were so uncomfortable. I would not stay here again if given a choice.

Hotel was near everything. 2 short blocks to beach. If you're looking for top of the line this isn't it. Hotel is clean and comfortable, bathroom was really small, but we were only there for a few days so we could live with it. Would be ok if I had to stay here again.

Good stay short walk to beach lots of places to eat nearbyHotel provides their guest with beach chairs and beach towels which was very convient .Having a kitchen saved on buying food everyday since we prepared breakfast in our room.

Location, staff and price are the biggest plus for this hotel. It definitely needs some upgrades and renovations such as fresh coat of paint, black out curtains and just some updates in the bathroom can make this place outstanding.

Good location you can walk to almost everything. Building was outdated together with the decor and appliances inside the room. The price was ok however, had to charge for parking and resort fee although the facility did not feel like a resort.

This hotel had exceptional service but was run down. Terrible choice for a stay in a gorgeous destination. We actually checked out early due to cockroaches. Seek an alternative for lodging, you will not regret it.

Suppose to stay at Aqua Skyline but was relocated to Ohia due to plumbing/flooding problems; good location, great staff but older property with possible mold issues; balcony railing needs to be secured, very shaky

The Ohia Waikiki is reasonably priced and convenient to restaurants, shopping and the beach. For more extensive travel, the bus system is available and the staff was able to recommend which number to take for our various excursions.

The parking area and signs could be better. An it confused when trying to find the parking and how to park during checking in. Also wasn't sure how to get out of parking. Had to figure out on our own.

We picked this hotel on price and location you can read from the reviews what you want but we found the hotel to be what it is 3 stars. Staff were lovely pictures definitely from when brand new much more used and dated decor now. Small pool area but was deep and refreshing when needed. Lower floors very noisey we were on 3rd and was terrible but we managed ok. Car park below is a tricky one to get down into but no stress really. $18 per day resort fee is a ripoff but all places charge this type of fee and $25 parking same type of deal. ABC stores accross street and a mini superette and mcDonald just along street and subway with some bars and small restaurants. Worth what you pay.

Great staff, good location near enough to Waikiki beach, especially for the price. Renovation/Updating needs to be completed, however, as stated before - for the price this was a great place to select.

I have stayed in just about every hotel in Waikiki at one time or another. I know the issues that they all face and can make a comparison. For an older property, I would say that they are doing well with this one. They have made soft upgrades such as painting and bedding. Why do millions in upgrades for a budget property. It's clean and the beds are comfortable. It does not have black-out curtains, so you really need to sleep when it gets dark (like people in Hawaii do). The shower grout appears to be dirty, but this is normal with people using the shower with sand on their feet. The bath was perfectly clean. The location can't be beat, if you wish to be close to shopping and dining (across from the International Marketplace). It's a couple of blocks to the beach. It's also right on Kuhio Avenue, which is where The Bus (the city bus) runs through Waikiki. For a two star property it does very well in its class. For those from the Mainland, you can't compare Motel 6 prices with Hawaii prices. For those that are unhappy with the "old" building, let me tell you, there are far worse! If you want First Class, then pay four times more. I enjoyed staying here, and also would like to compliment the staff for First Class service.

The only reason we chose this hotel is due to the special offer of FREE airport shuttle service that was to be included. After reservation was made & we went to schedule this shuttle pickup we found out that they admitted to having the wrong wording on the website & that they were fixing it. The shuttle service was only discounted. After we were there, the rooms were pretty good, the main rooms were nice & bathrooms looked like they were getting improved some. The air conditioning wasn't very powerful & had to turn all the way up to really feel it, but overall was decent.Beds were very comfortable.

My sister was in an accident and I flew to Hawaii to be with her. The hospital concierge pointed me to this hotel. I am so grateful. Although it's an older building, it was very clean and the room had a stove, small fridge and sink and dishes. Small balcony with a glimpse of the beach. A short walk to the beach and shopping. There is a pool area and on site parking (at about $25/nite).

Travelling with a group, wife and I got a room with a single King bed, 10th floor corner with a balcony view of the building across the street, I chuckled. Positives - large room with area for my wife to work out, decent TV and a PS3 i think to play games and DVD's . I liked the bed, too firm for wife. Mini-fridge and stove, but no microwave? Didn't ask, not sure if one could be obtained. Good A/C, nice little swimming pool. Decent WiFi. Negatives - $25/night parking, i had a rental car reserved and parked it on the street a couple block away, had to go grab it early to avoid a parking ticket. Kinda cramped shower for a big guy like me, dumb is such a big room. Very loud outside all night, but room fairly soundproof (I guess that's sort of a positive). Carpet in the room about the thinnest i've ever seen, like an indoor/outdoor type. Overall not a bad place to stay unless you have more money. Its definitely not a 5 star type place, but worked well for our purposes.

This is a very basic hotel which our travel agent booked us into without seeking our approval. Everything is so old we felt we were staying at a backpackers hotel. Not again. There was so much noise from drunks in the street at 2.00am.

Pricey for an old building. Staff are not even greeting their guests. Shower door is rusty and getting stucked when closing. Room darkening curtain is thin. The sun wakes you up because room is too bright. Paint is bubbling and peeling in the bathroom

Location is very good. Staff efficient and friendly. Room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom was bad. Lots of mildew in the grout in shower. Fixtures old. Junk shower head. Bathroom floor stained so looked dirty. In general had a old, tired feel to it. Stale smell when we first entered room but we quickly go used to it especially if opened doors to air out a bit. We have stayed in 3 or 3-1/2 star hotels much nicer than this one. Too bad because with a spiffing up it could be nice.

The room has a very strong smell on mold and old. The bathroom sealing has mold, the windows are not soundproof at all, it looks dirty and everything wearn out. The building and hallways, carpets, elevators it's dirty and outdated.

They changed the room in us. Didn't accommodate our requests. When we checked in to the room there was hair on the bathroom sink plainly visible. The room was so loud that you couldnt relax. The smell? Gross. Very poor experience

We had a comfortable stay at this hotel. The main reason that we rated it a 4 was because of the condition of the room... It was very clean but very the carpet was stained in a few places and the bathroom and kitchenette need updating. There was evidence that there were improvements being made though. In other parts of the hotel. All of the staff were very accommodating and made our stay a great time!

Room had many bugs and was not clean! Very loud from noises from the street(Music/people yelling etc). Safety Box was out of order and toilette flush needed twice to be fixed (what they did very promptly).

Another pleasant stay in paradise. The location of the Ohia Waikiki is great. All the staff whether reception, housekeeping or other were very helpful, respectful and pleasant. This is a place that I highly recommend.

The Ohia is a hidden jewel. We're on a short trip to Waikiki for some R & R and to attend a family wedding. We were not looking for anything fancy but were pleasantly surprised by how chic and well kept the rooms were. The staff here is amazing and the rooms have a fresh upgrade from what it used to look like. The kitchen was very convenient to have, traveling with 2 little ones eating out gets expensive. The property is a block away from the newly renovated recently re-opened International Marketplace. Keep in mind if you're looking for a "quiet" room just do yourself a favor and stay out of Waikiki or ask for a room high enough away from the city noise (it's unavoidable if you want a hotel in a great location). The room was kept clean at all times and nothing really to complain about other than I wish we had more time to spend on your beautiful island! Thank you again for your hospitality we hope to be back again soon!Arlene & Family

We notice that the room is not that clean when we arrived in our room the garbage can is full and the veranda is full of cigarette butts. Then when we ask to clean our room the next day they not even clean the bathroom they just replenish and change the towel but not bother to clean the toilet the sink and the floor the water spill was still there. I hope you guys improve it.

Had such a good time staying here. Matt, Skye, David, Omar and Ese were so helpful and kept my chatterbox dad entertained. They all had great suggestions for activities, food place and booking shuttles etc through them was never a hassle. They really made you feel welcomed. Location has major bus stops near it and has parking if you hire a car. Short walk to Lewers street, restaurants, nightclubs and the beach. The hotel also does free shuttles to the shopping centre. The beds were comfortable but slightly noisy at night when drunk people are walking home. Would definitely stay here again.

I loved the location. They offer beach towels and chairs. Excellent on site travel person. She's fantastic. Lot of places to see. Not far from the beach and plenty of access to shopping and dining. I found the restaurants to be reasonably priced.

Beds way too hard unable to sleep drapes ro thin and sheer outside city noise and sun not stopped room completely lit up by sunlight at 5:45 a.m. if you are looking for a good night sleep you will not find it at this hotel
user_location: Tenorio Volcano National Park, Costa Rica
user_name:
robertsC9959PU
Tenorio Volcano National Park, Costa Rica

review_body: Its a great and safe location close to restaurants, clubs, the international market, Royal Hawaiian Centre, everything within walking distance plus the staff are great - very helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean too :-)

Great location near the beach and shopping center. The rooms are outdated and could use a spruce up. The bed and pillows are comfy. There was a slight fish odor in our room plus the hallway. The bathrooms are okay. The toilet seat and counters were chipping. The shower area is a bit small. The staff at Ohia were a delight.

There's no where to pull in, in front of the hotel to check in, spouse had to go around the block a de times. Also no parking at the actual hotel, had to park a block away (or more) at another hotel that was more expensive than the Ohia Waikiki! I am just glad that I had my spouse with me, I can just imagine how scary it could be to walk through an area I am not familiar with pulling my suitcase in the middle of the night.I know Waikiki is fun and excitement, but not when i can hear all the hooting and hollering from inside my room.The hotel service was not terrible, I did not stay at the hotel long enough to utilize any amenities or interact with any staff outside of checking in and checking out.

Curtains need blinds behind them. Drain needs to be fixed in room 185 slow drain in the shower stall. The desk needs a chair in the room. Bar across the street is pumping music pretty loud into the night.

Couple with an 8year old child get put on the 10th floor in room 1089, got out of the lift go around the corner and walk all the way to the end, cant find our room was a little strange, then we saw the Fire Escape door with a little blue sign on it saying room 1089 was through this door - yep right out into the outside of the hotel ( on the 10th floor ) it was windy as anything, the hotel door was jammed shut, had to push so hard to open the door - small room, two beds no space for anything, sliding door with a lock that was a joke, balcony that was shakey, couldn't sleep a wink thinking of my daughter, got up at 5am, went down to reception (it was as if they were waiting on me to come down) told them the issue, didn't sleep, didn't feel safe, was asked if we could move straight away (to which we never unpacked) yes we can, we have a room ready on the 5th floor, I said sorry for complaining, I normally don't, she said don't worry EVERY one does.....pay for parking $5.00 per night, pay for a daily allowance of Towels, shuttle bus $18.00 per day even if you don't use the service you still pay and a hotel fee of $46.00 Australian dollars for nothing, would never ever stay here again.

Hotel staff very attentive- on the edge of Waikiki - grounds need a little spruce up. We were only in town for 2.5 days so fit our needs. Not in the best part of town, However, staff was great. Be prepared to pay for parking.

The price and location of the hotel were ideal. We ditched our rental car because we could easily walk around Waikiki from there. The shuttle service to the mall was a simple way to explore other areas of Honolulu. The staff was superb. All and all, a pleasant vacation!

Great location and staff. What you read in reviews is true about the shape of the hotel. It is very outdated. The bed was comfortable and clean. We were disgusted when a supervisor called an employee off his shift to check if he actually made the decision to not charge us $18 for a special local tax. Our confirmation said our stay was paid in full. I think there is a management problem. Staff all over was very helpful and cheerful. My review for service is only for the floor folks. We feel that supervisor's action and the way she acted with us was unprofessional. Noise from construction was loud early morning and evenings (we were out during the day).

I thought the hotel was good value for the money. It is centrally located and easy to get places from. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable about the area and able to assist with tour planning and things.

Awesome stay for quick weekend trip. Great location, good value for money and good bed which is important. Only thing is the shower drainage needs to be fixed as smells comes out whilst showering. Other than that above all great stay.

Parking sucks, noise level was high and Windows didn't block the noise from nightclubs next door. I struggled finding parking every day that I was there. The rooms are spacious but I will never stay here again.

The location was great. Concierge was not helpul or she just dont want to help or act like ahe is new to Hawaii. Just check your bill before you check out. Make sure you were not billed other charges.

Aqua Ohia is centrally located in Waikiki. The overall value for staying here exceeded our expectations! The staff is very friendly and accomodating. We slept so good and comfortably we almost missed our flight! Haha...

picked the hotel through the airlines package, could inprove parking especially for 25.00 a day and being blocked in because there were to many cars. could use a computer and a printer for guest, beds and pillows were very comfortable. a good size room for what we need durning our brief stay. The curtins were thin a lot of light came thru the room was too light at night. The kitchen had plates, silverware, cups, coffee maker, refrigerator but no micro wave or stove/burner.

Found this hotel on booking.com. I choose this hotel based on price and location. Pleasantly surprised by room size and decor, not generic like some I've stayed at. Rooms clean and have all the amenities that you would expect. The wifi connection and speed worked flawlessly. Only a five minute walk from Waikiki beach.

The building and rooms need major updating. The air conditioning could only be set at low, medium, high which we could never put the room at a comfortable temperature. The carpet was gross and the bathrooms were extremely old. The hotel needs major updating.

Wonderful staff ,wonderful experience. Window blinds can be thicker to block out early morning light for a better sleep. Wonderful front desk staff that are helpful. Iced water at guest area for proper hydration against the heat.

We travel a lot and have never met such wonderful caring staff members as at this hotel.Paola and PT went out of their way to make sure everything was wonderful.The location was great, the pool offered shade which few hotels do, the cost was affordable, and the accommodations were more than acceptable.If we return, we will definitely stay there again.5 stars!

Superb location and view.....very good housekeeping service with honest staff....left some personal items after checking out..but we're sent to me overseas...kudos to Sarah and her staff............a bit outdated toilet...front desk staff needs a bit of customer service with a smile..... generallly a good choice to stay in Waikiki...

we enjoyed are stay and this is a perfect place to say. I will probably book this hotel the next time I come to Hawaii. The Hotel was clean and the accommodations were wonderful. It was my wife's birthday and they put two boxes of candies and a card when the cleaned the room, I've never seen any hotel do that before.

I had a fantastic room and the staff was awesome. Since I was staying a week I really appreciated all their suggestions for meals and transportation. Loved the DVD rentals. I was able to catch up on all the current movies.

Aqua Ohia needs to have a friendlier, more efficient and knowledgeable staff. They also need staffs who genuinely shows concern and care for their guests, especially if they did something very inconvenient to their guests. They need staff who knows how to recognize their mistake and apologize for it.

Had bottom floor with view of garbage cans...Parking was tough. You could hear outside noises all day and night. Resort fee was ok, bettter than most hotels we stayed at. Traffic was always a problem.

Customer Service was great, friendly service throughout the facility. Rooms were pretty clean and comfortable. The location of this hotel, is perfect! Just a walk away from everything. The one thing that will keep me coming back is the lower price available for rooms.

overall it was a great stay. the ramp for the garage needs to be flatten so it does not scrap the bottom of the vehicle. The door for the card reader for Rm 790 is missing the cover. Many of the washers are inoperable.

The cleanliness was deplorable. The common area bathroom floor has not been swept in at least 2 weeks; same with our bathroom floor. Truly a trashy hotel. I understand it is lower budget, but cleanliness should be a top priority. The unit was supposed to be a king bed, we got two doubles. Only 2 front desk people working while others stood around so it took forever to even speak to someone. The sliding door in our room would barely open or close. Just horribly disappointing.

Parking not available if you check in late, had to park down the street. Air conditioner was not working, staff made us feel like iit was our fault for not informing them as soon as we checked in. If we notified them sooner they could have changed our room

A lot of different restaurants at reasonable prices; Udon, Korean, Thai, etc; I was so surprize to see many many people in que for Udon, it is available much easily in Japan. Close to bus stops, tax free shoppings, and several minutes walk to the beach. Comfortable size of the room with mini kitchen. Everything is good.

Not bad for a budget hotel, but like all Aquas beware the small, tight parking spaces. Single room came with a fridge and stove if you need it. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Every room had a balcony. Best thing about it is it sits in the middle of Kuhio Ave; a short walk away to every restaurant, shop, mall, worth being at, and for a whole lot cheaper than a premium hotel. 4 nights ran me about 600 where that would've gotten me only 2 nights at bigger hotel. It ain't perfect, but worth the price.

You can't beat the location! Rooms are small and dated. Check-in is 3pm strict. A couple of bars next to the hotel. Pool is super small. Hotel offers excellent Tv entertainment and did rentals included in the resort fee.

Upon checkin there is an additional charge of $18 a night and $25 a day for parking. I needed an extra room key and the person was unable to make one after delaying us 15 minutes. The pool was refreshing for the kids - yet small.

If you are looking to save money this is the place. The rooms are old and smell a bit. They do it clean your room and tidy your bed daily, which I am used to. The only trash can they provide is in the bathroom. So you have to make an extra effort to stay tidy yourself.

A good location to Waikiki. We just used it as a place to stay after getting in late, and heading to the North Shore the next day. Small kitchenette, but even smaller beds. They say they are doubles, but they are more like a super single. Very difficult for two to sleep in those beds.

By Karen, Sept. 28, 2016 I stayed for two nights. Easy to find, helpful staff, everything you would need to cook your own meal. Home away from. In-house DVD's for free. Close to the beach, stores, and attractions. Shuttle provided to several great points of interest including one of the largest open outdoor shopping center known as the Ala Moana Shopping Center.

Very good location and great staff. I would recommend to someone wanting to be close to beach and all Main Streets. We may have gotten the wrong room category and maybe would book earlier next time. We had quick service to the cruise port as we were going on a cruise and the hotel was in a great location

We stayed for one night and it was awesome and it was a beautiful view and peaceful environment and quiet. It has a stove pots pans coffee maker and fridge and much more. I will be going back very very soon.

The location is great! Walking distance from beaches and a shopping center. I suggest to book a rent a car even though there is $25/ day for a parking in the building. The hotel offers beach towels and DVD and Games. Those fees are already included in the hospitality fee (18$/day) in the original charge.

There is no heater in the pool, super cold. Shower pressure was no existent. 7 movies in the "unlimited" DVD kiosk. Parking is $25 and next door is $18. Could barely open balcony door. Was told we had a king size bed for my fiancé and I, when we got in the room there were 2 full size beds.

Went to see a show at fusions waiting this hotel was located in the perfect area which is only walking distance. No drinking and driving for me. Location of hotel is great it's walking distance to shops and restaurants as well.

The location is great. Centrally located. The service from the staff was great. Courteous and friendly...really welcoming. I would recommend to anyone looking for a nice hotel which isn't too busy to stay at the Ohia

Stayed one night, and check in was efficient, plus got a free DVD rental from the kiosk. The room was spacious and comfortable, the lanai was pretty large. Had a kitchen, and would have been cool if I stayed longer. Good value for the price. Its a bit of an older property, but the bed was very comfortable. Parking could be tight, if it's a busy night, but if you don't have a car, you are right in the middle of everything. Cool bars, restaurants, coffee, all within a few blocks.

location is great ,staff are friendly,bed are comfy,the beach towl is clean,the shuttle bus is conveniet ,every thing is perfect! And i would definitely recommend staying here to my friends and family.

Room rate was awesome and there was a stove which is good although I didn't use it. The only bad thing was that the Parking fee is Ridiculous, $25 a day and bathroom had hair in the shower and on the floor, room smelt old. My husband was in the hospital so stayed alone.

Friendly atmosphere overall great place to stay i would definitely recommend staying here to my friends and family.The staff were awesome and courteous.I'm not sure if she was a manager but I'm greatful to have met a kind person with aloha....

Great location. You can walk everywhere, and it's only two blocks from the beach. It's close to the bus and trolley. Old hotel in need of an update, even though it states it has been refurbished! Very friendly and helpful staff, especially front desk staff.

The lobby and pool are beautiful, the staff were friendly and helpful, the bar next door is dodgy (and awesome) and the bed was comfortable - we were on the 14th floor had a great view from the balcony. The room was run down and desperately in need of basic maintenance; the bathroom was falling apart, the door didn't work; the electrical outlet my phone was plugged into exploded (wrecking my adapter) and it definitely wasn't a quiet. The price was right, but I wouldn't likely stay again and I wouldn't have stayed there if I had been travelling solo.

This is a place to stay if you like being close to everything as well as if you like to cook to save money the hotel is grate and the staff is wonderful. The international market place is right there.

The location was convenient, the staff were friend but the room was below average. The website pics are deceptive, as the room appears renovated. Upon arrival the lobby is nice looking, but the room was a different story... It was old, things were broken, it was not very clean and the bathroom needs a sledgehammer. The bed was decent though.

I came to Waikiki for a short vacation. The rooms in the pictures do not show the regular room with Kitchen. Kitchen means that you get a tiny stove top and a dorm size fridge. The paint was peeling. The lighting was dark. The hotel seems very old and not updated. Good - only short walk thru the International Marketplace to the beach. One block off of the beach is close.

If you want a basic clean hotel in Waikiki this place fits the bill. We had no internet service our entire 8 night stay, and parking is very tight, and $25 extra per night. Located directly behind the International Market.

The lobby is quite nice and deceiving because the rooms are not. The bathroom is disgusting! This hotel needs a lot of work and it wasn't clean and it smells like bleach. The staff were as helpful as possible but couldn't help us with some things. I don't recommend staying here at all. The only good things were the location and the free shuttle to Ala Moana and the bed was moderately comfortable.

This hotel locates in the center of Waikiki, and we was able to go to Waikiki beach for 5 minutes by walk. And then, since all rooms of this hotel has kitchen amenities, we were able to cook breakfast.

Limited access to the Internet in the rooms. Towels were small. If I was to come back I wouldn't utilise Elite services in the lobby, Limited access to car hire ect. Weren't forthcoming in telling us about the parade on Saturday which was celebrated yearly!! Short answers to your questions, was like pulling teeth from a chicken to find out what was available to do.Hotel Staff where fantastic.. This hotel was clean but I would have liked something a little more updated

Not worth they money staying here. Small showers, our shower had a constant dripping leak, check in took forever. Run down hotel needs a renovation. The balcony railing was sketchy, I touched it and it moved.

Super slow wifi that's very frustrating, no printer for guests to use, cleaning routine not consistent. Coffee snobs need to buy their own coffee elsewhere. Good location close to business conferences, shops and restaurants.

Good service, friendly staff, the hotel is close to the shopping mall and a food court. This is our second time visit Honolulu, we really enjoyed our one week stay in Hawaii. We will visit Hawaii's other Islands again in the future.

The hotel needs total refurbishment as it looks hotel is 1970'sThe location is very goodParticular improvement needed in the bathrooms and change of furniture in the rooms Common areas and lift needs to be updated

Parking is very tight and expensive ! Easy to scrape the wall - only one car should go down the steep incline at s time to avoid problems...$25 a day for parking plus more taxes and fees..however the girl that helped dos everything she could to be kind and try to make it right and I had a tiny room but a great view

Perfect location, right in the middle of Waikiki amenities and most important few min away from amazing beaches. Reasonable price, friendly and helpful staff. Comfy room, great view. No breakfast facilities.

They told us our reservation was cancelled somehow by Expedia, which never happens- we think they were covering up for their own mistakes. Then they tried to put us in a lower-grade room. They didn't clean the floor for the three nights we were there. Staff extremely unfriendly. Really, if you want to have a nice time, DO NOT STAY HERE.

Expensive for a cheap dirty and poorly managed room. Not enough parking spots and forced to pay for resort fees and parking when there wasn't enough spots and nothing resort like about the hotel we stayed at

A very pleasant surprise. Great location helpful staff. The staff were also very helpful in advice and organising shuttles. An older hotel with a comfy bed, spotlessly clean. Great value for moneyVery efficient checkin and check out. Will definitely stay here our next trip to Hawaii.

Pros: - Good location, 5-10 min walk to everything you need in WaikikiCons: - Too much overpriced for what you get (I understand it's Waikiki, but 18$/day resort fee doesn't make you "resort")- Old, everything needs refreshment. Refrigerator under the TV (should it be there?) doesn't worked.- Loud, we could hear absolutely everything what was happening in the neighbor room (our room was on the 17th floor). Actually , we asked to change it, but were rejected due to "sold out" while there was the "vacancy" light on the entrance door

Very helpful and friendly staff, comfy beds and pillows, clean rooms, great location close to shops restaurants and beach, close to bus stops, great price. Loved our stay - would definitely stay there again.

The Title speaks for itself. on arrival the Rooms were not available as requested. We had requested a Double & a Twin side by side on a high Floor. We finished up with the Double on Floor 15 and the Twin, after 3 Hours of stalling, on Floor 2. They both should have been empty and awaiting our arrival as we had already paid for the previous night so that they would be available when we arrived.

Very friendly staff, about 10min from beach, 20ish from the zoo. Pool was cold and pretty dirty (though we did watch them clean it! Just a bad location for pool) We would stay there again for the price!

Good location. Bathrooms could use an update but overall we had no problems and a great stay at Ohia. Travel desk was helpful and couldn't fault the staff. Very helpful to us and as we arrived early they let us into our room to rest. Great time had by all

An older hotel but location is great. It's close to the beach, international marketplace, restaurants, bus stops and ABC stores. The staff were friendly. Just wish our room was better. We stayed at the one with a kitchenette. The refrigerator have a moldy smell (i didn't like opening it cause i couldn't stand the smell), the faucets in the kitchen had some kind of mildew on it. The bathroom was outdated and had a weird smell. The air conditioner was weak, we couldn't feel it. Our safe was broken, i told the front desk about it but nothing was done to fix it during our stay. Which is disappointing because it was part of the resort fee. This hotel needs a major upgrading, once they do, then maybe i'll think about staying here again.

A very pleasant stay. Will definitely come back and it has everything that you'll need! The beach is super close and the friendly staff made it super welcoming. There is a washer and dryer that made my life easier!
user_name:
Brian Doyle L
San Francisco, California

review_body: Poor I can't recommend to any one. The hotel management is no concern on safety of the the guest.Improve your parking ramp to accommodate larger vehicle. The scratches on the wall are visible to the public and no improvement have been done.

Great location excellent staff very knowledgable of the area and the resteraunts and very friendly.If you a reasonably priced hotel then this is one of the better ones in Waikiki and I have stayed at a lot of hhotels in the area

The hotel was older though looked renovated. The staff was understanding on some things, though the A/C in the room did not work well at times. The parking was charged although we had a sticker in the window and I thought that was how you did not get charged... I could have misunderstood that. Checkout was not a great experience. Still, the place is a good price for the location and the hotel is in okay condition.

This hotel pleasantly surprised me. Waikiki is expensive and we needed 2 rooms so moved back off the main strip and chose Aqua Ohia. Great service the rooms are clean and spacious. Bathrooms are a little older but always clean and serviced everyday with clean towels. The staff are friendly you get beach towels to go to the beach which is less than 10mins walk. You walk through dukes market or the international market place and you end up in the beach right in front of the royal Hawaiian resort! Buy yourself a beach umbrella from the ABC store but this hotel is super central to restaurants night life and shopping and in a safe area of Waikiki not in back street or anything. Would recommend this hotel to people on a stricter budget. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here!! Thank you

The Ohia is an older property so set your expectations accordingly. Plastic sliding doors on the bathroom do not provide much privacy. Staff worked hard to take care of our needs but the hotel could use a renovation. If you need a roll away bed, you might as well sleep on the floor as the roll aways were terrible. OK property for the price.

Very friendly, nothing was a problem, always clean , very central Had a problem with dryer reported to front desk, by time I got back to laundry, maintaince was there waiting for me, fixed in no time with a smile

Overall this is a friendly & reasonable priced hotel. Close to Waikiki beach & shops & market place. The staff are fun & friendly & always offer to help you for anything like directions, recommended places to visit & are simply there to have a friendly chat or you need any services during the stay. I very highly recommend this hotel & will be back in the future. Mahalo Aqua OHIA

Staff was extremely helpful, especially with my 4 year old. Older place, parking was challenging to find and kind of hard to park, but once in I felt comfortable and safe. Almost closed gate on my rental car but were careful once I spoke to them.

Clean room with small lanai and a very small shower with a kitchnet for us to have breakfast and a snak at night, walking distance to the waikiki beach, dukes beach, restaurants (lots of them), bars and shoppings. ABC stores are in every single street corner, supermarkets and laundry places. Very friendly staff, but be aware of the parking fee on the hotel. Good for couples, family with kids.

Great staff. Friendly, spontaneous, and professional. The building and facilities were rather disappointing. The room was super small. The shower head made super loud noises when the water started running. We had a big water leak from the wall so we had to move into another room. Made it an even terrible experience since we were traveling with a 3-year-old and a 9-month-old.

Needs a major update. Smell is terrible throughout. Broken bathroom door. Small rooms. Poor lighting. I would suggest to spend the extra money elsewhere so that you can be comfortable. This hotel was definitely a waste of money and I would not recommend it. Wifi did not work and staff was not helpful in fixing it.

The given Room had Carpet and Kitchenette appliances well past use-by date, above all had no WiFi coverage. Technician could not be reached. All Rooms shown as replacement had one problem or the other like either no WiFi or defective Safe. Replacement Room could not be provided until more than 24 hours.

Convenient location to shops, restaurant & beaches. Room rate reasonable. Ask about their beach amenities when checking in, not always remembered by the staff. In the one bedroom suite (Rm 108) ask to have the phone moved to the living/kitchen room from the bedroom. Can't always here the phone ring from staff and most of the time is spent in the living area and not the bedroom.

18 dollars for each day on top of the price per room very bad , one employee very helpful and quickly look into a situation with the room. not supply a good plastic bags for laundry .washer machines very dirty with left over soap , may be the machines don't work properly .

My stay was comfortable no major complaints except that housekeeping would forget to replenish amenities. Was also thrown off by the extra charges but that is my fault for not reading the fine print. It was noisy at night but I expected that (given the location).
user_name:
Corady T
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: Good choice, clean, close to beach & all shops, good bus service around the city Booked in advance. Long taxi ride from airport. Should have checked for a airporter to the hotel Don't know if they have one.

No stovetop, fridge didn't work, bathroom door couldn't close 100%. Gum on our floor. I was supposed to have a 2 bed room but got a 1 bedroom for 3 people. Air conditioning not cold even on the HIGH setting and it is very loud. Not enough parking stalls for the amount of people staying there. The only good thing is the staff is nice. Very disappointed, never staying here again.

terrible. overcharged. parking impossible. hidden extremely high hold on the credit card. I was not happy with how my account was handled. and am still waiting for the hold to be released. ridiculous to have been charged multiple times for a 3 day stay. absurd.

The Hotel is well located, but unfortunately in my stay, I arrived at 9am for the check-in, I understand the check-in hours so I patiently waited until 3pm even though I waited for a long time my room wasn't ready and I received it at 4:30pm, but if you do your check out after 12:30m you will be charged $50 more... not fair at all. I tried to negotiate with the manager for a 1pm check-out and he refused and told me that I'll be charge if I dont do my check-out on time. very unfriendly manager. UNFAIR UNFAIR

Room did look like website leaves a lot to desire. Sliding door does not lock,shower door does not stay closed when showering, ac works poorly. No mirror over sink. Over all room needs some work. Shower floor looks like it needs to be really scrubbed .

We need a place to stay overnight after a long day from work and school to attend our son's school orientation for the evening and to avoid a lengthy drive back to Waianae due to President Obama arriving to Oahu for a few events on his working agenda. Also to avoid an early morning commute back to Diamond Head from Waianae.

Spent a week comfortably and enjoyed the friendly and helpful staff. The accommodations were no frills but functional. Could use a microwave instead of an oven. The patios are nice with or without a view. I would stay here again and recommend it for an affordable and comfortable place to rest. DVD rental is good too for the kids.

We were concerned based on reviews but our room was fine. It was aged but it was clean and tidy and close to everything. We would most likely stay here again if we return. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating.

This hotel is okay for a brief stop in the crowdy Waikiki. The room are okay - this is not Hilton - The staff is kind and helpful. Our room on the 5th floor was okay and just enough high to be standing out of the city night rumbles and noise. Nice pool. The are making efforts to make the lobby charming with live music at night and little snacks for customers.

Arrived here at Aqua Ohia Waikiki and I had an issue with the reservation. The agent was very calm and told me to call my booking agent who fixed everything. After that everything was a breeze, my room was nice and clean and comfy. The hotel is conveniently located in a great spot meaning access to busses, shops and of course Waikiki beach!

Hotel is in a good location one block down and 2 blocks to the side of Waikiki beach. This is a recently acquired building for the group. The room did not have any shelves in the closet to put clothes. Sink in kitchenette doubled as sink for bathroom. It was clean. Safe did not work. Asked to have it fixed, was told that they can't. Asked for wake up call on two different days. Neither time the wake up call did not eventuate. If you are in Hawaii you are there to explore. The hotel was adequate but not a wow....

The staff was very freindly & helpful. Will defintiely come back. Elevators and carpets in public areas need to be replaced and upgraded. Free DVDs are a good idea. Noise in corridors can be loud. Kitchenette ok but dated.

I'm giving this hotel a high overall rating because of how conveniently close it is to everything. Sure the room was a little small and the hotel itself seemed a little beat up, but the bed was comfortable, everything in the room worked, the kitchen was handy, and the staff was friendly. It isn't the fanciest hotel around and I would give a higher rating if it wasn't so expensive. For the price I paid and all the resort fees, I expected to be more impressed. But I can't complain too much because nothing else was really wrong with the hotel except for the shower head fell off when I adjusted it haha. Also, my room was extremely dusty.

Great little hotel with everything you need in Waikiki at you're finger tips. Staff are very friendly & made us feel very comfortable. I would stay here again & recommend the Aqua Ohio to my friends. I had a small hiccup with the 1st room given but the young man checking me in rectified it in no time & personally guided me to our new room. New bonus to its location is the opening of the International Marketplace across the road, with shops & resturant stop please any traveller

The hotel was great. Had small issue with room and staff took care of problem right away. They offered to upgrade to jr. Suite at no charge for the rest of our stay. The staff was very friendky and helpful. Very close to waikiki beach.Would stay here again.

Our first room was definitely no frills and quite small for two. We moved to a larger studio and that was great. Water pressure in the shower was minimal. The pool was tiny and not clean. Convenience of being close to the beach and the price of the room per night as well as having a full kitchenette outweighed the negatives. We saved money on accommodation and used that for activities. Ask for a large room when booking.

Our hotel was set up to look and feel like an apartment away from home. Had everything you needed to make the stay enjoyable and easy to function in. I stayed on the ninth floor and the view was absolutely amazing because it overlooked the downtown area. Overall had the perfection location to shop, eat, and was even close to the beach! I would definitely stay there again when I return to the island at another time!

I believe that what I paid for my staying in the hotel is not fair & reasonable. In the web site you see a "nice hotel", However, in reality the building looks old and the rooms needs improvement plus the pool area. After remodeling the hotel the price could be fair, right now... I don't think so
user_name:
Sonia Estefani ... R
New York City, New York

review_body: One of the older hotels. bathrooms need an upgrade and shower wasn't the cleanest. pool area was nice but very loud and packed. wouldve been a great location if I had wanted to stay cheap and central so i could shop.

Hotel is in the heart of Honolulu, restaurants are all over the hotel, and also grocery stores. Beach is 10 minutes walking distance. Very busy Japanese restaurant is next to the hotel, Marukame udon - there is always a line but food is cheap so i recommend to try even you have to wait. So location is perfect, but hotel is not the best, i found a lot of bugs during night time. You can't see them during day but over night they are everywhere. Fridge smell really bad so I didn't use at all. Bathroom was old but overall was clean. But for that money you can't get better

We spent 9 nights here and the hotel has its pros and cons.Pros:- Very central location with easy access to Waikiki Beach, shops, restaurants and public transport.- Our room was located on the 16th floor and we had a great view of the city from our balcony. We also had a partial beach view to the left of the balcony.- Concierge service who helped us book all our tours and made great recommendations.- Friendly reception and housekeeping staff.- Comfortable beds.- The room had a large TV, desk and kitchenette including oven and stove (no microwave though)- Lots of amenities including a pool and laundry room.Cons:- Shower was very poor. Virtually no pressure, awkwardly positioned shower head, door didn’t close properly, fluctuating temperature (if another guest nearby was also using the hot water) and the cubicle was dirty.- Room was small and a bit cramped for 3 people.- The décor is quite outdated and really needs updating. Our room and the hallways looked old and dirty. Overall, if you’re looking for relatively well priced, well located and convenient accommodation, I’d recommend this hotel.If you’re someone who holds cleanliness of high importance and needs plenty of space, I would not recommend this hotel.

Comparable to Super 8, nothing great nothing real bad. Beat up room, chipped furniture, stains etc. Mid-twenty crowd some families. Staff very friendly and helpful. Need a place to put your head down and nothing else this place is for you. Parking is a pain; need to park down the street. Close to beach and high end shopping. Strip club next door.

We reserved our a studio room with 2 beds and a kitchen almost 3 months prior to our arrival at the hotel. On Saturday, we arrived to check-in approximately 2:30 in the afternoon. The front desk clerk advised that our room was still being cleaned and that it will not be ready until 3:00. She, however, was able to check us in and gave us our parking pass. When we returned half an hour later, there was a line of guests also trying to check-in so we waited for our turn. At about 3:15, we were able to talk with her and again was told that our room was still not ready and that it was being "updated". I told her that we will be at the waiting area and to please let us know as soon as it's ready. We waited another 15 minutes and finally decided to stay in line again. When it was our turn, we were told that our reservation for a studio with 2 beds was not available and that she was going to place us into a regular 2-bed room or if we chose to, we can stay in a studio room with 1-bed and a roll-away. We have 4 guests in our party so we knew that the latter option was not going to work. With no other options, we took the 2-bed room and she offered to waive the hospitality fees for our stay. When we got to our room, we found that it was much smaller than a normal bedroom in other hotels, the bathroom and kitchen counter had water spots on them, the bathroom floor was very sticky, the shower curtain had a musty smell, the shower floor drain cover was rusty, one portion of the kitchen counter just above the refrigerator was cracked and if one accidentally rubs on it, may get cut/hurt, the left door hinge of the drawer door was broken and the throw pillows were dirty. This was not what our expectation was from a hotel that promises comfort based on their website and definitely not a place where we would want to spend our vacation. We then went back to the front desk, told them our dissatisfaction of our room and that we be moved to a studio with 2 beds as soon as one comes available. This was on a Saturday and we were told that one will not be available until Monday. We agreed to it not wanting to stay much longer in that room in spite of the inconvenience of having to pack up all our luggage to be moved to another room. On Monday, we were then moved to a studio with 2 beds, which was much better and roomier but still had a musty shower curtain smell, dust on table which was very visible (the one by the sliding doors especially when the window covers are drawn open), dirty throw pillows and the water temperature is not constant (it can all of a sudden turn scalding hot or very cold). The housekeeping of the rooms definitely needs a lot of improvement. The Friday we were there, we left early in the morning, came back at around 2:30 and our room was still not cleaned. We left and returned that night and our towels were just laying on the bed, showers were not fully cleaned, found a mosquito on the shower wall and counter tops were still dirty. We also left a used tea cup in the kitchen sink and it was still there unwashed when we returned. The parking lots are also very inefficient especially the upstairs since there is no two-way traffic. Cars need to back out to get out of the lot, which is very dangerous. $25/day parking fee is absolutely excessive. When we got our final bill, we found that we were charged the same price per night for the first 2 days of our stay for the regular 2-bed room as the studio, which was unacceptable. The waiving of the hospitality fee does not make up for the price difference. There is no hospitality in this hotel and a hospitality fee is definitely not warranted. Needless to say, we will not be returning at this hotel or recommending it to anyone.

I booked studio with kitchen (it is 400 sq feet). They give us the smallest room (room with kitchen 290 sq feet) even without telling us that don’t have a bigger room or to discuss it. The room was too small for 3 people. Still they charged me as for bigger room. They didn’t even apologize when I understand what happens. Stay far away from this hotel.

Staff were fantastic! Rooms were quite clean overall. Great location!!Balcony railing was not attached, VERY dangerous. Shower didn't feel clean. Very old and dated shower, kitchenette and cupboards. Pool looked dated and dirty. Carpet stained. Outdoor furniture needs updating.

A reasonable hotel located centrally in Waikiki. The hotel is a little dated but it was clean and comfortable.The reception staff were good and the check in, check out and dealing with general inquiries were all handled efficiently.There was a bar area next door, as part of the hotel, that provided breakfast and basic meals during the day.The hotel had a good swimming pool area. The wifi was reliable during our stay.The rooms require updating but they had the basic necessities expected of a hotel

The best part about this hotel is the location. The actual room was nice with free wifi and decent cable options. The views were nice. The only issue I had with the hotel was the shower. The water pressure was okay but the cold to hot variable was hit and miss. The worst thing about a shower is getting unstable water temperatures hitting your body. It's not that bad of an issue, but it was worth noting. Overall, it's an okay place in a great location.
