This hotel is in the perfect location, without paying the typical high Waikiki rates. Only trouble is it's an old building (paint/tiles/finishes in the rooms are faded, peeling, and dingy). On top of that, the hotel is RIGHT next door to a gentlemen's club so first floor rooms get to listen to loud music and lots of foot traffic through early morning hours. Staff did the best they could to move us but had no more available rooms. Our only other hiccup is that a staff person booked an airport shuttle for us the night before we left, however, the next morning the shuttle never came and the company didn't know about our reservation. We still don't know where the error happened, but were left snagging a last minute cab ourselves with little help from desk staff. Overall, worth the cheap price for the awesome location, just stay off the first floor and make your own plans.

My friends and I stayed at this property in a studio room for 2 nights. Room was clean, bathroom was clean and there was so much closet space for 4 females traveling together. My only complaint would be that it's two double beds that are a little bit squishy, but they were still comfy regardless. This property is 10 minutes from the beach, ABC stores close by, and lots of good bars to check out (like Tsunamis when there's live music going on down the road). If you're looking to save a few bucks while in expensive Waikiki this is definitely the place to stay. Good, clean and affordable. Front desk staff were wonderful too!

As an avid Amazon.com shopper , if it is not as pictured or not as advertised......Amazon takes care of you and gives you a refund, not to be too critical but this hotel needs some fixing upThis place is not as pictured It's oldIt's run downIt's hard to get in and out of the parking garageIt's noisyThings that didn't work1. A/C2. Tv remote3. Bathroom floor is scary and peeling4. One of the 2 elevators was out of serviceNeeds a remodel badlyToo overpriced and the $18 a day resort fee does not make it a resort!!!!

I originally booked six nights at the Aqua Ohia via Travelocity. The day I arrived, the lobby was very busy and looked small/worn. The front desk staff seemed tired and overwhelmed by the volume of travelers coming in and out of the hotel. I was a little surprised as I had spoken with someone at the hotel who told me that the building had recently been converted from condos a little over a year ago. I suppose I had been expecting something a little fresher/newer. I checked in at around 11am but was told my room wouldn't be ready until 3pm. I kept my fingers crossed that the room was better than the lobby indicated.Unfortunately, my room had a number of problems: stains on the sheets/pillow as well as the upholstered chairthe ceiling in the bathroom was disintegratinglow pile/cheap carpetingknicked/scratched furniturebathroom sink hot water faucet would not turnlow quality and dated furnishingsfelt dirtyI thought that I could suck it up and get through, but the morning after my first night I found a bug (cockroach?) next to my bathroom sink. I hurried to get my phone to take a photo, but by the time I returned, the bug was gone. I decided then and there that I needed to find another place to stay.When I told the front desk that I had found a bug in my room and wanted to cancel the rest of my stay, I did not get any kind of apology. When I asked for help in transferring my reservation to another Aqua property, I was basically told that I had to do it myself. They were not able to transfer the money that I had paid for six nights to the new property, so at one point in time I was paying for twelve nights total (even though it was only going to be an additional five).If you are looking for a cheap hotel in a good location, this place is for you. If you are looking for a clean property with some nice amenities and a service oriented staff, I would highly recommend you look for another spot.

Located in the heart of Waikiki with the beach just a few blocks away and a very accommodating staff made my Hawaii vacation a relaxing carefree stay, The general manager Cathy was very helpful with my many detailed needs as I am not the easiest customer to please.The concierge Sarah Beth assisted us with our entire stay, she listened to all of our wants and needs to provide us with a full but not stressed itinerary including a free shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Center (Great shopping, btw) The hotel is quaint and clean with a kitchenette that made meal planning a breeze! Did I mention the free coffee every morning in the lobby! Bottom line Great Value, Excellent staff plus perfect location equal the PERFECT HAWAIIAN VACATION! Mahalo(thank you) to my new friends at Aqua Ohia

The hotel is central and close to everything you need in Waikiki, including the beach and cafes. The rooms are quite outdated and because of this they do not feel very clean, there is only so much you can get an old white shower to 'look' clean. We were travelling with our 9 month old son and the room was bright and quite noisy due to light curtains and construction going on in the surrounds, so wouldn't recommend if you have young ones that require naps or early bedtimes.The pro's were super friendly and helpful staff, a dvd machine to rent limitless movies, good location and a free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre (if you're into shopping). There was also complimentary wifi but it kept dropping out (maybe because we were up on the 15th floor)?We stayed in July, so being peak season the room was still quite expensive.... a little too pricey for what you got perhaps but like i said, location was good.

Aqua is centrally located in Waikiki, 2 streets back from the beach. 5 minute walk to everywhere. Apartment was small, but clean and very well presented. Serviced daily. The unit is dated with a 1970s decor. Watch out for the onsite carpark. At $25 / day it's not cheap. Very tight getting in and out. Bays have limited room as well. Kitchenette allowed for in room food preparation. Overall great value.

Very nice, clean rooms with a nice view, daily served coffe at the lobby, nice staff.The hotel is situated next to the clubs and bars so I reccomand you to take the room situated at the higher floors. The hotel has a shuttle bus to the shopping center.

Stayed at this property at the beginning of March. We booked a room with two beds and a kitchenette. The room itself was decent, but very outdated. The water in the bathtub wasn't draining well and because the curtain was narrow (half a size of a bathtub) the water would splash everywhere, even though we tried to be as careful as possible. We like to sleep in, so we would wake up at around 8am and cook some light breakfast, leaving room between 9am and 930am. At that point, leaving so late, we pretty much could forget about the room being cleaned. It's like you see the ladies in the hallway, they ask you if you need your room cleaned, you say "yes, please", you come back after 5 pm and the room is not touched at all. I tried to take the trash out myself daily and we reused our towels every day. The room got cleaned twice during our 10 day stay. Other than that, the front desk folks were friendly and helpful. The hotel is small and cozy, the swimming pool is small, but really nice. Basically, you get what you pay for.Oh, the location is great and that was the main reason for booking this property.

When we stayed here, the hotel was in transition of being renovated. It was also a student housing. The staff were super friendly and very helpful. The location could not be better. And the price was very affordable for Oahu. Would recommend again.

rarely do I rave about a business, but for this place I make an exception. To say it is charming does not do it justice. I came to stay a week and did not want to spend giant money to stay on waikiki beach. besides most my time away from the hotel was on the windward side. The staff could not be more friendly, always smiling and always happy, whats not to be happy they live in hawaii. They made me feel like, well like they were really glad I was their guest. Now I get what they mean by the "Aloha Spirit" When I came back from my daily excursions it was always, "How did it go today". The concierge I thought was first rate, just as friendly and helpful as everyone else there. They even hooked me up with some free things I would never have done had I not spoken with them first. My room was HUGE and super comfortable, and every time I came back from my excursions, clean towels and a made bed always greater me. I guess its the little things that they provided that made my stay so great. You guys made my vacation!!! can't wait to come back. See you in about six months.

Decent location in Waikiki but not on beach. Difficult to drop off or pick up as no turnaround or place to park except on street (which is always full). Rooms are decent sized but old and worn. The beds and dresser are newer. The kitchenette is very old. Small dorm fridge won't hold much. Cupboards are warped. Bathroom is small and shower very small. Door to bathroom is a weird slider. Laundry downstairs is convenient but about a third of the machines were not working. In room safe also not working. Super tiny pool. Most staff were nice and helpful though. Free DVD rentals and games.

This 3* aparthotel is excellent for the budget conscious, large rooms with balcony, excellent central location and a 24 hr desk with very friendly staff. If you get it for the right price you can't go wrong, also just a 2 minute walk to the Tsunami Bar with cheap happy hour drinks from 11am till 7pm.

Yes, it has a pool, washers and dryers for clothes, television, and gorgeous views of Waikiki, but the BIGGEST convenience that stood out our entire trip was the location. The Ohia is dead-smack in the middle of everything going on in Waikiki. The beach is only a 5 min. walk away, and restaurants are lines up on either sides of the walkways. If you're into tours, most tour buses pick up passengers right in front of the hotel, and the public transit buses stop on the curb on the other side of the main entrance. Ohia was great, we stayed there for 5 days, and we thoroughly enjoyed it.

I just completed a business trip to Oahu and needed a reasonable hotel near the Waikiki beachfront. Beachfront hotels, where I had stopped previously on holidays, were simply out of the budget - so I looked at hotels set back into Waikiki. Aqua Ohia seemed to have a very good location one street off the main boulevard - and the rooms were very reasonably priced with Free Wifi and a not-entirely unreasonable garage parking fee. The booking was simple and there were no charges set against my credit card in advance. On arrival, the room was ready and exactly what I'd asked for. Initially, parking was a bit confusing, as you can't access the underground car park until you have a room key, and on-street parking is fairly scarce. However, the garage itself had plenty of spaces and although one has to enter the garage through a door on the front outside of the hotel (via a small set of steps), you always remained under cover. The staff is friendly and the hotel is being modernised. The shower was clean, although a bit a throwback to the 1970s (which I kind of liked, to be honest). My room was on the 7th floor and had windows facing two sides, which was great. The hotel itself is in a lively 'nightlife' area (I'd not call it seedy as others have - its just normal big city). There were several good restaurants nearby of virtually any ethnic variety. The hotel itself will soon have a cafe attached (Big Kahuna) - as it was in final preparations as I was there. The room did get a bit noisy on Friday and Saturday nights from the tourist antics in the local establishments - however, the rest of the week was absolutely peaceful.  I'm absolutely please with the hotel and actually may use it for a holiday later this year. It's a 5 minute walk from the beach and nearly 1/2 the price of beachfront hotels.

This hotel isn't fancy, but it is perfect for someone who wants location at a good price. It has a kitchenette and a balcony. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Lobby was recently renovated . No complaints! very satisfied

We stayed here for three nights in January and it was one of the cheapest hotels we could find, but still cost us a little over $175 CAD/night before the mandatory resort fees.The location of the hotel is great. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby on Kuhio Ave, and a short walk to Kalakaua Ave and Waikiki Beach.The reception area started undergoing renovations the day after we checked in and the front desk was temporarily moved to the pool area. The staff are quite friendly. The hallway smelled funny, but our room was okay and clean. Internet worked well and we also got a card to rent DVDs and Playstation games downstairs. Didn't have time to make use of it though, but that could be nice for longer stays.

My friend and I stayed 12 days in this hotel.The receptionnists were always smiling and nice, the room was clean, the swimming pool was perfect to relax, it was a good choice: cheap, not too far from the sea and the buses and a good quality of services.Negative points: 25$ for the parking/night it's a lot, the noise from the street during the night. We had great vacations in Hawaii and I highly recommand this hotel for young travelers.

1) Location. I chose this hotel because it was close to the start of the half marathon we were running. This made the morning of the run stress free. There are many different places to eat that are within walking distance and a grocery store also.2) Parking. There was always ample parking and the front desk staff were very helpful parking our car for us.3) The managers reception. It was wonderful to hear live music and have adult refreshments in the lobby. I met the supervisors and hotel managers. I wish the reception was more frequently throughout the week.4) The suite. Our room was on the higher floors above the busy streets and provided views of Waikiki and Diamond Head. I rarely heard any noise from the hallway considering we were close to the elevator on our floor.5) The kitchenette. We didn't use the oven but it was nice to know we had the option. The stove top was helpful in providing hot water for my coffee press and cooking meals.6) The pool. Because the pool was a salt water pool, I didn't experience the itching I would usually have after a dip in a chlorinated pool. It also helped ease my aches after the run.7) The front desk. Everyone was extremely helpful and kind. Our requests were always met with a smile and always fulfilled. My key card would occasionally not function and the staff were there to issue my replacement. There were times that the lobby was busy with what appeared to be Chinese tourists. Avoid these times as it can be really loud in the lobby.8) The housekeeping. Our room was clean. The sheets were crisp. The towels were soft and requests for additional linen were quickly met. The toiletries were great.9) The laundry. I'm accustomed to using the shower to wash and dry my running clothes when I stay at hotels but having a laundry that was secure freed my time to go around Waikiki instead.10) The ice machine. Had I known that the ice machine was in the lobby, I would have brought a cooler as the ice bucket provided is small. I only really used the ice machine the first day because our drinks were not yet cold in the fridge.11) The fridge. It was great having a mini fridge to keep all my sports drink cold and our left over food from spoiling. This fridge is large enough to keep a decent size container of food.12) The morning paper. I appreciate having the morning paper available while drinking my morning coffee.13) The overall service. I would stay here again and recommend to my friends and coworkers.

We were recently on Oahu in January, and our usual hotel was booked. Since we were on a budget from the last trip (shopping too much haha) we had signed up to run the hapalua half marathon as part of a bucket list of ours the location of the hotel was just a few steps from the starting line! We found the ohia online and found the price to be very reasonable.The front desk were very kind and friendlyThe desk gets really busy ( lots of tour groups) but they help everyone as best they can in a timely manner. We booked a studio and found the room to be spacious and well equipped oddly this was one of the only hotels I have been to that had an oven, which turned out to be a huge money saver for us. There is a local grocery store nearby to buy food. Overall a big thanks to the staff, we were very much surprised with a positive experience.
